response: Preheat oven to 350f. Line 13x9 pan with foil, with ends of foil extending over sides. Butter foil and set aside. Combine first four ingredients in medium bowl. Beat with electric mixer until crumbly. Press onto bottom of prepared pan. Bake 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with 1/3 cup almonds and 3 Tbsp coffee granules. Bake 5 more minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven. Combine 1 Tbsp milk with 1 tsp vanilla and remaining 1/2 cup almonds and 1 Tbsp coffee granules in small bowlstir until smooth. Spread over hot crust. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Lift from pan using ends of foilcut into bars. Dust with powdered sugar if desired. Makes about 24 bars.

Cook sausage and mushrooms in skillet. Remove from heat. In a mixing bowl, combine mushrooms, sausage and vegetables with bread cubes. In a medium saucepan, melt 2 tablespoons butter over medium heat. Add flour and cook 1 minute. Gradually add 1 1/2 cups chicken broth, stirring constantly. Add the mixture in the bowl and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste. Add more chicken broth if mixture is too thick. Stuff into turkey. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour. Sprinkle with sage. Makes 2 quarts.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Grease 12-inch round pizza pan or pie plate. Spread bread cubes evenly over bottom of pan. Arrange cooked turkey over the bread cubes. Sprinkle with swiss cheese. Beat eggs lightly with milk and poultry seasoning. Pour over bread, turkey and cheese. Sprinkle with onion. Bake at 375 degrees f for 25-30 minutes or until set. Cut into 8 wedges to serve.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the spaghetti according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Stir in the stock, soy sauce, vinegar and pepper. Bring to a boil. Cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the broccoli and cook until it is just tender. Stir in the peanut butter. Transfer to a large serving bowl. Add the cooked spaghetti and toss until evenly coated. Serve hot.

Cook the macaroni in boiling water. Drain. Melt the vegan mayo in a saucepan. Mix in the nutritional yeast. Stir in the milk substitute. Salt and pepper to taste. Add the noodles to the sauce. Heat on low heat for 10 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a casserole dish. Sprinkle with the breadcrumbs. Bake at 350F for 15 minutes.

Brown the sausage and onion and bacon in a large frying pan. Remove the sausage and bacon and set aside. Drain the fat from the pan and add the french onion soup mix and 2 cups of water. Mix well and allow the mixture to boil for about 5 minutes. Add the frozen mixed vegetables and bring the mixture back to a boil and then remove from the stove and let cool for a while. Stuff the sausage mixture into the sausage casings and roll into links. Arrange the rolls in a baking dish and cover with the french onion mix and the mixed vegetables. Sprinkle the top with fresh parsley. Bake at 350 degrees F for one hour or until the rolls are done and the mixture is bubbly and hot.

Spread crunchy peanut butter on one side of white bread. Spread grape jelly on whole wheat bread. Place one slice of white bread on one slice of whole wheat bread. Sprinkle with goldfish crackers. Cut into four squares.

Remove any excess fat from chicken breasts. In small bowl, combine flour, soy sauce, and sugar. Dredge breasts in mixture. Place in shallow dish. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine brown sugar, pineapple juice, and lemon juice. Bring to boilingreduce heat. Simmer 15 minutes. Stir in pineapple chunks. Combine 1/2 cup water and rice in another saucepan. Bring to boilingreduce heat. Simmer until water is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Stir in parsley. Cover to keep warm. Arrange chicken in shallow baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until juices run clear. Stir pineapple mixture and pour over chicken. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with rice.

Preheat the oven to 325f. Cream together the butter and brown sugars. Add the eggs and vanilla and mix well. In another bowl mix the flour, baking soda and salt. Mix the dry mixture into the wet mixture until just combined. Stir in the water and then the chocolate chips. Drop by spoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes and then take out and let cool on the cookie sheet for 10 more minutes. Makes about two dozen.

Place sugar and 3 cherries in the bottom of a tall glass or jar. Muddle sugar and cherries together with lime and vodka. Add ice and grapefruit and ruby red grapefruit juice and shake vigorously. Strain into martini glass.

In a large saucepan combine the sugar, water, orange juice concentrate and lemon juice. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Boil, stirring constantly until mixture reaches the soft ball stage (238 degrees). Remove from heat and stir in almond flavoring, vanilla, cloves, allspice and cinnamon. Pour into bowls. Serve hot. Garnish with orange slices if desired.

Separate the whites from the yolks of 4 large eggs. Whisk together the egg yolks and milk. Add the egg whites and beat until smooth. Add the cheddar cheese. In a nonstick skillet over medium heat, saute green onions until tender. Add the egg mixture. Stir until the egg mixture is firm. Serve sprinkled with the green onions.

In a blender, combine strawberries, ginger ale, milk and sugar. Blend until smooth. Add the lemon juice and vanilla. Chill several hours. Serve with a dollop of sour cream and a sprinkle of fresh berries.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix orange juice and honey. Place salmon in a 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Pour mixture over fish. Cover with foil. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove foil and bake an additional 10 minutes. Remove from oven and brush with Hoisin Sauce. Garnish with chopped cilantro if desired.

Prepare a barbecue or broiler. In a blender or food processor combine the peppers, cilantro, vinegar, garlic, mustard, cinnamon, coriander and oil until a smooth puree forms. Thread chicken on to the skewers. Grill or broil about 8-9 inches from the heat about 8-10 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Brush with the pesto during the last 2-3 minutes of grilling or broiling.

Combine cheese, butter, lemon juice and seasonings in a bowl until well blended. Set aside. Preheat grill to medium high heat. Thread the veggies onto skewers, leaving about 1 inch between each veggie piece. Brush the veggies with oil, sprinkle with seasonings and then grill for about 3 minutes on each side. Remove from grill and place the veggies on a serving plate. Spoon the blue cheese butter over the veggies. Garnish with the basil and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Rinse pork loin and pat dry with paper towel. Insert 2 to 3 slices of garlic into each side of loin. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon of each of the salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon of butter and olive oil in heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Brown meat on all sides for about 10 minutes. Place loin in a shallow baking pan. Roast for 15 minutes. In skillet, cook onion and remaining butter until soft. Pour over pork loin. Bake for another 15 minutes or until meat thermometer registers 160 degrees. Let rest 10 minutes before slicing.

Place the peeled and cored pears into a large saucepan and cover with enough water to cover the fruit. Simmer over medium-high heat until the fruit is soft when poked with a fork, about 30 minutes. Drain the fruit and let cool. Add the sugar and spices and stir well. Add the pumpkin puree and stir until the mixture is smooth. Add the figs and stir well. Pour the filling into the crust and bake until a knife comes out clean when inserted into the center of the pie. Allow the pie to cool completely before slicing. Makes a wonderful breakfast with coffee.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium bowl, combine butter and brown sugarbeat until creamy. Blend in vanilla and flour, then stir in crumbs and nuts. Press mixture into bottom of a 9 x 13 baking pan. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from ovenstir in marshmallows and spread evenly over hot crust. Bake for 2-3 minutes longer or until marshmallow mixture is lightly browned. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Cut into 24 bars.

In a medium bowl, combine all of the dry ingredients. In a large pot combine the water and honey and bring to a boil over high heat. Remove from heat and stir in the dry ingredients and the vanilla. Stir until everything is well combined and spread mixture onto a cookie sheet sprayed with cooking spray. Bake for about 45 minutes or until it is light golden brown and crunchy. Cool completely then stir in dried fruit and store in an air-tight container or in plastic bags in freezer.

Peel and segment the oranges. Place segments in a bowl. Add 1 tsp of sugar and 1/2 tsp of vanilla bean pulp to each segment. Cover and leave to macerate. Remove segments from bowl and place in a small pan. Add remaining sugar and liqueur and cook over low heat for 5 min. Add brandy and cook for 2 min. Remove from heat and pour into serving bowl. Serves 4.
Mix sugar and margarineadd eggs and vanilla. Blend in cocoa and nuts. Add flourmix well. Pour into greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 375 for 18 minutes. Cool completelycut into squares.

Mix together butter and splenda. Add the sugar. Add the egg substitute and the pineapple, mix well. Add in the flours, the soda and the salt. Blend together. Add in the vanilla. Pour into a greased and floured loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan. Combine the first 3 ingredients in a large bowl. Beat with a mixer at medium speed until well blended (about 1 minute). Add the next 5 ingredients. Beat at medium speed until well blended. Stir in the flour and the chocolate chips. Spread the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. Cut into 24 squares.
I love the sound of the walnut fudge.
Combine miracle whip, sugar and vinegar. Fold in remaining ingredients. Refrigerate overnight. Serve on lettuce leaves.
Mix BACARDI LIMAN, lemonade and lime juice over ice.

Wash the berries well and put them in a bowl. Add the jelly and stir until well mixed. Let stand for about an hour at room temperature. To serve, spoon some of the berry mixture onto each of 6 dessert dishes. Dot each with a few orange sections and a few cherries. Pour some port over each serving. Garnish each serving with mint. Serve immediately.

Cut the mango flesh away from the skin and stones. Puree the fruit in a food processor or blender until smooth. Add the orange and lime juices and 1/2 cup of the club sodaprocess briefly. Pour the mixture through a fine strainer to remove the fiber. Add the remaining 1/2 cup club soda and pour the mixture over the ice cubes. Serve immediately.
Put a layer of each item in an 8x8 inch glass dish. When finished pour sweetened condensed milk over the top and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve chilled.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a large bowl. Add beer. Beat with a wooden spoon until smooth. Stir in eggs. Add jalapeno and onion. Fry in hot oil 3 inches from heat until golden brown, turning once. Drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with salt.
In a bowl combine 1 cup all purpose flour and 1 cup self rising corn meal. Set aside.
In a small bowl combine 1/4 cup milk with 2 eggs. Add to the dry mix.
Add 1/4 cup chopped bacon or ham and 1/4 cup cheese.
Heat oil in deep fryer or heavy skillet to 350 degrees.
Shape batter into patties and fry until golden brown.
Drain and sprinkle with sea salt.
Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

Spread both sides of the bread with butter. Place the brie in the center of each slice. Sprinkle both sides with the basil. Top each slice with a tomato slice. Cut each sandwich in half. Heat a sandwich press or heavy skillet over medium heat until hot. Place the sandwiches in the press or in the skillet and cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until golden brown on the outside and the brie is melted in the center.

Combine the balsamic vinegar, lemon juice and olive oil in a large plastic bag or glass container. Add the lamb chops and marinate at room temperature for at least one hour and up to overnight. The longer the better, the more flavour the meat will have. Heat a cast iron skillet over high heat or a barbeque grill. Remove the chops from the marinade and pat dry with paper towels. Sear the chops on both sides until cooked through about 3-4 minutes on each side. Remove from the heat and let sit for one minute before serving.

In a large saucepan combine zucchini with enough water to cover. Add salt to taste. Cook over medium heat until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain zucchini and set aside. Heat chicken broth to boiling in a small saucepanboil for one minute to kill any bacteria present. Strain broth through a fine sieve into a liquid measuring cup and let cool to room temperature. In a blender or food processor, process garlic with 1/4 cup broth until smooth. Transfer to a small bowl and stir in remaining 3/4 cup broth, lime juice and oregano. Season with black pepper and parsley. Add zucchini to broth mixture and toss to coat evenly. Serve hot or cold. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet saute garlic in oil until softened. Add all remaining ingredients except pretzels and simmer 10 minutes. Stir in pretzels. Cool slightly before serving. Serve with vegetable sticks or crackers. Makes 5 cups.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Wrap each pear half with a slice of bacon. Place the wrapped pears onto a baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove the bacon-wrapped pears from the oven, and let them cool. Meanwhile, whisk together the vinaigrette ingredients in a small bowl. Toss the salad greens and nuts together in a large bowl. Top the salad with the bacon-wrapped pears. Serve with the vinaigrette on the side.

Spray a 9 x 13 pan with cooking spray. Place bread in bottom of pan. Sprinkle with cheese and bacon. Beat eggs, milk, salt, and pepper with a whisk. Pour over the bread mixture. Bake 40-45 minutes or until eggs are set in the center and lightly browned.

Place the fish fillets in a shallow baking dish. Season with salt and black pepper and sprinkle the lemon rind over the fillets. Place in a preheated oven at 200 deg C for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and set aside. Add the butter to a pan and heat. Add the green peppercorn and cook for 3 minutes. Add the lemon juice and stir. Return the fish fillets to the pan and cook for 5 minutes. Arrange the scallops over the fish fillets and cook for another 5 minutes or until cooked through. Sprinkle with parsley and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Sift together the flour and baking soda. Set aside. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in egg yolks one at a time. Stir in the vanilla. Blend in the flour mixture. Fold in the chocolate chips. Roll into 1 inch balls. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Let cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

Beat together cream cheese and sugar in large mixing bowl. Blend in dessert topping and 2 teaspoons of the vanilla. Reserve remaining 1 teaspoon of the vanilla. Pour into prepared pie shell. Chill at least 4 hours. Pour chilled cherry pie filling over top of chilled cheesecake mixture. Chill at least 4 hours longer before serving. To serve, sprinkle with reserved 1 teaspoon of vanilla.

Saute the rice in the butter and bouillon until it starts to turn golden brown. Add the rest of the spices and saute for another minute. Add the lemon juice and warm water. Cover and simmer for about 30 minutes. This is a great side dish to any meal.
Mix all the dry ingredients together. Combine all the wet ingredients. Add the dry to the wet and mix together. Add the cabbage, onions, and carrots. Mix well. Chill overnight. Serve cold.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Slice the sweet potatoes in half lengthwise. Scrape out some of the pulp so you have about 1/4 thick slices of skin all around the outside. Place skins on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. In a saucepan combine all the remaining glaze ingredients and bring to a boil. Pour glaze over potatoes and bake for 30 minutes, or until tender when pierced with a knife. Top with toasted sesame seeds and seaweed strips just before serving.
Hey! I just added this recipe to my recipe blog www.recipebuddies.com . Thanks for sharing!
Those are some pretty pictures! I love sweet potatoes!
I love sweet potatoes! I’ve had this one bookmarked for so long now.
I’m always trying to get more veggies into my kids’ diet, but I’ll admit that I’m not always successful.
This is awesome! I’ll definitely try some of these recipes for my family!
Thanks for this! My son will eat

In a large pot of boiling water, cook clams until they open, about 5 minutes. Rinse with cold water, then remove from shells and set aside. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add clams, wine, tomatoes, garlic, lemon juice, parsley, salt, and pepper. Cook over medium-high heat until liquid evaporates. Serve with french bread.

Combine first 4 ingredientsreserve 1 tablespoon mixture for coating chicken. Dip chicken pieces into egg whitesdredge in reserved mixture. Fry in hot oil 10 minutesturn and cook 5 minutes longer or until done. Sprinkle with paprika.

Core the pears. Cut each half into 3 or 4 wedges. Cut each wedge into 2 or 3 slices. In a small bowl combine raisins, maple syrup, butter, vanilla extract, cinnamon. Arrange pear slices on a shallow baking dish. Pour syrup over top. Bake in a 400 degree oven for 35 minutes until tender. Serve warm. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Toss together the carrots, garlic, thyme, stock, salt and pepper in an 8 x 8 baking dish. Cover tightly with aluminum foil and bake until tender, about 30 minutes. Uncoverremove the garlic. Puree the carrots in a food processor until smooth. Return to baking dish and heat through. Serve warm.

Cream together cream cheese and sugar. Stir in egg and vanilla. In a small bowl combine the flour and cinnamon. Cut the dough into wedges, about 1/3 of the way through. Fill with the cream cheese mixture. Dust with the cinnamon and sugar mixture. Bake at 350 for about 12 minutes.
Place aluminum foil in a 9x13 pan. Cut red potatoes into cubes. Spray with olive oil. Sprinkle with onion. Top with taco seasoning and cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

Cook oatmeal as directed on package. Add milk and cereal and stir well. Add cinnamon and stir again. Cook and stir 1 minute longer or until desired consistency. Add banana and stir well. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream if desired.

Heat oil in large pot over medium heat. Add onion and cook 3 to 4 minutes or until translucent stirring occasionally. Add ground turkey and cook until browned stirring to break up large pieces with spoon and stirring frequently to keep meat from clumping. Stir in remaining ingredients and simmer uncovered for 15 minutes stirring occasionally. Serve with tortilla chips and topped with cheese sour cream or guacamole.

Cook potato wedges in boiling water for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain. Stir together sour cream, milk, salt, pepper, and cheese. Pour over potatoes. Sprinkle with cornflake crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Uncoverbake for an additional 5 to 7 minutes or until bubbly and golden.

Combine lentils and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer 15 to 20 minutes or until tender. Drain lentils, reserving liquid. Discard bay leaves. Heat olive oil and saut the onion and garlic until translucent and lightly browned. Add lentils and reserved liquid. Season with salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature. Garnish with orange segments and parsley sprigs.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 13 X 9-inch pan. In a medium bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and salt. In a large bowl, beat butter with an electric mixer on medium to high speed until creamy. Add sugarbeat until well-blended. Beat in eggs one at a time. Beat in vanilla. Add dry ingredients alternately with milk to creamed mixturebeat on low speed just until combined. Stir in walnuts and chocolate chips. Spread batter in prepared pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool completely on a wire rack. Cut into bars. Makes 24 bars.

Heat oil in heavy non-stick fry pan over medium-high heat. Place 1 tortilla in oil and fry for 30 seconds on each side or until crispy. Repeat with remaining tortillas. In a bowl combine cheese with onion and mix well. Dip each crispy tortilla into onion mixture and then roll up. Place in baking dish (13 x 9 inch pan). Add enchilada sauce over rolls. Top with chili without beans. Cover tightly with foil and bake at 350f for 15 minutes or until bubbly and cheese is melted. Serve hot. Makes 8 rolls.

Combine the soup mix with 1 cup of water. Pour into an aluminium pan or baking dish. Cook the hamburger and onions in a skillet. Add the hamburger and onions to the soup mix. Add the potatoes and carrots. Drizzle with the oil. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Fold the edges of the foil over the pan. Bake in the preheated oven for about an hour. Unwrap and serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease a 9 x 13-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Layer the bacon slices, overlapping slightly, on the bottom of the baking dish. Scatter the green onions on top of the bacon. Beat the eggs, light cream, seasoning salt, and onion until blended. Pour evenly over the bacon and green onions. Sprinkle the shredded cheese over the top of the egg mixture. Bake uncovered for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the top of the omelet is golden brown. Garnish with the sweet onion rings before serving.

Grease a 13x9 inch pan and preheat the oven to 350. Cream the margarine and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the cocoa powder and salt, beating until well mixed. Add the beaten eggs and mix well. Stir in the dry ingredients with the white chocolate chips until just combined. Spread the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 20 minutes or until a tester comes out clean from the center of the pan. Cool before cutting.

Cook pasta al dente. Drain. While it is draining, combine pesto sauce with potatoes. Place potato mixture in bottom of a large casserole. Add pasta and top with green beans. Mix together well. Bake 25 minutes.

Cook the macaroni according to the package directions. Drain the noodles and place in a large bowl. In a small bowl whisk together the egg and flour. Add to the noodles along with the milk and salt. Stir to combine. Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with the shredded cheddar cheese and bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting into squares.

In a large pot, brown the ground beef. Add the onion, carrots, potatoes, corn, and tomato paste. Slowly add the water. Bring to a boil. Add the bouillon and garlic. Reduce heat to simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.

Soak the dried beans in plenty of water overnight or at least 8 hours. Drain them and rinse them. Add them with 4 cups of fresh boiling water (or more if you prefer a softer texture) in a large pot or Dutch oven and boil them until they are soft but not falling apart, about 25 minutes. Drain and set aside. Meanwhile, in a large skillet saute the onion in a little vegetable oil until they are translucent. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the boiling rice and cook for 1 minute or until it becomes translucent. Add 2 cups of fresh boiling water (or more if you prefer a softer texture). Bring to a boil and cover. Reduce heat to low and cook for 30 minutes or until all liquid has been absorbed. Add the cooked rice, beans, TVP, chili powder, cumin and salt to taste. Cook for 5 more minutes or until heated through.

Cook bacon until crisp. Remove from pan. Cook onion in same pan. Add garlic. Add spaghetti to onion mixture. Saute for 2 minutes. Add frozen peas, bacon and cream. Cook over low heat until heated through. Remove from heat. Stir in ricotta and parmesan. Stir to combine. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

Heat oil in a large pot or casserole over medium-high heat. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Add chicken to pot in an even layer. Cook, turning once until browned on both sides, 8-10 minutes. Add onion and cook until softened and browned on edges, about 5 minutes. Add parsnips, broth, mustard and thyme. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to a simmer. Cover pot and cook until chicken is cooked through and tender, about 15 minutes longer. Remove chicken from pot and slice. Stir in honey, thyme, parsley. Serve chicken on top of vegetables

In a large bowl cream together the sugar and butter. Add the milk, peanut butter, and vanilla. Beat for 30 seconds. Stir in the cocoa. Add the oats. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375f for 7 to 9 minutes. Cool for 1 minute on the cookie sheets. Transfer to wire racks.

Pour the rum into a shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Add the apricot brandy, triple sec and pineapple juiceshake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Top with the orange juice and the grenadine. Serve immediately with a straw.

Bring carrots, stock and apple cider to a boil. Cook, uncovered until very tender. Strain and cool. In a heavy bottom pan melt the butter. Add the carrots and the brown sugar. Add the vegetable stock and the mustard. Cook until the glaze thickens. Remove from heat and add the fresh parsley.

In a large deep saute pan over medium-high heat, heat oil. Add mushrooms. Cook and stir for 1-2 minutes or until mushrooms are lightly browned. Add roasted red peppers. Continue to cook for another 1-2 minutes. Add penne pasta. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until pasta is coated with oil. Add remaining ingredients. Stir to combine. Cook for 3-4 minutes or until sauce thickens slightly. Serve hot.
What are some foods that contain the same nutrients as Pasta with egg salt and garlic?
Here's our list of key items with nutrients similar to those contained in Pasta with egg salt and garlic.

Fry sausage and ground beef in a large skillet for 15 - 20 minutes. Drain. Return meat to skillet and add velveeta, oregano, garlic powder and worcestershire sauce. Stir and cook until melted. Spread on slices of rye bread. Place on a baking sheet with wax paper between layers and freeze. When frozen, put in a ziploc bag and store in freezer until ready to use. Bake at 325 for 15 - 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Cut each eggplant half in half. Sprinkle each half with salt, pepper and garlic powderdrizzle with olive oil. Roast in oven until very tender about 45 minutes. Remove from ovenlet cool. When cool enough to handle, scoop out eggplant pulp into a bowlset aside. Puree 1/3 cup of the roasted red peppers in food processor or blender until smoothset aside in another bowl. In food processor or blender combine remaining roasted red peppers, tomatoes, onion and garlicprocess until smoothset aside. In large bowl combine all of above mixtures along with 1/4 cup of the watermix well. Spread 2 tablespoons of the mixture in each of 4 slices of French bread or Italian loaftop with slices of eggplant. Cover loosely with plastic wraprefrigerate at least 2 hours or until ready to serve.
What is an Aubergine?
What is the difference between eggplant and Aubergine?

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Mix together the cream cheese, mustard, lemon juice and hot sauce until blended. Mix in the ground chicken and onion. Chill for 30 minutes to firm up the mixture. Shape into 1 inch balls, roll in nuts and place on a baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, turning once.

Cook beef and onion in a large skillet over medium-high heat until beef is no longer pink. Drain off fat. Stir in refried beans and taco seasoning mix. Heat through. Heat flour tortillas in microwave 30-45 seconds on each side or until warmed through. Spoon 1/2 cup of meat mixture onto each tortilla. Sprinkle with cheese and taco sauce if desired. Roll up. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Grate carrots and onions together. Add mayonnaise. Add 1 tablespoon water at a time until mixture forms a paste. Add horseradish, pepper to taste. In a shallow dish, mix together breadcrumbs and butter. Place carrots in dish, top with cheese. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Melt the butter in a large pot over low heat. Remove from the heat. Stir in the cheeses. Remove 3/4 cup of the mixture to a small bowl. Stir in the rice krispies, then return to the pot with the remaining mixture. Stir in the Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco sauce, salt and pepper until well blended. Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden. Cool for 1 minute before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, cook the garlic and basil in oil. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the pasta and cook until done. Add the tomatoes. Salt and pepper to taste. Cut the avocado into 1/4" dice. Mix in to the pasta. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Rinse orange roughy with cold water. Pat dry with paper towels. Lightly flour fish. Melt butter in heavy skillet over medium heat. Add mustard. Stir for 1 minute. Add fresh lemon juice. Add 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce. Stir for 1 minute. Add enough flour to make a smooth paste. Add remaining 1/2 cup water. Add remaining Worcestershire sauce. Add 1/2 tsp. Salt and 1/4 tsp. Black pepper. Remove from heat. Lay fish in greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Spread paste mixture on top of each fillet. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Sprinkle with parsley. Dot with remaining 1 tsp. Butter. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with lemon wedge. Makes 4 servings.

Melt dark corn syrup and cornstarch together over medium heat. Stir constantly to prevent lumps. Stir in hot water. Dissolve the mixture and bring it to a boil. Add the lemon juice. Add the orange zest. Add the frozen baby carrots and simmer over low heat until the mixture has thickened. Remove from heat and toss the carrots. Sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve hot.

In a medium saucepan, combine potatoes with bay leaves and cold water. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Drain. Melt butter in a skillet. Stir in potatoes. Add herbs. Heat through. Add peas. Serve hot.

Brown the sausage in a large skillet over medium heat until completely cooked through. Add butter, flour, pepper and continue to cook for about 2 minutes. Stir in sour cream and milkcook until thickened. Serve over omelets.

Cream butter, add sugar gradually beating well. Add egg, vanilla and blend well. Blend in the dry ingredients. Cover and chill about 2 hours or overnight. Pack the dough into the cookie press and press out cookies on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 450 for 8-12 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Melt chocolate as directed on package. Dip half of each cookie in the melted chocolate. Place on waxed paper to harden. Sprinkle with nuts if desired.

Place whole cloves in a 5-quart pot along with tea bags, cinnamon sticks, and boiling water. Cover and steep for 1 hour. Strain through a fine mesh strainer into a large pitcher and discard the spices. In another pot combine the 10 cups of water with the sugar and bring to a boil. Remove from the heat and add the juice mixtures, lemon juice, and orange slices. Pour the tea mixture into the pitcher with the juice mixture. Chill thoroughly in freezer in desired glass. Garnish with fresh orange slices, if desired.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Line 2 large baking sheets with aluminum foil. Slice potatoes 1/8-inch thick. Place in bowl and toss with butter. Pour in cajun seasoning. Spread evenly on baking sheets. Bake 20 minutes. Turn slices over and bake until crisp and golden brown, about 15 minutes. Sprinkle with salt. Serve immediately.

Wash fresh asparagus and dry it very well. Lay spears out flat on a cutting board. Using a sharp knife, cut off the woody ends. Chop off the tender green tips. With a vegetable peeler, peel off the fibrous green skin of the spears. Cut the spears into one inch pieces. In a small bowl, combine the bacon fat with the Worcestershire sauce, brown sugar, garlic, and butter. Pour the mixture over the chopped asparagus. Toss the spears well until they are evenly coated with the sauce. Pour the mixture into a lightly greased baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for about half an hour. Stir occasionally to prevent burning. Serve hot.

Combine the sugar and corn syrup in a 1-1/2-quart saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook until the mixture reaches 236f on a candy thermometer, stirring frequently. Remove from the heat and add the milk, stirring until the mixture comes to a full boil. Boil and stir for 1 minute. Remove from the heat and stir in the unsweetened chocolate and butter until smooth and the mixture reaches a full boil. Remove from the heat and stir in the vanilla. Continue to stir for a few minutes until the mixture loses its gloss and becomes very thick and spreadable. Spoon the mixture into a bowl and let cool to room temperature before using as a frosting or dipping into a fondue pot.

Plump raisins by soaking in boiling water, about 10 minutes, then drain. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook, stirring for 1 minute. Add chard or spinach, cook until wilted about 2 minutes. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta and combine pasta, chard or spinach with pine nuts and raisins. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Combine coffee with 1/4 cup sugar in a small saucepan. Heat and stir until dissolved. Cool. Combine coffee mixture with milk and remaining sugar. Blend together in a blender until smooth. Pour into a tall glass. Top with ice cream and drizzle with syrup.
I have been using your site for years and am so grateful for all of your wonderful recipes. I just started a new diet and have been looking for ways to add flavor to my food. I think I've found what I need! Thank you!
I am so glad you enjoy the site and recipes! I hope you find some you love!
Hi! Just discovered your site and am so excited. My husband has type 1 diabetes and it is so hard to find delicious foods that we can both enjoy. Thank you for your dedication to this site. You have no idea how much it means to me.
I am so glad you found us and are enjoying our recipes! I hope you find more you love!
Thank you for your website. I'm so happy to find recipes that are good and healthy.
Cook potatoes in microwave until tender. Cut in half. Add cooked ham to each half potato. Spoon in cream of asparagus soup. Top with cheddar cheese. Bake at 375 for 15 minutes.

Heat oven to 375f. Line 12 regular size muffin cups with paper liners. Combine flour, cornmeal, sugar and baking powder in a large bowl. Combine buttermilk, egg and butter in another large bowl. Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and stir just until moistened. Divide batter into prepared cups. Bake for 12-15 minutes. Cool in pan for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with bacon bits and jalapenos. Serve warm.

Peel eggplant and cut into 1/2-inch sticks. Combine bread crumbs, parmesan, celery salt, and pepper. Mix eggs and milk and dip sticks into mixture. Drain excess crumb mixture. Heat oil in heavy fry pan over medium high heat. Fry sticks in oil until crispy. Remove from oil and place on paper towel to drain. Serve hot.

In a large pan over medium heat, heat olive oil. Add garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in crushed tomatoes and the canned tomatoes with juice. Add sugar and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in olives and cook for 3 minutes longer. Add the feta and parmesan cheese and cook until melted. Stir in the basil. Serve with cooked pasta.

Whisk together first 3 ingredients in a small bowl. Place salmon in a foil lined baking pan. Brush each side of salmon with a little of the sauce. Cover with foil and bake at 375 for 15 to 20 minutes or until done. Baste with sauce and serve.

Remove excess fat and connective tissue from the sweetbreads. Combine the vinegar, salt, and 1 cup water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the sweetbreads and cook for 5 minutes. Drain the sweetbreads. Rinse the sweetbreads with cold water. Heat the bacon fat in a skillet over medium heat. Add the flour and cook until lightly browned. Stir in the sweetbreads. Add the garlic powder, remaining 2 cups water, butter, and vinegar mixture. Cook uncovered over medium-low heat for 5 minutes or until the sweetbreads are tender. Garnish with parsley.

Preheat oven to 375. Brush skillet or roasting pan with oil. Brown chops on both sides in hot skillet. Combine apple and apple juice in skillet or roasting pan. Place chops on top. Cover tightly and bake for one hour. Cut up acorn squash. Place in pan. Continue to cook for another hour. Add maple syrup and spices to skillet or roasting pan. Bake an additional half-hour. Serve over brown rice.

Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the ham, red bell pepper, and cook, stirring frequently for about 5 minutes or until the ham is no longer pink. In a medium bowl whisk together the eggs, heavy cream, and the seasonings. Pour the mixture into the skillet. Cook for 5 minutes or until the eggs are just set. Remove from the heat. Sprinkle with the cheese. Let stand for 5 minutes or until the cheese has melted. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 175 degrees celsius grease and base line a 20cm square tin. Put all ingredients in a pan over low heat and stir until melted together. Spread evenly into tin then bake for 35 mins until it has set and browned slightly on top. Cool in tin for a few mins before turning out onto wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Beat the egg into the cookie mix until well combinedadd the oil, water, chocolate chips and milk. Pour into a greased 8x8 inch pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes. Cool completelyfrost with the cream cheese frosting and spread with the raspberry jam. Cut into 4x4 inch squares to serve.

Cream the butter, sugar, eggs, orange peel, and orange juice. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and nutmegadd to creamed mixture. Fold in cranberries by hand. Grease loaf pan with shortening or oil. Pour batter in pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until toothpick comes out clean. Makes 1 loaf.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and lightly flour a 9 x 13 inch pan. In a medium saucepan combine chips and pecans. Cook over low heat until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in cake mix. In a small bowl combine kahlua and half-and-half. Add egg and egg substitute. Stir until well blended. Pour over cake mix. Spoon the melted chips mixture over the top. Bake for 30 minutes. Spread coconut over the top and bake for another 5 minutes. Cool.

Position a rack in the upper third of an oven and preheat to 450f. Snap off the tough stem ends from the asparagus spears and arrange the spears on a baking sheet. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, garlic and almonds. Brush the asparagus evenly with the oil, turning the spears to coat well, and season generously with salt and pepper. Transfer the asparagus to a warmed serving platter and drizzle with the pan juices. Serve immediately.

Grease 1-1/2-quart baking dish. Mix cooked rice with eggs, sugar, vanilla and milk. Add flour gradually, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming. Add margarine to mixture. Spread into baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until set. Serve hot. Serves 6.

Put all dry ingredients in a zip lock bag. Add poultry seasoning and pepper. Add margarine. Cut margarine into the dry ingredients. Add a little water to make a sticky coating. Shake chicken pieces in the bag. Place in the oven at 350 for 1 hour.

In a large skillet melt butter over medium heat. Sear the tenderloins on all sides until brown on both sides. Add onion and saute until translucent, about five minutes. Add the wine and let it bubble away until almost all liquid has evaporated. Add the cranberries and rosemary. Simmer for about five minutes more until the cranberries are plump and sauce has thickened a bit. Add the honey and season with salt and pepper. Pour over the pork. Serve with wild rice pilaf or roasted potatoes. Enjoy.
Cook rice as directed. Add remaining ingredients to pot and stir until well combined. Simmer covered for 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Serve hot.

Mix greens in large bowl. Toss with dressing. Divide among 4 plates. Divide remaining ingredients evenly over greens. Serve immediately.
name: apple pecan and blue cheese salad with dried cherriesingredients: salad greens, apples, pecan halves, dried cherries, blue cheese, dijon mustard, maple syrup, apple cider vinegar, olive oil, salt and pepperpreparation:Mix greens in large bowl. Toss with dressing. Divide among 4 plates. Divide remaining ingredients evenly over greens. Serve immediately.
name: baby greens pear walnut and blue cheese saladingredients: lemon juice, dijon mustard, shallot, fresh thyme, olive oil, mixed baby greens, pears, blue cheese, walnutspreparation:Whisk first 4 ingredients in small bowl to blend. Gradually whisk in oil. Season dressing to taste with salt and pepper. Toss greens in large bowl with enough

Using an electric mixer, beat the softened butter until smooth. Add the herbs and continue beating until thoroughly incorporated. Add the lemon juice and zest. Mix well. Pack into a small plastic container. Refrigerate for 3 hours before serving.

Prepare a 9x13 glass dish by buttering the bottom and sides with melted butter. Add the heavy cream to a large pot and bring to a low boil on the stove top. Add garlic salt and pepper and stir to combine. Add the cavatappi and cook for 5 minutes until al dente or tender. Remove from heat and add the pecorino romano and parmesan cheeses. Stir to combine and transfer to the glass dish. Top with the shredded cheddar and bake for 10 minutes or until the cheddar is melted and bubbly. Serve warm with crackers or garlic bread.

Brown stew meat in skillet. In Crock Pot add all ingredients except stew meat. Cover and cook on low 4 hours or high 2 hours. Add meat after 3 hours of cooking time. Continue to cook for 1 hour. Serve over rice or noodles.

Roll up chicken halves with goat cheese in middle. Sprinkle with white pepper and season with garlic powder. Heat olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken rolls 4-5 minutes on each side or until done. Combine spaghetti sauce and mozzarella in a small bowl. Spoon sauce and cheese evenly over top of each roll. Place on a baking sheet. Bake at 350f for 5-8 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Combine all dressing ingredients together until smooth. Pour over salad and toss gently to coat. Chill at least 1 hour. Serve with lettuce leaf.
tuna fish
tuna fish sandwich
tuna fish casserole
tuna fish cake
tuna fish chili
tuna fish fritata
tuna fish casserole with noodles
tuna fish casserole with potatoes
tuna fish casserole with macaroni
tuna fish casserole with broccoli
tuna fish casserole with tomato
tuna fish casserole with peas
tuna fish casserole with carrots
tuna fish casserole with potatoes and peas
tuna fish casserole with tomatoes
tuna fish casserole with broccoli and cheese
tuna fish casserole with potatoes and green pepper
tuna fish casserole with potatoes and carrots
tuna fish casserole with potatoes

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add the meat and cook, breaking it up with a wooden spoon until it is no longer pink in color. Stir in the onion, celery, bell pepper and cook for about 5 minutes longer or until the vegetables are tender. Add barley and cook for 1 minute longer. Stir in the tomato paste, broth and water. Bring to a boil. Cover tightly and simmer for about 30 minutes or until the barley is tender and the mixture has thickened slightly. Stir in the parsley. Salt and pepper to taste.

Soak the chickpeas in water overnight. The next day, discard the water and put the chickpeas in a pot with enough water to cover by about an inch. Boil the pot until the chickpeas are soft. This takes about an hour. Drain the chickpeas and add the oils and the seasonings. Mash the chickpeas in a food processor until they are smooth. Add the lemon juice and mix. Add the water gradually until the desired consistency is achieved. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with pita bread or crackers. Serve at room temperature.
Mix all seasonings together in small bowl. Toss chicken with seasonings in bowl. Marinate at room temperature 1 hour or refrigerate overnight. Grill 350 degrees 20-25 minutes turning once.
Blend watermelon and strawberries until smooth. Add sugar and blend again. Add frozen lemonade and blend well. Add lemon juice and blend. Pour into glass and garnish with a slice of lemon.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Coat 13x9-inch baking dish with butter. In one large mixing bowl combine crisp rice cereal and all-purpose flour. Add thyme, poultry seasoning, salt and pepperblend well. In another mixing bowl, combine butter with hot water until melted. Add chicken to melted butter mixture, turning to coat both sides of the chickenset aside. Dip each piece of chicken into the flour mixture to coat both sides. Shake off excess coating and place into baking dish. Bake uncovered for 25 to 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Yummy!

Heat olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add onion, green pepper, salt and pepper. Saute until vegetables are tender. Beat eggs in a large bowl. Stir in sour cream. Add the vegetables. Heat the tortillas in the microwave for 1 minute or until pliable. Spoon the egg mixture into each tortilla. Roll up and place in a baking dish. Pour the picante sauce over the rolled tortillas. Cover with the cheese. Bake for 30 minutes or until the eggs are set. Serve with salsa. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9×13 inch baking pan. Beat butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Beat in the almond extract and eggs, one at a time. In a separate bowl stir together the flour and baking powder. Gradually beat into the butter mixture. Pour into the prepared pan and bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Sprinkle with the ground almonds. Bake for an additional 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and spread the glaze evenly over the top. Arrange the red glazed cherries evenly over the top and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Cool in the pan on a wire rack.
Cherry Cake by Sally McKenzie
The recipe for Cherry Cake is courtesy of Sally McKenzie.
Cream butter and sugar well. Add eggs, one at a time. Sift flour and salt. Add gradually to mixture. Add cherries. Pour into greased

Mix turkey with onion and spices in a skillet until cooked through. Drain fat from skillet. Stir in can of cream of mushroom soup, milk, and green beans. Heat until boiling. Spread mixture in a 9x13 pan. Top with a layer of tater tots. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 for 30-40 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Cover tightly with foil or lid. Refrigerate 3 days or freeze up to 1 month.
Thaw in refrigerator overnight or in microwave on defrost setting (check every 15 minutes).
Stir in sauce and let stand 10 minutes before serving.
Recipe categories: main dish, side dish, potato, vegetable, meat.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook the beef until it's no longer pinkdrain. Stir in the barbecue and teriyaki sauces. Add the chipotle and mix well. Heat until the mixture is steaming. Serve in hoagie rolls.
 spicy london broil steaksingredients: sirloin tip steaks, beer, soy sauce, garlic powder, black pepper, onion powderpreparation:Combine soy sauce, beer and garlic powder in a shallow dish. Add steaks and marinate in refrigerator 4 to 6 hours. Remove from marinade and sprinkle with onion powder and black pepper. Grill 4 to 6 minutes per side or broil 3 to 5 minutes per side.

beat butter, sugar and egg until light and fluffy. Add in vanilla and almond extract. Combine flour and baking soda. Add into butter mixture and mix until smooth. Roll into small balls and place onto ungreased cookie sheet. Make a depression in the center of each ball and press a whole or sliced almond into each ball. Bake for 20-25 minutes at 350 degrees F. Makes about 3 dozen.

Grease a 13 X 9-inch baking pan. Arrange the bread in the pan in overlapping rows. Scatter the tomato and green onions over the bread. In a bowl combine the mozzarella, eggs, milk, butter, basil, garlic salt and pepper. Pour the mixture over the bread and vegetables. Cover the pan with plastic wrap. Let stand at room temperature for 4 hours. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Bake the strata for 50 to 60 minutes or until golden brown. Cut into squares. Makes 6 servings.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add artichokes, tomatoes, bell pepper, and garliccook 5 minutes. Add lemon rind and juice. Cook 5 minutes longer. Mix in rice pilaf and capers. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve warm.
Combine all the spices. Store in an air-tight container. Use in place of kosher salt when seasoning meats.

In a large saucepan, combine water, egg white, cinnamon sticks and salt to taste. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil 3 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes. Remove cinnamon sticks. Add the nuts to the syrup and stir until they are evenly coated. Spread the nuts onto a baking sheet and bake at 250 degrees for about 1 hour or until the syrup is hardened and the nuts are crisp. Let the nuts cool completely before storing in an airtight container.
This is the most flavorful spiced nuts I have ever had. My daughter loves them too.
The best spiced nuts I've ever had!

In a saucepan, combine 1 cup pineapple with juice, orange juice and orange zest. Bring to boilingreduce heat. Simmer gently until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Stir in gelatin until dissolved. Remove from heatlet cool. Beat egg yolks and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in neufchatel and vanilla. Pour into pie shell. Bake at 325 degrees f. for 30 minutes or until set. Cool on wire rack. Whip cream with orange zest and sugar. Chill. Spread over pie and top with remaining pineapple and juice. Refrigerate. Serves 8.

Combine the first eight ingredients in a bowl. Form a ball about the size of a large marble out of the mixture. Place a small spoonful of wonton filling in the center of the wrapper. Bring the two opposite corners together and press to seal. Use a fork to crimp the seal. Repeat with the rest of the mixture and wontons. Heat oil in a medium skillet. Add butter and cook over medium heat until butter is golden and bubbly. Fry the wontons in batches and turn after a minute. Once all the wontons are fried and golden brown, drain them and place them in the oven. Heat the sweet and sour sauce. Once the wontons are hot, place them in a bowl and cover with the sauce. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and butter and mix thoroughly. Press into a pie pan. In a medium bowl, beat together Splenda and cream cheese until smooth. Beat in egg yolks and lime juice until smooth. Pour over the crust. Bake in a preheated 350 degree F. (175 degrees C.) oven for about 40 minutes or until set. Cool and refrigerate. To prepare the topping, beat together the whipping cream and Splenda until stiff peaks form. Fold in the fat free cream cheese and spread over the cheesecake. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, add the wild rice and cook according to package directions (about 50 minutes). While the wild rice cooks, combine the corn kernels and heavy cream in another medium saucepan over medium heatcook until the milk is thickened and the mixture has reduced by about half (about 5 minutes). Remove from the heat and season with salt and cayenne pepper to taste (I like to start with about 1 tablespoon of kosher salt and then add more as needed to get to the desired saltiness). Stir in the butter until it is melted and the mixture is smooth. Add the wild rice and stir to combine. Transfer the mixture to an oven-safe casserole dish and sprinkle with the milk. Bake until the top is golden brown (about 30 minutes). Let rest for 5 minutes before serving.

Trim ends off of peppers, leaving stems intact. Cut off tops, slice tops into strips. Cut peppers in half lengthwiseremove seeds and white ribs. Brush cut side of each half with olive oil. Set cut side down in baking dish, sprinkle with salt, cover with foil, bake at 425 for 20-30 minutes or until tender when pierced with fork. Cool. Arrange pepper strips in center of each pepper half, sprinkle with black pepper, drizzle with remaining olive oil. Serve as hors d'oeuvres or for snacks with crackers or bread sticks.

Cut the cabbage into long thin strips. Cut the orange peppers into thin strips as well. Place the red cabbage and orange peppers into a large bowl. Add the canola oil. Sprinkle the whole cumin seeds over the top. Sprinkle the chili powder and the celery seed over the top as well. Add the balsamic vinegar to taste. Mix well. Add the mayonnaise and the sugar. Mix well. Sprinkle the peanuts over the top. Serve with potato chips.

In a jar with a tight-fitting lid combine first six ingredients. Shake well. Let stand at least half an hour before using. Shake well just before pouring onto fruit or vegetable salads. Refrigerate unused portion.

Combine cornstarch and sugar in a small bowl. Add apple pie spice and stir. Set aside. In a large bowl combine the peaches and the cornstarch mixture. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Place a prepared crust in a greased 9 inch pie plate. Fill with the peaches. Sprinkle with the cinnamon. Top with the other crust. Press edges together. Crimp or flute. Brush top with the milk and sprinkle with the coarse sugar. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 55 minutes. Cool before serving.

In saucepan, boil soup and water. Add chicken and stir. In a small bowl, mix cream cheese and seasonings. Stir in soup mixture. Spoon into a 1 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with colby-monterey jack. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with tortilla chips.

Combine spinach with ricotta and parmesan cheese in a bowl. Season to taste with cracked black pepper. Line a baking sheet with wax paper. Spray a cookie sheet with cooking spray. Place a wonton wrapper in the palm of your hand. Spoon about a teaspoon of the mixture into the center of each wrapper. Bring the two sides of each wrapper together to form a triangle. Press the edges together to seal. Place on the baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. Serve warm.
I used 2% cottage cheese instead of ricotta.
I used frozen chopped spinach.
I used 1/2 cup chopped fresh mozzarella cheese in place of parmesean.
I used 2% cheddar cheese in place of parmesean.
I used 1/3 cup low-fat cream cheese in place of 1/2 cup low-fat cottage cheese.
I used 3/4 teaspoon garlic powder in place of 1 teaspoon minced garlic.

Combine french dressing and lemon juice in a small bowl. Whisk in garlic, paprika and capers. Place salmon in an aluminum foil-lined 15 x 10-inch baking pan. Top each salmon fillet with a dollop of the dressing mixture. Bake, uncovered for 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Pre-heat the oven to 190c. Put the potatoes into a large pan with a good splash of water, then boil for about 15 minutes until just tender. Meanwhile put the tomatoes, onion, zest and juice of half the lemon and the olives into a bowl, season with a little sea salt and black pepper and mix well. Cut the chicken breast into strips and add to the bowl. Heat the remaining oil in a frying pan and brown the chicken until well colored. Tip into the bowl with the other ingredients. Drain the potatoes and mix with the lemon and olives. Divide the potato salad between the ramekins and spoon the chicken mixture on top. Bake in the pre-heated oven for about 25 minutes until the potatoes are piping hot and the chicken is cooked through. Serve hot.

Fry bacon in olive oil until crisp. Remove bacon to paper towel to drain. Add onions to bacon fat in the skillet and saute until softened but not browned. Add garlic and stir 1 minute more. Add all remaining ingredients except sour cream. Cook until heated through, about 10 minutes more. Stir in sour cream. Serve with bacon bits.
I love this recipe! I use it in my salad instead of tuna.
I love this recipe! I use it in my salad instead of tuna. I also add it to my homemade chili recipe.
Great idea for a new recipe to try out!
I love this recipe! I use it in my salad instead of tuna. I also add it to my homemade chili recipe. Great idea for a new recipe to try out!
I love this recipe! I use it in my salad instead of tuna. I also add it to my homemade chili recipe. Great idea for a new recipe to try out!
Great idea for a new reci

In a large skillet cook lean ground beef until no longer pink. Add red beans and diced onions and cook until vegetables are tender. Drain. Add taco seasoning. Stir in prepared polenta. Spread in a lightly greased 13x9-in. Baking dish. Top with shredded cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until heated through. Serve with sour cream or guacamole if desired.
Boil potatoes until tender. Mash with butter and half-and-half until smooth. Stir in goat cheese and basil. Season with garlic powder.

Cook steaks in a skillet or oven for 15 minutes. Remove meat from skillet and set aside. In skillet, add oysters and 1/2 of teriyaki sauce. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and add remaining teriyaki sauce. Spread mixture over top of the steaks. Roll up and secure each roll. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 20 minutes.

In a medium sized saucepan combine the maple syrup, brown sugar and butter. Stir over medium heat until the mixture comes to a boil. Continue boiling until the mixture reaches 240° F on a candy thermometer. Remove the mixture from the heat. Stir in the half-and-half. Let cool. Once the mixture has cooled slightly add the vanilla extract. Stir until blended. Pour the mixture over the walnuts. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until the mixture is thick. Serve over your favorite dessert.

In a medium bowl, combine lemonade concentrate, honey, poppy seeds, vinegar, lemon juice. Whisk until blended. Chill. Combine grapes, watermelon, nectarines, and pears. Pour dressing over fruit. Toss to coat. Serve chilled.

Cream together butter and sugars. Add eggs one at a time and mix well. Add chocolate chips and stir until well mixed in. Add flours and baking powder and mix until dough is formed and comes away from the sides of the bowl. Roll into walnut size balls and place on a lined baking tray. Bake for about 15 minutes in a preheated oven at 350 degrees. Cookies will be slightly soft in the middle but will firm up when cooled down. Leave on trays until completely cooled then remove onto wire racks and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 375. Grease a large cookie sheet with cooking spray. Cut potatoes into wedges and toss with olive oil and seasoning. Place wedges in a single layer and bake for 35-40 minutes or until golden brown and crisp on the outside. Remove from the oven and place potato wedges on a serving platter and sprinkle with more seasoning and sea salt and pepper to taste.

In a bowl combine the artichoke hearts, parmesan cheese, thyme leaves, extra virgin olive oil, salt, and pepper. Stuff each chicken breast with about a tablespoon of the mixture and place in a greased casserole dish. Bake uncovered at 375 for about one hour or until a meat thermometer reads 160 degrees F (69 degrees C).

Cook mushrooms in microwave oven on HIGH 1 minutestir. Microwave on HIGH 2 to 3 minutes or until tenderstirring once or twice. Stir in dressing and asparaguscook 1 minute. Sprinkle with almonds. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, stir together butter and honey until well blended. Add the oats and stir until well blended. Add the remaining dry ingredients and stir until well blended. Spread in a large baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned. Allow to cool before stirring in the fruit and nuts. Store in an airtight container.

Squeeze the juice from the lemons and set aside. In a large bowl combine the lemon juice and cajun seasoning. Add the edamame and toss to coat. Taste and add more seasoning if desired. Cover and refrigerate overnight.
Name: chicken soupingredients: chicken broth, dried basil, dried thyme, dried oregano, dried marjoram, dried sage, bay leaves, water, chicken meat, noodles, carrots, celery, garlic cloves, lemon juice, butter, flour, chicken bouillon cubes, white pepper, green peppercorns, black peppercorns, white mushrooms, salt, garlic powderpreparation:In a large pot over medium-high heat, bring broth to a boil. Add basil through bay leaves. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer for 1 hour. Add chicken meat and cook for 15 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Stir in noodles and cook for about 1
Combine all ingredients in a food processor or blender until well mixed. Serve with crackers, bagels or english muffins.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Coat baking sheet with cooking spray. Coat fish with cooking spray and place on baking sheet. Sprinkle fish evenly with salt and pepper. Roast fish for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, heat broth in small pot over medium heat. Add mushroom and simmer for 5 minutes. Add mustard and whisk until smooth. Add cream and simmer for 1 minute. Add fish to mixture and simmer for 1 minute. Serve fish over cooked rice or noodles.
Name: tilapia with creamy lemon sauceingredients: tilapia fillets, flour, light italian dressing, chicken broth, lemon juice, fat free cream cheese, fresh parsleypreparation:heat the dressing in a medium skillet on medium heat. Coat the fish with flour and then add to the pan. Cook 4-5 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Remove from skillet, cover and keep warm. Add broth and lemon juice to the pan. Cook

In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and barbecue sauce until smooth. Add sugar and beat well. Add eggs one at a time. Blend well. Combine the dry ingredients in another bowl, then stir into the wet mixture. Stir in the nuts. Drop by teaspoonfuls on greased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on a wire rack. Makes about 4 dozen.

In a medium saucepan over low heat, combine the Gruyere cheese and Swiss cheese. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the cornstarch with the water. Cook until the mixture thickens and turns clear. Add the brie and continue cooking until it is melted. Remove the saucepan from the heat. Stir in the champagne, almond extract, nutmeg, salt and pepper. Pour the fondue into a fondue pot (or a chafing dish or heavy saucepan) and place over low heat. Serve with apple wedges and french bread cubes or breadstick.

In a large saute pan, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the spinach leaves, season with salt and pepper, and saute until wilted. Remove from heat. In a large ovenproof skillet over medium heat, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Add the beans and saute until hot. Stir in the oregano, tuna, eggs, and pecorino cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Pour the spinach mixture over the top of the eggs. Cook until set in the center, about 8 minutes. Place under broiler until golden brown, about 4 minutes. Cut into wedges or triangles and serve immediately.

Brush the tops of the peasant loaves with some of the oil and grill them over moderate heat until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side. Cut off the tops of the loaves and scrape out the insides of the loaves. Turn the loaves on their sides and place in a 325 degree F oven to keep warm. Brush the eggplants with the remaining oil and grill them over moderate heat until browned and tender when pierced with a sharp knife, about 5 minutes per side. Remove and let cool. Slice the tomatoes and mozzarella. Arrange the tomatoes and mozzarella on the tops of the toasted loaves and scatter the basil and some of the coarse sea salt over the tomatoes and mozzarella. Top with the grilled eggplants.

Combine first 5 ingredients in large bowl. Beat at medium speed with electric mixer until smooth. Stir in oranges and mandarin orange juice concentrate. Pour into prepared crust. Bake 50 minutes. Cool 3 hours. Refrigerate overnight.

Thoroughly wash carrots. Grate carrots, chop the pears coarsely, combine them all in large kettle. Pour in lemon juice, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, bring to a boil over medium heat. Add sugar, bring back up to a boil, boil 1 minute over high heat. Stir in pectin, continue stirring 5 minutes over medium heat, skimming off foam as it rises to surface. Ladle into hot sterilized jars, seal and process 10 minutes in a boiling water bath.

Heat oven to 350. In a large skillet, brown chicken in oil over medium heat. Drain off fat. Add kidney beans with their liquid. Stir in salsa, tomato sauce, chili powder, cayenne pepper, garlic clove, salt and pepper. Pour mixture into 2-quart baking dish. Top with cheese. Bake 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray a cookie sheet with cooking spray. Beat together the butter and sugar until creamy. Add in eggs, then flour, cornstarch, baking powder and salt. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheet. Bake 5-7 minutes. Remove from oven and spread with a small amount of raspberry jam. Return to oven and cook 2-3 minutes. Cool. Store in an airtight container. Makes about 3 dozen.

Preheat the oven to 375f. Arrange the potatoes in a single layer in a baking dish. Drizzle with the oil. Sprinkle with the sea salt and the black pepper. Roast for about 35-45 minutes, or until the potatoes are golden and crisp. Sprinkle with the garlic and the rosemary, and serve immediately.

Heat the olive oil in a large pan over a medium heat. Add the Brussels Sprouts and cook until lightly browned. Add the Siracha sauce, the Honey and the Lime Juice. Cook for another 1-2 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste.

Beat eggs until light and frothy with an electric hand-mixer. Add icing sugar gradually and continue beating until the mixture is thick and creamy. Sift in the flour, stirring until the mixture is smooth. Stir in aniseed. Spoon onto a greased tray, 1cm apart. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Dust with icing sugar before serving. Makes 24 biscuits.

Combine all ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat. Heat mixture until it reaches a boil, then turn down to a simmer. Continue to simmer until the mixture reaches the "hard ball stage," or the mixture forms a ball when a small drop of mixture is dropped into cold water. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Store in a glass jar until ready to use.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour one 10 inch tube pan or two 9 inch round pans. Cream together butter and sugar in large bowl until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time and mix well after each one. Add vanilla and mashed bananas. Mix well. In another bowl, combine flour, baking soda and salt. Add dry ingredients and mix well until blended. Fold in chocolate chips. Pour into prepared pans and bake for about 45 minutes or until done in center. Cool for 10 minutes and remove from pan. Cool completely on wire rack.

Put roast in 2 qt casserole. Mix 2 tsp. Onion Soup Mix and 2 cups water. Pour over roast. Cover and bake 350 degrees for 2-2 1/2 hours. Add 2 cans Cream of Mushroom Soup. Cover and bake 2 hours. Slice and serve with gravy. Serve with rice or potatoes. Serves 6.

Prepare scallopini by cutting them into 1/2 inch thick pieces. Toss in a little flour and coat well. Heat 1-2 Tbsp. of the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the scallopini and cook until brown on both sides, turning once. Remove from heat and set aside. In a saucepan over low heat, combine the chopped tomatoes and oregano and cook until the mixture thickens. Add the white wine, the rest of the butter, and the parsley and mix well. Add the scallopini and heat through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve over noodles.

Melt margarine in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onionscook until tender. Add garlic powder. In a separate bowl combine soymilk, flour, salt, and pepper. Add to skillet. Bring to a boilcook about 5 minutes or until thickened. Stir in the mushrooms. Add green beanscover. Cook over low heat until heated through, 10 to 15 minutes. Spoon into a 2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with onions. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until bubbly.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly spray a 13 x 9 inch pan with non-stick cooking spray. Add broccoli, teriyaki sauce and garlic to pan. Sprinkle with black pepper to taste. Spray cooking spray over top of broccoli. Cover with foil and bake for 20 minutes. Remove foil and continue baking for 10 more minutes or until tender and lightly browned.

Cook the mini marshmallows in the top of a double-boiler over simmering water for 1 minute, stirring frequently to melt them. Set aside to cool while you prepare the rest of the dish. In another pot, bring the rice, crushed pineapple, 1/4 cup sugar and 2 cups water to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer 10 minutes or until water is absorbed, stirring occasionally. Mix rice with marshmallows and 1 teaspoon vanillalet cool. In a large bowl, combine whipped cream, remaining 1/4 cup sugar and 2 teaspoons vanillabeat until stiff peaks form. Fold in rice mixturespread into 8-inch square baking dish. Top with cherries and almondsserve immediately or refrigerate up to 2 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the vegetables and the mushrooms in oil until tender. Add the chicken stock, and bring to a boil. Add the diced tomatoes and spinachstir and simmer until the liquid is reduced. Remove from the heat. In a large bowl, combine the chicken, vegetable mixture, and half of the cheddar cheese. Pour into a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Top with the remaining cheese. Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes in the preheated oven.

Slice the potatoes in half lengthwise. Place in a saucepan with cold water to cover. Bring to a boil then lower heat to a simmer. Cook until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Drain and let potatoes cool. Cut brussels sprouts in half lengthwise. In a large heavy skillet heat the butter over medium heat until melted. Add potatoes, bay leaf and cook for 3 minutes. Add sprouts and cook for 2 minutes. Add stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-lowcook, covered for 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Stir in sweet pepper. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with parsley.
I am not a fan of brussels sprouts at all. I do like them cooked with bacon.
I do not like cooked Brussels Sprouts at all.

Preheat oven to 425f. Scrub and peel the beets and cut them into 1/2-inch cubes. Scrub the parsnips and cut them into 1/2-inch cubes. Place the beets and parsnips on a parchment paper lined baking sheet and drizzle them with the olive oil and sprinkle them with the brown sugar and a little salt and pepper. Roast for 30 to 40 minutes or until the beets and parsnips are fork-tender and the beets are browning and the parsnips are golden. Remove the beets and parsnips from the oven and stir in the cubed carrots and mushrooms and drizzle them with a little more olive oil and a little more brown sugar and a little more salt and pepper and roast for 10 to 20 minutes or until the vegetables are slightly browned and fork-tender. Drizzle the apple cider vinegar over the vegetables and stir to combine and serve warm.

In a medium bowl combine all the ingredients. Add the chicken and toss to coat. Transfer to a baking dish and roast uncovered for 30 to 40 minutes or until cooked through. Sprinkle with chopped green onion.

Mix together eggs and water to make an egg wash. Fry sausage patties until browned. Spread each half of an english muffin with margarine or oil. Place sausage patty on each half and top with cheese and an egg wash. Place on cookie sheet and bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes or until fully cooked through and crispy on top.

Sprinkle meat with salt, pepper, and garlic salt. Spray skillet with oilbrown meat. Remove from skillet. Saute mushrooms and onions until tender. Stir in soup, water, mustard, and parsley. Cook and stir until bubbly. Return meat to skillet. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Covercook until meat is tender. Serve over rice.

Peel and slice potatoes into a large bowl. Dice onion into a separate bowl. Add to potatoes. Peel and dice cucumber into a third bowl. Add to potatoes. Peel and dice radish into a fourth bowl. Add to potatoes. Beat together flour, cider vinegar, water, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pour over potatoes. Toss. Chill for 1 hour.
How Do You Cook Potato Salad Recipes?
If you know another way to cook Potato Salad Recipes please make a comment in the form below to help other free recipe users make the best of this free recipie.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a small bowl combine the powdered seasonings. Sprinkle the seasoning mixture over the chicken. Drizzle with the olive oil. Combine the balsamic vinegar, minced onion, and garlic. Pour over the chicken. Cover and bake for 25 minutes. Uncover and bake an additional 10 minutes. Garnish with fresh parsley. Serve over cooked rice.

Combine flour, salt and baking powderset aside. Beat eggs and add vanilla extract. Add flour mixture and beat well. Add walnut pieces and mix well. Add dates, mix well. Add cherry and mix well. Pour into a greased 9 inch round pan. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan. Makes 1 loaf.
"What a great service! I just love it! The only site that has the recipes I was looking for"

Slice bread into 4 equal pieces. Butter one side and place on hot griddle until lightly browned. Remove from heat and sprinkle cheese on one side. Add bacon and top with a slice of tomato on each half. Return to griddle and cook until golden brown on bottom and cheese is melted on top. Remove from heat and eat.

In a large bowl combine sugar, flour, nutmeg, salt, eggs and mix well. Stir in rhubarb. Pour into two unbaked 9-inch pie shells. Bake at 450 degrees for 10 minutes or until crust is light brown. Reduce heat to 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until filling is set. Cool on wire rack. Makes 2 pies.
Preheat oven to 350. Mix all ingredients together. Put in unbaked pie shell and bake 50 minutes.

Boil water for pasta. Season chicken with salt & pepper. Heat a nonstick skillet with olive oil. Add garlic & broccoli. Saute until broccoli is tender. Add chicken & lemon juice. Cook until heated through. Drain pasta. Toss with the chicken mixture. Add tomatoes & basil. Top with grated parmesan. Serve immediately.
Tomato & Bell Pepper Spaghetti
Parmesan Chicken Broccoli Pasta
Spaghetti with Zucchini & Garlic
Chicken & Broccoli Spaghetti
