To make the marinade, combine the oil and water in a large bowl. Add the rind of the limes and the coriander leaves and set aside for 15 minutes. Remove the outer layers of the lemongrass stalks and cut the stalks into 4 inch lengths. Tie the ends of the stalks together and cut into 1 inch slices. Add to the marinade. Add the chicken breasts and marinate for 20 minutes. Remove the marinated chicken from the bowl and thread onto skewers. Preheat the grill. Season the skewers with the juice of the limes, the remaining coriander leaves and the chiles and grill for 10 minutes. Brush the skewers with the macadamia nut oil and grill for another 2 minutes. Brush again with oil and serve with the sugar and the remaining chile.

Boil ziti as directed on package. Drain. Brown sausage in a skillet. Add the oil to the skillet. Add the stewed tomatoes and the tomato sauce. Cook until slightly thickened. Add the oregano, parsley, and pepper to taste. Remove from heat. Combine the ziti and the meat mixture. Spoon the ziti mixture into a 11 by 7 inch baking dish. Top the ziti mixture with the breadcrumbs. Cover the top of the casserole with the cheese slices. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve hot.
Boil water and steep tea bags for 5 minutes. Discard tea bags and chill tea. When cool, add juices, sugar and ginger ale. Serve over ice cubes and garnish with orange and lemon slices.

Use the dough cycle on your bread machine. Let the machine do the kneading. When the cycle is complete, remove the dough from the machine and shape into a loaf. Place the loaf in a greased loaf pan. Cover the pan and let the loaf rise until doubled, about 1 hour. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the loaf sounds hollow when tapped on the bottom.

Remove rind and fat from the roast. Rub with dry rub. Place roast into slow cooker and add the onions. Pour ginger ale over meat and add barbecue sauce. Cook on low 16 hours. Remove roast and place on cutting board to rest 10 minutes. Slice and serve.

In a large bowl, cream together the margarine and sugars until well blended. Beat in the egg. Combine the dry ingredients and mix into the creamed mixture until well blended. Stir in the nuts and chips. Roll into small balls (about the size of a walnut) and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 12-15 minutes. Allow to cool on the cookie sheet for about five minutes before removing to a cooling rack.

In a slow cooker, add meat, onions, bouillon cubes and water. Cook on low for 10 to 12 hours or until meat is tender. Remove meat to cutting board. Skim fat from gravy in slow cooker. Add cornstarch to gravy stirring until thickened. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over cooked noodles.

In a large heavy saucepan combine sugar and dark corn syrup. Heat over medium high heat and cook without stirring until temperature reaches 248degrees f. on a candy thermometer, or when a small amount of syrup dropped in cold water forms a hard ball. Remove from heat and stir in butter and cream. Cook and stir over medium heat just until mixture is smooth and glossy and reaches 250degrees f. on candy thermometer. Stir in almonds. Pour mixture into greased jelly roll pan and refrigerate for about two hours or until mixture is firm enough to cut into desired shapes. Cut into desired shapes and wrap with waxed paper. Store in tightly covered container.

Crush garlic cloves with a mortar and pestle. Put in a blender with oil, vinegar and Worcestershire sauce. Blend until smooth. Pour mixture into a large mixing bowl. Add egg yolk and blend thoroughly. Add 3/4 cup of grated parmesan cheese. Blend to coat thoroughly. Pour mixture over romaine lettuce and sprinkle with bacon bits. Let stand for a few minutes before serving.

In a small bowl combine the onions with the lemon juice, honey and thyme. In a medium bowl combine the chicken with the green onions and jalapenos. Pour the onion mixture over the chicken and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Heat a grill pan or grill over medium heat. Cook the chicken until done. Serve with lime wedges.

Cream together the sugar, butter and eggs until smooth. Add the vanilla. Sift the dry ingredients together and combine with the creamed mixture. Stir in the milk. Spoon into prepared muffin cups and bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until done.

Rub meat with the spice mixture. Place meat in slow cooker. Stir together remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Pour over meat. Cover and cook on low for 10 hours or until meat is tender. Remove meat and skim fat off of sauce. Slice meat into thin slices and return to sauce. Heat through. Serve over rice or noodles. Serve with sour cream and fresh parsley if desired.

Preheat the oven to 350f. In a medium bowl combine the butter and both sugars and beat until light and creamy. Add the eggs and vanilla and mix well. In another bowl combine the flour, baking soda and salt. Add to the butter mixture and mix well. Stir in the chocolate chips and nuts. Drop by teaspoon onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly golden around the edges. Cool on wire racks.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x12 inch pan. Mash the banana into a small bowl. Add the eggs and beat until smooth. Sift together the potato starch and the confectioners' sugarbeat into the egg mixture. Stir in the lemon juice and the vanilla extract. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. Do not overbake. Cool in the pan on a wire rack. Dust with the confectioners' sugar and serve.
Mix together the cheese spread, cream cheese, rotel, smoked sausage in a crock pot. Cook on low for 3-4 hours. Serve with tortilla chips.

Heat the olive oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the yellow onions and cook until softened. Add the beet leaves and stir until wilted. Add the white wine, bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the bacon bits and sprinkle with the salt and fresh ground black pepper. Serve hot.

Mix caramel ice cream topping and pudding until combined. Spread evenly into 9-inch pie plate. Chill 1 hour or until set. In small bowl, combine the cool whip and chocolate-covered toffee bars until combined. Spread over pudding mixture. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add enough oil to coat bottom. Place chicken strips in skillet. Cook strips in skillet until browned. Add pineapple-orange juice concentrate, butter, ginger, and soy sauce. Cook over medium-high heat until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook for 20-25 minutes or until thickened. Serve with rice.

Bring water to boil in a pot and add salt. Add barley and reduce heat to low. Cook until tender, about 30-40 minutes. Drain liquid from the pot, discard any uncooked kernels, then rinse barley under cold water to stop cooking. Combine barley with basil leaves in a medium bowl. In a small bowl whisk together vinegar and olive oil. Pour dressing over barley mixture and toss until thoroughly combined. Add corn kernels and tomatoes and toss again. Serve at room temperature or cold.

In a heavy skillet, saute the sweet onions in olive oil over medium heat for about 45 minutes or until they are very tender and golden. Stir in the garlic and continue cooking for about 3 minutes. Sprinkle the brisket with the garlic salt and lemon pepper and place in the skillet with the onions and garlic. Cook, turning once, until the brisket is browned and tender (about 20 minutes). In a small bowl, combine the brown and hickory barbecue sauces with the bourbon and the light brown sugar. Pour over the brisket and cover the skillet tightly with aluminum foil. Bake in a 250f oven for 2 hours and 30 minutes or until the brisket is very tender (it should fall apart easily). Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing and serving with the barbecue sauce.

In a large bowl combine rolled oats, walnuts, and golden raisins. In another large bowl combine brown sugar, ground flax seed, olive oil, and honey. Stir in cinnamon and vanilla. Add dry mixture to wet mixture and stir well. Spread onto a baking sheet and bake for about 40 minutes. Stir every 15 minutes or so until mixture is golden brown and crisp. Let cool completely before adding dried fruit. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

Mix first 4 ingredients until crumbly. Press onto bottom of 13x9x2-inch pan coated with cooking spray. Beat sugar and margarine until creamy. Add eggsbeat well. Stir in flour, baking powder and lemon juice concentrate. Spread over crust. Sprinkle with coconut. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30-35 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool in pan on wire rack. Cut into 30 bars. Yield: 30 bars.

In a small bowl combine lime juice, lime zest, pectin, water, and honey if desired. Set aside. Place all dry ingredients in bread machine pan in the order listed in instructions manual. Add liquid ingredients, including butter, and turn machine on for dough cycle. When cycle ends, remove dough from machine, divide in half, place each half in a lightly greased 8x4-inch loaf pan. Spread evenly with prepared lime/blueberry mixture. Bake at 350°F for 40-45 minutes or until done. Cool on wire rack. Cut into slices and serve. Makes 2 loaves.

Slice the top off of each berry and use a spoon to scoop out the seeds and pulp. Rinse the inside of each berry with cold water to clean. Drain water and gently pat dry with paper towels. In a bowl, beat together the cream cheese and Splenda until smooth and fluffy. Add the orange extract and beat until well blended. Spoon the mixture into the berries and place back on top of the berry. Sprinkle with walnuts. Serve immediately or cover and chill for up to 3 hours. Refrigerate any leftovers.

Brown the ground beef with the onions and peppers. Drain fat and remove from pan. Add butter. In a small bowl, combine garlic with the tomato sauce and mix well. In a 2 1/2 quart casserole, layer half the meat mixture with half of the tomato sauce mixture. Top with a layer of cabbage. Repeat layers. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Pour in remainder of the sauce mixture. Bake for 1 hour or until tender.

In a food processor combine the ancho chiles, black pepper, and cumin powder. Pulse until the mixture resembles a coarse powder. In a bowl, mix the ancho powder with the fresh oregano and chopped garlic. Add the vegetable oil and stir to combine. Add the red onions and stir to coat. Put the meat in a large zip-top plastic bag and pour the marinade over it. Squeeze out as much air as possible from the bag. Seal the bag and place it in the refrigerator to marinate for at least 2 hours. Remove the meat from the bag and discard the marinade. Broil the meat for about 3 to 4 minutes per side. Serve immediately.

Cut the vegetables in bite-sized pieces. Toss with the dressing.

In a large saucepan over medium high heat, saute onions in the oil for 3-4 minutes or until soft. Add the ginger, carrots and broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer until carrots are tender (about 15 minutes). Remove from heat. Cool slightly. Pour the carrots and broth into a food processor or blender. Add honey. Process until smooth. Reheat over low heat. Serve hot or cold. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees, line pan with parchment paper. Place squash on pan cut side up. Combine remaining ingredients and brush half of the mixture on the squash. Bake for 45 minute or until tender. Brush once more halfway through baking, and again near the end.

Cut filet into strips. Dust with salt and pepper. Mix flour with a little water and dip strips in it. Cook in a saucepan with a little fat until golden brown. Add stock, tomatoes and mustard. Simmer for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley. Serve with a spoonful of sour cream.

Brown the canadian bacon in a large skillet. Cut the fillets into strips. Lay them over the bacon. Sprinkle the top with flour. Sprinkle with salt and white pepper. Slowly add the milk. Cook over low heat until thick. Remove from heat. Stir in the oregano. Top the fillets with swiss cheese. Bake in a 400 degree preheated oven for about 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. In a Dutch oven, melt the butter. Add the celery and cook for 3 minutes. Add the green onion. Cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the rice and cook for 1 minute. Add the orange juice. Bring to a boil. Stir well. Remove from the heat. Stir in the almonds. Cover the Dutch oven. Bake for 20 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Fluff with a fork. Serve.

Brown the beef and onion in a Dutch oven. Drain fat. Add the taco seasoning, water and sweet corn. Bring to a boil. Stir in the tomato soup and simmer for about 15 minutes. Meanwhile cook the pasta and drain. Add it to the meat mixture and stir well. Add the cheese and green pepper. Sprinkle with olives and serve.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Grease an 8 inch square pan. Cream together the butter and sugar. Add the egg yolks and lemon juice, beat well. Beat in the flour, baking powder and salt. Beat the egg whites until stiff and fold into the mixture. Spread the batter into the pan. Bake for 50 minutes. Cool in pan for 20 minutes. Remove from pan.

In a bowl combine the mushrooms, shallots, olive oil, vinegar, thyme, garlic powder, and pepper to taste. Toss together well to coat evenly. Cover and refrigerate at least 3 hours or overnight. Remove from the refrigerator about an hour before serving so the mushrooms are at room temperature.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon of the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Cook until reduced by half. Remove from heat. In a small bowl, combine the parsley, cayenne, and the remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Add the tuna and toss gently. Add the pasta and the broth and toss. Serve immediately.

Cut up cucumbers and mix with cherry and yellow pear tomatoes. Add all other ingredients and chill for at least one hour. Can be served chilled.
1. A mixture of the following vegetables: beans (green), peas (green), broccoli, cauliflower, celery, carrots, cucumbers, lettuce (green), spinach, and zucchini (courgettes), all washed and cut into bite-sized pieces.
2. A mixture of the following vegetables: beans (green), peas (green), broccoli, cauliflower, celery, carrots, cucumbers, lettuce (green), spinach, and zucchini (courgettes), all washed and cut into bite-sized pieces.
3. A mixture of the following vegetables: beans (green), peas (green), broccoli, cauliflower, celery, carrots, cucumbers, lettuce (green), spinach, and zucchini (courgettes), all washed and cut into b
In a blender combine all of the ingredients and blend until smooth and frothy. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cream together the shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and milk. Stir in the strawberries and rhubarb. Combine the dry ingredients. Add to creamed mixture and mix until just moistened. Spoon into muffin tins. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the centre comes out clean. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from pans to cool on wire racks.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Mix together the eggs, milk and mustard. Pour over crumbled bread and mix. Add cheddar cheese and mix well. Pour mixture into greased casserole dish. Bake at 375 degrees for 45 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving. Makes about 6 servings.

In a large bowl combine stuffing and butter. Crumble in garlic and parmesan cheese. Lay out chicken in a baking dish and cover with the stuffing mixture. Bake in the preheated oven until the chicken is no longer pink in the center and the stuffing is golden brown, about 1 hour.
Mix all ingredients in small bowl. Spray fish with non-stick cooking spray. Place on grill over medium heat for 8-10 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily with fork. Serve with lemon.

Preheat oven to 375. Core pears with apple corer. Dip in melted butter to coat. Sprinkle with pumpkin spice. Roast pears for 1 hour, or until tender when pierced with a knife. Serve pears warm or at room temp with almond slivers for garnish. Serves 2.

Preheat oven to 350. Cook sausage in skillet until browned. Add apples. Cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Drain in colander. In medium bowl, mix sausage mixture, sweet potatoes, sugar, flour, cinnamon, and salt. Add water just until mixture is moistened. Spoon mixture into 2-quart casserole sprayed with cooking spray. Bake, uncovered, for 1 hour or until mixture is set. Cool for 10 minutes before serving. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Place the salmon fillets in a lightly oiled 13-by-9-inch baking pan. Sprinkle with Italian dressingbake for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with mushrooms and onions. Bake for 5 minutes more. Top with the tomato slices. Bake for 5 to 10 minutes more or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with leftover dressing.
I have always thought that it is important to know how to cook a basic meal before getting into fancy food. Here are some tips from the experts to help you become a master chef.
First, you need to learn how to prepare basic meals like spaghetti. If you do this right, you can even do this for your family. You can cook it at home. You can get it from your local grocery store. You can even go online.
But there is a problem with this. It is not easy to learn how to cook spaghetti. If you want to learn how to cook it properly, you must be able to read a cookbook.

Preheat broiler. In a small skillet, saute the green onions and garlic in the olive oil until the onions are tender-crisp and the garlic is lightly browned - 2 to 3 minutes. In a shallow baking dish or individual serving dishes, arrange the shrimp in a single layer. Sprinkle with the onion and garlic mixture and the lemon juice. Broil about 4 inches from the heat until the shrimp turn pink and are just cooked through - 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Makes 4 servings.

Grease a 2 qt casserole dish. Preheat oven to 375f. Heat a small amount of butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the sliced leek to the pan. Saute the leeks until tender and light golden brown. Add the flour and stir until blended. Add the milk in a slow stream. Stir the mixture frequently until well blended. Add the remaining ingredients. Pour into casserole dish. Bake for 45-60 minutes until golden brown and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.

Chop ginger finely or put in food processor. Combine ginger, sugar, rice vinegar, and enough water to cover ginger by at least an inch. Simmer 5-10 minutes. Cool, pour into sterilized jars or bottles. Keep refrigerated up to 2 months.

Preheat oven 160 degrees c. Grease 18cm square tin. Soak dates in hot water for 20 minutes or until soft. Drain and blend until smooth. Add the soft brown sugar and the crystallized ginger. Melt the butter and mix the bicarbonate of soda into it until it is all mixed in. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Fold the drained blended dates into the mixture until well combined. Sift the self-raising flour into the mixture, folding it through until well combined. Pour into the tin and bake for 30 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Leave the cake in the tin for 5 minutes then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

Heat oil in Dutch oven over medium heat. Cook bell pepper and mushrooms in oil until tender. Stir in tomatoes and cook 5 minutes. Add garlic powder and seasonings. Stir in rice and cook over medium heat until rice is lightly browned. Stir in broth mixture and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. Yield: 8 servings.

In a large saucepan over low heat, cook the bacon until crispy. Drain on paper towels. In a large bowl combine the cooked bacon, onion, garlic, jalapeno pepper, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, salt, and peppertoss to mix well. Add the cooked spinachtoss to combine. Serve warm.

In a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, warm the olive oil. Add the garlic, onion and saute until the onion is tender. Add the brussel sprouts and saute for about 10 minutes, tossing often. Add the balsamic vinegar, butter, salt & black pepper. Cover and cook for about 10 minutes more until the brussel sprouts are tender. Stir in the chopped parsley. Serve immediately.

In a food processor, combine the sunflower seeds and sunflower oil and pulse until the seeds have been crushed into a paste. Add the honey and pulse to combine the honey into the paste. Add the salt and pulse to combine the salt into the paste. Process the sunflower seed butter for about 30 seconds or until the sunflower seed butter is smooth and creamy and reaches the consistency that you like best. Store in the refrigerator in a covered container for up to 1 week or in the freezer for up to 3 months. Serve chilled or frozen as a dip or spread on toast or bagels.

Place the popcorn in a microwave safe bowl. Heat on high for 1 1/2 minutes, or until all popped. In a saucepan, combine the nuts, butter, corn syrup, sugar, salt and vanilla. Cook over medium heat until bubbly. Pour over the popcorn and stir to coat. Spread in a single layer on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 250 for 1 1/2 hours. Cool before storing.

Melt butter in a 10-inch skillet over medium heat. Add flourstir 1 to 2 minutes or until smooth. Gradually stir in milk until blendedbring to a boil. Cook and stir until mixture thickens and boils. Remove from heat. Stir in ham and 1 cup of the cheese. Spoon into unbaked 9-inch pie shell. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until golden brown. Let stand for 10 minutes.

Put the cranberry juice cocktail and frozen orange concentrate in a blender. Blend for 1 minute or until slushy. Pour into glasses. Squeeze lime wedges into the glasses and drop them in. Serve with chilled vodka.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line the bottom of an 8x8x2-inch baking pan with aluminum foil. Spray the foil with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine the garbanzo beans, eggs, granulated sugar, canola oil, vanilla extract, baking powder, salt, ground cinnamon and old fashioned oats. Stir to combine. Spread the mixture into the prepared baking pan. Bake for 25 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with semisweet mini chocolate chips. Bake for an additional 5 minutes or until the chips are melted. Remove from oven. Let stand for at least 30 minutes before cutting into squares. Serve warm or at room temperature. Store any leftovers in an airtight container. Yields approximately 20 bars.
I made these today for the first time. They were amazingly delicious. I used 6 eggs, 1/2 cup cinnamon and raisins.
These are great! I made them for my son's birth

Mix the jam with the parsley. Heat the oil in a frying pan. Dust the cutlets in the breadcrumbs. Fry in the hot pan for 3 minutes per side. Pour in the stock. Simmer for about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with the corn.

In a large saucepan, heat the broth over medium-high heat until boiling. Stir in the cumin, chili powder, and coriander until blended. Stir in the pumpkin puree and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat and gradually stir in the whipping cream until smooth. Return the saucepan to the heat and stir in the brown sugar and nutmeg until blended. Heat until the sauce is hot but not boiling, about 5 minutes. Season with the salt and pepper to taste. Ladle the soup into 4 bowls and garnish with the cilantro and cheese. Makes 4 servings (serving size: about 3/4 cup).

Pound chicken breasts to 1/2-inch thickness. In shallow dish, combine the cream cheese and milk. Add chicken to the dish, turning to coat. Refrigerate 1 hour. Meanwhile, heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Cook pepper and onion until softened. Add chicken to skillet. Cook until no longer pink. Remove from heat. Stir in 1 cup of the cheese and 1/4 cup of the sour cream. In small bowl, combine the remaining sour cream, 1/4 cup of the cheese and the chicken. Spread 1/4 cup of the chicken mixture down the center of each of 4 tortillas. Roll up and place seam side down in baking dish. Spread with remaining chicken mixture. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup of the cheese. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes.

In shallow dish combine egg substitute, milk, cinnamon and nutmeg. Dip each slice of french bread into mixture turning over to coat both sides. Set on grill or skillet that is coated with nonstick cooking spray over medium heat. Cook 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Sprinkle with cereal before serving.

Combine cream cheese and italian dressing in small bowl. Stuff each black olive with 1/2 teaspoon of the dressing mixture. Roll each stuffed olive in parsley. Place on serving platter. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375f. Stir together graham cracker crumbs, flour and baking powder. Set aside. Beat Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk and margarine until smooth. Add dry mixture and stir until blended. Stir in raisins, coconut and walnuts. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375f for 8-10 minutes. Cool 1 minute. Remove from cookie sheet to wire rack. Cool completely.

Pound steaks to 1/2 inch thick. Rub with 1 teaspoon of garlic salt and 1/2 teaspoon of pepper. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add steaks and cook 3 minutes per side. Remove from heat. Mash parsley into skillet. Spread evenly on top of each steak. Serve in rolls. Spread mayonnaise on both sides of bread. Fill with steak mixture.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Wash the red bell peppers and dry them. Cut them in half lengthwise. Remove the seeds. Season the inside of each half with salt, beef, garlic salt and black pepper. Place 1 tablespoon of the mixture in each half of the bell peppers. Heat the butter in a saute pan. Add the lemon juice, Tabasco Sauce. and bread crumbs. Cook over medium heat until the bread crumbs are golden brown. Lay 1/4 of the mixture on the bottom of a 9 by 13 inch baking dish. Place 4 bell peppers on top of the mixture. Top with 1/4 of the remaining mixture. Top the mixture with 4 bell peppers. Repeat until all of the mixture is used. Top with the remaining mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes. Serve hot.

Cook the beans in a large pot of boiling water until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Drain. Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the curry paste and stir-fry until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the dried shrimp and stir-fry until the shrimp are lightly browned, about 1 minute. Add the pork and stir-fry until the meat is browned, about 3 minutes. Add the stock and fish sauce. Add the lime leaves. Simmer over medium-low heat until the liquid is almost evaporated, about 5 minutes. Add the palm sugar. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add the green beans. Heat until the green beans are tender. Serve with jasmine rice.

Preheat grill to medium high heat. Mix cream cheese, garlic salt & parsley. Wrap 1 piece of bacon around the middle of each breast to form a pocket. Spoon cream cheese mixture into pocket of each breast. Season both sides of the breast with garlic salt & place on grill. Grill until meat is no longer pink & cheese is melted (about 8-10 min.). Remove from heat & place on cutting board & slice down the middle of the pocket to let the cream cheese & bacon out. Serve with your favorite side item & enjoy!

In a large punch bowl combine limeade concentrate, lemonade concentrate, orange extract and water. Stir until well combined. Add in the 7-Up. Refrigerate until ready to serve. When ready to serve add in the tequila. Serve over ice.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f (220 degrees c). Prepare pie crust as directed on box for a single-crust pie. Spread with 1/2 cup of creamsprinkle with chives and cayenne pepper. Arrange broccoli and salmon over creamsprinkle with dill and remaining cream. Beat eggs and remaining ingredients with a mixer at high speed until smoothpour over filling. Bake at 425 degrees f (220 degrees c) for 30 minutesthen reduce heat to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Bake for 10 to 15 minutes more or until center is set.

Separate the eggs and combine the whites and yolks in a medium bowl. Add the milk and beat until well combined. Stir in the vanilla extract and sugar and beat until smooth. In another bowl, stir together the cream cheese and cinnamon until well combined. Stuff each piece of bread with about 1/3 cup of the cream cheese mixture and spread the remaining mixture on top of the bread. Be sure that the mixture reaches the edges of the bread. Heat a lightly greased skillet over medium-high heat. Add the slices of bread and cook until golden brown on each side, about 2 minutes per side. In the meantime, combine the fruit with the sweet cream and serve on the side. Serve the toasts warm with the fruit mixture on the side.

In a small bowl, combine the melted butter with the lemon juice, parsley, garlic and pepper flakes. Set aside. Arrange the shrimp in a single layer on a broiler pan lined with aluminum foil, brush with the melted butter and sprinkle with the bread crumb mixture. Broil for 1 to 2 minutes on each side or until the bread crumb mixture is golden brown and the shrimp are opaque and firm. Serve immediately.

Combine berries, tapioca, sugar, cinnamon and lemon juice in a large bowl, mix well. Let mixture stand 15 minutes. Line a 9-inch pie plate with pastry, fill with berry mixture. Dot with butter. Adjust top crust, cutting slits for steam to escape. Bake in a preheated 400-degree oven for 50 to 55 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbly. Spread with sour cream. Cool completely before cutting into wedges to serve.

Line a 20cm x 20cm tin with greaseproof paper. Place biscuit crumbs in a large bowl. Melt butter and golden syrup. Stir through the biscuit crumbs until well combined. Press mixture into the prepared tin. Bake for 10 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 160c. Spread the sweetened condensed milk over the base. Sprinkle with copha and slivered almonds. Bake for 25 minutes. Pour over the melted chocolate and allow to set. Cut into squares.

Cut zucchini in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds. Chop zucchini and put in a mixing bowl. In a separate bowl, mix egg and mayo. Add zucchini and bread crumbs to the egg mixture and combine well. Add the italian and old bay seasonings and mix thoroughly. Form zucchini mixture into four equal balls. Fry in hot oil until brown. Remove from oil and place on a paper towel to remove the excess oil. Serve with tartar sauce.

Mix the butter, sugar and egg together until smooth. Add the self raising flour and a pinch of salt. Add the orange zest and juice, followed by the vanilla and cocoa powder. Stir in the water to make a soft dough. Wrap in plastic and refrigerate for at least half an hour. Divide the dough into small balls and roll in your hands to form small balls. Place on baking trays lined with baking paper. Bake in a preheated oven at 180C/350F for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown on the outside. Dip the puddings in the melted butter, then roll in the cocoa to coat well.

Cream together butter and granulated sugar till light and fluffy. Blend in milk, cocoa and vanilla. In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. Add to creamed mixture and beat until well blended. Add quick-cooking oats and mix well. Add coconut and walnuts and mix well. Drop by teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheets and bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 12-14 minutes. Do not over bake. Cool on wire racks. Makes about 60.
I am so glad that I found this website! The recipes are awesome and I have already tried one and it was delicious! I will be trying more in the future!
I have used this site for years and the recipes are great! I have used some of them for years and they have never failed me! Thanks so much and keep up the good work!
I have been looking for an easy way to make a peanut butter cookie and this was it! It is easy and delicious! I will be making it again!

Cream the softened butter with the brown sugar until pale and creamy. Beat in the treacle and eggs until smooth. Sift in the plain and self raising flours with the mixed spice and bicarbonate of soda. Put the mixture into a refrigerator for about half an hour to firm up slightly. Roll out about half a centimetre thick on a floured surface and cut into shapes with a cookie cutter. Lay the shapes on a non-stick or greased baking sheet with the flat side down. Bake for about half an hour at 180c/gas mark 4 until firm. Allow to cool on the tray before removing to a wire rack.

Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions. Cook until the onions are translucent and lightly browned. Stir in the ground nutmeg. Add the corn kernels. Cook until the kernels are tender. Combine the cooked corn kernels with the milk. Stir in the eggs. Season with the salt, black pepper and nutmeg. Transfer the mixture to a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle the cheddar over the top. Bake until the custard is set and the cheddar is melted. Serves 8.

Combine vegetables in a large saucepan. Cover with water. Bring to a boilcover and cook over low heat 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Drain and discard liquid. Melt margarine in a small saucepan over low heatadd garlic and cook 1 minute. Stir in lemon juice and herbscook over medium heat 1 minute or until heated through. Stir into vegetable mixturetoss lightly. Makes 4 servings (2-1/2 cups).

In a large pot bring heavy cream and whole milk up to 180 degrees F. Whisk brown sugar, honey, gingerroot, and vanilla into the warm cream mixture until well blended. Remove from heat and cool slightly, then strain mixture through a fine-mesh sieve. Return the mixture to the pot over low heat and gradually add the egg yolks, whisking constantly until the mixture thickens and coats the back of a wooden spoon. Remove from heat. Chill mixture thoroughly. Process mixture in your ice cream maker according to the manufacturers instructions. Transfer the mixture into a storage container and freeze until hard. Serve with a garnish of finely chopped crystallized gingerroot.

Combine sugar and honey in a small saucepan. Add milk and cook over medium-low heat until mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in ginger, cloves, and red pepper. Return to heat and stir in cocoa and vanilla. Simmer for 1 minute. Serve immediately with a dollop of whipped cream.

Cook the spaghetti according to the package directions. In a large skillet over medium heat add the white mushrooms. Add the butter. Cook and stir until the mushrooms are tender. Add the spaghetti and the cooked turkey. Add the remaining ingredients. Cook and stir until thoroughly heated. Serve.
name: leftover turkey or chicken enchiladasingredients: cooked turkey, vegetables, cheddar cheese, mexican blend cheese, salsa, cumin, chili powder, hot sauce, tortillaspreparation:Preheat oven to 350f. In a bowl toss turkey, vegetables, cheese, salsa, hot sauce, chili powder, and cumin. Spoon filling into tortilla shells. You may need to use more than four if your shells are small. Roll the tortilla up and place seam side down into a lightly greased baking pan. Top with extra cheese and salsa if desired. Baked until heated through, about 15-20 minutes.
name: hot

Preheat oven to 250 degrees. In a small bowl, combine the crispix cereal and the spaghetti sauce mix. Spread onto a baking sheet. Bake for 45 minutes stirring once or twice. Remove from oven and let cool. In a large bowl combine the pretzel nuggets, parmesan cheese and garlic powder. Mix until the nuggets are coated. Spread the nuggets onto a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes at 250 degrees. Remove from oven and let cool. Store in air tight container. Serve with pretzel nuggets and garlic bread.

In 12-inch skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add pork chops. Cook until brown. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with onion soup mix. Lay frozen vegetables evenly over top of pork chops. Mix rice and broth. Spread over vegetables. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Bake 45-50 minutes.

Melt the butter over medium-high heat in a medium-sized sauté pan or frying pan. Add the mushrooms, then the garlic and cook for 3 minutes or until the liquid evaporates from the pan and the mushrooms are tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Melt the butter in the pan, then add the chives and cook for about 1 minute more or until the chives are just wilted. Serve hot with the mushrooms. Serves 4 as an appetizer or 2 as a main course.

Mix the milk and the tea in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Heat until the mixture starts bubbling vigorously. Add the cinnamon sticks and simmer for another minute or two. Pour into tall glasses and serve hot with a little extra cinnamon on top.

Cut onions into thin slices. Heat the oil in a saucepan, add onions, garlic cloves and saute for 2 minutes. Add passata and stir well. Add turmeric powder and garam masala powder. Stir well. Add green cardamom seeds. Add 4 cups of boiling hot water. Bring to boil. Simmer for 10 minutes. Stir well. Add more boiling hot water if needed. Stir well. Add more salt if needed. Serve with boiled rice.

Boil water with stock cube. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Drain water and let cool for a few minutes. Melt butter in a large frying pan. Add shallot and cook until soft. Add tomatoes and cook for about one minute. Add the sour cream and paprika and cook for a few minutes until it is all warmed through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add potatoes and stir through until coated. Garnish with parsley.

Wrap each tortilla in a dish towel, place on a microwave-safe plate and microwave on high for one minute. Top each with a couple tablespoons of enchilada sauce and about a tablespoon of onion and roll up. Pour the remaining enchilada sauce into a 13x9 inch baking dish. Place each rolled up tortilla seam side down in the baking dish. Bake for 15 minutes or until heated through. Serve with low-calorie salsa if desired.

Steam the broccoli florets for 10 minutes. Heat the oil in wok over medium heat. Add the red chili pepper. Stir fry for 2 minutes. Add the broccoli. Stir fry for 2 more minutes. Add the dark soy sauce. Stir fry for 1 more minute. Serve hot.

In a large skillet over medium heat, brown chicken in butter. Remove from pan. Saute the mushrooms until they are golden brown. In a bowl, combine the soup, sour cream, garlic salt and paprika. Place the chicken in a greased 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Spread the mushrooms on top of the chicken. Pour the soup mixture over the chicken and mushrooms. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until the juices run clear. I would have used swiss cheese shredded.

Whisk cream in a bowl until it forms soft peaks. Add the lemon and sugar and beat well. Fold in the low-fat cream cheese until it is evenly distributed. Spoon into dishes and refrigerate for 4 hours. Garnish with fruit of your choice or whipped cream if desired.

Melt the butter over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute until fragrant. Add the scallions and saute until softened. Add the scallops and stir until lightly browned. Add the white wine and cook until the liquid evaporates. Add the cream and bring to a boil. Add the salt and pepper and serve. Serve over hot pasta or rice.

In large mixing bowl combine neufchatel cheese, butter, egg, and vanilla. Mix well and add chocolate cake mixmix well. Place 1 tablespoon of dough onto prepared cookie sheet and shape into ballrepeat until all dough is gone. Bake at 350 degrees F for 11-13 minutes. Cool on wire rack and store in airtight container.

In a food processor bowl, combine tomatoes, breadcrumbs, cheese, chives and basil and pulse until evenly mixed. Transfer to a medium bowladd 2 tablespoons butter and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt and 1/8 teaspoon of pepper. Using your hands, mix until the mixture is evenly moistened. Divide mixture evenly into 16 portionsform each into a 1/2-inch-thick patty. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat remaining 2 tablespoons butter until melted. Add the pattiescook 3-4 minutes on each side or until browned and heated through. Serve immediately.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Chill for one hour. Serve on lettuce leaf. Sprinkle with coconut and cherries.

Brown the pork in a little oil. Add the soy sauce, ground ginger and ground pepper. Add the chicken broth. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and add the chinese cabbage. Add the chow mein noodles. Boil for an additional 2 minutes.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the olive oil, onion and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally until the onion is soft and slightly golden. Add the baby spinach and stir until just wilted. Stir in the feta and season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a serving dish and top with creme fraiche. Serve with pita wedges.

Wash and dry whole chickens. Melt butter in a 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking pan. Remove skin and cut up whole chickens into small pieces. Add parsley to the butter. Add the crumbs and mix well. Add the cheese and mix well. Add the chickens and mix well. Bake uncovered for 35 minutes at 450 degrees. Baste after 15 minutes. Cook until browned and done. Remove and serve.
name: cranberry orange rosemary chickeningredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil 3 (1/4 inch) thick boneless pork chops 1/2 teaspoon oregano 1/4 teaspoon dried rosemary 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme 1/2 teaspoon dried marjoram 1/8 teaspoon dried savory 1/8 teaspoon dried sage 1/8 teaspoon dried basil 1 teaspoon lemon zest 1/2 teas

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f (190 degrees c). In a large bowl, combine the broccoli and celery. In a small bowl, combine the italian dressing and mustardpour over the vegetables and toss to coat. Spread the vegetables in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Bake for 15 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Remove from the oven and let cool slightly. In a large bowl, combine the cheddar cheese, ham, black olives and pasta. Stir in the vegetables and toss well. Cover and refrigerate.

Heat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray cookie sheet with cooking spray. Mix all topping ingredients. Cut bread into 1/2-inch strips. Spread with margarine and sprinkle with half the topping mixture. Place strips on cookie sheet and bake for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Flip and sprinkle with remaining topping mixture. Bake 5 minutes more or until golden brown. Serve warm or cool.
name: german french toastingredients: eggs, white bread, muenster cheese, milk, butter, saltpreparation:Melt butter in a skillet on medium heat. In a small bowl, beat together eggs, milk and salt. Dip bread slices one at a time in egg mixture, and fry in butter until bolden brown. After turning once, top each slice of bread with a slice of muenster cheese. Cover skillet until the cheese is melted. Serve and enjoy.
name: basic french toastingredients: eggs, milk, sugar, salt, white bread, but

In a medium heavy bottomed saucepan whisk together eggs, maple syrup, milk, salt and nutmeg until smooth. Stir over medium low heat until mixture begins to thicken (do not boil). Remove from heat and cool. Serve warm or cold. Serves 4 to 6.

In a large skillet cook beef and drain. Add the vegetables and cook 5 minutes longer. Mix the rest of the ingredients together and add to beef mixture. Cook a few minutes more and serve on hot dog buns.

Mix all the filling ingredients together. Place a teaspoon of filling in the middle of a wonton wrapper. Bring up opposite sides and press together. Pinch top and bottom corners together. Heat a pan of hot oil and deep fry the dumplings till they are golden brown.

In a medium bowl mix soy sauce, vinegar and sugar. Cut chicken into strips and marinate in mixture for 30 minutes. Drain chicken and saut in hot oil for 3 to 4 minutes. Add green chilies and saute for 2 to 3 more minutes. Spread chicken mixture over kaiser rolls. Top with cheese and broil in oven just until cheese melts. Cut in half and serve.
This recipe for Green Chilie Chicken, by , is from The McCluskey Cookbook Project, one of the cookbooks created at FamilyCookbookProject.com. We'll help you start your own personal cookbook! It's easy and fun. Click here to start your own cookbook!
Heat green chilies, soup, and sour cream in a saucepan. Pour into 9x9 cake pan or casserole dish and add chicken. Stir to coat chicken.
Pre-heat oven to 350 f and bake for about 45 minutes. Chicken is done when center is no longer pink

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook until al dente. Drain and return to pot. In a small bowl combine the flour, garlic powder and 1 tsp of the parsley flakes. Mix well. In a large skillet heat the butter over medium heat. Add the flour mixture and stir until blended. Cook for 2 minutes. Whisk in the milk. Bring to a boil. Add the chicken and cook until heated through. Stir in the remaining 1 tsp of the parsley flakes. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet. Add salt and pepper to taste. Toss well. Transfer to a serving dish. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.

Sauté onion and garlic in olive oil until tender. Add cayenne and saute until fragrant. Add bacon and saute until crisp. Add oysters and saute until they just open. Place in a dish and sprinkle with dry bread crumbs. Top with parmesan cheese and bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Serves 4 to 6.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook onions and stir occasionally for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Gradually add the milk and broth and bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to medium-lowsimmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes or until thickened, stirring occasionally. Stir in the salt, mace and egg yolkscook for 2 minutes or until yolks are cooked through, stirring constantly. Stir in the parsleypour into individual bowls and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 300f. In a large skillet over medium heat melt the butter. Stir in orange liqueur and orange rind. Cook for 2 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rind is softened. Remove from heat. Stir in the pecans. Place on a cookie sheet. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until nuts are golden. Cool. Store at room temperature for up to 2 weeks.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Combine brown sugar with vinegar in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil. Stir in the cumin and red pepper and simmer 1 minute more. Remove from the heat. Rub the mixture all over the pork chops, then place them on the grill. Grill the chops until the meat is no longer pink in the middle, 8 to 10 minutes per side. Serve immediately.
What is it with men and their cars? I am not sure why it is that men seem to have this affinity for cars, but I will tell you that it is not just men that seem to like cars, but women as well. I have known many women that enjoy cars as much as their husbands or boyfriends do. I guess that it is the thrill of the road that makes these people so excited about their cars.
One of the main things that people seem to enjoy about cars is the fact that they can get from one place to another very quickly. The fact that people can go from one place to another so quickly is really the main thing that people like about cars. People

Spread margarine evenly on 2 slices of whole wheat bread. Layer slices of tomatoes and bell peppers on one slice of bread. Lay 2 slices of swiss cheese on top of tomatoes and bell peppers. Place other slice of whole wheat bread with margarine on top of sandwich. Fry on both sides until brown and cheese has melted. Cut sandwich into 4 pieces and add olives and lettuce leaves.

In a large skillet, saute carrots and onion in butter until tender. In a medium saucepan, combine flour, salt and dry mustard. Stir in low-fat milk. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly until thickened. Stir in the carrot mixture. Add the pepper and cheese. Pour into a greased 2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm. Makes 6 servings.

Mix garlic powder, salt and pepper together in a small bowl. Add chicken and rub in spice mixture evenly on both sides of the breasts. Grill for 6 minutes per side until cooked through. Spread apricot preserves on the grilled chicken and sprinkle with sweet chili sauce, scallion and ginger. Serve over cooked rice.
I am trying this tomorrow for dinner! Yum!
Haha! I'm trying these tomorrow too!
Wow, I think I will try out the spicy citrus one tomorrow night! Thanks for the recipes!

Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sausage and saute until browned and no longer pink in the center. Remove the sausage from the pan and set aside. In the same skillet, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the onions and saute until soft and transparent. Remove from heat and add the parmesan cheese and stir until melted. Add the basil and oregano and mix until well combined. Place in a large bowl and set aside to cool slightly. Once the sausage and the onion mixture have cooled slightly, mix together in the bowl of the sausage and onion mixture and add the ground beef, eggs and parsley and mix until well combined. Using about two tablespoons of the mixture for each meatball, roll the mixture into 2-inch balls. Place the meatballs in the skillet and brown them, turning once so they are evenly browned all over. Once the meatballs are browned remove from the skillet and place into the prepared casserole dish. Pour the sausage and onion mixture over the meatballs and bake in the

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Rinse the pheasant under cold water, inside and out. Pat dry with a paper towel. Combine the honey, lemon juice, tarragon, thyme, pepper and garlic powder to form a paste. Place the pheasant on a baking sheet or roasting pan, and use your hands to rub the honey mixture all over the bird until completely coated. Sprinkle the pheasant with the salt, then roast for 15 minutes. Turn the pheasant over and roast for another 15 minutes or until the juices run clear when the bird is pierced with a knife. Remove the pheasant from the oven and brush on some more honey to taste. Serve hot. Serve with the lemon halves on the side for squeezing over the pheasant. Serves 2 to 3.

Cook the edamame in the boiling water for 5 minutes. Drain and set aside to cool. Meanwhile heat the butter in a sauté pan over medium-high heat. Once the butter has melted add the corn and cook for 3 minutes. Add the red onion and cook for another 2 minutes or so. Add the edamame, sherry wine, basil, salt and pepper to taste. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover and cook for 5-10 minutes or so- it should still be bright green, but fork tender. Serve hot.

Wash and pit plums. Cut plums in half and remove stones. Place plums, water, sugar, lemon juice, ginger, and rind in a heavy saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to lowsimmer for 1 hour stirring occasionally until plums are soft. Remove from heatstir in butter. Force plums through a sieve set over another saucepan. Cook until thickened over medium heat for 5-7 minutes stirring frequently. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Ladle hot jam into sterilized jars leaving 1/4-inch headspaceseal jars and process according to manufacturers instructions.

Line 8x8 pan with aluminum foil and spray lightly with cooking spray. In large mixing bowl, combine all ingredients. Spread into pan. Bake 25-30 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool. Cut into squares. Wrap individually in plastic wrap or wax paper and place in airtight containers. Makes 24.

Beat egg white with fork until foamy. Add brown sugar. Stir in curry powder and seasoning salt. Add nuts and toss well until coated. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees until golden, about 10 minutes. Stir after about 5 minutes.

In a large pot, over medium-high heat, saute the onion and carrot until tender. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and add the chicken legs. Cook until the chicken is tender and cooked through. Add the sour cream and milk and stir until blended. Add the pepper and cook for another minute or so.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare cracker crumbs by placing crackers in a food processor and pulsing until fine crumbs are formed. Combine egg, milk, brown sugar, baking powder and flour in a bowl and mix well with a fork. Stir in cracker crumbs and 1/4 cup coconut and mix well. Press into a 13 x 9 inch baking pan and bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned. Cool for 15 minutes. Crumble remaining 3/4 cup coconut over bars while still warm. Press cherries into the top when cooled. Cut into 2 inch squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cut off top of each poblano pepper. Remove seeds. Set tops aside. Place each pepper on a small piece of foil. Divide potatoes evenly into four peppers. Spoon about 1/4 cup enchilada sauce into each pepper. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon each of the cheese. Top each with 1/4 of the sausage. Replace tops of peppers. Fold foil around each pepper. Place in shallow baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Remove from oven. Serve in peppers. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup of cheese.

Peel and cut mushrooms into halves. Heat a saucepan over medium heat. Add butter and cook until butter is bubbling. Add mushrooms and cook until soft. Pour white wine and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Cook until wine is almost all gone. In a small saucepan over medium heat, bring cream and tarragon to a boil. Turn off heat and pour over mushrooms. Serve mushrooms over a slice of toasted bread and a salmon fillet. Serve with lemon wedges.

Grease 1 1/2 quart slow cooker with cooking spraysprinkle bottom with salt. Layer 1/2 of potatoes and onionssprinkle with 1/2 of the soup mixture, 1/2 of the milk and 1/2 of the cheese. Repeat layers. Sprinkle with pimiento and peppercover and cook for 4-5 hours on low, or 2-1/2-3 hours on high (until potatoes are tender). Serve hot.
name: crock pot potato casserolepreparation:In a medium size bowl, combine potato mixture, milk, egg, onion powder, salt and pepper to taste. Mix well. Spray a 9 x 13 baking dish with non-stick spray. Pour potato mixture into dish. Bake for 1 hour or until potatoes are tender and a knife inserted into a casserole comes out clean. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.
name: slow-cooked chicken with vegetablespreparation:Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-

Beat butter with sugar until soft. Add vanilla extract and beat again. Add eggs one at a time. Beat until light and creamy. Fold in ground almonds and sifted flour. Beat lightly again. Spoon into a greased springform pan lined with parchment paper. Place in a waterbath in the preheated oven for about 1 hour. Cool in the waterbath for 1 hour more then remove from pan and cool on a rack. Place on serving plate and frost with strawberry jam and heavy cream.

Peel and cube potatoes. Combine with margarine in large saucepan. Cook over medium heat until tender, about 20 minutes. Stir in green pepper and onion. Cook 5 minutes longer or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Stir in onion soup mix. Cook for 1 minute longer or until heated through.

Cook the peas in boiling water for 15 minutes or until tender. Rinse with cold water and drain. Shell the hard-boiled eggs and cut into small pieces. Chop the onion and combine with the eggs in a bowl and set aside. In a large bowl, combine the peas with the eggs and onion and mix well. Add the mayonnaise and mix well. Add the pimiento and mix well again. Add the salt and pepper and mix well again. Refrigerate for a few hours before serving. Serves 6.

Melt butter in large skillet. Saute onions until tender. Add soup, milk and half-and-half. Stir well. Bring to boil. Add crabmeat and sherry. Heat through. Stir in salt and pepper. Serve with crackers.
Puree pomegranates in a blender or food processor. Add all other ingredients and puree again. Serve in tall glasses, garnished with fresh mint. Serve chilled.
Fill a shaker with cubed ice. Add the ronague bay whisky, lime juice and sugar syrup. Shake for 10 seconds. Strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Combine mint leaves, sugar and balsamic vinegar in small bowl. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Stir in rosemary. Cover with plastic wraprefrigerate up to 3 days.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 13 x 9-inch pan. Arrange the hamburgers in the pan and top with cheese and green chilies. Beat the eggs with the milk in a large bowl. Pour the egg mixture over the hamburger mixture. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake the casserole for about 40 minutes or until the egg mixture is set and lightly browned.

Grease and line a 9x13 inch pan with parchment paper. Heat oven to 325 degrees F. In a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, granulated sugar and salt. Add the butter and mix well. Beat in the egg and orange extract. Spread the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 25 minutes, until golden. Let cool completely and then spread on the cream cheese mixture. Sprinkle with powdered sugar and orange zest before serving.

Carefully remove the core of the tomatoes and finely dice them into a bowl with the onion and sugar. Season with salt and pepper and mix the diced tomatoes and onion together, leaving the mixture a bit chunky rather than pureed. Sift the flour into the bowl and mix into the tomatoes with your hands. Divide the mixture into small balls (about 2 tbsp of mixture per ball), flatten slightly into a patty shape and place onto a plate. Lightly coat your hands with some flour and then take each patty and flatten it gently into an oblong shape about 2cm thick. Heat a heavy nonstick frying pan over a medium-high heat until just smoking (the pan should be hot before adding the domatokeftedes), add a good splash of the olive oil and sear the domatokeftedes until they're lightly browned on the bottom, about a minute or so. Flip the domatokeftedes over and cook the other side for a further minute or so. The domatokeftedes should be cooked through but still retain a little softness in the middle.

In a bowl combine the first 6 ingredients. Add the shrimp and toss to coat well. In a small bowl combine the lime juice and next 4 ingredients. Set aside. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until very hot. Add half the shrimp mixture to pancook 3-4 minutes or just until shrimp turn pink, stirring constantly to brown evenly. Transfer to a platterkeep warm. Repeat with remaining oil and shrimp mixture, adding the lime juice mixture after the third batch is cooked. Toss to coat well. Garnish with parsley, if desired. Serve over rice or pasta.

Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook carrots until crisp-tender. Drain well and set aside. In a medium saucepan combine butter, brown sugar, bourbon and fresh parsley. Cook over medium heat until sugar melts and mixture comes to a boil. Boil for 2 minutes. Add carrots and cook for 3 minutes or until glazed. Stir in fresh parsley. Season to taste with additional salt and pepper if desired.

Cut mozzarella into 1/4-inch thick rounds. Wrap each round with a prosciutto slice. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil. Add the mozzarella wrapped in prosciutto and cook over medium-low heat for 3 to 4 minutes per side or until browned and just warmed through. Place 1 piece of salad greens on each of 6 dinner plates. Top each with a slice of the pan-fried mozzarella and 1/2 teaspoon of cranberry sauce. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Toss cauliflower with margarine in large bowl. Transfer to 13 x 9 inch baking pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until florets are just tender. Sprinkle with italian seasoned bread crumbs. Bake 5 minutes more or until lightly browned.
These recipes for baked chicken breasts are so delicious. The chicken breasts are moist, tender and full of flavor.

If you want to make it a main meal, it's easy to bake up a whole chicken breast and have a meal in just a few minutes. Chicken is also one of the leanest meats around. It's high in protein and low in fat, so it
Toss together radishes, peppers and carrots in large bowl. Combine next 5 ingredients. Mix well and pour over vegetables. Toss well to blend. Refrigerate up to 24 hours.

In a large saucepan cook sausage in hot oil over medium-high heat until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in carrot, onion, broth, and seasoning. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes or until pasta is tender. Add kalecover and cook about 10 minutes longer or until kale is wilted. Top each serving with cheese.
name: italian wedding soup with 5 ingredientsingredients: olive oil, onion, chicken broth, thin spaghetti, black pepper, meatballs, baby spinachpreparation:in a large pot, combine oil and onion. cook over medium heat for 1 minute, or until sizzling. add broth, pasta, and pepper. bring to a boil. cook, stirring, for 5 minutes. add meatballs and spinach. reduce heat to low. cook for 5 minutes or until pasta is tender.
name: easy italian chicken soupingredients: chicken breasts, olive oil, chicken broth,

Cook cumin seeds and pine nuts in a frying pan until fragrant. Add diced red onion and cook until soft. Add vegetable stock and bring to the boil. Remove from heat and add couscous and leave to stand for 5 minutes. Add apricots and sultanas and fluff gently with a fork. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix gently. Serve warm.

Place the salmon in a greased pan. Add the italian salad dressing and water. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Simmer for about 40 minutes or until fish is flaky with a fork when tested in the center of the fish. Serve over rice and sprinkle with mushrooms.
Puree honeydew in blender until smooth. Transfer to bowl. Stir in lime juice, honey and yogurt. Serve in bowls with honeydew balls.

Heat the oil in a wok or large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the onion and capsicum and stir-fry for 3 minutes until soft. Add the noodles and broccoli florets and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes. Add the prawns and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes. Add the teriyaki marinade to the pan. Stir-fry over high heat until the mixture is heated through. Serve with extra teriyaki marinade and squeeze of lime.

Melt margarine in a large skillet over medium heat. Add shallots and saute 2 minutes. Add green beans and cook 3 minutes or until tender crisp. Stir in chicken broth. Add salt and pepper. Cover. Cook 1-2 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with Parmesan.

Soak the fish for an hour or so in the buttermilk and cornmeal mixture. Then dip the fish into the flour mixture and then into the egg mixture and then back into the flour mixture and then into the vegetable oil heated at 325 degrees and cook the fish for about 10-12 minutes on each side. Then when the fish is done you can put it on a plate and sprinkle the fish with the sea salt and black pepper mixture and serve it with the coleslaw and the fries and a lemon wedge and you are ready for some good eatin'

Remove stems from strawberries. Cut a deep x in top of each berry. Spread berries apart. In a bowl, whisk milk and pudding mix for 2 minutes. Fold in whipped topping. Pipe or spoon about 5 teaspoons into each berry. Chill until serving.
I love my strawberry cheesecake and this is a great recipe to get you going.
I love Strawberry Mousse, this one looks and sounds delicious.
I love your recipe for Strawberry Mousse. I have been looking for a recipe like this for my family. Thanks so much!
I have to try your recipe for Strawberry Mousse. I'm sure it will be a hit.
I love Strawberry Mousse. I can't wait to make this recipe.

Cook rice in water and salt in a double boiler until done. Add mushrooms to pan and cook until tender. Add onion and cook until tender. Stir in cooked rice, cream cheese, eggs, evaporated milk, and season to taste. Turn into a greased casserole. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Serves 6-8.

In a 2-quart saucepan over medium heat, stir together the cocoa powder and 4 tablespoons of the Splenda Brown Sugar Blend. Slowly add the water and stir until blended. Cook 1 minute over medium heat. Stir in the milk. Continue cooking until boiling. Remove from the heat. Stir in the vanilla and cool until it is the desired temperature. Ladle into mugs. Garnish with the cinnamon stick and whipped cream. Serves 4.

Cook the streaky bacon until it is crisp. Chop it into small pieces. In a saucepan heat the olive oil. Add the streaky bacon, the crushed cherry tomatoes and the zucchini. Cook the vegetables for about five minutes. Add the pasta to the saucepan. Stir in the pesto sauce and the parmesan cheese. Toss everything together until the pasta is evenly coated. Serve immediately.

Slice the 4 strips of bacon in half and saut&apose with the onion and peppers in 1 tbs butter. Add 1 tsp of water and then add the eggs and season with salt and pepper. Cook and stir until the eggs are done. Sprinkle with shredded cheese and serve.

Puree chickpeas, red peppers, garlic, feta cheese and hot red pepper sauce in a blender or food processor. Season to taste with the pepper and the salt. Serve as a dip for vegetable crudités. Serves 4.

Place coffee beans in a mortar or heavy bowl and crush into fine powder using a pestle or wooden spoon. Transfer the powder into a heavy-bottomed pot and add whole cloves, cinnamon sticks, red pepper flakes and water. Bring to a boil over high heat and reduce heat to low, cover and let boil for approximately 3 hours or until very dark in color. Strain through a fine sieve into another pot. Bring to boil over high heat again. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil over high heat again. Reduce heat to low and let simmer for another half hour or until it starts to thicken. Add honey and salt. Serve immediately in mugs or cups with honey drizzled on top if desired.

Boil potatoes until tender, about 15 to 20 minutes. Cool. Cut into quarters. In a large bowl, combine bacon, mayonnaise, broth, mustard and vinegar. Add potatoes and toss to coat. Sprinkle with green onions, parsley, and season to taste with salt and black pepper.

Grease 9x13-inch pan and preheat oven to 375f. Combine flour, baking powder and saltset aside. Cream together butter and sugars. Beat in vanilla and eggs until well combined. Add dry ingredients to wet and mix well. Pour into prepared pan and bake 18 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean from center. Cool completely and cut into squares. For frosting combine chocolate, butter and milk in a small saucepan and heat until melted and smooth. Pour evenly over cooled brownies and cool in refrigerator until frosting is set and then cut into squares.

Heat olive oil in skillet. Add chicken breasts and brown on both sides. Add chopped vegetables to the skillet. Add the chicken stock, curry powder, and the seasonings. Bring to a boil. Reduce to simmer and cook for 20 minutes. Add frozen vegetables. When vegetables are tender add the raisins and couscous. Mix well. Cook for 5 minutes or until couscous is tender. Serve with yogurt. Serves 3-4.

butter one side of each slice of bread. Spread olive salad on non-buttered side of one slice of bread. Top with ham, mortadella and salami. Add other slice and spread olive salad on inside. Add remaining slice and press down. Spread olive salad on outside and place on your grill or on your george foreman grill and cook until it is golden brown on both sides. Enjoy.

Mix all ingredients together in a bowl and toss until well coated. Spread out on a greased cookie sheet, bake for 1 hour or until well glazed and crisp. Store in an air tight container.
This site offers you a way to find out how to make peanut brittle without corn syrup or sugar.
A recipe for homemade peanut brittle without corn syrup or sugar.
A recipe for making peanut brittle at home with corn syrup.
A recipe for homemade peanut brittle with corn syrup.
A recipe for homemade peanut brittle without corn syrup or sugar.

Toast the amaretti cookies by placing them in the oven for about 4-5 minutes on a baking sheet, or until fragrant and lightly toasted. Allow to cool completely.In a medium saucepan, bring the whole milk to a simmer with the amaretti cookies. Add the short-grain rice, stirring to break up any lumps. Reduce the heat to low and continue to cook, stirring occasionally, until the rice has absorbed most of the liquid and the mixture is thickened slightly, about 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the white chocolate until smooth. Serve immediately with a dusting of cocoa powder on top, if desired.

Brown the ground beef and onion. Add the pasta sauce and water. Bring to a boil and cook 20-30 minutes. Add the pasta and mushrooms and cook a few minutes more until the pasta is cooked through and the sauce is thickened and bubbly. Sprinkle the cheese over top and serve.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, saute the meat and vegetables in the oil until tender. Add the broth and cook until slightly thickened. Add the gravy mix and cook according to package directions. Serve over rice.

Bring water, bacon, onion, celery to boil in large skillet. Reduce heatsimmer for 30 minutes or until bacon is crisp. Remove bacon from panreserve 1 tablespoon drippings. Remove 1/2 of bacon with slotted spoon. Cut remaining bacon into 1/4 inch slicesset aside. Add brown rice, chicken broth, herbs, pepper, and 1 cup water to panbring to boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 40 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in corncook 5 minutes or until heated through. Add reserved baconmix lightly. Sprinkle with parsley before serving. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Spread nuts on cookie sheet. Combine 1/2 cup sugar & cinnamon in small bowlset aside. Beat egg white with vanilla until foamygradually add remaining 1/2 cup sugar. Beat until mixture is smooth. Drizzle evenly over nuts & mix well. Bake for 8 minutes or until mixture is bubbly & golden brown. Cool completely before using or storing in airtight container.
Almonds are one of the most nutritious nuts available in the world today.
Almonds contain more than 30 essential nutrients.
Almonds are a rich source of vitamin E, the body's primary fat soluble antioxidant.
Almonds are also rich in monounsaturated fatty acids such as oleic acid which have been found to help lower LDL or bad cholesterol levels while increasing HDL or good cholesterol levels in the body.
Almonds are a good source of potassium which is beneficial for blood pressure and heart health.

Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet. Add spinach. Cook over medium heat until wilted, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Remove to a bowl. Add 2 tablespoons of oil to skillet. Saute red bell peppers over medium heat until tender, about 3 minutes. Add garlic to skillet. Saute until golden brown. Add cooked spinach. Toss well. Season with hot pepper flakes. Serve immediately.

Boil ziti in a pot of salted boiling water until al dente. Drain and set aside. Melt 2 tablespoons of the butter in a small skillet on medium high heat. Add the garlic powder and cook for 30 seconds. Whisk the remaining 3 tablespoons butter into the hot garlic mixture. Add the heavy cream and 1/4 cup of the milk. Whisking constantly, bring the mixture to a boil and cook for 2 minutes until the mixture is slightly thickened. Add the cooked ziti and the remaining 1/2 cup milk to the skillet and toss to coat the noodles. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese and pepper to taste and toss to combine. Add the parsley and toss again to combine. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400f. Heat 2 inches of water to simmer in a large Dutch oven. Remove husks from 6 ears of corn. Place the ears of corn directly into the water to blanch. Cook 3 minutes. Remove from the water and allow to cool slightly. Peel back the husks and silks to remove the kernels. Discard the husks. Put the corn kernels into a blender. Add 1/2 cup of the water used for blanching the corn. Puree the mixture until smooth. Heat 1/2 cup of the oil in a large heavy skillet over medium heat. Add the chiles and cook until the chiles are softened, about 10 minutes. Add the pureed corn to the skillet. Add the remaining 1/2 cup of the water. Bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low. Simmer the mixture for 10 minutes. Stir in the feta cheese. Taste the soup for seasoning. Serve the soup hot. Makes 6 servings.

Microwave beans 1 minute. Spread over each chip. Top with a mound of cheese. Lay the chips in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Heat under the broiler until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Top each chip with a dollop of sour cream. Top with a sprinkle of cheese. Add onion and tomato.

Heat oil in heavy skillet. Sear pork on all sides until well browned. Add onion and saute until tender. Remove pork and set aside. Add mushrooms and saute until tender. Return pork and stir in wine. Cover and cook over medium-low heat for 20-30 minutes, or until done. Add parsley and stir in. Serve with noodles.
name: pork chop pot pieingredients: ground beef, vegetable shortening, onion powder, tomato sauce, frozen mixed vegetables, frozen puff pastry sheet, chicken broth, shredded swiss cheese, boneless pork chopspreparation:Preheat oven to 375. Brown the ground beef and drain. In a saucepan combine the tomato sauce and vegetable shortening. Add the browned ground beef and onion powder. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Add the frozen mixed vegetables and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the broth and heat to boiling. Add the pork chops and cook until the meat is

Peel, wash and slice the okras. Put them in a pressure cooker with 1 tbsp of water. Close the lid and cook under pressure for 4-5 whistles. Cool and set aside. Heat the oil in a pan. Add the onions and saut until golden brown. Add the ginger and saut for 30 secs. Add the garlic and saut for 10 secs. Now add the cooked okras and saut for 5 mins. Add the ground cumin, coriander and chilies. Sprinkle some water. Cover and cook under pressure for 5 mins. Add the lemon juice.

Pour sweetened condensed milk into mixing bowl. Add lime juice and egg yolks beat with an electric mixer on medium speed for 1 minute. Add lime zest pour into prepared pie shell and bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool on wire rack. Whipped cream topping can be made by using 3/4 cup heavy cream and 3 tbsp powdered sugar. Beat till stiff peaks form then add the lime juice and lime zest. Top pie with whipped cream.

In a 9x13x2 pan, layer 1/2 the rhubarb on the bottom and sprinkle with 1/2 the brown sugar. In a mixing bowl beat the eggs lightly. Add the vegetable oil and the white sugar. Stir in the dry ingredients. Then add the rhubarb and remaining 1/2 brown sugar and mix well. Spread over the rhubarb in the pan. Sprinkle with the quick-cooking oats and the cinnamon. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Cool and serve.

Cream together the white sugar and butter in a large bowl. Beat in the egg yolks, one at a time, then add the eggnog, vanilla and nutmeg. Stir in the flour, cinnamon and baking powder until combined. Stir in the chopped nuts, if using. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto greased baking sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks.
Eggs are a versatile food used in many recipes from pancakes to puddings to cookies to omelets to quiches.
Eggs are also used to thicken sauces like hollandaise or custards like pudding or pie filling.
The eggs used in recipes should be free of any cracks or dirt on the shells and should be refrigerated before using. The refrigerator will help keep them fresher longer.

Cook pasta according to box directions. When done drain and set aside. Melt butter in a large saucepan. Add evaporated milk and stir well. Add both cheeses and stir until melted. Add milk, cayenne pepper, salt and pepper. Stir well. Add pasta and mix well. Put in 9x13 pan or casserole dish. Bake 30 minutes on 350 degrees. Macaroni cheese.

Combine first seven ingredients. Place frying chickens into marinade and let stand for 30 minutes. Drain. Pour enough vegetable oil into skillet to come half way up side of chicken. Fry chickens at 350 for 10 minutes. Drain. Add onion salt and garlic powder. Mix and serve.

Brown sausage and drain. Cook ground beef until brown. Drain. Add sausage, cayenne, black pepper and salt. Cook 1 minute. Add onions, celery and green bell peppers. Cook until tender. Add cooked long grain rice. Cook, stirring frequently until heated through.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Whisk together flour, cardamom and baking powder in a bowl. With an electric mixer, beat the butter until light and fluffy. Add the sugar and beat until creamy. Add the eggs and vanilla and beat until blended. Add the flour mixture alternately with the milk, beating just until blended. Spread the batter in a 10 inch pie plate. Bake until the top springs back when lightly touched in the center. Cool for 10 minutes. In a bowl combine the butter and the oatmeal and crumble. Sprinkle over the batter and bake for 30 minutes longer. Spread the preserves on the warm cake. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Drain juice from the pickles in a small bowl. Set aside. Finely chop the pickles in the bowl of a food processor. Set aside. In a small saucepan, combine the remaining ingredients. Heat until the butter is melted and the sugar is dissolved. Add the chopped pickles and stir until well combined. Pack the mixture into sterile jars or freezer containers, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Seal the containers and refrigerate up to 3 weeks or freeze for up to 1 year.

Peel potatoes, cut in half lengthwise and boil in a large kettle of lightly salted water for about 20 minutes or until tender. Drain potatoes and return to kettle. Add heavy cream and butter to kettle and mash until smooth. Add 2 cups of flour and 1 teaspoon of salt to potatoes in kettle and mix well. Add enough flour to make a soft dough that can be kneaded. Knead on a lightly floured board for about 5 minutes or until smooth. Place about 1/4 of the dough on a lightly floured board or work surface. Pat with your hands into a 6-inch circle. Cut circle into four wedges with a pizza cutter. Place wedges onto an ungreased baking sheet. Repeat procedure until all of the dough has been used. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until lefse are golden brown on bottoms. Cool on wire rack before removing from pan or baking sheet.

In a 2-quart microwave-safe measuring cup, combine the pumpkin, milk, brown sugar, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and salt until blended. Beat the egg lightlyadd it to the mixture, stirring well. Cover the measuring cup with plastic wrapmicrowave on high for 5 minutes or until the custard is set but still moist. Let stand for 3 minutes. Spray a 1-quart microwave-safe dish with vegetable cooking sprayspoon the custard into the dish. Let stand 30 minutes before serving.

Combine first 4 ingredients in slow cooker. In a small bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Stir into first mixture. Add chicken breasts. Cover and cook on low for 3 hours or on high for 1 hour 45 minutes. Serve over hot cooked noodles or rice.
