Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the zucchini, onion and garlicsaute 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Add the salt and pepper. Increase the heat to medium-highsaute until the vegetables are tender and lightly browned, about 4 minutes. Add the diced tomatoescook 2 minutes or until the tomatoes are heated through. Remove from the heat. Stir in the roasted red peppersset aside. Drizzle both sides of the fish with the oilsprinkle with the seasoning mix. Place the fish in the skilletcook 4 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Sprinkle the parsley over the top. Yield: 2 servings.

Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place 8 honey graham cracker rectangles onto a baking sheet. Bake for 8 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown. Remove from oven, let cool and break into pieces. In a large bowl combine sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, eggs, heavy cream, milk and vanilla extract. Whisk until smooth. Add crushed honey graham cracker pieces and broken pieces of Hershey Bar. Add miniature marshmallow pieces and continue whisking until completely combined. Pour mixture into a freezer safe container and place in your freezer for 8 hours or overnight. Serve immediately or store in your freezer for up to 3 months. Serve in chilled glasses.

In a large pot of water with a little butter and a dash of Worcestershire Sauce, cook the oysters and remove them when the edges just begin to curl. Drain and keep warm. In a large pot of boiling water, cook the potato pieces for about 10 minutes, or until tender. Drain and mash with the low-fat milk and nutmeg. Season with the salt and white pepper. In a small pan over low heat, melt the butter with the flour and cook for 1 minute. Add the Worcestershire Sauce and stir. Stirring constantly, add the milk to the butter mixture and bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and add the cooked oysters. Serve with hot crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a large pot or kettle of boiling water, cook the squash for 2-3 minutes or until crisp tender. Drain and pat dry. In a large saut pan over medium heat, warm the oil. Add the squash and cook until golden and crisp tender, stirring occasionally. In a small bowl, mix the garlic and water until smooth. Pour the mixture over the squash and stir. Sprinkle the squash with the salt and pepper. Top with basil and serve immediately.

Wash and trim the string beans. Cook in boiling water until crisp-tender. Drain and set aside. Saut the onion in butter in a saucepan until translucent. Add the mushrooms and saut until tender. Add the string beans to the pan. Stir in the granulated sugar, seasoning salt and the garlic powder. Heat through. Stir in the whipping cream. Heat through. Remove from the heat and serve.

Bring 8 quarts of water to boil in large saucepan over high heat. Remove from heat and add baking soda. Add tea bags and brew according to package directions. Remove from heat and squeeze tea bags. Stir in sugar until completely dissolved. Cool completely, then chill at least 6 hours or overnight. Serve over ice cubes.
Bring 8 quarts of water to boil in large saucepan over high heat. Remove from heat and add baking soda. Add tea bags and brew according to package directions. Remove from heat and squeeze tea bags. Stir in sugar until completely dissolved. Cool completely, then chill at least 6 hours or overnight. Serve over ice cubes.
With a vegetable peeler, peel each orange in a continuous spiral, removing only the outer colored layer of peel. In a large pitcher, pour boiling water over the tea bags and orange peel. Cover and steep 5 minutes. Remove tea bags. Chill tea mixture with peel in a covered container. To serve, remove the peel and pour

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a large skillet, melt butter with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in cabbage and saute until slightly softened, about 5 minutes. In a separate bowl combine breadcrumbs with cinnamon and brown sugarsprinkle half of these crumbs over cabbage. Place apple slices evenly over top of cabbage and sprinkle remaining crumbs on top. Drizzle with canola oil and bake in preheated oven until golden brown and bubbly, about 25 minutes. Serve warm.

Whisk cream into the egg mixture until smooth. Add Worcestershire sauce. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Heat butter in skillet until melted. Add egg mixture and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until eggs are firm. Serve immediately on toast or in tortillas.
Drain wine. Mix with mayonnaise and paprika. Season with salt and pepper. Spread over fish. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and spray with cooking spray. Cut 1/2 of the chili in half lengthwise. Seed the other 1/2 of the chili. In a food processor combine the cheese, 1/4 of the parsley and the pine nuts. Pulse until combined. Add the chili and garlic and process until smooth. Add the remaining parsley and the cilantro. Pulse until combined. With the processor running drizzle in the olive oil. Set aside 1/4 of the pesto for the top of the finished dish. In a small bowl combine the pesto with the lemon zest and the butter. Spread 1 tablespoon of the mixture on the aluminum foil. Top with the shrimp. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes until the shrimp are just cooked through. Remove from the oven. Spread the remaining pesto mixture on top of the baked shrimp and sprinkle on the reserved parsley. Serve immediately

Heat 1 teaspoon of oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat until very hot. Add ginger and stir-fry for 10 seconds or until fragrant. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil in the same manner as in step 1. Add the radishes and snow peas and stir-fry until crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Add the soy sauce, vinegar, chili sauce, sesame oil, scallions and cashews and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 425f. Place the salmon skin side down in the baking pan and brush with the butter and sprinkle with the green onion, thyme, and lemon peel. Mix the panko breadcrumbs with the dried cranberries and sprinkle over the top of the salmon and bake uncovered for about 12 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and the fish flakes easily with a fork.

Peel, halve and core Fuji apples. Place in a medium bowl. In another medium bowl, combine mayonnaise, lemon rind and juice. Mix well. Add apple mixture to bowl with dressing and mix well. Add cashews, cranberries and radishes. Toss until thoroughly combined. Garnish with onion rings if desired. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

Prepare marzipan dough as described for marzipan cookies, or use store-bought dough. Roll out the dough to 1/4 inch thickness on a lightly floured surface. Using a floured 2-1/2 to 3-inch cookie cutter, stamp out the dough. Gather the scraps togetherre-roll once and stamp out the remaining cookies. Place the cookies on lightly greased parchment paper on baking sheets. Chill the cookies for at least 30 minutes, or until firm enough to handle. Heat the oven to 350 F degrees. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until lightly browned around the edges. Place the cookies on cooling racks. In a small bowl, combine the jam with 2 tablespoons of the poppy seeds. Spread about 1 teaspoon of the jam mixture on the bottom half of each cookie. Top with the remaining cookie bottoms. Makes 2 dozen cookies.

Peel the potatoes, then mash them well with the ginger, thyme and seasoning, then add the creamed corn and mash everything together until it's a fairly smooth consistency. Add the flour and mix well. In another bowl beat the egg with the milk, then add this to the mashed mixture, adding the butter a little at a time until it is all combined into a batter-like consistency. Heat the oil for deep frying in a pan or wok over a medium heat until it is a little less than half-way up the pan. Using a large spoon drop the mixture into the oil (the oil should be hot enough to start sizzling immediately). Turn the fritters over a few times until they are golden all over. Remove from the pan with a slotted spoon to drain on kitchen paper. Serve hot with a fresh salad or salsa.

Cut the fennel into 1/4-inch dice. Heat the olive oil with 1 teaspoon of the fennel and a pinch of salt in a large frying pan over medium heat. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the pasta and cook until just al dente. Add the remaining fennel and the pepper and cook for 1 minute. Remove from the heat. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Stir in the fish and cook for 30 seconds. Sprinkle with the red pepper flakes and toss to combine. Transfer to a serving platter and sprinkle with the parsley. Serves 4.

Mix the cheddar cheese, cream cheese, mayonnaise, fresh garlic, pimento peppers, onion powder, tabasco sauce, and butter flavored cracker crumbs in a large mixing bowl until smooth. Stir in the pimento stuffed olive. Chill for 2 hours to allow flavors to blend. Serve on crackers or celery sticks. Makes 2 cups.

To make the chipotle mayonnaise, combine mayonnaise, fresh cilantro, green onion, and lime juice. Whisk together until combined. Spread a 1/4 cup of the mayonnaise over the bottom half of a flour tortilla. Top with the smoked turkey, romaine lettuce leaves, and the top half of the flour tortilla. Cut into 4 wedges.
These are the ingredients I will need. I will try to find them at the store today. I will come back later to tell you how it turned out.
Thanks for the recipes! I have to try this.
I made this last night and it was so delicious! I made it for my boyfriend and he said it was the best meal he has ever had.
This recipe looks absolutely delicious. I will definitely try it soon. I love spicy foods.
I love this recipe. I will definitely try it soon. I love spicy foods.
I love this recipe. I will definitely try it soon. I love spicy foods. The recipe looks amazing! I will definitely be trying this

Cook the pasta as directed. Drain and rinse in cold water. Combine the other ingredients, except the pasta. When the pasta is cooked through and cooled, add it to the other ingredients and mix. Cover and refrigerate until serving time. Can be made ahead and refrigerated for up to 2 days.

Preheat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add canola oil to pan and heat for 1 minute. Add the green beans and the onion. Saute for 3 to 4 minutes or until the onions are soft. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Remove the pan from the heat. Add the parsley and toss. Serve at once.

Mix together first four ingredients. Combine remaining ingredientsmix well and stir into chicken mixture. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve on crusty rolls or crackers or toasted whole wheat bread. Serve on lettuce leaves in sandwich form or as an entree salad. Serves 6-8.

Soak the lentils overnight. Cook the lentils with the celery ribs until tender. Cool. Cut the pork hocks into small chunks. Sauté the onion with the garlic. Add the pork hocks. Sauté until the pork hocks are brown. Add the cool lentils. Add enough water to cover the lentils. Add the sugar. Simmer for 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Wash the potatoes and leave whole. Scrub the onion, cut in half lengthwise then slice thinly. Heat the margarine in a heavy-based pan over a low heat. Add the onion and the tomatoes. Cover the pan with a lid. Cook for 5 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in the herbs. Cook for a further minute or two. Remove from the heat and allow to cool. Place the potatoes on top of the onion mixture. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Pour the milk over the potatoes. Preheat the oven to 175c/350f/Gas Mark 3. Sift the flour into a bowl. Add the milk a little at a time until you have a smooth paste. Pour the mixture over the potatoes. Top the mixture with the grated cheese. Bake in the oven for 1 hour. Remove from the oven. Drain any excess liquid from the top of the mixture. Serve immediately.

Combine the sugar with the hot water and bring to a boil over medium heat. Add the corn syrup and the egg whites. Stir until the mixture comes to a boil. Boil for one minute. Remove from heat and add the vanilla. Let stand for ten minutes. Then add the salt and the mayonnaise. Stir until well blended. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Slice the oranges. Put the orange slices on a plate or bowl with the marshmallow sauce over them. Garnish with the orange rind. Serve chilled.
Combine all ingredients in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease two 12-cup muffin tins. Beat together the Bisquick and cold water until dough forms. Turn onto floured surfaceknead lightly 10 times or just until smooth. Roll out dough 1/2 inch thick. Using 1-1/2 inch floured round cutter or lid of glass, cut out dough circles. Place circles in prepared muffin cups. Beat the butter and orange marmalade together with a fork. Brush over the tops of each biscuit. Bake at 375 degrees F for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm for breakfast or brunch.

Melt butter in a 10x12x2 inch glass baking pan in a 350 degree F oven for 5 minutes. Combine the flour, sugar, baking soda and cinnamonstir well. Stir in the melted butter until well mixed. Spread evenly in the pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until firm to the touch. Cool 20 minutes in pan on a wire rack. Break into piecesstore in an airtight container.
Place frozen chicken in crock. In small bowl mix all other ingredients. Pour over chicken and stir. Cook on low 6-8 hours. Serve over cooked rice.

Peel the apples and cut them into small pieces. Put them in a saucepan with the butter and sugar and cook gently for about 5 minutes or until the apples begin to soften. Remove the apples from the saucepan and put them in a bowl. Put the saucepan on a low heat with the wine, lemon juice and zest, bring to the boil then pour over the apples and mix well. Heat the oven to 350f, grease an ovenproof dish with the melted butter, then spread the apples over the base. Grate the rind of the orange over the top. Cut the bread into cubes and spread over the apples, then sprinkle with the lemon juice. Beat the eggs with the cream and pour over the top of the bread cubes. Bake for about 40 minutes until firm on top and cooked through. Serve with cream or ice cream if liked.
Name: sweet bread bread puddingIngredients: sweet bread, raisins, butter, milk, sugar, eggs, apple pie filling, cinnamon

In a large skillet over medium heat, brown the ground beef and onions. Drain the fat. Mix the meat and the rest of the ingredients together. Pour into a greased 9 by 13 inch pan. Bake at 375 for 1 hour. Serve hot.

Combine cornstarch and water. Set aside. In saucepan heat all remaining ingredients until sugar is dissolved and liquid is hot. Slowly add the cornstarch and water mixture, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens, about 1 minute. Remove from heat. Serve warm or room temperature.

In a large bowl, mix together the flour, cornmeal, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar. Mix in the water and then stir in the egg and canola oil. Pour the batter into a 9x9 inch pan that has been sprayed with pam. Bake in a 375 degree oven for approximately 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

Mix flour and sugar. Cut in the butter until mixture resembles cornmeal. Sprinkle half of the mixture in the bottom of an unbaked pie shell. Add berries and sugar. Combine the remaining mixture with the orange juice and sprinkle over the pie. Bake at 425 degrees f for one hour. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease a 9 inch springform pan with butter. In a medium bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, splenda sugar substitute, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Whisk in the heavy cream until smooth. Beat the eggs in another bowl with a wire whisk. Add the ricotta cheese mixture to the eggs in batches, whisking after each addition. Pour into prepared springform pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 50 minutes. Remove from oven, and cool in the pan on a wire rack for 1 hour. Run a sharp knife around the edge of the springform pan to loosen the cake. Release the sides of the springform pan, then remove the sides of the springform pan and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f.In a large mixing bowl, combine the first seven ingredients. Add the egg whites, corn syrup and vanilla and beat until smooth and blended. Stir in the rice krispies. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees f. for 8-10 minutes or until set. Cool on wire racks.

Heat a large skillet over high heat. Add the olive oil and the garlic. Saute the garlic until golden. Add the bell peppers and onion and saute until soft and tender. Stir in the cumin and oregano. Add the chile and saute until soft and fragrant. Add the chicken and saute until the chicken is cooked through. Toss in the lemon juice and serve.

Place the rinsed lentils and rice together in a pot along with 4 cups of water and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper and cumin. Cook for 20 minutes over a low flame, stirring occasionally to make sure the grains don't stick to the bottom. Heat the oil in a separate pot and fry the sliced onions in the oil for a few minutes, then add the fried onions and the remaining spices to the rice and lentils and continue to cook for another 15 minutes. Serve warm with a salad of tomatoes and cucumbers or raita or a fresh vegetable salad.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Saute onion in skillet over medium heat in oil until softened, about 4 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and chiles, let cook 2 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl and stir in spinach, cheese, cream cheese, half and half, and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon mixture into shallow baking dish like a 9 inch quiche dish or pie plate. Bake in the preheated oven until the dip is bubbly and the top is light brown, about 35 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375. Lightly spray a deep dish pie plate or tart pan with cooking spray. Separate crescent dough into triangles. Roll each triangle into a 4-inch circle. Press each circle into pie pan, overlapping slightly. Bake for 12-15 minutes. In a skillet brown sausage and onion over medium heat until sausage is browned and onions are soft. Drain well. In a medium bowl mix together sausage and onions. Stir in eggs. Add salt and pepper. Mix well. Spoon into baked pie crust. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Bake for about 20 minutes or until top is golden brown. Let cool slightly before cutting into wedges.
I'm a big fan of breakfast quiche. It's easy to make and is delicious served warm with a cup of coffee. I love all of these different recipes for breakfast quiche!
I love all kinds of egg dishes and quiche is one of my favorites. I'm going to have to try one of these recipes.
I love Quiche!

In a large nonstick saut pan over medium heat, combine cooked rice and whole milk. Heat until mixture begins to boil. Decrease heat to low and cook to a simmer, stirring frequently, until mixture begins to thicken, approximately 5 minutes. Increase heat to medium, add coconut milk, sugar, and salt. Continue to cook until mixture just begins to thicken again, approximately 5-10 minutes. Use a whisk to prevent the coconut from clumping. Once mixture begins to thicken, remove from heat and stir in coconut extract and coconut flakes. Transfer the mixture to individual serving dishes or a glass bowl and place plastic wrap directly on the surface of the pudding. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Prepare the filling. In a food processor combine the crust ingredients and process until fine. Press into the bottom and sides of a 9 inch springform pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Allow to cool completely. Beat the filling ingredients in a food processor until smooth and spread over the crust. Bake for one hour. Allow to cool completely. Serve with whipped topping. Refrigerate leftovers.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f (220 degrees c). In a medium bowl, beat the eggs and water together. In another bowl, mix the biscuit mix, onions and cheddar cheese together. Add the egg mixture to the biscuit mix and stir just until blended. Spray two 9x13 inch pans with cooking spray. Divide the dough evenly among the two pans, pressing down firmly and spreading it evenly. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper if desired and bake until golden brown on top and the edges are golden brown, about 20 minutes. Cut into squares and serve hot.
I love the idea of these and would love to try them out with my kids. Thank you for sharing with us at Snickerdoodle Sunday.
I love these casseroles! I'm definitely going to make them at some point! Thanks for sharing with us at Your Turn to Shine!
I love this! Thank you for sharing this with us at our link party!

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. In a small bowl combine 2 tablespoons Dijon, 1/4 cup molasses and 2 tablespoons cider vinegar. Whisk together until combined. Add salt and pepper to taste. Rub the mixture onto both sides of the pork chops. In a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat, warm 1 tablespoon oil. Place the chops in the skillet and sear them for 2-3 minutes on each side. Pour the remaining 1 tablespoon oil over the top of the chops. Place the skillet in the oven and cook for 20 minutes or until the internal temperature of the meat reaches 145 degrees F. Remove the chops from the oven and drizzle the maple mixture over the top. Serve warm.

Place potato in a pot of boiling water. Boil for about 10 minutes or until potatoes are soft. Drain. Mash potatoes. Combine with shredded coconut. Add vanilla, powdered sugar, and almonds. Place in a baking pan and bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely on a wire rack. Drizzle with dark chocolate and sprinkle with almonds if desired. Makes 16 pieces.
This entry was posted in Uncategorized by admin. Bookmark the Needham cookies recipe.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Boil chicken breasts for 20 minutes or until cooked. Remove from water and let cool. In a large bowl combine cooked chicken with 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 1 cup cream of chicken soup, and 1 cup whole milk. Combine until well blended. Seperate crescent rolls into triangles. Roll out slightly and place 2 heaping tablespoons of chicken mixture in middle. Fold dough up and place in a baking dish. Place any leftover chicken mixture around rolls. Bake for 25 minutes or until tops are golden brown. Cover with 1 cup remaining shredded cheddar and return to oven for an additional 10 minutes.

In a large saucepan, cook the onion in the butter until soft and transparent. Stir in the courgettes, season well and cook for a further minute or two. Add the cooked pasta and mix well. Pour in the cream and stir in the chopped parsley. Turn off the heat. In a bowl, mix together the grated cheese and the ground nuts. Sprinkle over the top of the pasta. Serve hot.
name: pasta with walnut lemon cream sauce
ingredients: whipping cream, lemon peel, pasta, butter, sliced mushrooms, walnuts, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper, fresh parsley
preparation:In small saucepan, stir together whipping cream and lemon peel. Simmer until cream is reduced by one-third, about 15 minutes. Cook the pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, in large skillet, melt butter. Saute mushrooms. Drain pasta and combine with cream, mushrooms, walnuts and cheese. Toss lightly
Mix the coffee and brown sugar in a blender. Add the bananas and blend. Add the almonds and blend again. Pour into an 8 x 8-inch baking pan. Freeze for at least 2 hours. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a loaf pan with foil and spray with cooking spray. Combine all ingredients and mix thoroughly. Place mixture into loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour or until done. Makes 4 servings.

Combine all ingredients in a large saucepan or 3 qt casserole dish. Bring to a boilcover and reduce heat to simmer for 15-20 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir occasionally during cooking time. Serve with cilantro if desired.

Place ham shank in pressure cooker, add water to cover, then add potatoes, carrots, onion and cabbage. Cover tightly and place on high pressure for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let steam down naturally for at least 10 minutes before removing cover. Check seasonings and serve.

Bring boiling water to the surface. Cook potatoes and drain. Mash potatoes and add the spinach. Combine egg yolks and parmesan cheese. Add to potatoes and spinach. Season with salt and pepper. Add flour to potato mixture. Knead until smooth. Form into small balls and roll in flour. Drop into boiling water. Cook 3 minutes until they float to the top. Serve with butter.

Bring water to a boil in a large sauce pan. Add the corn syrup and white sugar. Stir to dissolve and remove from heat. When mixture has cooled slightly, add the peanuts and mix well. Pour the mixture onto a flat surface, preferably a large cutting board. Use a large metal spoon to knead the mixture. The dough should be soft and easy to work with. When the dough is soft and elastic, knead in the rice flour. Divide the dough into 2 equal pieces. Using a large metal spoon, stretch one piece of the dough out and pull it around until it resembles long strands of hair. Use the other piece of dough to cover the strands of hair. Continue to knead the mixture until the strands become long and thin. Allow the candy to cool completely and then break into bite sized pieces.

Heat oven to 450°F. Beat together milk and eggs. Stir together flours and saltadd butter and blend well. Stir into egg mixture just until blended (batter will be lumpy). Divide batter evenly among 12 well-greased muffin cups or a popover pan. Bake at 450°F for 20 minutesreduce heat to 375°F and bake 15 minutes longer or until puffed and lightly browned. Remove from pans immediately and cool on racks. Serves 12.

Place the kidney beans in the bottom of the baking dish. Top with the ground beef and cover with the tomatoes. Sprinkle with the sweet onion, bell pepper and paprika. Add the Monterey Jack cheese and butter. Salt and pepper to taste. Bake for 30 minutes or until the top is bubbling and the cheese is melted. Serve with buns or biscuits for dipping.

Heat the oil in a Dutch oven or other heavy pan over medium-high heat. Brown the turkey in batches, adding more oil if needed. Drain the grease from the pan. Add the onions and cook until golden and tender. Stir in the chili beans and salsa. Add the broth and stir. Add the chili powder, cumin and refried beans. Cook the mixture over low heat for about 10 minutes. Serve hot over rice. Garnish with the cheese.

Heat oven to 375. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook the pasta until al dente. Drain the pasta in a colander. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the pine nuts and cook until lightly browned. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the broth, 1/4 cup of the tomato paste (reserve the rest for garnishing), chard stems, and chicken breasts. Season the mixture with salt and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the cooked chard leaves. Stir in the reserved pesto. Add the penne and cook for 2 minutes. Add the balsamic vinegar and the remaining 1/4 cup of tomato paste. Top each serving of pasta with 2 tablespoons of the reserved pesto, a few pieces of the reserved chicken breast. Sprinkle each serving with 1 tablespoon parmesan. Serve immediately.

Slice the green part of the scallions. Peel and finely mince the white part. Heat the oil in a wok over high heat. Add the green part of the scallions and cook until crisp-tender. Transfer to a plate. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon oil to the wok and swirl to coat. Stir in the minced white part of the scallions and cook 30 seconds. Add the sugar, ginger and salt and stir-fry until the mixture is fragrant and the sugar is dissolved. Add the soy sauce and cook 1 minute. Stir in the chicken and cook until it is no longer pink. Transfer to a serving dish and scatter the scallions over the top. Serve immediately.

Trim the bottoms and halve the brussels sprouts lengthwise. Place in a large bowl and drizzle with oil. Toss to coat and arrange in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet. Roast for 30 minutes, until crisp-tender and lightly golden brown. Add the water and butter and toss to combine. Transfer back to the baking sheet and spread out in a single layer. Roast for an additional 5 minutes. Transfer back to bowl and add lemon juice and peppertoss to combine.

Combine buttermilk, mustard and salt in a medium bowl. Add cucumber and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Combine sugar and water in a small saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Add cucumber and green onions to the soup. Cook for 3 more minutes and serve hot. Garnish each bowl of soup with a small amount of chopped green onion and a sprinkling of chopped cucumber.

In a small saucepan combine water and dried apple. Cook over medium heat for about 25 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. In a food processor add the orange juice and zest. Add the dried apple mixture, sugar and cinnamon. Blend well. Place the mixture in a greased pie plate. Cover with the second crust. Seal and vent. Bake at 450f for 35-40 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Serve with a scoop of ice cream and whipped cream.
Mix all the ingredients in a small bowl. Toss the baby spinach leaves in the dressing and serve at room temperature or chill for several hours. Serve on individual plates or in small bowls.

In a small saucepan over low heat, combine the sugar and water. Stir until sugar dissolves. Add the gelatin, stirring until dissolved. Remove from heat and let mixture stand for 5 minutes. Add the lime juice and zest, stirring until thoroughly combined. Cool to room temperature. Whisk in the condensed milk and food coloring until smooth. Whisk in the whipping cream until just blended. Chill for 3 hours or until set. Garnish with extra lime slices if desired. Place in a frozen pie shell or freeze in individual servings in small plastic containers.

Preheat oven to 325f. Line an 8x8 pan with aluminum foil, with the ends of the foil extending over the sides of the pan. In a large saucepan, melt the butter and chocolate chips over low heat, stirring frequently until smooth. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. In a large bowl combine the melted chocolate mixture, the sugar, eggs, and vanilla. Mix well. Add the flour and the salt and mix well. Stir in the chopped nuts. Spread the batter evenly into the prepared pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until firm around the edges. Let cool in pan for 1 hour. Remove from the pan using the foil ends as handles. Cut into bars.
The recipe for the best brownies is not the same as the recipe for the absolute best brownies or the recipe for the world�s best brownies. The recipe for the sinful brownies is not the same as the recipe for the tanner�s brownies or the recipe for the milk brownies. The recipe for the 1 brown
Combine water and lavender in a 2-quart pitcher. Let steep 2-4 hours. Add lemon juice to taste. Add sugar to taste. Add ice if desired. Garnish with lemon slice.

Place graham crackers in ungreased 8-inch square dish. Combine margarine, brown sugar and vanilla. Pour over crackers. Sprinkle with nuts. Bake at 350f for about 25 minutes or until browned. Cool. Cut into squares.

Remove greens from carrot tops. Cut greens from root to root into 2-inch sections. Cut off the top 1/4 inch of each carrot section to expose the core. Cut each carrot section into 4 wedges. Remove any seeds from the carrot tops. Cut tops crosswise into 1-inch strips. In a large skillet heat 1 teaspoon of cooking spray over medium heat until hot. Add the carrot wedges and the cooking spray. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Stir and add the strips of carrot tops. Cover and cook for 3 minutes. Uncover and cook for 2 more minutes or until tender-crisp. Transfer to a serving dish. Stir together the onion and the salt and pepper. Spoon over the carrots.

Place the chicken and the cornstarch in a large sealable plastic bagtoss to coat. In a medium bowl, whisk together the egg whites and lemon juice until frothyadd the parsley and season with salt and pepper. Add the chicken and turn to coat well with the mixturelet stand at room temperature for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the breadcrumbs and the parsley and season with salt and pepper. Remove the chicken from the bag and allow to drain on a wire rack for 5 minutespat dry with paper towels. Place the breadcrumb mixture in another large bowl. Working with one piece at a time, dip the chicken first in the egg white mixture and then in the breadcrumb mixture to coatlet stand for 1 minute. Transfer the chicken to the prepared baking sheet and bake for about 20 minutes, or until browned and cooked through. Turn the oven off and let the chicken stand for 5 minutesserve warm or at room temperature.

Combine gelatin and 1/2 cup boiling water in medium bowl. Stir 3 minutes until gelatin is completely dissolved. Set aside to cool slightly. In large bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy. Beat in 1/3 cup lemonade concentrate until well blended. Gradually beat in gelatin mixture. Beat in remaining 1 cup lemonade concentrate and food coloring. Refrigerate for 3 hours or until slightly firm. In separate bowl, beat whipped topping until stiff peaks form. Fold into cream cheese mixture. Spoon into dessert dishes. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

Preheat oven to 425f. Peel the potatoes and cut them in half. Place them on a rimmed baking sheet. Drizzle the potatoes with olive oil and toss with the kosher salt and pepper. Bake until crisp and brown on the outside, about 40 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the chopped garlic. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly grease two sheet pans. Cream butter and sugar together. Beat in molasses. Add egg and beat well. Add flour and spices and mix well. Roll into 1-inch balls. Roll balls in granulated sugar. Place on sheet pans 1 inch apart. Bake 8 to 10 minutes until edges are lightly golden brown. Remove from oven and cool on pans for 1 minute. Transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Store in an airtight container. Yield: 36 cookies.

Bring a medium pot of water to boil over high heat. Add the orzo. Cook according to package directions for al dente. Drain. Add the frozen chopped spinach and stir until incorporated. Transfer to a serving bowl. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and sauté 1 minute. Whisk in the lemon juice. Stir in the parmesan cheese. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add the onion powder. Pour the sauce over the pasta.

Cut bread into 4 pieces. Butter one side of each. Grill in a grill pan or grill press on buttered side. Set aside. Saute onion in butter until tender. Add sour cream. Stir in oregano and bacon. Spread on grilled bread. Add sliced tomatoes. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Melt in microwave.
Combine the first four ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Add the rum and blend again. Serve over ice with a pineapple chunk and melon ball for garnish. Serve with ginger ale.

In a bowl mix together the eggs with the cornstarch. Heat the oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the eggs and mix with a fork until the eggs are scrambled. Remove from the pan. Heat the oil in a separate pan. Add the yellow onions and bok choy. Cook until the vegetables are tender. Add the eggs. Add the soy sauce, the bamboo shoots, the garlic powder, the salt, and the pepper. Add the shrimp. Cook until the shrimp turns pink. Add the green onions. Serve the egg foo yong over rice.

In a shallow bowl, beat egg whites until foamy. In a separate shallow bowl, stir together sesame seeds and pecans. Dip tenders in egg whites, then coat with seeds and nuts. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook tenders in oil about 2 minutes per side or until golden brown. Place tenders in a serving bowl. Combine hoisin sauce and mustard. Drizzle mixture over tenders. Serve with sauce.

Place all ingredients except crabmeat in a blenderprocess until smooth. Add crabmeatpulse just until blended. Chill at least 1 hour. Ladle into bowls, and garnish with green onions.
I love avocadoes! These recipes sound wonderful! Thanks for the great list!
Thanks for the comment, Janice!

Mix and prepare as directed on package. Pour into a 9x13 pan. Add pretzels and let cool until set. Add cream cheese, sugar and butter. Blend until smooth. Spread over top of jello. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until ready to serve. Garnish with raspberries.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a 13 x 9-inch pan, layer 1/2 of the hash browns. Top with half of the beef and black beans. Repeat with remaining potatoes and mixture. Pour soup over mixture. Cover with foil. Bake for 1 hour. Uncover. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered for 5 minutes. Serve with salsa.

Wash celery well and slice thinly. Mix well breadcrumbs with fresh parsley and salt. Cook chicken in broth till tender. Drain and cut in small pieces. Mix well together the eggs, milk, and broth. Place a layer of bread crumbs in the bottom of casserole dish. Add a layer of chicken mixture, and another layer of bread crumbs. Continue until all the mixture is gone. Top with remaining bread crumbs and dot with butter. Bake in 350 oven for about an hour until bubbly.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet or saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic, butter, shallots, tarragon, thyme and cook until shallots are translucent, about 3 minutes. Add mussels and cook until shells open, about 4 minutes. Discard any unopened shells. Add parsley and chives. Add beer and continue cooking until liquid is reduced by half, about 1 minute. Serve with bread.
Baby spinach is now available in our supermarkets all year round. It is so easy to use in cooked dishes such as quiches or omelets or in salads or as baby leaves with your main course. It is more nutritious than normal spinach as it is less mature when picked so it has more of those beneficial nutrients.
Baby spinach is more delicate in flavor so it is not so strong in flavor so can be combined with more delicate flavors such as mushrooms or asparagus.
Baby spinach is so good for you as it has been found that it contains a lot of antioxidants that protect us

Mix dressing with water. Place chicken in baking dish. Pour dressing mixture over chicken. Bake 25-30 minutes. In another pan combine soup, cream cheese, and wine. Stir until smooth. Add to baking dish. Cook over low heat until heated through. Serve over cooked angel hair pasta.

In a saucepan combine the first 5 ingredients. Heat until sugar is dissolved. Bring mixture to a boil and boil for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in pineapple and banana. Allow mixture to cool completely. Add food coloring if desired. Fold in pecans and cherries. Spoon into unbaked paper cupcakes in muffin tray. Cover with plastic wrap and freeze for 6 hours or overnight. To serve remove from freezer and place on a serving dish. Keep refrigerated.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and line with parchment paper a 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan. Combine unbleached flour and sea salt in a large bowl and set aside. Beat sweet creamy butter and unbleached cane sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy. Add vanilla and beat until incorporated. Add eggs one at a time and beat after each addition. Beat in mashed bananas. Add dry ingredients and beat on low speed until just incorporated. Stir in pecan pieces. Spoon batter into prepared loaf pan and spread evenly. Bake at 350 degrees for 60-70 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely on wire rack. Yields one loaf.
name: banana coconut bread
ingredients: sugar, butter, eggs, mashed banana, shredded coconut, flour, baking powder, salt

Sift together 3/4 cup all-purpose flour, 3 tsp. cocoa and 3 tsp. baking soda. Set aside. In a large bowl combine 3/4 cup shortening with 2 cups sugar and beat until creamy. Add 2 eggs and beat well. Add the vanilla. In a separate bowl combine 2 cups all-purpose flour with 2 tsp. salt and the 3 tsp. cocoa powder. Mix well and add to the shortening mixture. Add 1/4 cup boiling water and beat until well mixed and smooth. Pour into a greased and floured tube pan. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for one hour or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely before frosting.

Cook the rice and broccoli and set aside to cool. Melt the butter and saute the onion until tender. Add the broccoli and the seasoning and stir. Add the sour cream and cheese and stir to blend. Spread over the prepared dish. Melt the remaining butter and sprinkle over the top. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Serves 6-8.

Combine 8 ounces cream cheese, lemon juice, mustard, garlic powder and 1 teaspoon salt in a small bowlcover and refrigerate until serving time. Toast 4 slices bread lightly. Spread 1 tablespoon mustard mixture over each slice of bread. Top 2 bread slices with 4 ounces turkey, 1 ounce peppers and 2 spinach leavescover with 2 remaining bread slices. Spread remaining mustard mixture over top slice of breadsprinkle with remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt. Makes 4 servings.

Peel and core apples. Cut into thin slices. Place in a large bowl and toss with the first six ingredients. Pour into prepared pastry shell. In a small bowl mix together the next three ingredients and sprinkle on top of the apples. Bake at 425 degrees for 1 hour or until the filling is bubbling and the crust is golden brown. Cool on wire rack for at least 1 hour before serving.
Place vegetables in a large skillet. Add soy sauce. Cook over medium-low heat until vegetables are crisp-tender. Sprinkle with almonds. Serve over rice.

Melt the butter in a medium saucepan. Add the onion, garlic and mushrooms. Cook over medium heat until soft. Stir in the pearl barley and cook for about 2-3 minutes. Stir in the chicken broth. Cover and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 25-30 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Stir in the black pepper and season to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Separate crescent rolls into triangles. Wrap an apple piece around each triangle. Place in a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan. In a bowl combine sugar and buttersprinkle over rolls. Slowly pour the Mountain Dew around the rolls. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake uncovered for 35 to 40 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Mix together the pie crust, evaporated milk, brown sugar and Kahlua in a medium bowl. Beat with a mixer on low to combine. Mix in the pumpkin pie spice and salt and pour into a 9 inch baking dish. Bake for 25 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350 degrees F and bake for an additional 45 minutes to an hour or until firm in the center. Allow to cool completely before serving.

Dip flounder in egg and then in bread crumbs. Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large skillet and fry the fish for 2-3 minutes per side until golden brown. In a medium bowl, combine the pasta sauce, oregano, salt and pepper. Add the fish to the sauce and cover. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley and top with cheese. Bake for an additional 2-3 minutes until melted. Serve with pasta.

Saute the leek in a little oil over medium heat until softened. Add the cauliflower and stir to coat with the oils. Add the stock and simmer until the cauliflower is tender, about 10 minutes. Puree using a blender or food processor. Return to the pot. Stir in the nutmeg, season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.
Place chicken in crock pot. Mix together soup and broth. Pour over chicken. Cook on low for 5 hours. When ready to eat add butter to sauce. Stir and cook for 10-15 minutes. Serve over noodles.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Brush bagels with melted butter and place on baking sheet. Bake for 5 minutes and remove from oven. Make egg mixture by whisking together eggs, salt and pepper. Pour egg mixture over bagels and sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Return to oven and bake for an additional 5-6 minutes or until egg mixture has set and bagels are golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease a 10-inch square baking pan. Combine apples, oats, raisins, cinnamon and salt in a large bowl. Add soymilk and maple syrup and mix well. Spoon into prepared pan. Bake 35 minutes. Sprinkle with nuts. Serve warm.

Cut up chicken into bite-size pieces. In a bowl mix together relish, salt, oil and ground black pepper. Add pieces of chicken. Add lemon. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours. Grill for about 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a saute pan over medium heat. Add the onions, cook and stir until tender. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Stir in the remaining 3 tablespoons olive oil. Add the tomatoes. Season the sauce with the chili pepper flakes, balsamic vinegar, sugar and the basil. Cook for 15 minutes over low heat. Remove from heat. Serve with pasta.

Place the rice in a saucepan with the water. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer until the rice is tender. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. In a large skillet cook the onion and garlic in the oil over medium heat until the onion is soft. Add the carrots, corn, and peas. Cook for two minutes more. Add the rice mixture. Stir to combine. Transfer to a 2-quart casserole. Sprinkle with the basil, oregano, parsley. Bake for 10 minutes.

Cook pasta shells according to package directionsdrain. Heat spaghetti sauce in a small saucepan over medium heatstir in the light sour cream and whipping cream. Stir in the parmesan cheese and mozzarella cheesemix well. Add the pasta shellstoss well to coat. Sprinkle with more parmesan cheese, if desiredserve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Bring water to a boil in a large pot over medium heat. Cook the elbow pasta according to package directions. Drain the pastaadd 1 cup of the pasta water to the pot. Add the butter and flourcook until the mixture thickens and becomes smooth. Add the chicken broth, milk, mustard, and tuna. Season with the salt and pepper. Stir in the cheese. Add the pasta to the pot. Pour into a 2-quart baking dishsprinkle with the crushed potato chips. Bake for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with the remaining cup of cheesebake for an additional 15 minutes or until the top is bubbly. Serves 4 to 6.

Rinse tofu, wrap in paper towels and place in a bowl. Press to remove water. Cut tofu into cubes. Place cubes in blender with vegan mayo. Blend until smooth. Add remaining ingredients and blend until smooth. Serve in sandwiches or as a topping for baked potatoes or other veggies. Makes enough for a party platter or 2 small sandwiches.

In a 10 inch skillet, heat oil and garlic over medium high heat until oil bubbles. Add raw shrimp. Stir fry for 2-3 minutes or until pink. Add dry sherry and cook for 1 minute. Add parsley and Old Bay seasoning. Toss gently and serve hot. Serve with warm French bread.

Butter a 2 quart casserole dish. Lay a single layer of dry white bread over the bottom of the dish. Sprinkle with raisins, nutmeg, superfine sugar, white sugar and ground nutmeg. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Place the casserole dish in a large roasting pan. Pour 1 inch of boiling water in the roasting pan and bake in the oven for 1 hour, or until the top is lightly golden brown. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.
I have just tried the chocolate bread and butter pudding recipe on your website. I just wanted to let you know that it was delicious! I did use about 1/4 cup of chocolate chips though for an extra special treat. Thanks again for the recipe!
I made the bread pudding recipe with a slight variation to it. I used 2 slices of white bread cut up in small pieces and 1 slice of sliced french toast (from a french toast cereal) for a total of

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Boil the potatoes until tender. Drain and mash with the butter and milk. Add the remaining ingredients and stir well. Pour into a greased 8x8 square baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with the blanched slivered almonds. Bake for another 10 minutes until browned.
Slice the leeks in small pieces. Fry the onion and leek in the olive oil. Add the carrots and fry for 3 minutes. Add the vegetable stock and simmer for about 20 minutes. Season to taste.

Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain well. Combine broccoli florets, pineapple tidbits, cheese, onions, bacon, raisins in a large bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together dressing ingredients. Pour over the broccoli mixture. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight.

In a medium saucepan over low heat combine white sugar and coffee liqueur until melted and smooth. Add heavy cream and corn syrup and cook until mixture is thick and caramel colored. Remove from heat and pour mixture through a strainer into a small bowl. Let cool. Break up 30 chocolate wafers into small pieces. Using an electric mixer, beat heavy cream until stiff peaks form. Fold in powdered sugar and set aside. In a small bowl combine almonds and cinnamon sugar. Set aside. In a small bowl combine coffee and cocoa powder. Set aside. In a large bowl combine the cooled caramel mixture and the chocolate wafers. Add the heavy cream and mix well. Add coffee and cocoa powder. Fold in the almonds. Divide into 1/2 cup portions and roll into balls. Roll balls in coffee/cocoa mixture to coat. Roll in cinnamon-sugar mixture. Serve. Makes 24 balls.

Separate dough into 20 biscuits. Pull 8 apart. Put 2 in bottom of 9x13 pan. Repeat 2 more times. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup cinnamon sugar. Mix together melted butter and brown sugar. Pour over cinnamon sugar. Pull 8 apart. Put 2 in bottom of pan. Repeat 2 more times. Sprinkle with remaining cinnamon sugar. Mix remaining 1/2 cup brown sugar with 1/2 cup cinnamon. Sprinkle over top. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet over medium heat, combine butter and kohlrabi. Cook until golden brown. Add the sugar, stirring constantly. Add the broth and the seasonings. Cover and cook until the vegetable is soft. Stir in the flour. Serve with Parmesan cheese.

Beat together the salted butter and the icing sugar until light and creamy and smooth. Add the vanilla extract and the cornstarch and beat until smooth again. Add the flour and beat until smooth again. Divide the dough into three balls. Roll one ball between two sheets of waxed paper into a disk about 6 inches in diameter and 1/4 inch thick. Wrap well and chill overnight. Repeat with the other two balls of dough. Slice the dough into rounds about 1/2 inch thick and arrange on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for about 12 minutes until lightly browned around the edges. Cool on the cookie sheets for a few minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely. Store the cookies in an airtight container.

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine all the ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 3-4 minutes. Add the drained carrot slices and heat through. Remove from heat and gently toss. Serve hot.

Cook the broccoli and beans for 6 to 8 minutes in boiling water until bright green. Drain well and set aside. Heat the oil in a large frying pan and add the nuts. Fry over a medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes until golden. Add the beans and broccoli and cook over a low heat for 3 minutes. Season to taste with sea salt. Serve hot.

Combine egg yolks and condensed milk in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture thickens. Stir in vanilla. Add 1 cup chocolate sandwich style cookies. Stir until blended. Remove from heat. Stir in heavy cream. Pour into a freezer container. Freeze until firm. Top with remaining chocolate sandwich style cookies. Freeze until firm. Store in freezer in airtight container.
name: candy corn icebox cookieingredients: butter, brown sugar, egg yolks, molasses, all-purpose flour, salt, baking soda, candy cornpreparation:Cream butter and sugar. Add egg yolks. Add molasses. Mix dry ingredients together. Stir into above mixture. Add candy corn. Chill dough. Roll in 1 inch balls. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes.
name: chocolate chips with white chocolate chips icebox cookiesingredients: unsalted butter, white ch

Cream butter and sugar, then add cocoa and egg yolks. Cook until thick over low heat. Remove from heat and stir in the salt and vanilla. Pour into cooled graham cracker crust and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Beat egg whites until stiff, then add cream of tartar and beat until stiff. Beat in the 1/4 cup of sugar and continue beating until the whites are shiny. Spread over the pie filling and top with chocolate curls and nuts. Serve cold.

Place orange zest and juice into a bowl with coconut milk, fish and chili sauces. Add garlic and ginger and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Preheat oven to 400 f. In a large skillet, heat 1 teaspoon oil over medium-high heat. Season fish with salt and place in pan. Cook for 2 minutes. Transfer to a baking sheet and bake until just cooked through, about 5 minutes. Garnish with herbs and serve over rice.

In large heavy bottomed sauce pan over medium heat add in the butter. When melted add in the light brown sugar. Stir constantly until the mixture starts to boil and then remove from heat. Add in the salt. Add in the maple syrup and stir. Let cool completely before using on the ice cream.
Combine bread cubes, sausage and cheese in a large bowl. Add eggs, milk, salt and peppermix well. Pour into a greased 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Bake at 375 for 45 minutes or until firm.

Split each of the 8 jalapeños in half. Remove the ribs and seeds from the inside of the pepper. Spread the inside of each with 1 tbsp of the cream cheese. Lay a piece of the bacon over the top of the cream cheese. Wrap a piece of the bacon around the side of the pepper, then twist the end of the wrap to secure the bacon to the side of the pepper. Repeat with all of the peppers until they are all filled with the cream cheese and wrapped with the bacon. Place the wrapped peppers on the baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until the bacon is crispy. Serve with sour cream or ranch dressing for dipping.

Whisk together the flour, baking powder, and sugar in a medium bowl. Make a well in the center. Whisk the egg yolk and orange juice in another medium bowl. Add the water and whisk to combine. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients. Fold in the egg white. Heat a 10 inch nonstick skillet over medium heat. Coat the pan with cooking spray. Add 1 1/2 tablespoons of the batter per pancake. Cook for 2 minutes. Flip with a spatula. Cook for 1 minute more. Repeat with the remaining batter. Serve hot.

Heat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray 12x8-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Arrange mushroom caps, cut sides down, in single layer. In a small bowl, mix together olive oil, butter, garlic granules, salt, and pepper. Spread mixture evenly over the tops of the mushroom caps. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Drizzle with the red wine. Bake 15 minutes. Serve warm.
I use dried porcini mushrooms to make a broth with a few dried herbs, a bit of dried mushroom powder (which is available from many health food stores), and a splash of red wine. I use this as a soup base.
I make a soup with fresh chicken broth and dried porcini mushrooms. I use a few dried herbs as well. After the soup has been cooking for a while, I add a bit of dried mushroom powder (which is available from health food stores). I also add a splash of red wine. It's really

Mix all ingredients well in a bowl. Heat a little butter or cooking spray in a skillet. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet. Cook until the egg mixture is no longer runny. Sprinkle cheddar cheese on top of the eggs and continue to cook until the cheese is melted. Serve on toast or English muffins.

Split each hotdog in half and place each half in an open-face piece of bread. Beat two eggs in a shallow dish. Place breadcrumbs in another shallow dish. Dip each bread sandwich into the eggs and then the crumb mixture. Place on cookie sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes or until crumbs are golden brown. Remove from oven and top each with cheese. Bake for another 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Toss the rhubarb and raspberries with the orange zest and 3 tablespoons of the sugar. Pour the juice of the orange into a saucepan with the red currant jelly. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-high and boil until the mixture is reduced by half, about 10 minutes. Pour the berry mixture into the prepared tart shell. Top with the pastry. Brush the pastry with the beaten egg. Bake the tart until the pastry is golden brown, 30 to 40 minutes. Brush the top with the red currant jelly mixturesprinkle with the remaining 2 teaspoons of sugar. Bake for 5 minutes more, until the top is shiny. Let cool on a rack before cutting into wedges and serving with cream or ice cream.

Place the dried apples, fresh sage leaf, cinnamon stick in the bottom of a heatproof mug or punch bowl. Add the Scotch Whisky. Top with boiling water and stir to combine. Sprinkle with the honey and stir to combine. Garnish with an apple slice and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Combine first four ingredients in a large skillet. Cook and stir over medium heat until tender. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in mozzarella cheese and toss to combine. Pour into baking dish. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes or until hot. Let stand for 5 minutes. Makes 4 servings.
Heat the butter with the onion and garlic until soft. Add the green beans and potatoes and cook until tender. Season with the creole seasoning and serve.

Combine all of the spices together and store in a glass jar. To use, rub into meat or fish before cooking and discard the spices before serving. Tunisians use the spice mix to rub into fish and meat before cooking. Use it to rub into roasted chicken or sprinkle over fish before baking. Also rub into cooked steaks just before serving.

In a large pot over medium high heat, saute the onion and the tomatoes until soft. Add the beans and stir. Add the water and the soup mix and stir. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and cover. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add the salt and the vinegar. Mix well. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Mix all ingredients together. Pour into greased muffin tin. Bake for 18 minutes. Makes 12 muffins.

These are so yummy. They are so good and healthy too.
I made these and they are very good and healthy.

These are very good and easy to make.

This recipe has a rating of 5.0 by 1 members and no comments.
These were so good. I used whole wheat pastry flour. I will make these again.
These were so good. I made them for my kids and they ate them.

Beat eggs in large bowl with an electric mixer until frothy. Add oil and vanilla. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Beat into egg mixture until dough is smooth. Chill at least 2 hours. Divide dough into 3 balls. Roll each out to about 1/8-inch thickness on lightly floured surface. Cut each into 3-inch circles using a lightly floured pastry wheel or sharp knife. Place 2 tsp raspberry preserves in center of each circle. Fold over half of circle to form half moon shapes. Crimp edges with fork to seal in filling. Place on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 20 to 25 minutes until lightly browned. Cool 2 minutes on cookie sheets before removing to wire racks. Makes about 3 dozen.
name: baked ham california styleingredients: ham, orange peel, brown sugar, olive oil, dry mustard, pepper, whole cloves, grape juicepreparation:Rinse ham thoroughly. Pat dry and cut slits randomly with a paring kn

Crush wafers in food processor. Place in large bowl. Combine oleo with frozen orange juice until smooth. Add to crushed wafers and mix well. Shape into balls about one inch in diameter and roll in coconut. Place on wax paper until ready to serve.

Remove skin from salt cod fish. Soak in cold water for 12 hours. Drain and cover with boiling water in a saucepan. Cook for 1 hour. Cut fish into 1/2-inch chunks. Fry fat salt pork until crisp. Add onion and cook until tender. Add fish. Cook over low heat for 10 minutes. Add carrots, potato, milk, corn, salt and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

In a saucepan on medium heat add 1/4 cup of the heavy cream, 1/3 cup of the sugar, 1/4 teaspoon of the vanilla, and the kahlua and stir until the sugar has dissolved. Remove the mixture from the heat and cool slightly. Beat the remaining 3/4 cup heavy cream until stiff peaks form and then set aside. Beat the remaining 1 cup of the sugar and 3/4 cup heavy cream together until stiff peaks form and then set aside. In a medium bowl beat the egg yolks with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of the vanilla until slightly thickened and then add the grand marnier and the kahlua and beat until combined. Pour the mixture back into the saucepan and cook over medium heat until the mixture coats the back of a spoon and reaches the consistency of thick custard. Stir in the chocolate chips and pour into 4 custard cups or 4 ramekins and place the custard cups into a baking dish with hot water to come halfway up the sides of the custard cups and bake

Spray a griddle or large skillet with cooking spray and heat over medium heat. In a shallow bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk. In a separate bowl, stir together the cornflakes and coconut. In a third bowl combine the macadamia nuts and hawaiian sweet bread. Dip the slices of bread first into the cornflake/coconut mixture then into the egg mixture and then into the macadamia nut mixture. Cook for about 2 minutes on each side until golden brown. Serve with maple syrup and whipped cream.
Boil noodles and drain. In a sauce pan melt butter and stir in pot cheese until melted and blended together. Add sour cream and stir. Pour over hot noodles and serve immediately.
Saute onion in bacon grease until tender. Add flour and seasonings. Add tomatoes. Bring to a boil. Simmer 2 minutes. Remove bay leaf and celery leaves. Serve over hot rice.

Mix the parsley, mustard powder, salt and pepper in a shallow bowl. Dip the fish in the buttermilk, then coat it with the breadcrumb mixture. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the fish and cook until it is golden brown on both sides (about 6 minutes per side). Place the fish on a baking sheet. Pour the melted butter over the fish and bake for 5 minutes in the preheated oven. Arrange the almonds on top of the fish. Serve hot.
Combine all ingredients in a mug. Heat in microwave for a minute or two. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Lightly grease a baking sheet. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough into a rectangle about 10 by 14 inches, then cut into strips about 1 by 4 inches. Arrange strips about an inch apart on the baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes or until just golden. Meanwhile in a small bowl combine broccoli, red pepper, cheese and onion powder. Set aside until the wonton strips are ready. In a small bowl beat egg with water until well blended and set aside. When the strips are ready to remove from the oven, brush lightly with the beaten egg mixture and sprinkle with thyme. Bake for another 4 minutes or until the strips are golden brown on top. With a slotted spoon place about a tablespoon of broccoli mixture on each strip. Gently press the edges of the wonton strips together over the broccoli mixture to form a seal and transfer the tarts to a serving dish. Serve warm or

Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat. Take a piece of aluminum foil big enough to hold all the potatoes and vegetables and spray with the vegetable cooking spray. Place the onion in the middle of the foil and season with salt and pepper to taste. Place small pats of the butter or margarine over the onion. Carefully seal all the edges of the foil around the vegetables to form an enclosed packet. Grill over medium heat for 20 minutes. Carefully open packet, check for tenderness with a fork. If tender, sprinkle the cheese over the vegetables and allow it to melt. Transfer to a platter and serve with your main entree.

Grate your russet potatoes into a large bowl and add in your diced onions. Add in your oil and salt and pepper and mix well. Heat your skillet over medium high heat. Add in your mixture to the pan and flatten your mixture into 1/4" thick patties and place in the pan. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side until golden brown and crispy. Serve and enjoy!

Cook macaroni in salted water until done to taste. Drain in colander. Butter a baking dish and layer in tomato juice then macaroni. Sprinkle with seasoning. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until heated through. Serve hot.

In a small bowl combine honey, soy sauce, vinegar, and corn starch. Mix until corn starch is dissolved. In a large wok heat 1 tablespoon of the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, red pepper flakes, and onionsaut for 2 minutes or until the garlic is lightly browned. Add the rest of the vegetablessaut for 3 minutes or until the vegetables are crisp-tender. Stir in the honey mixture. Heat until the mixture thickens. Stir in the peanuts. Serve over steamed jasmine rice.

Rub fish all over with a little of the olive oil. Place in a baking dish. In a small bowl combine the remaining 2 tablespoons of the olive oil with the juices of the lemons and orange, sea salt, and pepper. Pour over the fish. Roast for 30 minutes or until fish is just cooked through. Transfer fish to plates. Pour any remaining liquid over the fish. Garnish with capers.
Cook pasta according to directions. Drain well. Mix all remaining ingredients and pour into a greased 2-quart casserole dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Let cool for 5-10 minutes. Enjoy.

Cook the pasta according to package instructions. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, until the garlic is golden, about 1 minute. Add the spinach and cook until it wilts, about 3 minutes. Pour the beans and vegetable broth into the skillet. Bring to a boil and cook until the liquid thickens slightly and coats the spinach, about 5 minutes. Add the pasta to the skillet. Toss to combine. Serve immediately, sprinkling each portion with Parmesan.

Preheat oven to 400. Place crust in pie dish. Sprinkle with half of cheddar cheese. Layer with bacon, onion, mushroom, asparagus spears. Combine milk, eggs, italian seasoning and garlic. Pour over top. Sprinkle with remaining cheddar cheese. Bake 30 minutes or until custard is set.

Combine everything but the legs in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Add the drumsticks and cover. Simmer for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Place legs on baking sheet and pour sauce over top. Bake at 375 for 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Put all the ingredients in a bowl and toss together. Make the dressing and pour over the salad. Toss gently. Chill and serve.

Mix cake mix as per instructions. Add jell-o gelatin to boiling water and stir until dissolved. Pour over batter and mix well. Add diet soda to the batter. Bake according to box directions. Cool. Mix together cool whip and flaked coconut. Spread on top of cake. Sprinkle with toasted coconut. Store in refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 350. Mix breadcrumbs and ranch mix. Spray a large baking dish with cooking spray. Cut chicken breasts into strips. Lay strips flat and spread with sour cream. Sprinkle with crumb mixture. Bake, uncovered for 30 minutes.
Hey, I just made this recipe last night for the first time and it was awesome! I followed the recipe exactly and it was really tasty. It was a hit with the whole family. Thanks for sharing!
Hi! I love your blog! I'm doing a search on the web for healthy recipes and stumbled on your site. I am a mom of three and I really appreciate all your great ideas. I've been following your blog and your blog is so cool! I'll be back.

Whisk egg whites and yolks in a large bowl until blended. Add dressing and mustard. Stir until well combined. Heat a large nonstick skillet or griddle coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat. Add egg mixture. Cook, stirring frequently until almost set. Top with parsley and cheese. Cook until cheese is melted. Cut into wedges and serve.

Put the grated carrots into a pan with the lemon peel and the ginger and cook over a low heat for about ten minutes or until they are soft and the liquid has all but disappeared. Remove from the heat and leave the mixture to cool a little, then tip it into a bowl and stir in the honey and the cream cheese and beat until smooth and creamy. Stir in the breadcrumbs and the hazelnuts and spread the mixture into the base of a round baking tin or cake pan. Beat the egg yolks with the honey in a bowl and then beat in the whites until the mixture has formed a fairly stiff meringue. Spread this on top of the filling and bake in an oven preheated to 200C/Gas Mark 7 for 25 minutes or until golden and firm. Leave the cake in the tin to cool for about ten minutes and then remove it and cool on a wire rack.
I had a great weekend! On Friday we had a girls' night in at my place. I cooked up some cheese straws and potato skins, then we watched The

Slice avocados in half and remove the pit. Scoop the flesh into the bowl. Add green onions, green chili and garlic. Mash the avocado with a fork. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a large bowl, combine rice, onion, parsley, thyme, cinnamon and ginger. Combine juice and cornstarch in small bowl and stir until smooth. Add to rice mixturetoss well. Spoon rice mixture in shallow dish and spread evenly. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place chicken on rice mixture. Combine orange marmalade and lemon juice in small bowlpour over chicken. Bake at 400 for 40 minutes. Stir rice mixture every 10 minutes. Serve. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 400. Season each side of the pork chops with salt and pepper and set aside. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium high heat. Place the chops in the skillet and brown them on both sides. In the same skillet, pour in the white wine and reduce by half. Add the honey and the Dijon mustard and reduce by half again. Remove the skillet from the heat and transfer the pork chops to a baking dish. Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake the chops for 20 minutes. Remove the foil from the baking dish and bake the chops for an additional 10 minutes or until the internal temperature is 150 degrees.

Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add mustard and honey and stir until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in pecans. Divide the mustard mixture into 4 portions. Stir 1/4 of the mixture into 1/4 of the fish. Sprinkle with 1/4 of the bread crumbs and 1/4 of the parmesan. Repeat to make 4 portions. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add fish and cook for 3 minutes or until golden. Turn fish and cook for 2-3 minutes longer or until just opaque in the center. Serve topped with remaining mustard mixture and garnish with parsley.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Drain orange juice into a bowl. Add orange peel, garlic, ginger, vegetable oil and flour. Stir until smooth. Put the fish into the orange mixture. Mix lightly so the fish is coated with the orange mixture. Spread fish evenly on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 20 minutes or until the fish is just firm. Sprinkle fish with green onions.

In blender combine heavy cream, espresso powder and condensed milk. Blend until smooth. Add yogurt and blend until smooth. Transfer mixture to plastic bag or sealable container and freeze for 4 hours or until firm enough to scoop. Combine ground cinnamon and figs. Sprinkle over scoops of ice cream before serving.
Scoop out avocado flesh and place in medium bowl. Using a potato masher, mash the flesh until it is very smooth. Stir in the remaining ingredients and set aside. Makes 6 servings.

In a small bowl mix gelatin and boiling water. Stir 5 minutes until completely dissolved. Add cold water. Stir 2 minutes until slightly thickened. Cool slightly. Beat cool whip until stiff peaks form. Fold into gelatin mixture. Refrigerate 30 minutes or until firm.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). In a large skillet, cook frankfurters in boiling water for about 8 minutes, until done. Meanwhile, in a bowl, melt butter in the microwave. Add onions, basil and garliccook and stir until onions are soft. Drain frankfurters. Cut into bite sized pieces and add to onion mixture. Mix in celery soup and milk. Pour into an ungreased 9x13 inch baking dish. In a skillet over medium heat, brown tomatoes in butter until thick. Stir in parsley. Spread over frankfurter mixture. Bake uncovered for about 40 minutes. Stir in wide egg noodles and bake for another 10 minutes. Serves 8.
Mix together cream cheese, mayonnaise and salsa. Spread evenly on each tortilla. Top each with 1/4 of the bacon, 1/4 of the tomatoes and 1/4 of the lettuce. Roll up tightly. Chill until serving time.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the sausage and garlic in olive oil until the meat is no longer pink. Drain and return to the skillet. Add the basil, tomatoes and beans. Season to taste. Meanwhile, cook the pasta in a large pot of salted water. Drain and combine it with the sausage mixture. Season to taste. Toss in the basil leaves and serve, topped with the asiago.

Bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Add asparagus. Cook 3 to 5 minutes or until tender but still firm. Drain well. In a medium bowl, whisk together lemon juice, mustard, and olive oil. Stir in seasoning salt and pepper to taste. Add asparagus to bowltoss to coat. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 200c. In a small bowl combine wine and seasoning. In a small saucepan combine oil, lemon juice, rosemary and garlic. Heat to a boilremove from heat. Place breasts in a baking dish. Pour boiling marinade over breasts and turn to coat. Bake uncovered 20 minutesturn. Bake 15 minutes longer or until done. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 400f. Heat butter in a small skillet over meduim-high heat until hot and foaming. Add beans and garlic and cook until beans are bright green and crisp tender. Transfer beans to an ungreased 15x10x1-in baking dish. Mix brussel sprouts with balsamic vinegar in another small bowl and arrange on top of beans. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and bake until crisp and browned, about 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl combine bread crumbs, parmesan, paprika, thyme and pepper. In another bowl combine buttermilk and margarine. In a third bowl combine egg and garlic salt. Dip each breast in egg mixture and then in bread crumb mixture to coat. Place breasts in a single layer in a 13 x 9-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake uncovered 30 minutes. Turn breasts over and bake 15 minutes longer or until no pink remains when chicken is cut to the bone.

Melt butter in a skillet. Saute shallots 1 minute. Add mushrooms and saute until tender. Add wine. Stir in artichokes, parsley, pimiento, lemon juice. Cook 3 minutes. Add shrimp. Cook 1 minute or until shrimp turn pink. Garnish with lemon wedges.
I am glad you enjoyed this. You are so welcome. I love cooking and I love eating good food. Thanks for stopping by.

Place all ingredients into pan except yeast. Mix on basic cycle until smooth, then add yeast and run on dough cycle. Remove dough from pan when cycle is complete and place on a floured surface. Divide into 6 equal pieces. Roll into a 5-inch circle. Place on a lightly greased baking pan. Cover with a clean dishcloth and let rise until doubled in size (about 20 minutes). Brush with melted butter. Bake at 375 degrees for about 15-20 minutes or until the tops are golden brown. Remove from pan while still warm. Cut on the diagonal to form triangles. Makes about 6 dozen small rolls or 3 dozen large rolls.

Cook the chicken. Cool. Shred with two forks. Combine first three ingredients in a large bowl. Add mayonnaise and salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the curly parsley. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan. Whisk in the flour and continue whisking until the mixture is smooth and the flour is fully cooked. Slowly pour in the tomato sauce and mix well. Add the rest of the ingredients and whisk to combine. Bring to a simmer and cook until thickened. This sauce can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

In large bowl combine flour and 1/4 cup sugar. Cut in butter until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Add 1/2 cup milk and mix lightly. Add egg and mix well. Add remaining milk and mix well. Add remaining 1/4 cup sugar and almond extract. Stir just until moistened. Fill greased or paper lined muffin cups 1/2 full. Top each with a plum slice. Bake in 400 degree oven 20-25 minutes until golden brown. Remove from pan and cool on wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar if desired.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to boiling. Add potatoes and return to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Drain and return to pot. Add chicken broth and butter to potatoes and mash with a potato masher or food processor until smooth. Add parmesan cheese and mix well. Stir in kale and season with garlic powder and pepper to taste. Serve warm.
Place all the ingredients in a large pot. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Simmer for 2 hours. Serve over rice.

Place the beans in boiling water and cook until tender (about 5 minutes). Drain the beans and set aside. Place the asparagus in boiling water and cook until tender (about 5 minutes). Drain the asparagus and set aside. Cut the cherry tomatoes in half and place in a small bowl. Drizzle the tomatoes with olive oil, vinegar, mustard and season with freshly ground black pepper. Toss gently to combine. Slice the cooked beans into bite-size pieces. Slice the cooked asparagus into bite-size pieces. Dice the cooked chicken into bite-size pieces. Stir the cooked beans, asparagus, tomatoes, diced chicken, pine nuts, basil, baby salad leaves and remaining dressing ingredients together in a large bowl until well combined. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl beat together eggs, milk, sour cream, chives, chiles, pepper and salt. Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Spread one half of the mixture into the prepared pan. Top with half of the cheese. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup of the cheese. Top with remaining ham. Spread remaining egg mixture over top. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup of the cheese. Bake for 45 minutes or until the middle is set. Cool 5 minutes before serving.

Bring water to a boil. Stir in grits. Cook 2 minutes stirring constantly. Stir in butter, milk, salt, and pepper. Cover and cook over low heat 20-25 minutes or until grits are tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in bacon, onion, and tomatoes. Heat through.

In saucepan, combine tomato sauce, lemon juice, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, dijon mustard, fresh ground black pepper, red pepper, garlic powder and salt. Cook over low heat for 30 minutes or until thickened. Serve over meat or chicken or as a dipping sauce for vegetables.
