Place the dried fruit and walnuts in a saucepan with 150ml water and the brown sugar. Cook on a low heat until the fruit is tender and the liquid has evaporated. Preheat the oven to 200c/gas mark 6 and grease a deep 20cm flan dish. Roll the pastry to line the dish. Prick the base with a fork and bake for 10 minutes until golden. Mix the fruit with the beaten egg and lemon juice. Spoon the filling on the pastry and sprinkle with glace cherries. Bake for a further 30 minutes until the pastry is golden and the filling has set. Cool and dust with icing sugar.

Peel and slice the potatoes into 1/8-inch slices. Combine the dried thyme, cumin powder and sumac in a small bowl. Toss the potato slices with the spice mixture and flour and spread evenly onto a jelly roll pan coated with cooking spray. Drizzle the potatoes with the remaining 2 tablespoons melted butter and sprinkle lightly with the salt. Bake for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes or so for even browning.

Cook ground beef with onion until browned. Drain fat off and add water, tomato paste and seasoning mix. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes stirring frequently. Serve on a layer of taco chips and sprinkle with cheese.

In a skillet add a tablespoon of flour and mix with one tablespoon of water. Cook until bubbly. Add one can of tomatoes (drained), one can of water and one can of tomato juice. Add one medium white onion (diced), one green bell pepper (diced) and three cloves of minced garlic. Simmer until thickened.

Place rhubarb in a large pot. Add water and cover. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Simmer over low heat for 30 minutes or until tender. Drain. In another pot combine sugar and gelatin. Add 1/2 cup milk. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat and stir in remaining milk. Add rhubarb. Cool to room temperature. Fold in whipped topping. Fold in crushed pineapple. Refrigerate at least 4 hours before serving. Serves 12.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. grease a 2 quart casserole dish with cooking spray. In a large pot cook the pasta according to the package directions. In a large bowl whisk together the eggs, butter, evaporated milk and the cheese soup. Stir in the cooked pasta. Pour into the prepared dish. Sprinkle with the shredded cheese and paprika on top for color if desired. Bake in 350 degree fahrenheit oven for 30 to 45 minutes until done. Serve hot.
Peel cucumber. Cut it into bite-sized pieces. Combine in a bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients. Serve chilled.

In a large skillet, cook chicken in the hot oil over medium heat for 5 to 6 minutes or until thoroughly cooked. Drain and place in a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. In a blender container combine the next 5 ingredients and process until smooth. Stir in the broccoli. Pour the sauce over the chicken. Sprinkle with the cheese and the roasted red pepper. Bake for 15 minutes or until the sauce is bubbly and the cheese is melted. Serve with rice.

Preheat the oven to 450f. Place the shallot and 2 tbsp water in a small saucepan over medium high heat. Cover and cook until the shallot is tender, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside until cool enough to handle. Transfer the shallot mixture to a blender or food processor along with the other tapenade ingredients and process until smooth. Transfer the mixture to a small bowl and stir in the vinegar. Set aside. On a rimmed baking sheet place the tomato halves open-side down. Top each half evenly with the tapenade mixture. Arrange the fillets over the top of the halves. Bake the fish until it is cooked through, about 10 minutes. Serve the cod over the roasted tomato halves.

Mix yogurt, mustard, garlic and ginger together in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Arrange chicken in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Pour yogurt mixture over chicken. Bake uncovered in a preheated 375 degree fahrenheit oven for 30 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in center.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees f. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, combine 1 tablespoon of the oil, the onion, and thyme. Cook until tender and golden brown, about 30 minutes. Stir in the sweet potatoes and cook for another 20 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile, combine sour cream and remaining tablespoon of oilseason with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

In a small bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth. Gradually beat in milk and mayonnaise until blended. Add the horseradish, red pepper sauce, worcestershire sauce, tuna and paprika. Mix well. Serve with crackers or celery. Refrigerate leftovers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Place frozen blackberries into a greased 9x11 inch pan. Place drained crushed pineapple in a small bowl along with pecans. In another bowl, combine blackberry pie filling mix with water until the consistency of a paste (thick). Spread blackberry mix over top of blackberries in pan. Place sliced peaches on top of blackberries. Combine remaining blackberry pie filling mix with water until the consistency of a paste (thick). Spread blackberry mix over top of peaches in pan. Combine remaining blackberry pie filling mix with water until the consistency of a paste (thick). Spread blackberry mix over top of peaches in pan. Combine remaining blackberry pie filling mix with water until the consistency of a paste (thick). Spread blackberry mix over top of peaches in pan. Spread the yellow cake mix over top of the fruit in the pan. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Serve warm with ice cream

In small sauce pan combine the milk and flour and cook over medium heat until thickened. Stir frequently with whisk. Remove from heat. Beat in butter and season with black pepper and cayenne pepper. In a small bowl break up the two slices of swiss cheese. Spread some of the hollandaise sauce over the bottom half of the english muffins. Add the cheese and place the other half of the english muffins on top. Cut into two pieces. Heat the two slices of canadian bacon for one minute in the microwave. Top the english muffins with the canadian bacon and the remaining hollandaise sauce. Serve with your favorite breakfast drink.
Totally delicious, thanks for sharing!

In large skillet heat oil over med-high heat. Add butter. When melted add garlic and sage. Saute for 3 minutes. Add chicken. Cook for 4 minutes or until no longer pink. Add potato and chicken broth. Cook, covered, over low heat for 15 minutes or until potato is tender. Add parsley. Makes 1 serving.

Boil and drain potatoes. Melt butter in saucepan. Add flour and cook a couple of minutes. Add milk and seasonings and stir until thickened. Add paprika and bouillon. Add cheese. Add potatoes and toss lightly. Pour into baking dish. Top with paprika and butter. Bake at 400 for 40 minutes.
Saute onion in butter. Add flour, salt, sugar and pepper. Mix in sour cream, beans and cheese. Pour into 9x13 baking dish. Top with cornflakes. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes.

In a large bowl combine eggs and milk. In a second bowl combine flour and seasonings. Dip both sides of slices of bread in flour mixture. Then dip in eggs mixture. Place two slices of bread together. Place two slices of smoked turkey and two slices of honey-baked ham on one slice. Top with slices of jack pepper cheese. Top with second slice of bread. Dip in hot pepper jelly. Fry in melted butter until golden brown. Flip and fry on other side until golden brown. Remove from pan and serve warm with hot sauce.

Boil chicken breast in water until tender. Remove from water. Allow to cool. Chop chicken breast into small pieces. Mix in celery, red bell peppers, dried dill weed, dry ranch dressing mix, and mayonnaise. Chill at least 1 hour. Serve on bread or in lettuce leaves.

Remove stems from mushroom caps and set aside for filling. Cut spicy bulk sausage into small pieces and cook until brown in a skillet with the onions and garlic. Remove meat from skillet and set aside. Add soy sauce and let simmer for a few minutes. In a mixing bowl, add egg and milk and mix well. Add crumbs and meat mixture and mix well. Stuff mixture into caps. Bake in a shallow baking dish at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes or until lightly brown and crispy on top. Serve hot with steamed vegetables and a salad or alone as a snack.

In small saucepan combine sugar and water. Bring to a boil over medium heat and cook without stirring 5-7 minutes until mixture thickens. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter and vanilla. Spoon into bowls. Top each serving with one scoop of peanut butter-flavored vanilla ice cream and garnish with salted peanuts.

Combine the mashed sweet potatoes with the sugar, evaporated milk and eggs. Add the vanilla and beat thoroughly. Add the melted butter and mix well. Spread the mixture into a greased 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Combine the flour and brown sugar and stir into the coconut. Add the nuts and mix well. Sprinkle over the top of the sweet potatoes. Bake at 350 degrees f. for 30 minutes.

Cook couscous as directed on the package. Add fruit and nuts. In a small saucepan combine milk, honey and vanilla. Heat until hot. Stir in couscous mixture. Stir in sugar and cinnamon. Let stand for 5 minutes or until slightly thickened. Serve warm or cold. Makes 4 servings.

In a 10 to 12 inch skillet, bring milk to a boil over medium high heat. Add pastinastir until well coated. Reduce heat to medium low. Cover pansimmer 10 to 12 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in eggs until well blended. Sprinkle with cheese. Season to taste. Serve immediately.

Pierce steak with a fork all over and season with a little black pepper. Heat a heavy frying pan over a high heat. Add the steak and cook for three minutes on each side. Remove from the heat and allow the steak to rest for five minutes. Meanwhile cut the sweet potatoes into wedges and place in a bowl with the oil. Mix well and then add the black pepper. Season with the extra virgin olive oil and roast in a pre-heated oven at 180C (350F) for ten minutes. Heat the remaining oil in a small frying pan and fry the slices of ginger until crisp. Heat the sweet chilli sauce and lemon juice in a small saucepan and pour over the steak. Serve with the roast sweet potato.

Cut the rolls in half. Spread the bottom halves with cream cheese. On top of each piece of cream cheese, arrange a slice of black forest ham and a slice of gruyere. Butter the top halves and place over the hams and cheeses. In a small pan over medium heat, melt the butter. Stir in the parmesan cheese until melted. Sprinkle the top halves of the rolls with the parmesan mixture. In a small bowl, mix the worcestershire sauce with the dried onion flakes and brush over the top halves of the rolls. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the rolls are golden brown. Makes 6.
1. I would like to make a batch of the Ham and Cheese Sandwiches for a church function. I am looking for the recipe for the "Ham and Cheese" part.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit. Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking pan with cooking spray and set aside. Separate each biscuit into 4 rectangles and place in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until light golden brown. Remove and let cool. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute green peppers and onion in oil until crisp-tender. Stir in black olives and mushrooms until combined. Remove from heat and set aside. Combine pasta sauce and mozzarella cheese in a small bowl and set aside. To assemble bubble pizzas, place a rectangular piece of baked biscuit on a plate. Spoon pasta sauce mixture down center of each plate. Top with some of the green pepper mixture and a layer of pepperoni. Sprinkle with a little parmesan cheese and serve warm.

In a large saucepan add water and bring to a boil. Peel and seed peppers. Add to boiling water and boil for 5 minutes. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet brown meat. Add onions and garlic and saute until onions are soft. Drain. Add tomato sauce and rice and cook until heated through. Stir in peppers and heat through. Serve over hot cooked rice. Garnish with parsley.

Combine cake mix and pudding in a large bowl. Add eggs, oil and water. Start on low speed, then 10 minutes at medium speed once ingredients are throughly mixed. Turn batter into a 12 cup bundt pan. Bake 50 minutes at 350 or until toothpick is clean. Cool in pan on rack do not turn upside down. Using a 2 tined fork, poke holes 1 inch apart in the entire cake. Prepare glaze mixing powdered sugar and milk til smooth. Pour glaze over cake immediately and allow to cool in the pan.

wash pink beans. remove ham hock from packaging. place in large pot along with onion and garlic. cover with water. bring to boil. remove from heat. cover and let sit for at least 3 hours. remove from heat. remove ham bone. skim fat from water. add pink beans. cook for at least 1 hour or until desired tenderness is reached.

In a large bowl, combine the avocados, tomatillos, onion, roma tomatoes and lime juiceset aside. In a small bowl, combine the hot pepper sauce and pepper flakesstir well. Stir the mixture into the avocado mixturecover and refrigerate for 2 hours or until ready to serve. Stir again before serving. Serve with tortilla chips or as a garnish to chicken or fish tacos or enchiladas. Makes about 4 cups.

In a bowl combine the dry ingredients and set aside. Mash bananas and add the vanilla and mix well. In another bowl, cream together the butter and the sugars until light and fluffy. Add the egg and mix well. Add the banana mixture and mix well. Add the dry ingredients and mix well. Fold in the chocolate chips. Spread in a greased 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool and cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a bowl combine the Miracle Whip and lemon juice. Spread evenly into the bottom of an ungreased 9 by 12 inch pan. Top with the cheese and crabmeat. Combine the rolls with the parsley and onion. Spread the mixture evenly over the filling. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Dip the fish into the egg mixture and coat with the bread crumb mixture. Place the fish on the greased cookie sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes or until fish is flaky. Serve with tartar sauce or any other sauce you prefer.
baked flounder,bread crumb fish,bread crumbed fish,parmesan crumbed fish,baked fish,panko fish,chicken parmesan recipe.
baked fish,bread crumb fish,bread crumbed fish,parmesan crumbed fish,baked flounder,panko fish,chicken parmesan recipe.
bread crumbed fish,bread crumbed fish recipe,baked fish,baked fish recipe,baked fish fillets recipe,chicken parmesan recipe.
baked fish recipe,bread crumbed fish recipe,bread crumbed fish recipes,baked fish fillets recipe,bread crumbed fish,chicken parmesan recipe.
bread cr

Combine brown sugar, flour, and salt in a medium saucepan and whisk well to combine. Whisk in the egg yolks one at a time until well blended and the mixture is smooth. Add the milk and stir well to combine. Cook over medium-low heat while constantly stirring with a wooden spoon for 5 minutes or until the mixture thickens slightly. Remove the pot from the heat and let the mixture cool for 10 minutes or until it is just warm to the touch. Add the vanilla extract to the mixture and stir to combine. Pour the mixture into individual glasses or a bowl and refrigerate until firm for 4 hours or overnight. Serve cold or at room temperature.

In a medium saute pan over medium-high heat, cook the garlic and chili flakes in the olive oil for a few minutes until the garlic starts to turn golden brown. Toss the cooked pasta with the hot garlic and oil mixture and the chopped parsley. Serve immediately with lots of freshly grated parmesan cheese and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 180 c / 350 f. Line a baking sheet with foil or a silicon baking mat. Season the chicken breasts with the salt and fresh ground black pepper and place them on the baking sheet. Drizzle the chicken breasts with olive oil and sprinkle with the chopped fresh rosemary. Place the baking sheet in the oven and bake until the chicken is cooked through, 12-15 minutes. Remove the chicken from the oven and allow to cool for a few minutes before slicing. In a sauce pan, heat the marmalade, vinegar and orange juice until the marmalade is melted. Add the orange zest and chopped rosemary leaves to the pan. Pour the glaze over the chicken slices and serve warm or at room temperature.

Boil the white potatoes in plenty of water with a dash of salt. Drain and mash the potatoes well with butter and set aside. To prepare the vegetable salad, bring the watercress to the boil with the peas and the corn kernels in just enough water to cover all. Simmer for 10 minutes or so, until the vegetables are just tender but still have a bite to them. Drain the vegetables and set aside. Arrange the potatoes in the center of the serving dish and top with the vegetables. Pour the watercress/pea/corn stock over the vegetables and sprinkle with a little pepper and salt. Serve hot or cold.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the potatoes and broth. Cook for 8 minutes or until heated through. Stir in the spinach and heat through. Remove from heat. Add the cheese and mix well. Add garlic powder to taste. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a mixing bowl combine mayonnaise, eggs and oil. Stir in contents of both boxes of the cornbread mix. Pour in a greased 9x13-inch pan. Bake 25 minutes or until golden brown. Makes one 9x13-inch pan.
i have been trying to find this recipe for years! i don't remember where it came from, but i made it a lot when i was a kid.
my grandmother used to make these molasses cookies and i always loved them! i don't remember much about her recipe but i'm sure i can figure it out after having this recipe!
i have never had these cookies but i sure do like them!

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat olive oil. Add onion, carrot and garlic and saute until soft. Add split peas and saute for 1 minute. Add turkey ham and cook for about one minute. Add enough boiling water to cover ingredients. Add dried marjoram and season with salt and fresh ground pepper. Bring to a boil and then simmer for about an hour or until thick and creamy.

Mix meat with salt and pepper. Shape into 4 patties. Heat a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add patties and cook, turning once and cooking for about 4-5 minutes each side for medium. Remove the patties from the skillet and set aside. Add butter and caramelize the onions over medium-low heat. Cook until they are soft and golden brown. To assemble the burger, top the bottom bun with gravy, mozzarella cheese and the onions. Add the patty and top with the other bun.

Combine all ingredients in a crock pot and cook on low for 2 to 3 hours stirring occasionally. Mash peaches slightly and remove from heat. Cool for several hours and then pour through strainer to remove skins and seeds.

Preheat oven to 325. Sift cake flour with baking powder and set aside. Beat Crisco and sugar together until light. Add the egg whites. Blend. Add the dry ingredients alternately with the milk. Pour into a greased 10-inch tube pan. Bake for 1 hour. Cool 10 minutes. Loosen edges with a knife. Invert the cake on a plate.
name: chocolate chip cheesecakeingredients: graham cracker crust, butter, chocolate chips, eggs, sugar, cream cheese, chocolate chips, whipping cream, butter, sugarpreparation:Pulse graham crackers in food processor. Add melted butter. Press into 9-inch springform pan. Bake 5 minutes at 350. Let cool. Beat together cream cheese, sugar, chocolate chips, and eggs. Pour over crust. Bake 1 hour at 300. Let cool completely. Garnish with whipped cream.
name: coconut chees
Combine dressing ingredients in small bowl. Set aside. Combine salad in large bowl. Add dressing and toss well. Top with almonds. Divide evenly among four plates. Top with chicken.

To make rub, combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Rub both sides of the tenderloin with the mixture. Place the tenderloin on a broiler pan coated with cooking spray. Broil 4-5 inches from the heat for 5-7 minutes on each side or until a meat thermometer inserted 1 1/2 inches from the center reads 160f. Let the tenderloin stand for 5 minutes before slicing.
Cook bratwurst in a skillet. Cut into 1 inch slices. Add peppers and onions to skillet. Saut until vegetables are tender. Sprinkle with paprika and caraway seed. Serve on toasted rolls.

Heat the olive oil in a pot over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook until golden brown all around. Add the onions and cook until translucent. Add the carrots and cook until softened. Add the cauliflower florets and cook for 5 minutes or until softened. Add the herbs and stir. Add the stock and simmer for 3 minutes. Add the pasta and cook for 3 minutes. Add the chicken back and cook for 2 minutes. Season to taste and serve with parmesan cheese.

Heat the oil in a frying pan over a low flame. Add the cumin seeds and fry gently for a minute or so until they begin to sizzle and turn brown. Add the onions, then stir in the garlic and cook until the onions are soft and lightly browned. Stir in the lentils and pour in the water. Cover and cook for 20 minutes until the lentils are tender. Remove from the flame and season to taste. Sprinkle the cayenne before serving.
Combine ham with onion and celery. Mix together lime juice and honey. Add to ham mixture. Stir in mayo. Chill for several hours. Add melon.

Remove the skin from the breasts. Cut each breast in half lengthwise to make two fillets. Layer a piece of ham on each piece of chicken. Sprinkle with half the cheese. Roll up as you would a jelly roll. Wrap each piece in plastic wrap. Place in refrigerator overnight. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine the mustard and bread crumbs. Place the oil in a shallow dish. Dip each piece in the mustard mixture, then roll in the crumb mixture. Place on a lightly oiled baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until the juices run clear. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.

Dredge the chicken breast in flour. Heat the oil in a skillet. Saute the chicken breast until it is brown. Add the olives and the thyme. Pour the sherry over the chicken. Cover the skillet. Simmer the chicken until it is tender. Serve hot.

Cook gnocchi according to package directions. Add the garlic to the boiling water and cook for 1 minute. Drain the pasta and garlic in a colander and set aside. Heat the oil in a saute pan. Add the basil and prosciutto. Cook 2 to 3 minutes. Add the pasta and cheeses. Toss over medium heat until the pasta is heated through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brown the pork chops in a skillet. Combine the margarine, apples and cinnamon. Stuff the pork chops. Place in a large shallow oven-proof skillet or roasting pan. Bake for one hour.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add the canola oil. When the oil is hot and shimmery add the snow peas and saute until they are bright green and tender crisp. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the rice and cooked vegetables and stir until heated through. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and serve.

Mix the dry ingredients together. Gradually add the milk. Cook on medium heat until it comes to a boil. Reduce heat and stir until thickened. Add butter. Serve on toast.
Chocolate is an essential ingredient in many recipes and is one of the most popular flavors in the world.
Chocolate comes from the seeds of the Theobroma cacao tree. The seeds are fermented and dried and then roasted. The seeds are then crushed and ground into a paste known as cocoa mass. This paste is then pressed and the remaining oil is removed and the resulting solid is known as cocoa butter.
Chocolate is often combined with other flavors such as peanut butter, mint, and coffee to make some of the most popular confections and beverages.
Chocolate is thought to have originated with the Olmecs of the ancient Mayan civilization and was used as early as 900 B.C.
Today's chocolate is made by combining the cocoa mass with the cocoa butter and adding other ingredients.
Ch

In a small saucepan, combine sugar with 3/4 cup of water and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Once the mixture starts to bubble, reduce the heat to low and simmer until the mixture thickens into syrup, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and add vanilla extract and ground cinnamon (if desired). Cool completely. In a blender or food processor, combine 3/4 cup of vanilla soymilk with 1/4 cup of soymilk and sugar mixture. Add 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract. Pulse until smooth, then place in an ice-pop mold or ice cube tray. Freeze for at least 1 hour or until solid. To serve, place one ice pop in each glass and add slivered almonds and sprig of mint.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In large bowl, combine all the dry ingredients. In small bowl, combine the eggs and the canola oil. Add the eggs to the dry ingredients, then add the yogurt. Pour into a round cake pan or a cast iron skillet sprayed with pam. Bake for 15-20 minutes, until the edges are golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center of the bread comes out clean. Cut into wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease and flour 9 x 5 inch loaf pan. In a large bowl, combine dry ingredients. In another large bowl, combine applesauce, sugar and egg whites until well blended. Add bananas and vanilla. Stir in dry ingredients just until moistened. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for 60 to 65 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes on a wire rack. Yield 1 loaf.

Melt baking chocolate and butter together. Beat in sugar and vanilla. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Stir in dry ingredients and nuts. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake at 400 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until edges begin to brown and centers are still soft. Let cool on cookie sheets for 2 minutes before removing with a spatula to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine dried seasoning and salt and pepper to taste in a bowl. Toss the potatoes with the seasoned salt and pepper until evenly coated. Layer the potatoes, apples and sauerkraut in the bottom of a 9×13-inch baking dish. Place the pork chops on top of the vegetables. Pour the wine over the chops. Layer the kielbasa slices on top of the pork and the vegetables. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Remove the dish from the oven and stir in the frozen peas and the cooking juices. Return the dish to the oven and continue baking for another 30 minutes. Serve with hot cooking juices from the baking dish or over mashed potatoes.
Combine the first 6 ingredients in a bowl. Chill thoroughly. Shape into a ballroll in the nuts. Serve with crackers or graham cracker sticks.

Peel and dice sweet potatoes and place in medium saucepan with enough water to cover them by about 1/2 inch. Bring to boil over medium high heat and then reduce heat to low and simmer until tender about 10 minutes. Meanwhile in small saucepan melt butter and add the remaining ingredients and mix well. When the potatoes are cooked remove from heat and add the apple mixture and pecans and mix well. Place in an ungreased baking dish and bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until heated through.

Peel and finely chop the garlic. Peel and finely chop the green onions. Peel the outer layers off the green chile. Cut them into thin strips. Peel the garlic and slice the green chiles very thin. Add the salt and olive oil. Mix well. Add the sherry vinegar. Mix well. Add the green onions and the chiles. Mix well. Cover the bowl and let it sit for about 1 hour at room temperature. Add the chopped cilantro. Mix well. Check the seasoning. Add the water if desired. Chill for about 2 hours. Serve cold. Serves 4.

In a bowl combine the fish sauce with the shallot, red pepper flakes, cracked pepper, and water. Set aside.In another bowl add the corn kernels along with the fish sauce mixture. Add the cornflour and mix until well combined.Heat 1/2 inch of oil over medium high heat. Using a cookie scoop, spoon out the batter into the hot oil. Fry until golden brown and crisp. Remove from oil using a slotted spoon or spider skimmer. Drain on paper towels.Serve hot with sambal oelek.

Cook the macaroni according to package directions. Drain the macaroni well. Heat the oil over medium heat in a large nonstick skillet. Brown the turkey and drain off the excess fat. Stir the garlic into the turkey mixture until the garlic is lightly browned. Stir the spaghetti sauce into the turkey mixture. Cook until heated through. Stir the corn into the macaroni mixture. Stir the macaroni into the turkey mixture. Sprinkle with the Italian seasoning. Serve immediately.

Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Remove from heat & add tea bags. Steep for 5 minutes & remove tea bags. Stir in cranberry & apple juices & cider. Bring to a boil over high heat & add sugar, cinnamon stick & ginger. Reduce heat to medium & cook for 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat & stir in cloves & cinnamon stick. Ladle the hot tea into cups & serve with orange slices as garnish.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a large bowl, toss sweet potatoes and pineapple chunks with 3 tablespoons of the oil. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet and sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon of the salt and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper. Bake until the edges begin to turn golden and crisp and the pineapple begins to soften, about 15 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. In a small bowl, whisk together the remaining 2 tablespoons of the oil, the maple syrup, marmalade and lemon juice. In a large bowl, toss the roasted vegetables with the dressing. In a separate bowl, combine the pecans and remaining 1/4 teaspoon of the salt. Sprinkle the nuts over the dressing. Serve.

Put the carrot and celery in a large pot and cover with the water. Bring it to a boil, then cook it over medium-low heat until the vegetables are tender and the liquid has been reduced by half. Add the rice and stir. Add the salt and pepper. Continue cooking until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed. Remove the vegetables and stir in the chicken. Cook for a few more minutes. Serve with butter. You can substitute a can of chicken stock or water for the broth. Use a cup and a half of dry white rice.

In a bowl combine the honey, low sodium soy sauce, rice vinegar, and garlic and gingerroot, stirring well. Remove 1/4 cup of the glaze mixture and set aside. Heat the grill to medium-high. In a shallow dish combine the remaining glaze mixture and the 1/4 cup water, stirring well. Add the pork chops and turn to coatmarinate for 10 minutes. Grill the pork over medium-high heat for 10 minutes on each side or until no longer pink in the center. Remove to a carving board and let stand for 5 minutes before carving into 1/2-inch thick slices. Drizzle the reserved glaze mixture over the pork and serve immediately.

Mix sour cream and sugar. Add the other ingredients. Pour into a 9x13 pan. Chill. Cut into squares. Serves 6.
Categories: Fruit, Jello, Pineapple, Pudding, Salads | Tags: apple, cranberry, fruit, jello, pineapple, pudding | 4 Comments
4 thoughts on “Pineapple Jello Salad”
Jello Salads are still around? I had forgotten all about them! I don’t think I’ve ever eaten anything like them. They do look tasty though.
They are really easy to make.
Wow! These look really good. I’ll have to try some of them.
They are so easy to make and are perfect for a potluck dinner.

In a medium bowl, sift together flour, salt and baking powder. Cut up the chili pepper and add to the flour mixture. Slice the garlic clove and add to the bowl. Add cream and mix until the dough begins to come together. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead about 5 times. Pat the dough into a 1/2 inch thick round. Cut out 1 inch rounds using a biscuit cutter. Place the scones about 1/2 inch apart onto an ungreased baking sheet. Brush with the whipping cream and sprinkle with the cayenne. Bake in a preheated 400 degree F oven for 10-12 minutes. Allow to cool for about 5 minutes before serving. Serve with a nice smokey chipotle salsa and a dollop of sour cream. Serves 6.

Peel and slice the onions in half lengthwise and place them in a small roasting pan. Scrub the beets well and slice them in half lengthwise (about the same size as the onions). Toss the beets in the butter and arrange them in the pan with the onions. Place in the preheated oven and cook until they are soft (about 20 minutes). Pour the vinegar over the beets and onions and toss them to combine. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium-heat, heat olive oil. Saute onions until translucent. Add peppers and saute 2 minutes. Add lentils, vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover and cook 20 minutes until tender. Using a food processor, add onion/pepper mixture, 1/4 cup cheese and a small amount of the soup to make a smooth puree. Stir back into soup and add remaining cheese. Heat through, add more red pepper flakes if desired and serve warm with crackers, pita chips or veggies. Serve with crackers, pita chips or veggies.

In a large saute pan, heat the butter and saute the onions over medium heat for about 10 minutes. Add the garlic, bay leaf, and black and white peppercorns and cook for another minute. Add the salt and continue cooking for another minute or so. Remove the pan from the heat and add the thyme. Cool. On a lightly floured surface, roll the puff pastry sheet to a 12-inch square. Cut out a circle about 10 inches in diameter. Transfer the pastry circle to the bottom of a 9-inch pie dish and trim the edges. Fill the pie dish with the cooled onion mixture. Sprinkle with the jarlsberg and thyme. Fold the edges up over the filling and crimp with a fork. Bake the pie for about 45 minutes, or until the pastry is golden and the filling is bubbly. Serve hot.

In a bowl mix together hot water and stuffing mix. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Rinse the chicken breasts under cold water, then pat dry with paper towels. Place chicken in a casserole dish and place in the refrigerator. In a large saucepan cook the soup and sour cream over low heat until hot. Remove from heat and stir in the water and stuffing mixture. Stir in the carrots and peas. Pour over the chicken in the casserole dish. Sprinkle with the cheese and cook for 55 minutes in the preheated oven or until the cheese is melted and the chicken is cooked through.

Place soba noodles in a medium bowl, cover with ice water, drain and rinse under running water. Set aside in a large serving bowl. Combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl, whisk to combine, pour over the noodles and toss to combine. Sprinkle with green onion and serve immediately.

Mash or run through a food processor 1 12-oz container low-fat cottage cheese. Add chopped green onions and dill. Stir in pepper and Tabasco to taste. Chill. Serve topped with thinly sliced cucumbers.

Preheat oven to 400F degrees. Beat butter and applesauce in a large bowl until smooth and creamy. Add raw sugar and beat until combined. Beat in eggs one at a time until smooth after each addition. Beat in vanilla until combined. Add dry ingredientsmix until combined. Stir in chocolate chips and oats. Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto lightly greased baking sheets. Bake in preheated oven for 7-9 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool on the sheets for 1 minute. Remove to wire racks to cool completely.

In a large saute pan over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the onions and garlic. Saute until onions are soft. Add the tomato sauce. Add the halibut steaks. Bring the sauce to a boil. Cover. Reduce the heat. Cook for about 4 minutes or until fish is no longer translucent. Remove the fish. Discard the onion. Add the fresh parsley. Stir. Spoon the sauce over the fish. Serve immediately.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a saucepan, melt margarine. Whisk in flour. Cook for 1 minute. Whisk in milk. Stir in broccoli. Add mustard. Add cooked pasta. Add cheese. Heat through. Stir well. Makes 4 servings.

Cook rice according to package directions. Heat a wok or a large heavy skillet over high heat. When it is very hot add the oil and swirl to coat the bottom of the wok. Add the garlic and stir-fry until golden brown and fragrant. Add the onion and stir-fry until the onion is soft and translucent. Add the shrimp and stir-fry until it is heated through. Add the fish sauce and sugar and stir to blend. Add the cooked rice and stir-fry until heated through. Add the pineapple and stir until the rice is thoroughly heated. Garnish with the green onions. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 375f. Line a jelly roll pan with parchment paper or foil. Toss together the first six ingredients. Place in a large bowl and mix well. Add the dressing mix. Toss to coat. Place the wings in a single layer on a large jelly roll pan. Bake for 40 minutes, turning once. Serve at room temperature.

In a large bowl, combine pretzel sticks, sugar and margarine. Press mixture into bottom of a 13x9 pan. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese with electric mixer until creamy. Beat in the cool whip. Stir in the jello. Add the boiling water and stir until the jello is dissolved. Stir in the raspberries. Pour over the crust. Refrigerate until set.

Prepare the jello according to package directions. Add the lemon juice to the jello mixture. Stir until dissolved. Add the canned cranberry sauce. Stir until the mixture is uniform. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 pan. Chill until firm. Cut into squares. Serve with fresh raspberries.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9x13 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Mix the ground beef, spaghetti sauce, onions, seasoning mix and peppers in a large bowl. Mix in the spinach. Spoon 1/2 of the meat mixture into the baking pan. Layer the cooked ravioli over the meat mixture. Spoon the remaining meat mixture over the top of the ravioli. Sprinkle evenly with mozzarella cheese. Bake uncovered for 25 to 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated through. Serve hot.

Mix together all the cream cheese spread ingredients until smooth. Spread the mixture over the pita bread and top with the cheddar cheese slices. Cook in the microwave for 20 seconds and check to see if the cream cheese has melted. If not, cook for an additional 10 seconds at a time until melted. Add the vegetables to the pita sandwich. Cut into wedges with a sharp knife to serve.

Combine all ingredients in a small bowl and mix well. Pour dressing over spinach and toss lightly. Serve immediately.
Spinach is an edible flowering plant in the family of Amaranthaceae native to central and western Asia. It is an annual plant (rarely biennial) growing as much as 30 cm tall, with alternate leaves 2-30 cm long and 1-15 cm broad. The flowers are inconspicuous, yellow-green, 3-4 mm diameter, maturing into a small, hard, dry, lumpy fruit cluster 5-10 mm across containing several seeds. Spinach may be considered to be either a vegetable or a leaf green. The term "spinach" is derived from the Persian word ispanaih, which means "green" or "green vegetable." In India, the word "spinach" is known as palak and has been used since ancient times. Spinach is an excellent source of vitamin K, vitamin A (in the form of carotenoids), manganese, iron and folate.[3] It also contains moderate amounts of vit

Preheat oven to 350f. Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Spread half of the mixture into an ungreased 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Cover with hash browns. Spread remaining mixture on top of hash browns. Bake for 20 minutes or until hash browns are heated through. Top with cheddar cheese slices, if desired. Broil 1-2 minutes or until cheese melts.

Cream the yolks well with the sugar and lemon rind for at least five minutes or until very light and creamy, then add the vanilla extract. Add the nuts and beat well. The dough is very sticky and hard to handle, so spoon it on to the cookie sheets in heaped tablespoons, and press lightly with the back of the spoon. Bake at 180 C (360 F) for about 10 minutes or until the edges of the cookies begin to brown and the surface is crisp and dry. Cool on the rack and store in an air tight container. Makes about 30 cookies.

Soak bread in milk and let stand for 10 minutes. Grind meat in food processor with half-and-half and onion until finely ground. Add soaked bread and egg and mix well. Season with dill and pepper to taste. Form meat mixture into thin patties about 1/2 inch thick. Dip patties in dry bread crumbs and saute in butter in hot skillet for 2 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Serve on toast points with cranberry sauce. Makes 4 servings.
Whisk together dressing ingredients. In a large bowl, mix together chicken, apples, cranberries, and dressing. Chill for at least 1 hour or overnight. Serve on bread or rolls.

In a large bowl beat together butter and powdered sugar until creamy and smooth. Add vanilla extract and beat well. Add dry ingredients one cup at a time until a dough is formed. Chill in refrigerator for one hour. Roll into small balls and place on a baking sheet. Press each ball down lightly into a circle. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for ten minutes or until lightly browned on bottom edges. Remove from oven and allow to cool on baking sheet for two minutes or until set. Store in an air tight container in refrigerator for up to one week.

Heat butter in large skillet. Saute onions and garlic until tender. Stir in brown sugar, continue cooking until the sugar is melted. Add beef, sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook until the beef is browned. Pour in the balsamic vinegar, stir. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Serve the beef with the onions.

Mix all the ingredients together except for the tomato sauce. Form into 2-inch balls. Heat 2 tbsp. Olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the meatballs and brown on all sides. Pour the tomato sauce over the meatballs and stir. Lower the heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve the meatballs over pasta.

Mix eggs, sugar, milk, vanilla, and pinch of salt together. Soak one side of each slice of bread into mixture. Spread half of the brie slices on the bottom side of each slice of bread. Sprinkle cranberries on top. Place on a baking sheet and bake at 350 degrees until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook pie shell as instructed. Cook and drain the spinach. Mix the souffle as instructed. Mix together. Put in the shell. Bake for 30 minutes. Let set for 10 minutes. Then cut into wedges. Serve hot.
Pulse brown mustard seeds 10 times or so in food processor. Add remaining ingredients. Pulse to combine. Refrigerate until ready to use.

Preheat oven to 375F. Mix brownie mix, water and applesauce in mixing bowl according to package directions, about 1 minute. Stir in egg whites until blended. Divide batter among cupcake liners. Bake cupcakes until edges are firm and centers spring back when lightly pressed with finger, about 18 to 22 minutes. Cool completely before frosting. For frosting: Beat topping with spoon until fluffy. Fill each cupcake with about 1/4 cup frostingtop with candy corn pieces. Makes about 18 cupcakes.
Brownies are just one of those things that seem to hit the spot at any time of day or night. It’s no wonder that people love to eat them. Brownies are also very versatile so you can make them to suit your own tastes with different flavourings or chocolate chips. They are also easy to make with many recipes that will have you in and out of your kitchen in no time at all.
Brownies are also very portable so you can eat them at work or school

Preheat oven to 180 degrees. Line 2 20cm round tins with non-stick paper. Beat eggs, sugar, and salt until thick and creamy. Sift in flour and baking powder. Stir to mix well and divide between 2 tins. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until cooked through. Cool in tins for 10 minutes before turning out on wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease a 9 inch square pan. Combine dry ingredients in a bowl. In a separate bowl beat together egg yolks. Add juice rind, vanilla, melted butter to egg yolks. Add dry ingredients alternately with milk beating until smooth. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold into mixture. Spread evenly in pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Cut into bars.

In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook until softened. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, 30-60 seconds. Add potatoes and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add broth, water and cauliflower. Bring to boil. Reduce to simmer and cook until potatoes are tender, 10-12 minutes. Working in batches, puree in blender or food processor until smooth. Stir in milk and season with salt and pepper. Garnish with chives.

In a saucepan over medium heat, bring broth to a boil. Add frozen corn and cook for 2 minutes. Add celery ribs and carrot slices to broth. Cook for 2 minutes more. Add onions and cook for 1 more minute. Add cooked chicken to the mixture. Add diced tomato to the mixture and cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Season the mixture to taste.

Place cornstarch in a small bowlset aside. In a large nonstick wok or skillet, heat 1 teaspoon of the vegetable oil over high heat until hot but not smokingstir-fry the gingerroot until crisp-tender, about 1 minuteremove to a plate. Add the beef to the wokstir-fry until no longer pink, about 2 minutesremove to the plate with the gingerroot. Add the remaining vegetable oil to the wokadd the garlicstir-fry until fragrant, about 1 minutereturn the beef to the wokadd the sugar, soy sauce, rice wine, and cornstarch mixturestir-fry until the cornstarch is dissolved, about 1 minuteadd the snow peasstir-fry until crisp-tender, about 1 minuteserve at once.

Melt butter in a heavy skillet. Add the onions and saute until they are golden. Stir in the curry powder. Blend in the chicken broth and the aroma seasoning. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Add the chicken. Cook for 5 minutes. Remove the chicken. Add the rice. Cook according to package directions. Stir in the corn flake crumbs. Add the chicken back to the skillet. Heat through. Serve immediately.

Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain well. In a large skillet over medium high heat, brown beef and onions until no longer pink. Drain if needed. Stir in remaining ingredients. Pour into a 9 x 13 baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 for 20-30 minutes or until thoroughly heated.

Bring large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook eggplant in the boiling water until tender. Drain and cool. In small bowl, combine basil, marinara and romano. In separate bowl, combine eggplant and marinara mixture. In another bowl combine mozzarella, romano and garlic. Cut chicken into bite-size pieces. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add eggplant and garliccook and stir 5 minutes. Stir in tomato mixture. Cook and stir until eggplant is tender. Stir in chicken. Remove from heat. Add marinara mixture and mozzarella mixture. Combine and spoon over cooked rigatoni. Garnish with basil.

Cream margarine and powdered sugar. Blend in flour and vanilla. Stir in nuts. Chill dough a few hours. Roll dough into small balls. Dip in melted chocolate. Roll in powdered sugar to coat. Store in refrigerator. Makes 1-1/2 dozen.

Place sausage in crock pot. Pour barbecue sauce and water over sausage. Cook on low for 3 hours or until sausage is cooked through. Serve with Hawaiian rolls.
I love a good crock pot recipe. So many good things can happen in the crock pot.
I have to say that the smoked sausage and bean soup is right up my alley.
I love the smell of cooking in the crock pot.

Preheat grill to high heat. Combine butter and 1/2 cup water in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer 1 minute. Add orange concentrate and simmer 2 minutes. Add chipotle chiles and molasses and cook 3 minutes. Add 1 teaspoon salt and remaining 1/4 cup water. Stir until smooth. Brush corn with glaze. Grill until tender and lightly charred, turning occasionally. Serve glazed corn with remaining glaze and chopped cilantro.

sift together 4 cups flour, 1/2 cup lard, 1/2 cup sugar & 1 tsp salt. Blend in 1 whole egg and 1 tsp vinegar. Blend in enough ice water to make pastry easily handleable. Knead on floured surface & shape into two balls. Wrap in waxed paper & chill for at least 30 minutes. Roll out between two sheets of waxed paper to fit your pan. Remove top sheet of waxed paper & prick bottom of pastry with fork or knife. Chill for 20 minutes while you prepare filling. Bake at 400f for 15 minutes. Cool 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch pan. Combine the crushed pineapple, eggs, sugar, and butter in a bowlmix well. Spread over the bottom of the prepared pan. Arrange the cubes of white bread over the top of the mixture. Combine the melted butter and brown sugardrizzle over the top of the bread cubes. Bake in the preheated oven until the top is browned, about 40 minutes. Serves 6 to 8.

Rinse shrimp under cold water. Pat dry with paper towels. Clean scallops by removing side muscle from each scallopthen pat dry. Soak mussels in cold water for 30 minutesdrain and scrub shells to remove beards. In a large saut pan over medium heat, combine wine, shallots, mushrooms, tomatoes, basil, and 1/4 teaspoon peppercook for 5 minutes or until liquid evaporates. Add mussels, scallops, and shrimpcover pan, reduce heat to low, and cook for 3 to 5 minutes or until shells opendiscard any unopened shells. Stir in lemon juiceserve immediately. Serves 4 as an appetizer or 2 as a main course.

Preheat grill to 300 degrees. Prepare grill for indirect cooking. Thread the tomatoes onto the skewers. Mix together the pesto, onion and cheese. Spoon the mixture over the tomato halves. Sprinkle with parsley. Grill over the indirect heat for 20 minutes or until the cheese has melted.

In medium saucepan over medium heat, combine salsa and miracle whip. Stir in chili powder and bring to boil. Add chicken and heat until warmed through. Remove from heat and stir in half the cheese. Divide salsa mixture evenly between 4 flour tortillas. Top with remaining cheese. Heat in microwave 1 minute. Cut into wedges and serve with salsa.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch pan. Toss the fruit with the sugar in a medium bowlspoon into prepared pan. Combine the dry ingredientscut in the butter with a pastry blender or fork until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Sprinkle over the fruit in the pan. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the topping is golden brown. Serve warm or at room temperature with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream if desired.

Cut the tomatoes into 1/2-inch thick slices. Place a slice in the centre of a serving plate. Top with a slice of halloumi. Drizzle with pesto sauce. Sprinkle with a little lemon juice and a drizzle of olive oil. Repeat with remaining tomato slices. Garnish with basil leaves. Serves 4.

In a large non stick skillet, cook sausage until brown. Drain off fat. Add potatoes and cook until potatoes are tender and brown. Add eggs and mix until eggs are cooked. Sprinkle with cheese and serve with biscuits or toast. Prep time includes cooking time for potatoes.

Mix together the cream of mushroom soup, milk and dry onion soup mix until smooth. Pour over the cubed steaks. Lay the potatoes around the edges of the cubed steaks with the carrots in the middle. Cook in a foil packet for two hours at 400 degrees. Serve with baby carrots and celery.
Cut melon into cubes. Mix fruit cubes, icing sugar & rosewater. Serve cold.

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, cook the broccoli in the chicken stock until just tender. Add the celery and onion and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Add the mashed potatoes and mix well. Stir in half-and-half and thyme and bring to a simmer. Remove from the heat and stir in the cheese until melted and well blended. Season with the pepper and salt.
The recipes look good and I am going to try them out.
I love this time of year. We have just finished the strawberry season and are moving into the raspberry and blueberry season. I love fresh fruit.
Preheat oven 400. Brown hamburger with onion in large skillet. Drain fat. Add soup, onion soup mix and mix well. Pour over meat. Add sliced mushrooms. Bake 1 hour. Serve on top of biscuits.
Beat cream cheese, sugar, cocoa and vanilla until smooth. Beat in milk and 1/3 cup whipped topping. Spread into crust. Top with remaining topping. Refrigerate 2 hours before serving.

Bring a large pot of water to boiling. Add potatoes and boil until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain potatoes and cool to room temperature. In a large bowl toss potatoes with picante sauce and lime juice until coated well. Heat oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Add tomato and olivessaute until softened, about 2 minutes. Add to potatoestoss to combine. Season with salt, pepper and more lime juice if desired. Garnish with cilantro leaves. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Add all the ingredients to a food processor and process until the mixture is smooth. Taste and adjust the seasonings. Garnish with paprika and serve with vegetables or pita bread.

Prepare the rava mixture by heating ghee over medium heat. Add rava and stir until it turns golden brown. Remove from heat and let cool. Heat milk with sugar until it comes to a boil. Add rava mixture and stir well. Add coconut and mix well. Add ghee to your liking. Remove from heat and let it cool. Shape it into ladoo by rolling between your palms. Dip your hands in ghee. Roll each ladoo in the remaining ghee. Store in an air tight container. These ladoos can be stored at room temperature for 3 days. You can also store them in the refrigerator for 2 weeks.

Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add shallotssaute until tender. Add the chickensaute until browned, about 3 minutes per side. Pour wine into pancook until evaporated. Add brothbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the tarragoncover and simmer for 15 minutes. Transfer the chicken to a cutting boardlet stand for 5 minutes. Cut into piecesdiscard the bones. Transfer the broth to a bowl. Add the parsleystir well. Divide the red potatoes evenly between six serving plates. Top with the chicken and the broth. Garnish each serving with parsley springs. Serve immediately.

In a skillet brown sausage over medium high heat. Drain fat. In same pan saute onion in 1 teaspoon oil until tender. Mix in rice. In a medium size bowl combine chicken stock, diced tomatoes, chili powder, garlic powder and pepper. Pour over rice. Cover and bake in a 350 degree oven for approximately 50 minutes.

To make dressing, in a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, hazelnut oil, mustard, salt, and black pepper. Place lettuce in a large bowltoss with dressing. Divide lettuce among 4 plates. Arrange pears on top of lettuce. Shave Parmesan over the top. Sprinkle with blue cheese and walnuts.

Rinse the apricots and drain. Brush the bottom and sides of a 8-inch-square baking dish with melted butter. Arrange the apricots in the dish in a single layer. Sprinkle with the sugar and almond extract. Bake for 30 minutes or until the apricots are tender and the juices have thickened. Serve warm or at room temperature, sprinkled with the almonds. Serves 4.
Prepare cake as directed on box. Add 1/2 tsp each of oil and poppyseed. Spread pudding in middle of cake while warm. Cool. Spread with whipped cream. Top with grated chocolate.

Combine first 4 ingredients in heavy saucepan. Stir over low heat 2-3 minutes or until thick and smooth. Stir in vinegar and sugar. Add egg yolk. Stir over medium heat 1 minute or until thick and creamy. Serve immediately or refrigerate.

In a large bowl, combine the beef, stuffing mix, eggs, salt and pepper. Mix lightly but thoroughly. Form into 1-inch balls and place in a 3-quart slow cooker.In a small bowl combine the sauce and the sugar. Pour over the beef balls. Cover and cook on low for 7-8 hours. Uncover and stir.

Fry bacon slices in a pan until crisp, about 2 minutes per side. Place one slice of bacon in the center of each of the halved croissants and top with a tomato slice and a piece of lettuce. Drizzle with mayonnaise and sprinkle with the parsley.

Soften and blend the cream cheese and dressing together, then add the cocktail sauce and stir. Spread in an ungreased shallow 9 x 13 pan. Top with the imitation crabmeat and the shrimp. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese. Arrange the vegetables over the top of the cheese and sprinkle with the parsley. Bake at 400 for about 20 minutes or until the crabmeat is heated through and the cheese is melted. Serve with crackers or vegetable sticks. Serve cold or at room temperature. Makes about 10 servings.
You should try a recipe for a BLT Dip! I just made it last night, and it is so good! I have to share it with you!
I have never made a BLT Dip before, sounds good though!
That is my favorite kind of recipe!!

Peel the cucumber. Remove the seeds and cut into 1/4-inch slices. Combine with the onions and radishes in a bowl. Whisk together the oil, vinegar and sugar. Add the spices and pour the dressing over the cucumbers. Stir gently to coat evenly. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Serve chilled.

Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Cook onion, carrot and green beans for about 10 minutes or until softened. Add stock and bring to a boil. Add green beans and simmer for 5 minutes. In a blender, puree almond milk with salt, dried herbs and 1/4 cup of water. Stir into soup. Garnish with parsley.

Cut potatoes into 1-inch cubes. Wash and peel onions. Cut into thin slices. Peel apples and cut into wedges. Slice brisket into 1/4-inch slices. Combine apple cider, brown sugar, dijon mustard, cloves, cinnamon, salt, and pepperpour over brisket. Place meat, apples, potatoes, and onions into slow cooker. Cook on low for 5 to 6 hours. Serve with sauce from the slow cooker, cabbage and sour cream.

Peel the onion and slice it thin. Mix with the flour and water. Heat 2 to 3 inches of oil in a deep pot. Drop tablespoonfuls of the mixture into hot oil. Cook until golden brown. Remove with a slotted spoon and place them on paper towels to absorb excess oil. Sprinkle with mint, salt and pepper. Serve with lemon wedges.

Separate crescent dough into 8 triangles. Place 1 heaping teaspoon of cream cheese in the center of each triangle. Top with 2 tomato slice, 1 green pepper slice and 1 bacon slice. Fold dough over filling. Place seam side down in ungreased 15x10x1-in baking pan. Bake at 375 for 13-16 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 8 servings.

Grease an 8x8" baking pan. Beat together butter, sugar and eggs for 3 minutes. In another bowl combine flour and gingerroot. Add dry ingredients to wet and mix well. Pour into baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes until set. Meanwhile mix together juice of orange, zest of orange, gingerroot and fresh cranberries. Cool the pudding slightly. Add fresh cranberries and orange mixture on top. Dust with icing sugar. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cut chicken into strips 1 inch wide. Combine tomatoes with chili powder, cumin, salt and pepper. Dip the strips of chicken into the tomato mixture to coat. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Place strips in skillet. Cook for 3 minutes. Turn strips over. Cook for 3 minutes. Place strips in a 9x13 inch pan. Place vegetables around the strips. Pour remaining tomato mixture over vegetables. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve with tortillas.

In a large Dutch oven or soup kettle, combine the navy beans with water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and cook, uncovered, for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Add the olive oil, onions, garlic and bay leaf. Cook, stirring often, for 20 minutes or until the beans are very tender. Stir in the thyme. Add chicken stock to cover. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and simmer for 1 hour. Uncover. Add more chicken stock to cover, if necessary. Cook for 10 minutes. Add more chicken stock to cover, if necessary. Cook for 10 minutes. Uncover. Add more chicken stock to cover, if necessary. Cook for 10 minutes. Add more chicken stock to cover, if necessary. Cook for 10 minutes. Check for seasoning. Serve with crusty bread.

Sort and discard any bruised or spoiled fruits. In a large saucepan bring the cranberries, apricots, zest and 1/2 cup water to boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 15 minutes or until the cranberries begin to pop. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Stir in the chocolate until melted and smooth. Stir in the nuts. Line a baking sheet with wax paper and use a tablespoon to scoop the mixture. Refrigerate until firm. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week.
name: cranberry trufflesingredients: fresh cranberries, light corn syrup, water, butter, sweetened condensed milk, unsweetened cocoa, powdered sugarpreparation:
In a medium saucepan, combine cranberries, corn syrup and water. Cook stirring until berries are popped and mixture is thickened. Let cool.
In a heavy saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in c

In olive oil, cook the chicken until almost done. Remove from pan. In same pan, add onions and garlic. Cook until onion is translucent. Add natural-style peanut butter. Add ground coriander and red pepper flakes. Add sauce. Return chicken to pan and cook until the chicken is done. Serve with hot cooked rice.

Wash leeks carefully. Cut off green tops. Separate leek leaves carefully, cut them into thin slices. Melt the butter in a large saucepan. Add leeks, cook over moderate heat until they are soft. Add potatoes cut into small cubes. Stir for a few minutes. Add stock. Bring to boil. Simmer for 15-20 minutes. Add cream. Stir gently. Season with salt & pepper. To make chive cream, combine all ingredients in blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Spoon cream in a small bowl. Serve soup with a spoonful of cream.

In a large skillet or pot saute the onions in oil. Add the meat, jalapenos, and garlic. Cook over medium heat until the meat is browned. Add the chopped tomatoes. Add the broth, paste, beef broth mix, and the bay leaves. Bring to a boil. Simmer over low heat for 1 hour. Remove the bay leaves. Add the rice, stir to combine, cover, and simmer for 20-25 minutes. Stuff the bell peppers with the meat mixture. Cover the bell peppers with the soup mixture. Serve with crackers or bread.

Dissolve the gelatin in the water. Add the sugar and stir well. Add the lemon and orange juice and stir well. Cool to 70 degrees F (21 degrees C). Whisk the whipping cream until stiff peaks form. Fold the whipped cream into the orange juice mixture. Chill thoroughly. Freeze in your ice-cream freezer according to manufacturer's instructions. Serve topped with slices of fresh oranges.

In a small saucepan over low heat, melt butter. Add chili powder, onion & garlic powders, cayenne pepper, salt & lemon pepper. Stir to mix well. In a large bowl, pour margarine mixture over popped popcorn. Toss to coat well.
