Preheat the oven to 350f degrees. Combine the peanut butter and splenda in a bowl and mix well until smooth. Add the egg and the vanilla and mix again until well incorporated. Scoop out the cookie dough by the 1/4 cup measure and form into balls. Place the balls on an ungreased cookie sheet and flatten the balls with your palm. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until lightly brown. Remove the cookies from the cookie sheet and let cool on wire racks or flat surface.
I am interested in the recipe for the eggless chocolate chip cookie that is listed under the name "Very Good & Yummy Chocolate Chip Cookies".
I would appreciate it if you could forward it to me. Thank you.
I would like the recipe for the flourless chocolate chip cookie that is listed under the name "Very Good & Yummy Chocolate Chip Cookies".
I would like the recipe for the eggless chocolate chip cookie that is listed under the name "Very Good & Yummy Chocolate Chip Cookies".
I

Combine all the ingredients except the pineapple chunks and vegetables in a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Transfer to a medium bowl and stir well. Add pineapple chunks and vegetables to the bowltoss until evenly coated with the marinade. Place the vegetables and kielbasa alternately on metal skewers. Grill over a hot fire until the vegetables are crisp-tender, about 3 minutes per side. Brush the vegetables with additional marinade while cooking.

Combine pudding mix and milk in large bowl. Beat with whisk until thickened. Add protein powder and beat for 1 minute. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Peel and cut bananas into 8 slices. Lay 4 slices in bottom of prepared crust. Spoon pudding mixture over bananas. Repeat with remaining bananas and pudding mixture. Top with whipped topping and garnish with walnuts or pecans if desired.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Add the potatoes and cook until just tender, about 15 minutes. Drain the potatoes and return them to the saucepan. Mash the potatoes with a fork. Add the butter and heavy cream, and season with the salt. Set aside. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until lightly browned and fragrant, about 3 minutes. Add the cream and cook until slightly reduced. Add the parsley and stir to combine. Season with the salt and pepper. Mound the potatoes in a bowl and top with the green garlic butter. Garnish the top with fresh parsley.

Chop the stems of the mushrooms into 1/4-inch pieces. Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet until hot. Add the chopped mushroom stems, garlic cloves, salt, pepper and cook for 5 minutes or until the garlic is lightly browned. Add the wine and let it bubble until reduced by half. Add the soy sauce, the cooked mushrooms and the chopped parsley and toss well. Spread half the mushrooms on a baking sheet and sprinkle with half the crumbs. Repeat with the remaining mushrooms. Bake for 10 minutes or until the top is golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Cut jalapenos in half. Scoop out seeds and membranes. In a bowl, combine cream cheese and cheddar. Fill each jalapeno half with cream cheese mixture. Wrap each half with one slice of turkey bacon. Place on baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until bacon is crisp, about 15 minutes. Makes 6.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl, combine winter squash, peppers, onions, rice, oil, garlic, bell pepper and hot sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a 2-quart shallow casserole dish. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, combine rice with 2 cups water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover tightly with lidreduce heat to medium-low. Cook for 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Fluff with a fork. Stir into squash mixture. Bake an additional 10 minutes or until rice is heated through. Top with parsley if desired.

In a small bowl stir together broth and water until smooth. In a medium saucepan over medium heat whisk together cornstarch and malt vinegar. Gradually whisk in broth mixture and continue stirring until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in roasted garlic, mustard, honey and salt and pepper to taste. Cool slightly. Dip with crackers, vegetable sticks or chips. Yields about 1 1/2 cups.

Cut each breast into 3 portions and place in a shallow dish. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat and add the seasonings. Cook for about 30 seconds and then add the sherry and stir for another minute until the sherry has reduced by half. Remove from the heat and add the lemon rind and the lemon juice. Dip each piece of chicken into the sherry mixture and then place on a large plate. Pour the remaining sherry mixture over the top of the chicken and cover the plate with foil and refrigerate for at least an hour or overnight. Melt the butter in a pan over medium heat and add the cream and the Parmesan cheese and cook for about a minute until the cheese is melted and the cream is hot and thickened. Remove the chicken from the refrigerator and place on a serving dish. Add the sauce and garnish with the chopped parsley if desired.

Put the unthawed raspberries into a saucepan and add sugar. Cook on medium, stirring occasionally until all the sugar ahs dissolved. Using a potato masher, mash the raspberries and syrup thoroughly. Pour the mixture through a strainer, extract all the juice. Squeeze two of the lemons and strain the juice, add it to the raspberry juice. Add the boiling water to the raspberry juice. Allow the cordial to cool, then chill it in the refrigerator. Serve cordial with a thin slice of lemon in each glass.

In a large stock pot add the dried beans. Cover with water by an inch or two. Bring the beans to a boil then reduce the heat and simmer until tender. Remove the beans from the water and set aside. In a medium bowl combine the remaining ingredients except the hot dogs. Add the hot dogs and mix thoroughly. Fill a baking dish with the bean mixture and cover with the hot dog mixture. Bake at 325 degrees F for 1 hour or until the mixture is bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line baking sheet with waxed paper. In heavy small saucepan, combine brown sugar, butter and corn syrup. Bring to full boil over medium heat for 1 minute. Add vanilla and baking soda. Remove from heat. Quickly stir in nuts and pour onto prepared baking sheet. Spread evenly. Bake for 10 minutes or until firm. Let cool completely before cutting into bars or squares. Spread with melted chocolate chips. Let cool slightly before cutting into bars or squares. Yield: 16 servings (25 squares)

Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Add celery ribs and cook until tender. Add garlic and cook until lightly browned. Stir in chicken stock, tomatoes, paprika, cayenne, rosemary, marjoram and lemon juice. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered until reduced by half. Remove from heat. Puree the mixture in a food processor or blender. Return to the saucepan. Add sour cream and bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat. Ladle into bowls.
tomato soup is a great way to get a serving of vegetables into children.
This is a recipe that I learned from a friend of my parents. I have made this soup many times. It is always a big hit.
This is a great way to use up leftover veggies.
Tomato soup is a great way to get a serving of vegetables into children. This is a recipe that I learned from a friend of my parents. I have made this soup many times. It is always

Cook pasta according to package instructions. In a saucepan over medium heat combine butter and ham until ham is heated through. Add cream and bring to a boil. Cook until thickened. Add pasta, peas, chives and parmesan cheese. Stir until parmesan is melted. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Pre-bake the puff pastry according to package directions. When cool, cut to fit your 10" pie dish. Peel and slice the apples and place them in the bottom of the pastry crust. Sprinkle with the brown sugar and salt. Bake at 400 for 10 minutes until the apples are tender and the sugar has melted and caramelized a little. Cool for about a minute and then spread the caramel topping over the top of the apples and bake for an additional 10-12 minutes until the caramel is bubbling and has a nice golden brown color. Let the tart cool for a little bit and then top with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream and powdered sugar. Enjoy!

Spread the mayonnaise evenly over the 4 slices of bread. Place 2 of the slices of bread with the mayo sides down. Layer lettuce and then 2 slices of tomato over the 2 bottom slices of bread. Top with the bacon and then the chicken breasts and then top with the other 2 slices of bread with the mayo sides down. Cut each sandwich into 4 triangles and serve with sticks or pickles for dipping.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly grease 2 loaf pans. Cream the sugar and butter together until smooth. Beat in the eggs and the eggnog until combined and smooth. In a small bowl, combine the flour, baking powder and salt. Add to the batter and mix well to blend. Divide the batter between the loaf pans and smooth the tops with a spatula. Bake for 50 to 55 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaves comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for 5 minutesremove from pans and cool completely on wire racks. Drizzle the loaves with the glaze and garnish with the nutmeg.
name: eggnog quick bread
ingredients: eggs, white sugar, butter, eggnog, rum extract, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, ground nutmeg
preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly grease 2 loaf pans. Cream the sugar and but

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, combine salmon, 1 can of coconut milk (reserve remaining can for serving), curry paste, brown sugar and fish sauce. Cook, stirring frequently for about 10 minutes or until the salmon is opaque and the sauce has thickened slightly. Add lime juice and red bell pepper. Stir until heated through and serve over jasmine rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place a thin layer of butter in a small baking dish. Place the dill sprigs on the butter. Arrange the salmon slices over the dill. Drizzle with the oil. Bake for 15 minutes. In a medium bowl, combine the eggs, milk, pepper, and salt. Beat until well blended. Place the party round in a shallow dish. Dip one side of the round in the egg mixture. Arrange on a baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining rounds. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes. To serve, place the prepared rounds on plates. Top each round with the cooked salmon. Garnish with dill.

In a large bowl combine graham cracker crumbs and sugar. Mix in butter until crumbly. Press mixture into bottom of a 9x13 inch pan. Bake for about 10 minutes. In another large bowl combine condensed milk and jam. Spread over hot crust. Top with coconut and cashews. Bake for about 20 minutes or until the top is lightly browned. Let cool for at least 2 hours. Spread white chocolate chips over top. Refrigerate until chocolate is set. Cut into bars.

Mix together club crackers and margarine in a bowl. Press onto a 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake at 375 for 8 minutes or until light golden brown. Remove and cool. In a large bowl combine the sugar, brown sugar, graham crackers and chocolate chips. Melt the margarine and pour over the mixture. Spread evenly onto the cooled crust. Bake at 375 for 14 minutes or until light golden brown. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack. Cut into squares and serve.

Place the chuck in the crock pot and add the carrots and potatoes around the edges of the chuck. In a small bowl combine the soup mix and the stout and pour over the chuck and potatoes. Cook on low for 8-10 hours until chuck is tender and potatoes are soft. The liquid will reduce during the cooking. You may need to add more liquid if you prefer more soup like consistency. Garnish with parsley before serving.

Cut the cantaloupe into chunks and place into a large bowl. Add the spinach leaves and pistachios, tossing together. To make the dressing, combine the raspberry vinaigrette dressing with the orange juice in a small bowl and whisk together well. Pour dressing over the spinach mixturetoss together well. Serve immediately.
Spinach is a very good source of folate which is important for DNA replication and repair. It is also a very good source of manganese which is important for the formation of bones, connective tissue, sex hormones, and fatty acids. It is a good source of iron which is important for the transport of oxygen from the lungs to the rest of the body.
Spinach is also a good source of vitamins A (beta carotene), C, E, K, B6, folate, iron, magnesium, manganese, phosphorus, potassium, protein and zinc, and a very good source of dietary fiber, calcium, niacin, omega-3 fatty acids, riboflavin

Peel and cube the potatoes into a large pot. Cover with cold water to about an inch above the cubes. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover with a lid, and simmer for 10-15 minutes until a fork easily pierces a cube of potato. Drain water from pot and return cubes to pot. Add the remaining ingredients to the potatoes. Using an electric mixer, beat on low speed for 15 seconds, then increase to medium speed for 1 minute. Beat until smooth and fluffy, stopping to scrape down sides of bowl if necessary. Transfer mixture to a baking dish and bake for 30 minutes or until lightly browned on top. Serve immediately with your favorite meal!

In a large bowl, combine oats, skim milk and whole wheat flour. Add raw sugar, baking powder and salt. Stir well to combine. Combine the ground cinnamon and egg whites in another bowl. Fold into the oat mixture. Heat a griddle or frying pan over medium heat. Lightly grease with canola oil. Pour batter by 1/4 cupfuls onto the hot griddle. Cook until bubbles appear on top of each pancake. Flip and cook until golden brown on the other side. Serve with maple syrup.
name: fried banana pancakeingredients: all-purpose flour, 1 large egg, 1 cup water, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/4 cup sliced bananas, 1 tbsp granulated sugar, 1/2 cup canola oilpreparation: In a mixing bowl combine the flour, egg, water, baking powder, soda and salt. Beat until smooth.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Season the chicken breast halves with salt and pepper and cook until browned on both sides. In a small bowl, combine the ranch dressing, bread crumbs and butter. Spread each slice of bread with butter. On top of each piece of bread place 1 chicken breast and 2 slices of bacon. Top with 2 slices of cheese. Cook until the cheese melts. Cut each sandwich in half and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Wash the potatoes. Wrap them individually in aluminum foil. Bake for about an hour until they are soft enough to be pierced with a fork. Cut the potatoes in half lengthwise and remove the insides with a spoon. Set the skins aside. In a medium bowl mix the potato insides with the sour cream, chives and butter. Spoon the mixture back into the skins. Sprinkle each with cheddar cheese and bacon. Place the skins back in the oven for about five minutes to let the cheese melt.

Add pomegranates to a saucepan with enough water to cover the fruit, bring to a boil. Add tapioca and reduce heat to simmer for 15 minutes or until tapioca is soft and translucent. In a medium saucepan, combine grenadine and water. Simmer for 3 minutes or until syrup is reduced by half. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice and pomegranates. Stir in tapioca. Chill and top with whipped cream before serving.

Slice beef thinly (about 1/4 inch). Toss with 1 tbsp. Hoisin sauce. Slice bell peppers into strips. Toss with 1 tbsp. Hoisin sauce. Slice onions into strips. Toss with 1 tbsp. Hoisin sauce. Heat 1 tbsp. Oil in skillet. Add beef. Cook about 2 minutes. Add onions. Cook 2 to 3 minutes more. Add bell peppers. Cook 1 to 2 minutes more. Stir in 1/4 cup water. Bring to boil. Cook about 1 to 2 minutes more. Serve over rice.

Mix honey and mustard together until blended. Spray large baking pan with nonstick cooking spray and place in preheated oven for five minutes. Combine remaining ingredients and put in small bowl. Dip each piece of chicken into honey mustard mixture and then into the breading mixture and place on baking pan. Bake at 350f for thirty minutes or until no longer pink inside. Serve hot with your choice of sauce.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray a 9 x 13 baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine the potato, butter, salt and pepper. Spread the potato mixture in a single layer in the baking dash. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Stir in onions and cheese. Return to oven and bake 15 more minutes. Top with parsley just before serving.
In a small bowl combine olive oil, onion, garlic, chili, allspice, cinnamon, lime, and sugar. Set aside.

Cream the Crisco and Molassesadd the beaten egg and continue to mix welladd the remaining ingredients and mix wellrefrigerate for 2 hoursroll into small balls and roll in sugarplace 1 inch apart on a lightly greased cookie sheetbake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees F for 10 minutesremove from oven and sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup of sugarlet cool on wire rackMakes approximately 4 dozen.

In a large Dutch oven or other heavy skillet with a tight-fitting lid, saute bacon until crisp. Transfer bacon to a paper towel and reserve fat. Add onion and cook until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add clams and their juice, and simmer until clams open and are cooked through, about 10 minutes. Discard any clams that do not open after 10 minutes. Stir in reserved bacon and beer and cook until heated through. Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve hot with crusty bread.

Combine crab meat and cream cheese in a small mixing bowl and mix thoroughly. Add shrimp, garlic and hot pepper sauce and mix well. Stir in onion powder and parsley. Mix well. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Bake 30 minutes in a buttered casserole dish at 350 degrees until hot and bubbly. Serve with crackers or vegetable dippers.
Combine gelatin and water and stir until gelatin is dissolved. Mix in vodka and red bull and chill over night.

Mix the flour and 1/3 cup milk in a small bowl. Mix well and set aside. Beat the remaining milk with the eggs in a small bowl. Set aside. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Melt the butter in the pan. Add 1/3 of the crepes to the pan. Cook for 1 minute per side or until lightly browned. Repeat with the remaining crepes. Place a crepe in the bottom of an 8-inch pie dish. Top with a layer of the onion and 1/2 of the mozzarella. Add another crepe layer and top with another layer of the onion and 1/2 of the mozzarella. Add the spinach and top with the remaining mozzarella. Top with the remaining crepes and sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup mozzarella. Bake for 15 minutes or until the crepes are set and the cheese is melted. Sprinkle the remaining 2 tbsp. of mozzarella over the top. Broil for 2 minutes or until the cheese is melted

In a large bowl with a mixer, cream together the butter and cream cheese until light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla and egg. Beat in the cake mix. The mixture will be very stiff, and it will look like there isn t enough liquid in the recipe, don t worry this is normal and it will still turn out great! Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a cookie sheet with waxed paper and spray it with nonstick cooking spray. Form the dough into one inch balls and place on the cookie sheet. Bake for about 8 minutes. Allow to cool for a few minutes and then roll in powdered sugar.

Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch cubes. Melt the oil in a large skillet and saute the onion and garlic until soft. Add the parsley, pimiento and salt & pepper. Cook until the mixture is fragrant and the pimiento is slightly darkened. Add the potato cubes and chicken broth. Bring the mixture up to a boil and simmer until the potatoes are soft. Serve immediately or refrigerate for later use.

In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt and pepper until well blended. Place slices of bread into bottom of greased 9 x 13 baking pan. Pour mixture over bread and sprinkle with cheese. Bake in a preheated 350 degrees oven for about 45 minutes or until eggs are set. Remove from oven and sprinkle with bacon bits. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

In a large bowl, combine pudding and milk. Stir well. Lay graham crackers in bottom of a 9 x 13 glass baking dish. Pour pudding mixture over top. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Spread whipped topping over top. Melt chocolate frosting as directed on package. Drizzle over top. Refrigerate again for 2 hours. Cut into 24 bars.

Beat the eggs with the milk, spices and vanilla in a shallow dish. Dip the slices of gingerbread in the mixture, then fry on both sides until golden brown, about 4 minutes on each side. Drain on paper towels and serve with maple syrup or fruit compote.

Thread the dove, bell pepper and onion alternately onto 4 skewers. Brush the dove and bell peppers and onion with the teriyaki sauce. Grill the kabobs for about 4 minutes per side or until the dove is no longer pink and the onion is tender. Serve the kabobs with the tomatoes and mushrooms.

Dust both sides of the chops in the flour. Sprinkle on the dry mustard, garlic powder, and a little pepper. Heat oil in a skillet. Brown the chops in the hot oil. When the chops are browned on both sides place the chops in a casserole. Mix the soups and the sour cream. Pour the mixture over the chops. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. Serve over hot rice.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onionscook, stirring occasionally for about 8 minutes or until golden brown. Add sirloin steakscook for about 5 minutes per side. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 350 degrees. Meanwhile, place rolls on a cookie sheet. Sprinkle each with 1 teaspoon of the steak seasoning. Bake for about 2 minutes or until lightly toasted. Slice each steak diagonallystack the cut side of each slice on the bottom half of each bun. Top with the onions and a sprinkling of the steak seasoning. Cover with the provolone and the top of the bun. Bake until the provolone is melty. Serve immediately.

In 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat, cook bell pepper and onion in vegetable oil for 5 minutes or until tender-crisp. Stir in rice, mushrooms, garlic, Cajun seasoning and water. Bring to a boil. Coverreduce heat to low. Cook 25 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in pecans. Serve immediately.

Heat the olive oil in a large pan. Add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Add the courgettes, lemon juice and basil. Cook for about 10 minutes or until the courgettes are tender. Add the tagliatelle. Cook according to the packet instructions. Stir in the parmesan. Serve immediately.

Mix together the pancake mix and enough water to make a thick batter. Pour in a small amount of vegetable oil in a deep fryer and heat until hot. Drop batter in with a spoon into the hot oil and fry until golden brown. Drain on paper towel. Cool on wire rack. Roll in sugar. Makes about 18.

Prepare the potatoes according to your favorite method. When they are done, allow them to cool completely. Chop the potatoes into small bite-size chunks. In a large bowl combine the potatoes, onions and eggs. In a small bowl whisk together the light sour cream with the lemon juice and the olive oil until well blended. Add the mustard and the chopped parsley. Add the dressing to the potatoes and toss gently. Taste and adjust the seasoning with additional salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature or chill before serving.

Spread mayonnaise on one side of the bread and the cream cheese on the other. Place the swiss cheese on the bread spread with mayonnaise and the cream cheese on the other half. Slightly toast in oven and then cut into two triangles. Enjoy!

In a medium saucepan, melt caramel ingredients over medium low heat until smooth. Remove from heat. Line a 13x9 inch baking dish with non-stick aluminum foil which extends the 2 inches beyond the edges. In a saucepan, melt the butter over medium low heat. Stir in marshmallows, with a rubber spatula, and continue stirring until almost melted. Stir in vanilla, 1 teaspoon of the sea salt, and 1 cup of the melted caramel stirring until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in cereal and press mixture into prepared baking dish. Spread the remaining caramel over top and sprinkle with sea salt. Let cool completely, peel off foil, and cut into 24 squares.

Mix together tomato sauce, italian seasoning, and garlic powder. Arrange chicken in a 13 by 9 inch baking dish and cover with tomato sauce. Bake for 30 minutes. Increase oven temperature to 400 degrees. Beat eggs with cornflake crumbs and parmesan cheese. Sprinkle over the top of the chicken. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Sprinkle with dried parsley and mozzarella cheese. Bake 2 additional minutes or until mozzarella cheese is melted.

Brown the meat with the seasonings, drain. Add the sauce. Bring to a boil. Boil the pasta as directed, drain. Mix the pasta and meat sauce in a 2-quart casserole dish. Cover with the cheese. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes.

In a saucepan, combine the butter and the garlic. Heat over low heat until the garlic is golden. Stir in the cayenne pepper and the cream cheese. Cook over low heat until the cream cheese is melted. Stir in the milk and the Parmesan cheese. Cook until the milk is hot. Season with pepper. Serve with pasta.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease and flour a 12 cup muffin pan. In a large bowl, combine the sugar and butter. Beat until creamy. Add the buttermilk and beat until smooth. Stir in the eggs and vanilla extract. In another bowl, combine the flour, baking soda and salt. Stir into the butter mixture just until combined. Add the bananas and fold into the mixture just until combined. Stir in the blueberries until coated with the batter. Spoon the batter into the prepared pan and bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the middle of a muffin comes out clean. Serve warm.

In a large saucepan cover potatoes with water and bring to a boil. Cook until tender about 20 minutes. Drain and let cool slightly. In a small bowl whisk together vinegar and oil and season with salt and pepper to taste. To assemble, combine potatoes, peppers, and onion in large bowl and toss gently with dressing until combined. Toss in cheese and garnish with dill sprig and serve immediately or chill until ready to serve.

Rub the pork loin chops all over with the oil. Place the chops in a single layer on a cookie sheet. Sprinkle the chops with the thyme, basil and rosemary. Sprinkle the chops evenly with the salt. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour. Let the chops rest for 10 minutes before slicing.

Heat olive oil in skillet and saute leek for 1 minute. Add butternut squash and saute 1 minute. Add salt, pepper and herbes de provence to taste and saute 1 minute more. Add beans and water and simmer for 45 minutes. Add rotel and simmer 1 minute more. Divide among 4 bowls and top with mozzarella cheese and bacon bits.

Preheat the oven to 180 deg C. Grease and line a large baking tray with parchment paper. Cream together the butter, caster sugar and custard powder until light and fluffy. Add the egg and vanilla extract and beat until combined. Sift in the flour and beat until just combined. Add the chocolate and beat until combined. Roll tablespoons of dough into balls and place onto the prepared baking tray. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until lightly golden. Allow the cookies to cool on the tray for a couple of minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

In a large saucepan, combine brown sugar and flour. Gradually add milk while stirring. Cook and stir until mixture thickens and boils. Cool slightly. In another saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add egg yolks and stir until thickened. Combine with cooled brown sugar mixture. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Fold in butter and vanilla. Pour into prepared pie shell. Chill. Makes 1 pie.

Combine sugar and vinegar in large bowl and stir to dissolve sugar. Add onion and stir to coat. Add oil and stir to blend. Add spinach and toss to coat. Add strawberries. Sprinkle with feta cheese and pecans. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut the hot dog bun into thin strips and spread with melted butter on both sides. Roll in parmesan cheese and sesame seeds and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until crisp and lightly browned.
Food that is high on fat can cause heart diseases. Avoid eating such foods or foods that are high on calories.
Food that is high on carbohydrates can cause diabetes. Avoid eating foods that are high on carbohydrates or foods that have a lot of starch content in them.
Food that is high on proteins can cause kidney problems. Avoid eating foods that are high on proteins or foods that have a high content of meat in them.
Food that is low on fat can cause weakness and weakness of your body and your muscles.
Food that is low on carbohydrates can cause problems with your brain and your ability to think clearly and to concentrate on any given thing.
Food

In a large skillet combine onion and garlic with 1 cup water. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat, and allow to cool completely. In a 5 quart slow cooker combine onion mixture with roast and 1 cup water. Add the remaining cup of water to a separate bowl and add 1/3 cup of barbecue sauce. Add salt and pepper to taste, and stir until smooth. Pour 1/2 of the mixture over the roast in the slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours. Repeat steps above with remaining mixture for a second batch. Remove roast from crockpot and place on cutting board. With 2 forks or your hands pull meat into shreds. Add more barbecue sauce to taste. Place back into crockpot to serve. Serve with hamburger buns or on sandwiches.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Grease a 10 inch bundt pan or a 12 cup jelly roll pan. In a large bowl cream the butter until light and fluffy. Beat in the sugar until combined. Add the eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Beat in the vanilla. Sift together the flour and the baking powder. Add the flour alternately with the milk to the creamed mixture beginning and ending with the flour. Beat on high speed for one minute. Pour the batter into the pan. Bake for 1 hour. Remove from the oven and let the cake cool for 10 minutes in the pan on a wire rack. Turn the cake out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Dust with confectioners sugar before serving.

Combine cornstarch and water in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook until thickened but not dry. Add the rest of the ingredients, except the berries, stirring well to combine. Add the strawberries, stirring gently. Pour the mixture into a fondue pot. Serve the fondue in a shallow bowl accompanied by sliced shortbread cookies, wedges of cake or sponge fingers and/or meringues.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add cabbage, cover, and cook until tender crisp. In a small bowl combine vinegar, honey, and juice. Stir well. Pour over cabbage. Add remaining ingredients. Toss lightly. Cool.
 apple salad with pears and walnutsingredients: pears, walnuts, red seedless grapes, apples, celery, orange juicepreparation:Peel, core, and quarter pears. Combine pears with other ingredients. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Heat butter in a saucepan over medium heat until melted and foamy. Add onions and cook until browned and caramelized, about 25 minutes. Add turnips and cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Add milk and season with salt and pepper. Cook for an additional few minutes until mixture is heated through and creamy. Serve with french baguettes for dipping.

Beat together cheddar cheese and cream cheese until smooth. Add pumpkin puree and beat until well blended. Add allspice and nutmeg and mix well. Chill for 2 hours or until firm. Form into a ball and refrigerate for 24 hours or until firm. Roll the ball in the pumpkin pie spice. Shape into a pumpkin and place a pretzel stick into the top of the head for a stem. Serve with crackers or pretzels and fruit for dipping.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat cook the fennel in butter and the garlic with a pinch of salt for 3 minutes. Add the stock and thyme and simmer for 30 minutes. Add the chicken stock and cook for another 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a 2-quart casserole. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the flour and cook for 1 minute. Slowly whisk in the cream and cook for 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and pour over the fennel. Bake until bubbling and lightly browned.

Boil the potatoes in their skin for about 1 hour. Cool them slightly before you cut them into bite sized pieces. Cut the eggs in half lengthwise and remove the yolks. Add the egg yolks to the potatoes along with the salad dressing. Mix well. Cut the egg whites into strips to sprinkle over the top of the potato mixture. Add the onion, pickles, and a little of the egg yolk mixture to taste to the mixture. Salt and pepper to taste and serve chilled.

In a large bowl beat the eggs. Add the milk, salt and pepper. Beat until blended. Preheat the skillet. Melt the butter in the pan over medium-low heat. Pour the egg mixture into the pan. Cook, turning the omelet over once until the bottom is golden brown and the top is set but still slightly jiggly in the center. Serve immediately.
name: omelet with flowersingredients: fresh edible flower, eggs, water, flour, salt, pepper, cheese, olive oilpreparation:Beat eggs add water and flour and make a batter. Combine with cheese, flowers, salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a pan. Poor the mixture in the pan or take spoonfuls of batter and drop into the oil. When the bottom side of the omelet is golden brown turn it over the cooked on the other side4.
name: easy baked omeletsingredients: egg, green pepper, tomatoes, onion, sausage, cheesepreparation:Preheat oven to 350. Spray muff

Combine all ingredients and marinate for 24 hours in the refridgerator. In a large skillet heat 2 Tbsp of vegetable oil over medium high heat. Add the pork and cook about 3-5 minutes per side or until browned. Cover with remaining 2 Tbsp of oil. Transfer the meat to the crockpot and cover with remaining marinade. Cover and cook on low for 6-7 hours or on high for 4-5 hours. Remove the meat from the crockpot and place on a plate. Strain the meat juices from the crockpot and keep them in a small pot. Stir together the cornstarch and 1 Tbsp of cold water until smooth. Add the mixture to the pork juices and stir to combine. Return the meat to the crockpot and stir to coat. Cook for an additional 30 minutes on low.

Preheat oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Peel parsnip, cut lengthways into strips and slice each strip into chip size pieces. Place in a bowl and add seasoning to taste. Toss until well coated. Spread parsnip chips evenly over a baking sheet. Bake for 30-40 minutes until crisp and golden brown. Remove from oven and leave to cool for a few minutes. Serve immediately or store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350. Beat cottage cheese until smooth. Add other ingredients and beat until smooth. Pour into a greased pie pan. Bake for 1 hour. Cool on a wire rack. Refrigerate overnight. Top with fruit.

Place ricotta cheese in food processor containercover. Process until smooth. Add maraschino cherry and process until combined. In another bowl combine marshmallow cream with whipping cream. Stir to combine. Fold ricotta mixture into whipped topping mixture. Garnish with mini chocolate chips, pecans and a cherry.
name: chocolate bread and butter pudding
ingredients: bread, butter, chocolate chips, eggs, milk, sugar, sherry wine, vanilla
preparation:
Cut crusts from bread.
Butter and bread, cut into triangles and layer with chocolate in a ovenproof dish. Beat eggs, milk, sugar, sherry and vanilla together and pour over the bread. Leave to stand for 15 minutes to fully absorb liquid. Heat oven to 160 c. Bake for 30 minutes until golden and set. Dust with icing sugar to serve. Hope it tastes good.
name: sweet ricotta topping
ingredients: ricotta cheese, powder

Bring the port and water to boil in a medium size pot. Add the cranberries and cinnamon stick and simmer for about 5 minutes until the cranberries have popped. Stir occasionally. Reduce heat to low and allow to simmer for about 30 minutes until the sauce has thickened. Add the sugar and stir. Let cool and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Mix all dry ingredients in a bowl. Mix wet ingredients in another bowl. Add wet to dry. Fold in jam. Spoon into greased muffin tins or paper liners. Bake for 18-20 minutes. Cool slightly. Makes about 14 muffins.
Melt butterscotch and chocolate chips in a double boiler. Pour over the whole wheat cereal and peanuts and stir. Drop by spoonful onto wax paper to cool. Makes 3 dozen.

Place pumpernickel bread in crock pot and sprinkle with some of the sauerkraut. Place breast halves skin side down on top of the sauerkraut and sprinkle with some of the remaining sauerkraut. Place the remaining halves skin side up on top of the breasts and sprinkle with the remaining sauerkraut. Add the rest of the sauerkraut and the chicken broth and sprinkle with the thousand island salad dressing. Cover and cook on low for 6-7 hours or until the meat is falling off the bones and the meat is shredded. Remove meat with a slotted spoon and place in a serving bowl or on a platter. Mash the meat slightly and add the rest of the dressing and stir. Serve on pumpernickel rolls with the remaining sauerkraut.

In a large pot or dutch oven, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until it is softened. Add the kielbasa and cook until it is no longer pink. Add the beans and rice and cook until it is heated through. Add the remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer and cook for 15 minutes. Serve with hot sauce and cornbread.

Bake pie crusts until light golden brown. Prick bottom of crust with fork. In heavy saucepan combine fresh pumpkin and milk. Cook over medium heat until very thick and bubbly. Stir constantly. Remove from heat. Beat egg yolks and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg yolks mixture all at once to pumpkin mixture. Cook over low heat until mixture thickens and coats back of spoon. Cool slightly. Fold egg whites into mixture. Add spices. Pour into baked pastry shells. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean. Cool. Garnish with whipped topping. Makes two deep dish pies.
I think that these look delicious! I am going to have to try them sometime. I have only ever tried one and it wasn't the best. Thanks for sharing these. I can't wait until I can get some more.
I love pumpkins and I love pies. I will be making this one.

Cook rotini according to package directions. While pasta is cooking, heat butter in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Cook onion, stirring occasionally, until browned. Add zucchini. Cook until browned. Drain pasta. Combine the pasta, onion-zucchini mixture, tomatoes, basil, lemon juice and parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

In a large pot add butter, onions, elbow macaroni and cook on medium heat until tender. Add water, tomatoes, and seasoning to taste. Let cook for 2-3 minutes or until water is absorbed. Serve hot with breadcrumb topping.

Combine the salt and the all-purpose flour in a mixing bowl. Mix well. Add the oil and the water and knead until a soft ball is formed that is not sticky and is smooth to the touch. If the mixture is too sticky, add more flour and knead until it is not sticky at all. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut into 2 1/2-inch circles using a cutter or glass. Place a spoonful of the filling on one side of the circle and fold the circle in half to form a triangle shape. Place on a plate and continue until all the dough is used. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil and cook the pierogies for 3 minutes or until they rise to the surface. Remove from the boiling water and transfer to a large bowl of ice water to stop the cooking process. Serve with sour cream and/or melted butter.

Beat egg whites until fluffy. Add yolks, cream cheese, and milk. Season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in skillet. Drop batter by teaspoonfuls. Brown on both sides. Drain on paper towel. Garnish with chopped chives.

Peel, core, and slice the apples. In a bowl, toss the sliced apples with the cinnamon sugar. Drain the juice from the apples. Add the flour, sugar, milk, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Beat until smooth. Spoon the mixture over the apples. Bake at 350F for 40 minutes or until a knife inserted in the centre comes out clean. Serve warm with ice cream.

Bring 2 cups water to boil in a medium saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium low. Slowly stir in cornstarch mixture, whisking constantly until thickened and glossy, 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside to cool slightly. Whisk in margarine. Beat in soymilk, lemon juice, salt. Transfer to a covered container and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight to thicken.

Season scallops with salt and pepper. Heat oil in large saute pan over medium heat. Add scallops and saute for 1-2 minutes per side or until cooked through. Remove scallops to plate and cover to keep warm. Prepare salsa ingredients and set aside in the refrigerator. Cook rice according to package directions and set aside to cool. Divide rice onto 4 plates and top with scallops, then spoon salsa over scallops and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large mixing bowl, cream together butter and cocoa until smooth and creamy. Beat in eggs until smooth. Add sugarbeat until smooth. Sift together flour, baking powder and saltstir into cocoa mixture until smooth. Spread batter into greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Bake 25-30 minutes until firm to touch. Cool on wire rack 1 hour. Frost with chocolate frosting. Cut into squares.

Heat a small amount of oil in a skillet or frying pan. Add a little hot paprika or cayenne. Brown both sides of steaks. Sprinkle with salt, sage and garlic. Cook 4-5 minutes per side. Serve with rice, noodles or potato.

Cut up celery, onion, and green pepper. Combine celery mixture, eggs, and water in microwave safe bowl. Cook on high 5 to 6 minutes or until egg is firm. Drain ramen noodles. Add to the bowl with the celery mixture. Cook on high 4 to 5 minutes or until noodles are tender. Serve with sliced green onion on top.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In small bowl, combine water with corn muffin mix and stir until smooth. Spread mixture evenly in 9x13 baking dish. Bake 15 minutes or until set. In small bowl combine diced green chilies, beans and cilantro. In another bowl beat together eggs until combined. Pour egg mixture evenly over the corn muffin mixture in baking dish. Top with enchilada sauce, sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 10 minutes or until set. Sprinkle with green onions.

Slice off the top of the garlic heads, keeping the green sprouts intact. Peel back the layers of the head of garlic. Slice off the root of the garlic heads and add to a small saucepan. Add water, bring to a simmer, and cook until tender (30-60 minutes). Using a blender or food processor, puree the cooked garlic with about a cup of the cooking liquid until smooth. Pour into a bowl with the reserved cooking liquid and the chopped green sprouts. Season with salt and pepper to taste. In a small saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the sliced garlic cloves and cook, stirring frequently, until they are golden brown (about 3-5 minutes). Transfer the roasted garlic to a food processor with the canola oil and puree until smooth (about 1-2 minutes). Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Place chicken in a resealable plastic bag and add coleslaw mix. Seal and shake until well coated. Marinate in refrigerator at least 4 hours. Place a heaping 1/4 cup of coleslaw mixture onto each tortilla. Top with a piece of the chicken. Roll up and enjoy. Makes 4 servings.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add pasta. Cook 7 to 10 minutes or until al dentedrain. In a small bowl, combine garlic, ginger, tahini, soy sauce and toasted sesame oil. Set aside. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add onionscook 3 minutes, stirring frequently. Add pasta, and toss until combined. Add garlic mixturestir until well coated. Sprinkle with cilantro. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Season the cod fillets well on both sides with salt and pepper. Drizzle them with a little of the lemon juice. Arrange the onions on the bottom of a small baking dish. Lay the sweet pepper slices over the onions. Lay the cod on top. Scatter the diced green peppers over the top. Spoon the remaining lemon juice over everything. Drizzle the remaining oil over the top. Bake for 15-20 minutes. Sprinkle the dish with the bread crumbs. Serve hot. Sprinkle each portion of fish with a little fresh basil.

Remove the zest from the 2 lemons using a zester or vegetable peeler and finely chop into large pieces. Place the 2 finely chopped lemons, the 2 tablespoons of caster sugar, 1 quart of water and 1 tablespoon of mineral water into a large jug or bowl and stir well. Chop up the leaves of 1 sprig of mint finely using a knife or a vegetable peeler. Add this to the jug or bowl and stir well. Allow to steep for 30 minutes then add the ice cubes and top up with mineral water. Stir well before serving.

Mix stock with ravioli. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer 3 minutes. Add spinach, parsley and salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with parmesan. Serve hot with crisp bread.

It’s a pity you don’t have

Brown sausage in skillet until no longer pink. Add oil and vegetables. Stir and cook until vegetables are tender. Add tomatoes and ketchup. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Meanwhile cook pasta as directed for al dente. Drain and add pasta and sausage mixture and mix well. Place in a greased 9 x 13 baking dish and top with mozzarella cheese and bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees F. Serve immediately.

Saute the sausage in the olive oil until no longer pink, about 10 minutes. Remove the sausage with a slotted spoon to drain on paper towels. Add the mushrooms to the pan and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the sausage back to the pan and stir in the tomato sauce. Add the oregano and chablis to the pan. Simmer for 15 minutes. Serve over pasta with grated parmesan cheese.

Preheat grill to medium-high. Place beef on the grill. Cook for 2 minutes per side. Remove from the grill and let rest for 5 minutes. Meanwhile combine the soy sauce, worcestershire sauce and vinegar in a small bowl. Season with a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper and a small amount of kosher salt. Pour the balsamic sauce over the meat. Slice the meat on the bias into 1/2 inch thick slices. Serve on a bed of baby greens.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, carrot and celery. Cook until vegetables are tender. Add salmon. Cook 2 minutes or until salmon is opaque. Add pearl barley and rice. Cook 1 minute. Add water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Cook for about 25 minutes or until water is absorbed and rice and barley are tender. Stir in cilantro. Season with pepper. Serve.
Combine all in blender. Serve warm over ice cream.

In a large pot add the sugar, light corn syrup and the peanut butter. Cook on medium high until the mixture reaches a boil and then continue to boil for one minute and then remove from the heat. Add the Rice Krispies and stir until they are well coated. Spread the mixture into a greased 9x13-inch pan and chill until it is firm. Melt the chocolate morsels and spread evenly on top of the Rice Krispy mixture and chill again until firm. Cut into bars.

Saut the butter and onion in heavy bottomed pot until the onions are translucent. Stir in the flour. Gradually stir in the milk. Add the sherry and simmer for 2 minutes. Add the paprika and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the cream and the lobster meat. Season to taste with salt. Garnish with the chives and serve. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350f. Butter a small baking dish and spread half the rice into it. Scatter celery and onion over the top and spread remaining rice over it. Dot with butter and sprinkle with parsley and orange rind. Pour over the orange juice and add the water. Dot with butter and bake uncovered for 25 to 30 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Sprinkle with almonds and serve.

In a large skillet cook the sauerkraut slowly over medium heat. When tender add water and bring to a boil. Cook until all liquid is evaporated. Stir in the sugar and caraway seeds. Cook and stir until the sugar has dissolved. Add apples and continue cooking until they are tender. Add frankfurters and parsley. Cook for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with foil and set aside. In a medium bowl whisk together balsamic vinegar, honey and soy sauce. Add rosemary and garlic and mix well. Add the drumettes and toss to coat. Place the chicken on the baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes, until golden brown and cooked through. Meanwhile combine brown sugar with 1 tablespoon water in a small bowl and place in a small skillet over medium heat. Cook until sugar dissolves and turns amber in color. Add 1 tablespoon water and cook until mixture becomes thick and syrupy. Add the sesame seeds and cook for 1 minute. Serve the chicken topped with the syrup. Garnish with the parsley.

Place cooked ham on a rack in a roasting pan. Brush with 3/4 cup melted butter. Mix together the remaining ingredients and pour over the ham. Bake 25 minutes per pound or until internal temperature reaches 135f. Let stand 10 minutes before slicing to serve.

In a small bowl whisk together the first six ingredients. Whisk in the olive oil until a smooth dressing forms. Season to taste with additional salt and pepper. Place the greens in a large bowl. Add the cranberries, onion and pecans. Toss with 1/2 the dressing. Mound the salad on six plates. Top each salad with a small mound of goat cheese. Drizzle with the remaining dressing. Serve immediately.
Mix dry ingredients. Add skim milk and lemon juice and mix well. Form into round loaf (about 1-inch thick). Bake at 375 for about 1 hour or until golden brown.

Peel and slice baking potatoes into 1/2-inch slices. Place in large saucepan. Cover with water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes or until tender. Drain. Mash potatoes with potato masher or blender until smooth. Add 2 tablespoons of the butter or margarine, 2 tablespoons of the onions and sour cream. Beat until well blended. Stir in 1/2 cup of the orange juice, 1/8 teaspoon of the orange zest and remaining 2 tablespoons butter or margarine. Mix well. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

In a small bowl stir together all-purpose flour, baking powder and soda, cinnamon and clove. In a larger bowl stir together margarine and brown sugar until well blended. Beat in eggs one at a time. Add vanilla and applesauce and beat until just blended. Stir in flour mixture with a spoon until just combined. Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour or until dough is firm enough to handle. Preheat oven to 350f. Roll the dough into walnut sized balls and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned and the center is set. Cool for two minutes before removing from the cookie sheets and cooling on a wire rack.

Heat olive oil and saute garlic in a large heavy skillet over medium heat until golden brown and aromatic. Add the pork shoulder and brown on all sides in the skillet. Add the brown sugar, tequila, molasses and water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer until the liquid has reduced by half. Transfer the pork to a platter, cover with foil and set aside to rest. Add the onions and garlic to the skillet and cook over medium heat until the onions are soft and golden brown. Arrange the pork in a shallow baking dish, cover with the onions and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and lightly flour a 9x13 inch baking pan. In a large bowl, combine shortening and 1/2 cup sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. In another bowl, combine the flour, baking powder and saltstir into the shortening mixture until just blended. In a measuring cup, combine the milk and the vanillaadd to the batter. Spread into the prepared pan. In a small bowl, combine the remaining 1/2 cup sugar and the cinnamonsprinkle over the batter. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan on a wire rack.
Follow directions on the box. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and lightly flour a 9x13 inch baking pan. In a large bowl, combine shortening

Cook the macaroni in a large pot of boiling water. Drain the macaroni and run cold water over it until it is cool. Mix together all the other ingredients. Add the cooked macaroni and stir. Chill until ready to serve. Serve with sliced tomatoes on the side. Serves 6 to 8.

Place the pork chops between two pieces of plastic wrap and beat them with a mallet or rolling pin until their thickness is reduced by half. In a shallow bowl combine mayonnaise and parmesan cheese. In a small bowl combine the onions and lipton onion soup mix. Remove the plastic wrap from the beaten pork. Coat one side of the beaten pork with the onion mixture. Coat the other side with the mayonnaise mixture. Place the coated pieces of pork in the prepared baking pan. Bake for 45 minutes. Turn the chops and bake for an additional 15-20 minutes or until done.
Place cookie in microwave-safe mug. Top with remaining ingredients. Microwave on high for 2 minutes. Let sit for a minute or two before serving. Serve warm or cool.

Peel and slice cucumbers. Place in a bowlset aside. Combine vinegar, sugar, mustard seeds, garlic, and dried red chilies in a small bowl. Pour mixture over cucumbers. Let stand 5 minutes. Combine cucumbers and onions in a large bowl. Drain tomatoesadd to mixture. Add ground black pepper and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 3 hours. Garnish with parsley.

In a bowl combine the hoisin sauce with the sambal oelek and the scallions. Place in a sealed container and refrigerate until ready to use. Place the chicken in a gallon size ziplock bag. Add the wine and the marinade. Seal the bag and refrigerate for at least an hour. Take the chicken out of the refrigerator and let it come up to room temperature. Grill the chicken.
Mix all ingredients together. Serve over your favorite steamed fish or shrimp and enjoy.

Heat the oil in a small saute pan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until soft and golden brown. Add the cardamom pods and continue to saute for a minute or two. Add the smooth peanut butter and the soy sauce and whisk until well combined. Add the brown sugar and liquid pepper seasoning. Continue to saute until the mixture is bubbly and smooth. Add the lemon juice and cook for a few minutes more until the mixture thickens. Serve immediately with fresh vegetables.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine first four ingredientsbeat for 2 minutes. Fill 18 muffin cups two-thirds full with batter. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pans. Spread the top of each cupcake with icing. Decorate the top of each cupcake with a pecan half or walnut half.

Sift the flour into a mixing bowl. Add the salt and honey and mix well. Add the vegetable oil and mix again. Make a well in the centre of the mixture and add the egg yolk and the milk. Mix well and knead the dough until it is soft and smooth. Turn out on a lightly floured surface and knead for one minute more. Divide the dough into 12 equal pieces and roll each piece into a smooth ball. Place the balls on a greased baking tray and bake at Gas Mark 4 (180 degrees C) for 20 minutes. The bread will be light brown and crisp on the outside and soft and moist inside.

Mix together vinegar, olive oil, garlic and rosemary in a large zip-lock freezer bag or large bowl. Place the chicken in the bag or bowl, shake to coat the chicken with the marinade and refrigerate overnight. Remove the chicken from the marinade and grill on a medium-hot grill for 5-8 minutes on each side or until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the center. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. In shallow bowl, combine potato flakes and buttermilk. Dip each fish fillet in mixture then in buttered baking pan. Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork. Serve with lemon wedges.
I have no clue where to begin. This is the most disgusting recipe I have ever tried! I didn't even finish the 1st helping. I felt like I was eating mashed up dog poop. I wouldn't even recommend it to my worst enemy. It was horrible!
I have to agree with the other reviewers. This was horrible. I have never had such a bad recipe in my life. My husband and I didn't even try the second helping. We were so disgusted that we had to take it out of the house.

Mix together the onion, salt and pepper. Spread the mixture evenly over the meat. Heat the oil in a large pot. Add the meat and cook, turning occasionally until brown and no longer pink. Add the broth. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add the split peas and continue to simmer for 30 minutes. Add the apricots and prunes and simmer for a further 10 minutes.
name: asian marinated rack of lamb
ingredients: rack of lamb, hoisin sauce, honey, dark sesame oil, dry sherry, sesame seeds, black beans, orange zest, curry powder
preparation:Trim the rack of lamb removing fat and silver skin. Mix the marinade ingredients in a blender jar until well blended. Put the meat in a ziplock bag and pour the marinade over. Seal the bag well and place in refrigerator for 24 hours. Set out the meat and allow to stand at room temperature for 1 hour before cooking. Run the bones under cool water before roasting.

Steam green beans according to package directions. In small bowl, combine oil and garlicstir well. Cool slightly, then stir in rosemary. Drain green beansplace in large bowl. Add oil mixturetoss well. Makes 4 servings.

Cooking time: 2 hours. Heat the oil in a large pan or pot over a medium heat. Add the ginger, garlic, red onions and jalapeno and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add the okra to the pan along with the cardamom and 1 litre of water. Reduce the heat, cover the pot with a lid and cook for 1 hour 15 minutes. Add the tomatoes to the pot along with 1 litre of water. Season with salt. Remove from the heat and blend the mixture until smooth. Serve with bread.

Soak wheat overnight. Add 2 cups of hot water and cook until tender, about 40 minutes. Mash the cooked wheat. Add the remaining 4 cups of hot water and let the mixture cool. Stir in the eggs and salt and mix until smooth. Add the flour and continue stirring until the mixture comes together as a smooth ball of dough. Knead the dough lightly for 5 minutes or until smooth. Roll the dough out on lightly floured surface to 1/2-inch thickness. Cut into 1 1/2-inch squares or rectangles. Fold each square in half diagonally so that it looks like a triangle or diamond shape. Bring 2 quarts of lightly salted water to boil and add the triangles. Simmer uncovered for 5 minutes or until they float. Drain well. Bring 3 cups of lightly salted water to boil. Add the triangles and simmer until tender, about 5 minutes. Drain and cool completely on wire rack. In the meantime, whisk the yogurt thoroughly and chill. Beat the but

In medium stock pot, combine beans and enough water to cover by three inches. Bring to a boil and let cook for about 20 minutes. While the beans are cooking, saute the onions until golden. When the beans are done, add the onions and bring to a boil again. Add the avocado and cook for another five minutes. Serve with tortillas, cream, and chiles guajillos. Serve with cheese and salsa.

Pastry for double-crust pie-------------------------. Combine flour, lard and salt with a pastry blender or fork until balls are the size of a large pea. Add cold water by the spoonful and blend until the bowl starts to clean itself as you work the dough. Then it is ready for rolling. Preheat oven to 400f. Combine sugar, minute tapioca and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Stir in cranberries and orange zest. Let cool. Roll out pastry. Place in unbaked pie plate. Fill with cooled cranberry mixture. Place baking apples in center of pie. Bake for 20 minutes at 400f. Reduce heat to 350f and bake for 20 minutes longer.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Pat the chicken dry with paper towels and dredge each piece in the flour. Add the floured pieces to the skillet and cook for about 3 minutes per side. Pour the wine into the skillet. Cover the skillet and cook for 10 minutes. Uncover the skillet and add the chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer uncovered for 10 minutes more or until the liquid has thickened. Remove the pan from the heat. Add the mustard and butter. Season with salt and pepper. Serve the chicken with the sauce.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heatadd sweet potatoes, sugar and orange juice. Bring to a boilreduce heat to low. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 20 minutes or until potatoes are very tenderremove from heat. Stir in orange zest and nutmeg. Allow to coolstir in coconut and set aside. In a large microwave-safe bowl, combine sugar, marshmallows, milk and buttermicrowave on high for 2 minutes or until marshmallows are completely meltedstir to combine well. Remove from heatadd extracts. Working with about 1/4 cup marshmallow mixture for each ball (depending upon your desired size), roll 1 rounded tablespoon of filling between your palms to form a ball. (If necessary, place remaining marshmallow mixture in the refrigerator to harden for easier handling.) Dip each ball into reserved sweet potato mixture to coat completelyplace on wax paper-lined baking sheet. Repeat with remaining filling. Allow to set at room temperature for about 3 hours or

Grease a 2-quart baking dish. Mix together broccoli, cheese, eggs, and sour cream. Mix in the mayonnaise until well combined. Add the ramen noodles and mix well. Add the broccoli, mushrooms, and chicken. Pour into the baking dish and sprinkle with the black pepper. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Cut pears into 1/2-inch slices and toss with maytag blue cheese, walnut halves, lettuce leaves, and oil. Toss with raspberry vinegar, sugar, salt, and freshly ground pepper. Top with tabasco sauce, if desired. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

In a large saucepan over medium heat add 2 tablespoons olive oil. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the penne and cook for about 5 minutes. Add remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Season to taste. Stir in parsley. Serve topped with kalamata olives.
Baby Spinach is a salad leaf that is high in iron, calcium and folic acid. It is an excellent source of vitamins A and C and is very low in calories.

Remove the stems from the caps of the mushrooms. Cut the stems into 1/2-inch lengths and saute in the butter until they are crisp-tender. In a bowl, combine the stems with the caps, the garlic, salt, pepper, nutmeg, lemon juice, and cream. Heat thoroughly. Spread each slice of the bread with the mixture and sprinkle the top with the parsley. Broil 2 inches from the heat until the mixture is bubbling and the bread is crisp.

Heat oil in a deep-fryer or heavy 6-quart pot to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Whisk together flour, 1 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon black pepper in a shallow dish. Whisk together milk and egg in a shallow dishplace next to flour mixture. Dip each chicken piece in milk mixture, then coat with flour mixture. Fry each piece of chicken, turning once, until golden brown and cooked through, about 10 minutes per side. Drain chicken on paper towels. Sprinkle with additional salt and pepper, if desired.

Rinse apricots under cold running water. Remove and discard pits and cut apricots in half lengthwise. Toss apricots with 2 tablespoons sugar and 1 tablespoon lemon juice in small bowl. Spread apricots on baking sheetroast in 400 degree oven 10 minutes or until tender. Cool completely. Combine apricots, remaining 1 cup sugar and 2 cups water in blender container. Blend until smooth. Pour into freezer-safe containerfreeze 4 hours or until firm. Puree mixture in food processor or blenderreturn to container and freeze until firm, about 4 hours. Garnish with mint sprigs if desired.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sift together the dry ingredients, and mix with the oatmeal, applesauce and cinnamon. Stir in the raisins and nuts. Drop the mixture by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from the cookie sheets to cool on wire racks.

Rinse the onion and garlic under cold running water. Mince them in a food processor fitted with a steel blade. Transfer them to a mixing bowl. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Rub into both sides of the meat. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. The next day, remove from refrigerator and let stand at room temperature for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 275f degrees. Line a heavy baking dish with aluminum foil and place brisket in it. Cover and bake for 6 hours. Remove from oven. Drain and reserve the liquid. Place meat in a baking dish and cover with chili sauce. Bake uncovered for an hour. Serve with chili sauce and reserved juices.

In saucepan combine water and butter, stir until butter is melted. Add flour and whisk until smooth. Add eggs one at a time whisking to combine after each addition. Add salt to taste and cook over medium heat until soup thickens. Drop by spoonfuls onto chicken broth and simmer 10-15 minutes. Serve hot.

In a saucepan over medium heat combine oil, vinegar, sugar and onions. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and add celery. Set aside to cool. Meanwhile, boil potatoes in water until done, about 15 minutes. Drain and slice into bite sized pieces. In a large bowl combine celery, yogurt, mayonnaise, mustard, salt, and pepper. Gently fold in the potatoes. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.
I like to make a potato salad with red potatoes or new potatoes boiled in water with a little vinegar added. Then I drain the potatoes and add a little mayo, sour cream and chopped dill weed. This is my favorite!

Place a crust in a 9x13 inch pan. On top of that place cooked bacon then cooked breakfast sausage, then swiss cheese. In a bowl beat 3 eggs and 1/2 cup sour cream. Pour over all of that. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot garnished with fresh parsley if you like.

Thaw pie crusts. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut each pie crust into 4 triangles. Place on a baking sheet. Spread each piece with a small amount of spaghetti sauce and sprinkle with a little shredded mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle a little cooked chicken and a few fresh or canned mushrooms on top. Bake in preheated oven for 5-10 minutes until golden brown. Serve with extra spaghetti sauce on the side.

Cream the butter and the sugar together in a bowl until light and creamy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Mix in the lemon juice and zest. Add the flour and the baking soda and salt and blend well. Place the dough in the refrigerator and chill for at least one hour. Roll the dough out onto a lightly floured board about one-eighth of an inch thick. Cut the dough into desired shapes and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in preheated oven at 375 for about 10 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned. Allow the cookies to cool completely before icing. To make the icing combine the powdered sugar with the lemon juice and enough water to make it a spreading consistency. Add more water if necessary and beat the icing until smooth and well blended. Spread the icing onto the cooled cookies and sprinkle with powdered sugar or colored sprinkles. Allow the icing to dry before storing the cookies in an airtight container.

Combine all the ingredients except the cheese and buns, mix well. Place the mixture on top of the bun, sprinkle with tomatoes, lettuce leaves, mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with salad or french fries.
Mix all together & serve on lettuce leaves for salad.
In large skillet add oil & cook onion & mushrooms until tender.
Add beans & stir & add tomato juice & cook for 3 minutes.
Add beans, corn & chicken broth & simmer until heated through.
Stir in salsa & chicken & cook for 2 minutes.
Serve with sour cream or shredded cheddar cheese & chopped cilantro if desired.
Combine all together & serve with tortilla chips or over rice.

Bring the water to a boil and pour it over the ground coffee in an earthen vessel. Allow the coffee to steep for about 30 minutes until it is thick and strong. Meanwhile, stir together the saffron and water and allow to sit for 30 minutes. Pour the rose water into a saucepan and heat until hot. Add the saffron and cardamom and allow them to simmer for 10 minutes. Add the mixture to the coffee and serve in small cups with cardamom on top.
Cook pasta according to box. Add milk, butter, and soup to a saucepan. Stir in meat. Pour pasta into a baking dish and pour over the sauce. Top with bread crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.
Preheat a gas grill to medium high heat. Grill shrimp 4 to 5 minutes on each side. Season with parsley, oil, oregano, lemon juice, garlic, hot sauce, salt, and pepper. Serve with pasta.

1. Cook the whole milk with the long-grain white rice until the liquid is absorbed. 2. Add the butter, vanilla, salt and sugar and mix well. 3. Beat the eggs until frothy and add them to the rice mixture with the heavy cream. Mix well and refrigerate overnight. 4. Serve the rice pudding chilled with some freshly ground cinnamon on top.

In skillet brown boneless skinless chicken breasts in olive oil, about 5 minutes on each side until browned. Add onion and celery and saute until tender. Stir in carrots, tomatoes, broth, thyme and seasonings. Bring to a boil reduce heat cover and simmer for about 25-30 minutes or until chicken is tender and vegetables are cooked through. To serve, slice chicken breasts into strips. Serve over rice with stewed tomatoes. Serves 6-8.
Cut tomatoes in half lengthwise. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Add sugar. Combine remaining ingredients. Spoon over tomatoes. Cover. Marinate for at least 1 hour. Makes 4 servings.
Mix together cheese and chutney. Add apricots, brandy and gingermix well. Chill 1 hour. Spread on crackers or celery sticks. Makes 2 cups spread.

Melt butter in large skillet. Stir in flour and sugar until blended. Gradually add milk. Bring to a boilboil and stir for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in sour cream. Mix well. Spread in a greased 11 x 7 inch baking dish. Top with layer of corned. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Spread with meat mixture. Bake for an additional 20 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 5 minutes more or until cheese is melted.

Rinse and cut up broccoli florets into bite sized pieces. Peel and chop onions into bite sized pieces. Combine in a bowl with sunflower seeds, raisins and sweetener. In a separate small bowl add the mayonnaise, vinegar, sweetener and water. Pour over the broccoli mixture, tossing gently to coat evenly. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

In a large mixing bowl combine warm water and honeyadd 1 teaspoon oil and let sit for 5 minutes. Add 1/2 teaspoon oilsprinkle 1 teaspoon yeast over oil and stir until dissolvedlet sit for 5 minutes. Add salt and stir to dissolve. Add 1 teaspoon oil and stir until smooth. Add cinnamon and stir well. In separate small bowl mix oatmeal with 2 tablespoons warm water until smoothstir into batter. Add 1/2 teaspoon oil and stir to mix well. Add enough bread flour to make batter thick enough to hold its shapebeat until smooth. Stir in raisins. Spoon batter into 2 greased 9-inch round cake panssmooth tops. Let rise in warm place 1 hour or until doubled in bulk. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 30 to 35 minutes or until done. Remove from panscool on wire

In skillet brown sausage. In saucepan bring 5 cups water to boiling. Add pasta, bouillon cube and pasta sauce. Cook until pasta is done, 3 to 4 minutes. Drain. In skillet combine zucchini, summer squash, sausage, beans and pasta. Mix well. Serve hot.

Soak the gluten in the stock for 5 minutes. Drain and squeeze out the liquid. Add the remaining ingredients and blend until smooth. Pour into an 8 x 8 pan lined with parchment paper. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Remove and let cool completely. Slice into 1/2" medallions and bake at 350 for 10 minutes more. Melt 2 T butter in a pan and stir in 1/2 cup flour. Slowly whisk in 1/2 cup beef broth. Add 1/2 cup sour cream and simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and whisk in 1/4 cup worcestershire. Serve with the medallions and a sprinkle of fresh parsley.

Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a 2-quart saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and sauté until just beginning to brown, stirring occasionally. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat. Add the bread cubes and the pepper. Ladle into bowls and sprinkle with the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil. Beat egg with water to make an egg wash and brush over the top of each bowl. Place bowls in oven just until egg is set. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Boil potatoes until they are fork tender. Drain water. Cool and mash. In a bowl mix together the mashed potato, sour cream, parmesan cheese, cheddar cheese, and chives. Spray casserole dish with cooking spray. Layer the potato mixture in the casserole dish. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

Bring water and broth to a boil in a sauce pan over medium heat. Cook chicken in liquid until no longer pink in center. Drain well in a colander. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve in individual lettuce leaves or on your favorite bread or wrap.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees celcius. Line two baking trays with baking paper. Mix together butter and sugars until pale and creamy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Roll into teaspoon sized balls and place on baking trays, leaving space between each ball as they will spread. Bake for about 15 minutes. Line bottom of 9-inch square baking dish with waxed paper. In large bowl, combine all ingredients except pecans and baking soda. Beat until well blended. Add baking soda, and beat on high speed until fluffy. Spread half of mixture in bottom of baking dish. Sprinkle with half of the pecans. Top with remaining mixture. Sprinkle top with remaining pecans. Bake at 325 degrees for 20 minutes or until set. Cut into squares and remove from baking dish using waxed paper. Store in airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Drain spinach well. Saute onion and garlic in 2 tbsp of the melted butter until onion is translucent. Mix spinach with the eggs, cottage cheese, cheddar cheese, flour, and the remaining butter. Add the sauteed onions and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into prepared dish and bake for 1 hour.

Cut cod into small cubes and mix with green pepper, tomatoes and bacon. In another bowl beat eggs with black pepper. Pour over fish mixture and mix well. In another pan heat oil at medium heat. Pour fish mixture into pan and let it cook until it is ready for serving. Serve hot with French fries.
name: scrambled eggs with smoked salmoningredients: eggs, milk, basil leaves, smoked salmon, salt, black pepper, butterpreparation:warm a pan and add the butter to coat it. mix the egg and milk and pour into pan. cooking on a warm to medium heat gently stir the eggs until almost ready for serving. when the mixture is still a little runny add the salmon and chopped basil. cook for another minute so the salmon just starts to change colour. serve on freshly toasted bread. spinkle a little extra basil over. if you have any left also garnish with a twist of salmon. eat at once.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with foil and grease with cooking spray. Cut the eggplants in half lengthwise, then cut into 1/2 inch thick slices. Lay the eggplants flat on the baking sheet and bake for about 45 minutes or until the flesh is tender when poked with a knife. In a blender or food processor combine the eggplants with the palm sugar, soy sauce and salt until smooth. Add the chili paste and lime juice and process until smooth. Serve the dip with fresh green onions and a few fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Spread the asparagus in a single layer on a baking sheet and drizzle with the extra virgin olive oil and sprinkle with the coarse salt and balsamic vinegar. Roast in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes or until the spears are tender and the tips are lightly browned. Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally until they are browned and crisp on the outside and tender in the middle about 8 minutes. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Serve the asparagus warm or at room temperature and the shiitakes hot or at room temperature.

Add the chopped tomatoes and the water and continue cooking for another 10 minutes or until the tomatoes have broken down and thickened the sauce.
