Place water in a small saucepan. Stir in Morton Lite Salt and heat to a boil. Remove from heat. Add the coconut and stir until coated. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Spoon into 4 custard cups or dishes and chill overnight. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 450f. Heat olive oil in a large frying pan. Add the chicken breasts and fry on high heat for 2-3 mins on each side or until browned all over. Remove from pan. Add leek to pan and cook over medium-high heat for 5 mins or until tender. Add rice, stirring until lightly browned. Add the saffron strands, stir to mix well. Add the broth. Cook over medium heat for 5 mins or until the broth is absorbed. Add the lemon zest and juice. Cook for a further 2 mins. Place the cooked chicken in the pan. Stir in the peas. Cover with a lid or foil. Bake in the oven for 20 mins. Serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 350. In large skillet brown and drain chicken. Add rice and stir. Add cream of chicken soup and mix. Pour into greased pie pan. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees C (350 degrees F). Grease a 23 cm (9 inch) round tin and line base with greaseproof paper. Beat together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Sift together flour and bicarbonate of soda. Fold into mixture in 2 additions. Spoon mixture into tin and level surface. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until firm to touch. Cool in tin for 5 minutes then turn out on wire rack to cool completely. While cake is cooking, prepare syrup. Squeeze lemon to obtain 1 teaspoon of juice then finely grate rind. Bring juice and rind to the boil in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook until reduced by half then pour over warm cake. Serve warm or cold.

Boil water in a large pot. Cook egg noodles according to package directions. Meanwhile brown beef with onion and green pepper in a large skillet until beef is browned. Drain fat. Stir in garlic and crushed tomatoes with 3 tablespoons of the tomato paste. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in 2 cups of the water from the pot that the noodles were cooked in. Cover and simmer over low heat for 10 minutes. Drain the noodles. Toss with the meat sauce until well blended. Sprinkle with the remaining 2 tablespoons of tomato paste and the cheese. Makes 6 servings

Boil noodles according to package directions. Drain. Melt butter in same saucepan. Add thyme, basil and parsley. Cook 1-2 minutes. Stir in noodles. Toss gently. Sprinkle with chives. Serve immediately.

Blend first 3 ingredients in blender until crumbly. Add water until desired consistency. Roll into small balls (about 1 inch in diameter) and place on greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 20 minutes or until done. Cool slightly then roll in cinnamon.

In small bowl, combine honey, garlic and ginger. Place chicken in resealable plastic bag or other container and pour marinade over it. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or overnight, turning bag occasionally. Heat grill or broiler. Remove chicken from marinadediscard marinade. Grill or broil chicken until thoroughly cooked, about 20 minutesturn often. Serve warm.

Cook broccoli until crisp-tender. Cut the chicken into 1 inch pieces. Melt butter in skillet. Add onioncook until tender. Stir in chicken. Add broccolicook until thoroughly heated. In a 13x9 inch dish, combine cooked rice, soup, milk, garlic salt and pepper. Mix well. Top with chicken mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes.
Place the potatoes in a large bowl. Add the sour cream and mayonnaise. Add the other ingredients and mix together. Refrigerate. Serve chilled.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the butter with the shallot and garlic until soft. Add the white beans with their liquid. Add the vinegar, mustard and parsley. Toss the mixture. Add a little more olive oil if necessary. Taste for seasonings.

In a large pot add the chicken stock, water, soba noodles, ginger root, green onion whites, soy sauce, lime juice. Bring to a boil. Add the spinach and simmer until spinach is wilted. Add the shiitake mushrooms. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve hot in bowls.
Brown sausage on all sides. Add squash and cook 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Pour dressing over mixture. Add oregano and cheese. Serve on toasted bread.

Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until golden, about 5 minutes. Add rice and stir until hot and lightly coated with butter. Add bay leaf and salt & pepper. Add enough cold water to cover by 1". Bring to a simmer and cook until all liquid is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in hot pepper sauce and let cool for 5 minutes. Add peas and toss gently with the rice. Add fresh parsley. Mix gently and serve.

1) preheat over to 425 degrees.2) cut the butternut squash in half lengthwise and scoop out all of the seeds with a spoon. Place the cut side up in a glass casserole dish and drizzle with cooking spray and rosemary leaves. Roast for 1 hour in preheated oven.3) in a large dutch oven melt butter over medium heat. Add onions and cook for about 2 minutes until tender. Add garlic and cook for another minute or two.4) add risotto rice and cook for a minute or two until it starts to become translucent. Add broth and cook until the liquid is absorbed. Stirring frequently add a little bit of stock at a time until all of the liquid has been absorbed and risotto is creamy but still a little bit al dente. Add 1/4 cup of cream cheese and stir until melted. Add a splash of vinegar if desired.

Melt butter or margarine in skillet over low heat. Add pecans and coconut stirring constantly to brown. Cool. Mix cream cheese and sweetened condensed milk until smooth. Fold in non dairy whipped topping. Pour evenly into crust. Sprinkle with coconut and pecan mixture. Drizzle with the caramel and chocolate toppings. Cover and freeze until frozen hard. Remove from freezer 10 -15 min before serving.

Soak the lentils for 2 hours. Rinse well and drain them. Add the beef, water, salt and the mustard packet from the ketchup. Cook for 30 minutes until tender. Add the remaining ketchup ingredients and the onion soup mix. Heat to boiling. Serve hot.

Mix the soup and milk together in a bowl. Stir in the potatoes and sour cream. Transfer mixture to a 9x13 inch baking pan and dot with butter and sprinkle with cheese. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes or until heated through and slightly browned.

Combine 1 tablespoon oil and 1/2 teaspoon Jamaican Jerk spice. Brush each side of tuna with mixture. Grill over medium heat 4 minutes per side. Combine remaining 1 tablespoon oil and 1/2 teaspoon Jamaican Jerk spicespread on 1 side of each bread slice. Top with lettuce. Top each with 2 ounces tunaspoon 2 tablespoons salsa over each. Top each with 1 slice cheese. Add tomatocover with top of bread. Serve with additional salsa. Makes 4 sandwiches.
Soak navy beans overnight. Drain. Put in a large pot. Add all remaining ingredients and cook slowly for one hour or until thick. Serve hot or cold.
In a large bowl, mix together all dressing ingredients. Add the lettuce leaves, then the orange sections. Add the avocados and gently toss together. Serve immediately.

Place the breast halves between 2 sheets of wax paper or plastic wrap. Using a meat mallet or rolling pin, flatten each breast to about 1/2 inch thickness. Place a slice of ham and a piece of swiss cheese on each breast. Top with another piece of ham and another slice of swiss cheese. Place the breast halves in a greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish. In a medium bowl, combine the soup, milk and breadcrumbs. Mix well. Spoon the mixture over the top of the breasts. Bake at 350 for 40-50 minutes or until done. Uncover and bake 5-10 minutes longer or until the topping is golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting. Serve with mashed potatoes.

In a large bowl toss together the broccoli florets, almonds and mandarin orange sections. In a small bowl mix together the juice and zest of the orange, the juice of the lime, the sugar, the green onions and the olive oil. Pour the dressing over the broccoli mixture and toss until thoroughly combined. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees celsius. Line a deep 20 cm round cake tin with baking paper, grease the sides with unsalted butter. Melt white chocolate in a bowl over a saucepan of simmering water until smooth. Allow to cool slightly, then stir in brown sugar and golden syrup until well combined. Beat in the eggs and vanilla. Sift the flour and baking powder over the mixture and stir to combine. Pour mixture into the prepared tin. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean. Remove from oven and cool in the tin for 10 minutes before turning out to cool completely on a wire rack. To make the icing beat thickened cream in a bowl with the icing sugar and vanilla until soft peaks form. Spread over the top of the cake and decorate with toasted coconut to serve.

In a food processor or blender combine the chick-peas with the garlic, ground coriander and cumin. Add the olive oil and process until smooth. Add the chopped chives and process just until the chives are mixed in. Refrigerate until firm. Heat the vegetable oil in a deep frying pan and fry the croquettes in batches of 4-5, until golden brown. Drain and serve with tzatziki.

Slice apples thinly. Heat butter in large skillet or griddle over med high heat. Place apple slices in skillet to cover the bottom, adding more slices as they brown. Cook for 5 min per side or until browned and caramelized, turning once. Place in bowltoss with cinnamon, cardamom, raisins and brown sugar. Serve immediately.

Lay out two pieces of bread. Spread each with a generous amount of butter. Spread one piece with chutney. Place a slice of ham on top. Cover with the second piece of bread. Spread the top with more butter. Cover with grated cheese. Bake on a baking sheet for approximately 15 minutes or until the bread is crisp and golden. Serve with pickled onions.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil and blanch the asparagus spears until bright green and still a little firm (about 2 minutes). Drain the water and set aside the blanched spears. Melt the butter and sauté the lean ham until almost crisp. Put the eggs in a large bowl and whisk them. Slowly pour the eggs into the pan with the ham. Let the eggs set. Add the salt and the blanched asparagus spears. Flip the omelet and continue to cook until the eggs are firm. Slice the omelet into wedges and serve with the remaining chopped ham and freshly ground black pepper.

Dissolve yeast in 1/4 cup of warm water. Add 1/4 cup of oil and 1/4 cup of sugar and stir well. Add 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1 teaspoon of freshly ground pepper. Beat 3 eggs and add them one at a time to mixture. Combine 4 cups of flour with 1 teaspoon of baking soda. Mix with the other ingredients and knead until smooth and elastic. Place in a buttered bowl and set aside. Let rise until doubled, about 1 hour. Shape into a loaf and let rise again for 1 hour. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden brown and done.
Peel tomatoes and slice thinly. Toss with mayonnaise and yogurt. Add capers and lemon juice. Chill. Just before serving, sprinkle with zest.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. grease a 9 x 13 pan. mix together the first 4 ingredients until blended and smooth. mix together the next 4 ingredients until well blended. stir together the dry and wet mixtures until evenly blended. spread into pan and bake for about 15 minutes or until the top is springy and a tester inserted in the middle comes out clean. cool and cut into bars.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Cook ground beef with onion. Drain fat. Combine beef mixture with zucchini. Spread mixture over a greased 13 x 9 inch baking pan. Mix bisquick, milk, and eggs together. Pour over beef mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 50-55 minutes or until set. Cool 5 minutes before cutting into 1 inch squares.

Place the potatoes in a pan of boiling water. Cook for about 15 minutes till soft then drain and return to pan. Mash with the butter and milk, add the onion and season with salt. Allow to cool. Mix in the beaten eggs and flour. Spoon into greased souffle dishes (about 1 inch deep). Top with grated cheese. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake in the preheated oven for about 15 minutes till golden brown.

In a small bowl whisk together the buttermilk, mustard, garlic and red pepper. Place the chicken breasts in the buttermilk mixture and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight. In a food processor or blender place the cracker crumbs, the parmesan cheese and the sage and rosemary. Pulse until well combined but not a fine powder. Remove the chicken from the buttermilk mixture and discard the leftover marinade. Place the chicken on a baking sheet and spray lightly with cooking spray. Sprinkle the chicken with the herbed cracker crumb mixture and bake for 25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Separate biscuits and place on greased cookie sheet. Brush with butter and sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until tops are golden brown and biscuits are tender. While still hot and crisp, cut biscuits in half diagonally and sprinkle with nuts. Let cool on wire racks. Makes 24 twists.

Beat the egg white until it is stiff but not dry. Beat the sour cream until smooth. Add the brown sugar and cocoa powder to the sour cream and beat until smooth. Fold in the instant coffee granules and the vanilla. Add the egg whites to the cocoa mixture and fold until the mixture is smooth. Chill for at least two hours before serving. Serve in a parfait dish or in individual serving dishes. Serves 4 to 6.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cut figs in half lengthwise and place in a baking dish cut side down. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Bring Marsala wine to a boil in a small saucepanadd the oranges, reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Mix in honey and orange blossom water. Remove from heatset aside and allow to cool slightly. Spoon about 1/4 cup of the Marsala mixture into each hollow of the fig halves. Serve with whipped creme fraiche garnished with mint leaves.

Place rice in casserole dish. Mix margarine with onion soup mix and pour over rice. Cover and bake at 300 degrees for 40-45 minutes or until tender.
We just love rice pudding here at our house. It's a favorite of ours!
Amazing how versatile a little Rice-a-Roni can be!
I like the idea of using a rice mix like this to make a meal. I'll have to look into it!
I love using box mixes too!

Mix together pie filling and dark sweet cherries and spread in a greased and floured casserole dish. Combine the rest of the ingredients and spread over the cherries and bake at 350 for about 35 minutes. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.
Brown sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg make this fruit salad extra special for the holidays. It is a favorite of my family and my friends too!
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 13 x 9 inch baking dish.
In a large bowl combine the cranberries, cherries, and pears. Set aside.
In a medium saucepan combine the brown sugar, cornstarch, water, nutmeg and cinnamon. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil and is thickened, stirring constantly. Pour over cranberries, cherries and pears and toss gently.
Pour into prepared baking dish and bake for 5 minutes. Remove from oven

In a small saucepan whisk together 1 cup of the whipping cream with the sour cream. Heat over medium heat until it comes to a simmer. Stir in the chicken base, 1/4 cup at a time until the sauce has thickened. Add the clarified butter and continue stirring until the sauce has thickened once more to your desired consistency. Remove from heat and stir in the juice from one or two jalapenos. Set aside. In a small bowl combine the remaining 1/2 cup of whipping cream with the flour until it is smooth. Stir into the sauce and heat over medium-high heat until it comes to a boil. Add the shredded cheese a handful at a time until the mixture comes together into a smooth white sauce. Remove from heat and stir in the juice from another 2 to 3 jalapenos. Serve hot.
Cream butter & sugar. Add egg whites & beat well. Stir in flour & baking powder. Add nuts & form into sticks. Bake 375 for 10 minutes or until lightly browned.
In a large bowl, combine tempeh and the remaining ingredients. Toss gently until well combined. Cover and refrigerate for several hours. Serve on whole wheat bread or lettuce leaves.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Line 2 large baking sheets with parchment paper. In a small saucepan over low heat, combine cocoa, granulated sugar, oil, eggs and vanilla until smooth. Remove from heat. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder and salt. Pour cocoa mixture over dry ingredients, stirring to blend well. Drop dough by 1/4 cupfuls onto baking sheets, spacing 2 inches apart. Bake 15 minutes or until edges are set and centers spring back when lightly touched with a fingertip. Cool on baking sheets 10 minutes or until completely cooled. In a medium bowl, combine confectioners' sugar and milk until smooth. Drizzle over cookies with a spoon or a pastry bag fitted with a large star tip. Let stand 15 minutes to set icing before removing cookies to wire racks. Store at room temperature in a tightly covered container for 3 days or in the freezer for up to 2 weeks.

Cook the sausages in a frying pan until browned. Cut into bite size pieces and place in a casserole dish. Cook the mixed vegetables in a little butter and water until tender. Add to sausages and stir in curry powder and flour mixed with a little milk or water. Bring to boil and simmer for a further 5 minutes until thickened. Serve with rice or boiled potatoes and a green salad.

In a large pot of boiling, salted water cook the pasta to al dente and drain. Return to the pot and melt in the butter. Toss to coat. Whisk together the eggs, milk, hot sauce, salt, pepper, and mustard. Stir into the pasta and add the cheese. Over low heat continue to stir for 3 minutes or until creamy.

Bring a pot of water to boiladd snow peas and cook for 2 minutes or until tender-crisp. Drainrinse under cold waterdrain again. In a large skillet, saute onion in butter until tender, about 4 minutesadd peas and cook for 1 minute or until heated through. Stir in chives and season to taste with salt and pepper.

Grease an 8x8 inch square pan with shortening. Melt 1/2 cup butter in microwave, then add 1 1/2 cups sugar and mix well. Add 1 cup brown sugar and mix well. In another small mixing bowl, whisk together 1 cup of cocoa powder with 1/4 cup milk until smooth. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl, add the remaining 1/2 cup butter. Beat until creamy and smooth. Add in the remaining 1 cup of sugar, then mix well. Beat in eggs one at a time until thoroughly mixed. Stir in vanilla and cocoa mixture until just combined. Stir in the flour mixture until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips until just combined. Spread into prepared pan. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 30 minutes, or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Let cool in pan for 1 hour before cutting into squares and serving. Makes approximately 16 brownies.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a large bowl combine the flour, salt, and baking soda. Set aside. In a large mixer cream the butter and sugars together until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time mixing well after each addition. Add the vanilla extract. Stir in the quick oats and nuts. Gradually add the dry ingredients. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from the cookie sheet and cool on a wire rack.

Mix Jell-o and boiling water according to directions on package. In a large mixing bowl, combine Cream Cheese and Cola. Mix until smooth. Add the Jell-o mixture to the Cream Cheese. Cool in refrigerator. Add whipping cream and mix well. Pour into mold and refrigerate at least 4 hours. Top with dark sweet cherries and nuts.

Mix creams of soup in a bowl. Add half-and-half to the bowl. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Stir in garlic. Add frozen broccoli and cook until tender. Stir in noodles. Cook until al dente. Drain noodles. Stir in butter. Top with parmesan cheese. Serve.
I make a chicken broccoli casserole that is really good.
I cook the chicken breast, then I add the broccoli to the same pan. I cook the chicken, then I add the chicken broth to the pan. I put the chicken and broccoli in the bottom of the casserole dish. I make the white sauce to put on top. I use 1/2 cup of milk, 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese, 1 can of soup with cream of chicken in it. I use the whole can of soup. I add 2 Tablespoons of flour and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper to the milk in the can of soup. I mix it

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add fish, reduce heat to medium low and cook 1 to 2 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Transfer to a serving platter and sprinkle with parsley and red pepper. In the same skillet over medium high heat, combine the tomatoes, olives and capers. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the wine and cook until reduced by half. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Pour sauce over fish. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 F. Line a baking sheet with foil. Place a cooling rack on top of the foil. Wash the shrimp under cold running water. Pat the shrimp dry with paper towels. In a small bowl combine the garlic, oil and lemon juice. Set aside. Place the shrimp on the rack. Drizzle with the mixture. Bake for 6 minutes or until the shrimp just turn opaque. Remove from oven. In a small bowl combine the figs and horseradish. Spread the mixture over the cooked shrimp. Serve immediately.

fry bacon and drain well. cook onion in drippings until tender. add stewed tomatoes and heat through. add peas and cook until heated through. add rice. stir in hot sauce and garlic powder. season to taste with salt and black pepper. stir in salsa. serve with cornbread.

Boil potatoes. When done add green onions and celery. Drain and place in bowl. Mix in eggs, italian dressing and mustard. Add the mayonnaise and horseradish. Salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees f. Pierce each potato with a fork to make small holes all over. In a small bowl, combine the yogurt, sun-dried tomato, olives, feta cheese, Italian seasoning and pepper. Divide the mixture evenly among the potato holes. Bake in a single layer until the potatoes are tender and the toppings are browned, 30 to 40 minutes. Serve hot. Serves 4.

Brush the top side of each of 4 slices of the bread with butter. Spread the mozzarella cheese evenly over the 4 slices of bread, then top the mozzarella with the basil leaves. Arrange the roasted red peppers evenly on the other 4 slices of the bread, then top the roasted peppers with the remaining mozzarella cheese. Cover each sandwich with the remaining 4 slices of the bread. Place each sandwich in a small skillet over medium-low heat until the top slice of bread is lightly toasted, about 5 minutes per side. Remove each sandwich from the skillet and cut into 4 equal pieces with a sharp knife. Top each sandwich with Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese. Garnish with basil leaves and serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook bacon until crisp. Drain and set aside. Add green beans to skillet and cook for 3 minutes or until lightly browned. Stir in chicken broth. Cover and cook for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in butter, bacon and seasonings. Makes 6 servings.
name: green bean saladingredients: green beans, bacon, eggs, onions, mayonnaise, seasoning saltspreparation:Cook green beans until crisp. Drain and chill. Cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels and chill. In a large bowl, combine chilled bacon and cooked green beans with mayonnaise and seasoning salts. Chill until serving time. Garnish with hard boiled eggs.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a saucepan over medium heat, bring water and butter to boiling. Add potato and onion cubes and season with salt, pepper and garlic salt to taste. Cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain and return to the pan with the pimento and parsley flakes. Mix together stuffing mix and cheddar cheeseadd to the vegetable mixture and stir well to combine. Pour mixture into a greased casserole dish and bake for 30 minutes, or until heated through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Heat half of the vegetable oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook the pierogies until golden, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer to paper towel-lined plate. Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Add bacon and cook until crisp. Transfer to paper towel-lined plate. Add onion and cook 4 minutes. Add garlic. Cook 1 minute. Add cabbage. Cook 5 minutes. Add 1 cup water. Cover. Cook 2 minutes. Uncover. Cook 3 minutes or until liquid evaporates. Add pierogies. Cook 2 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with dill.

Cut each piece of fish in half lengthwise and stuff with a slice of onion, a slice of tomato and a slice of green pepper. Season with salt and pepper. Dip fish into the egg and then into the soy sauce. Dip fish into the flour and then into the butter. Dip fish into the egg and then into the sherry. Dip fish into the flour and then into the butter again. Dip fish into the egg and then into the egg yolk and then into the flour and then into the butter. Serve on a bed of rice and garnish with parsley.

Beat butter and sugars until well blended. Add egg and vanilla. Beat well. Combine dry ingredients in a small bowl and add to butter mixture. Stir in baby ruth bars and chocolate chips. Roll into 1-inch balls. Place on ungreased cookie sheets and press with the bottom of a glass dipped in sugar. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes. Do not overbake or they will be hard. Makes about 120 cookies.
Mix all together well. Bake in greased loaf pans for 1 hour at 350.

Heat a wok and spray with olive oil spray. Add eggplants. Cook until lightly browned. Add the remaining ingredients except for the spaghetti. Stir for 1- 2 minutes. Add the spaghetti and cook for another minute or two. Serve over rice.
I have not tried any of these recipes but they look yummy!
The recipes look really good. I'll be trying the Thai Chicken and Noodles soon.
I love Thai food and I like that it is healthy.
I have not tried this recipe but I am going to do it soon.
