I have not tried the recipes yet but I am going to try them.
I have not tried these recipes but I plan on making the Thai Chicken and Noodles.
I have not tried these recipes but I plan on making the Thai Chicken and Noodles. I love

Place potatoes in a saucepan and add enough cold salted water to cover. Heat over medium heat and bring to a simmer. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes or until tender. Drain and return to pan. Mash lightly using a potato masher or fork. Add light butter spread, milk, sour cream, bacon bits, and salt and pepper to taste. Heat on low heat just until warm. Garnish with additional bacon bits and fresh chives if desired and serve immediately.

Brown hamburger in frying pan. Drain fat. Add mushrooms and cook 5 minutes. Add dried basil, italian seasoning and garlic powder. Cook 5 minutes longer. Add chicken broth and tomato paste and bring to a boil. Add water and simmer 5 minutes. Add noodles and cook until noodles are tender.

Mix together the flour, baking powder, and sugar. Add the milk and beaten egg and stir until smooth. Stir in the chopped walnuts and pimientos. Divide the dough in half and form it into two loaves. Place the two loaves on a greased cookie sheet and sprinkle with the chopped olive and pimiento mixture. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 1 hour, or until done. Allow to cool for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

Mix cream cheese, powdered sugar, and butter until creamy. Add in milk and vanilla. Add in instant vanilla pudding. Mix together. Fold in cool whip. Spoon into 2 cup dishes. Top with oreo cookies. Chill. Serve with whipped cream.

Prepare the butter as directed on the packet. Slice the bread and place in a baking dish. Melt the butter over a low heat and stir in the cinnamon and nutmeg. Add the caster sugar and stir until melted. Pour this mixture over the bread cubes then scatter the chocolate chips over the top. Beat the eggs together with the vanilla essence and pour over the bread. Cover with foil and bake in a preheated oven at 180c/gas 4 for 30-40 minutes until golden and set. Leave to cool for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with custard or ice cream.
Cook penne as directed on package. Drain and return to pot. Add alfredo sauce and stir to coat. Top with sun-dried tomato and basil. Serve with crumbled bacon. Makes 4 servings.

Melt margarine and golden syrup together and mix in coconut. Add rice bubbles and mix well. Divide into 3 parts and add cherries and chocolate to each part and mix well. Shape into balls and roll in desiccated coconut. Allow to set before handling.

In a large bowl combine flour and ricotta cheese. Add eggs. Mix well. Place on a floured surface and knead until smooth. Divide the mixture into 4 parts. Roll each part of the mixture into a long rope. Cut the rope into 1 inch pieces. Place the pieces on a floured surface. Cook in a large pot of boiling water until they float to the top. Cook the other half of the gnocchi. In a large fry pan cook the other half of the gnocchi in a little olive oil. Remove from pan and set aside. Heat the sauce. Add the gnocchi to the sauce. Toss in the cooked gnocchi. Sprinkle with parmigiano-reggiano cheese. Serve.

Mix together the first five ingredients and cook in a saucepan until thickened. Remove from heat and add butter and brown sugar. Mix well and remove from heat. Fold in vanilla. Spread into the baked pie shell. Refrigerate. Top with whipped cream. Dust with ground cinnamon.

In blender or food processor container, combine all ingredients and blend until smooth. Serve immediately or freeze for up to 1 hour. Serve in bowl or glass and garnish with additional peach slices, if desired.

Cube braunschweiger into small pieces. In medium bowl, cream together cream cheese and milk until smooth and fluffy. Blend in other ingredients until well mixed. Refrigerate for several hours or overnight. Serve with crackers or vegetables. Makes about 2 cups of dip.

Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 10 minutes. Add bacon and cook until crisp. Add garlic powder and potato. Stir to mix. Cook until potato is tender. In a medium bowl, beat together cream and eggs. Add potato mixture to cream mixture. Season with paprika, salt and pepper. Pour mixture into a greased 8-inch square baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool 5 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

In a large bowl combine the Bisquick mix, sugar, and the beaten egg. Add the milk gradually, stirring until mixture is smooth and lump free. Stir in the nuts. Pour into a greased and floured 9 x 5 inch loaf pan. Bake in a preheated 350 degree F (175 degree C) oven for 45-50 minutes. Serve warm or cold.

Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the onion, carrot, oregano, quinoa, broth, and salt. Cover the pot and bring the mixture to a boil. Turn down the heat to low, cover the pot again, and simmer the quinoa for 30 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed and the quinoa is tender. Add the peas and lemon juice and stir everything together. Serve immediately.
Mix first 5 ingredients. Shape into patties. Cook and brown patties. Add mushrooms. Combine mushroom soup and milkpour over patties. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until done.

Place pigeon peas in a saucepan and add water to cover by two inches. Bring to the boil and then simmer for 30 minutes. Drain well and put beans in a bowl. Add the seasoning, herbs and cornflour. Mix well. Melt the butter in a frying pan. Add the meat and brown for about two minutes. Stir in the beans and cook for another two minutes. Pour into a serving dish.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium high heat. Saute onions until softened. Stir in curry powder and cook 1 minute. Stir in cake flour. Reduce heat to medium low. Gradually stir in water to make a smooth sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Mix sugar, vinegar, and water in a small bowl. Spoon over hard-boiled eggs and serve immediately.
name: curried eggs
ingredients: hard-boiled eggs, curry powder, mayonnaise, milk, salt and pepper, parsley
preparation:Cut hard boiled eggs in halves. Eemove yolks and place in bowl. Add mayonnaise, milk curry powder and salt and pepper, mix well. Spoon mixture back into egg halves. Press down gently with a fork. Sprinkle with chopped parsley.
name: african chicken curry
ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, bay leaf, whole canned tomatoes, curry powder, salt, chicken, unsweetened cocon

Whisk whites and egg together with a whisk until smooth. Add skim milk and continue to whisk until smooth. Add in scallions and bay shrimp and stir. Pour into a large nonstick skillet and sprinkle with the Swiss cheese. Cook until the eggs are set. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Pierce the skin of the butternut squash with a sharp knife all over. Place in a shallow roasting pan and roast for 30 minutes. Let cool enough to handle and scoop out pulp into a blender. Pour the roasted pulp into a large saucepan. Add the vegetable broth, onion, carrots and baking soda. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. When cool enough to handle, puree the vegetables in the blender. Return puree to saucepan and add the salt and cinnamon. Heat over medium heat until hot and thick. Add the half-and-half and heat through. Do not boil. Ladle into bowls and serve. Garnish with parsley if desired.
butternut squash are very high in beta-carotene. It is a precursor of vitamin A. Butternut Squash also contains many minerals including magnesium, copper and manganese. It is also

Place fish in shallow glass or ceramic container. Add in the remaining ingredients. Cover and refrigerate 3-4 hours. Turn fish once or twice. Lightly brush the grate with vegetable oil. Place fish on grate. Close lid. Grill over medium-low heat 5-6 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily. Serve with orange wedges.

In a small bowl, toss potatoes and garlic with olive oil and salt. Arrange potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for about 30 minutes or until golden brown and crisp. Makes about 6 servings.

In a 10-inch heavy-bottom skillet over high heat, saute the garlic with the hot sauce. Add the tomatoes with their juice and cook 5 minutes. Add the basil. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Butter the fish. Place the fish in the skillet, cover and cook for 5 to 8 minutes. Serve with lemon slices.

Bring water to boil in a small saucepan. Add brown sugar and white sugar, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat, stir in egg white and cinnamon. Add pecans and stir until nuts are coated with syrup. Spread on baking sheet in a single layer, bake for 2 hours or until nuts are golden brown. Cool completely and store in an air tight container.

Combine the first four ingredients in a medium pot over low heat and stir constantly until the mixture comes to a boil. Remove from the heat and stir in the almonds. Pour into a greased 9 x 13-inch pan and cool at room temperature for at least 1 hour. Cut into squares and enjoy!

Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, herbes de Provence, and cook for 5 minutes or until onions are translucent, stirring occasionally. Stir in broth and tomatoesbring to a boil. Add mushrooms and simmer for 5 minutes or until almost cooked through. Add cannellini beanssimmer for 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir in the winecook for 2 minutes or until reduced by half. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm over cooked pasta or rice.

Place pizza crust on a baking sheet lightly dusted with flour. Mix together bacon, spinach, and mozzarella cheese. Spread on crust and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and pepper. Bake at 450 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until crust is lightly browned and cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare cake mix according to package directions using oil, water and eggs. Stir in pudding mix until combined. Pour half the batter into a greased 10-inch springform pan. Sprinkle with walnuts and remaining batter. Sprinkle top of cake with chocolate sprinkles. Bake for 40-50 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes then remove springform pan sides. Cool completely then frost with chocolate frosting.

Heat a small amount of oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add grapeseed oil, curry powder, ginger, garam masala, onion, salt, cayenne pepper, garlic, and frozen spinach. Stir fry over medium high heat until heated through and spinach is wilted. Serve immediately. Top with yogurt and garnish with chopped cilantro.

Mash the boiled and cooled potato with the flour and cheese. Add the beaten egg and mix. Season with butter and salt. Divide into 24 pieces and shape them into small balls. Heat the oil and fry the cakes until golden brown. Serve hot.

Season veal with salt, pepper and paprika. Brown in butteradd scallions and mushrooms and saute until tender. Stir in flouradd white wine and cook until thickened. Add whipping creamheat through. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 9-inch square pan. In a medium bowl mix together pecans and cinnamon. In a large bowl mix together brown sugar, maple syrup and eggs. Add flour and salt and mix together well. Add the pecans-cinnamon mixture and mix together well. Pour into prepared pan and bake 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for 15 minutes. Dust with confectioners' sugar before serving.

In a large bowl, mix together potatoes, broccoli and green beans. In a small bowl mix together olive oil and lemon and add to potato mixture. Sprinkle with dill and salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving. Sprinkle with goat cheese and pine nuts. Serve and enjoy.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add sausagecook, stirring frequently, until browned. Add onion, red bell pepper, chile, and 1/4 tsp saltcook, stirring frequently, until vegetables are tender. Add tomatillos and winecook until tomatillos are softened and wine is evaporated. Add ricestir until heated through. Serve sprinkled with cilantro.

Cut squash and onion in pieces, boil together, then reduce heat until tender. Drain & mash squash some. Combine squash, onion, eggs, bread crumbs, butter, sugar, salt. Put into a 3 quart dish that has been oiled. Bake at 350 until lightly browned.

Season the fish with salt & pepper. Heat 1-2 tsp oil in skillet. Add halibut & saute until golden brown. Remove halibut & set aside. Heat the remaining oil. Add the onions & saute until tender. Add the garlic & saute for 30 seconds. Add the zucchini & saute until tender. Add the halibut & heat through. Add the tomatoes & lemon juice. Cook until heated through. Sprinkle with the parsley & serve.

Melt butter in saucepan. Stir in brown sugar. Stir in almond extract and egg yolks, one at a time. Stir in flour until well blended. Stir in dark corn syrup. Spread into a 12-inch pie plate or tart pan lined with foil. Bake at 375 degrees f for 12 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Combine powdered sugar and 1/4 cup water in a small saucepan. Cook over low heat until smooth. Stir in pecans and pour over crust. Cool completely before cutting into squares.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Rinse and pat dry the duck breasts. Cut the ends off the garlic heads. Cut off the tops of the garlic heads and discard. Slice the remaining halves. Put the breasts and the garlic in a bowl. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of the lemon pepper. Add 1 tablespoon of the oil and the juice of one half of the lemon. Mix well and rub the mixture onto the breasts and the garlic. Place the duck breasts in a shallow baking pan. Dot the remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil over them. Roast for 20 to 25 minutes, basting once or twice with the pan juices. Sprinkle with the remaining 1 tablespoon of the lemon pepper. Roast for 5 to 10 minutes longer or until done. Serve with the sliced garlic.

Heat oil in a saucepan over low heat. Saute the garlic and onion for 3-4 minutes. Add the anaheim chilies and saute until tender. Add the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Simmer 30 minutes. Strain the sauce and discard the chilies. Add the flour and stir until smooth. Simmer 30-40 minutes longer until the sauce is a deep reddish brown color. Add salt to taste. Let cool.

In a large skillet, melt margarine over low heat. Add apples and brown sugar. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until tender. Place apple mixture on bread slices. Fold bread slices around apple mixture and serve.
Mix all ingredients and bring to a boil over medium heat stirring constantly. Cook 1-2 minutes. Stir constantly to prevent sticking. Serve over ice cream, crepes and bread puddings.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Add the brie and mix thoroughly with the egg mixture. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat and pour mixture into the skillet (about 4 pancakes per skillet). Cook on each side until golden brown (about 2 minutes each side). Serve with chives and sprinkle with cayenne pepper to taste.
Mix all ingredients in casserole dish. Place pork chops on top of potatoes. Cover with foil. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic cloves and fry, stirring, until the onions are softened and the garlic is golden brown. Add the crushed red pepper flakes and stir well. Add the anchovies and cook until the mixture is fragrant. Add the crushed tomatoes and capers and continue to cook until the sauce is reduced and thickened. Add the tuna and the parsley and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions. Drain the pasta and place it in a serving bowl or pasta dish. Pour over the sauce and serve immediately.

Bake pie shells according to package directions. Cook ground beef in skillet until browned. Drain fat. Add hash brown potatoes and cook until done. Drain. Combine meat, potatoes and cheese. In a small bowl, combine cream, eggs and seasonings. Pour over meat mixture. Bake at 325 for 35 minutes. Sprinkle with more cheese if desired. Serve warm.

In an ungreased 9x13 pan, layer the fruit and the cake mix evenly. Sprinkle the coconut evenly over the top of the mixture. In a saucepan on med-low heat, melt the butter and the brown sugar together and stir until blended. Pour over the coconut. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes or until done. Cool completely before cutting into squares and serving.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a 1-quart baking dishstir in vegetables. Arrange chicken over vegetable mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Uncoversprinkle with green onions. Bake 2-3 minutes longer or until heated through.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees C. Grease a 24cm square pan. Melt butter in a saucepan. Stir in brown sugar. Remove from heat. Stir in egg. Sift together the plain flour, cocoa and bicarbonate of soda. Stir into the butter mixture. Press into the pan. Bake for 25 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. Melt the icing sugar with boiling water. Drizzle over slice. Sprinkle with coconut.
name: light carrot cocoa snack cake browniesingredients: cocoa, flour, baking powder, sugar, carrot, skim milk, applesauce, egg whites, vanillapreparation:Preheat oven to 350 and spray a 9 inch square pan with sprayable oil. Mix cocoa, flour and baking powder in a bowl. Mix in shredded carrots and sugar. In another small bowl, mix egg whites, milk, apple sauce and vanilla. Lightly beat with fork and add to

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10x13 inch baking pan. In a large bowl, combine the light brown sugar and the flourmix well. In another bowl, whisk the eggs, oil, extracts, and morsels until well combined. Stir in the dry ingredients just until combined. Fold in the nuts. Spread into the prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the top is golden and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with moist crumbs attached. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting into squares.
This recipe is the perfect way to get rid of some extra holiday baking supplies! I used a pre-made brownie mix, but you could easily double this recipe with your own favorite homemade brownie recipe!
These are really good! I made them for a school bake sale and they sold out fast!
These are really good! I made them for a school bake sale and they sold out fast! I was going to add more flavor

Heat olive oil and margarine together. Add onion, garlic and tomato. Cook for 3 minutes. Add capsicum and cook for 3 more minutes. Add rice and stir. Add boiling water and bring to boil. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes. Add pepper just before serving.

Scoop the flesh of the avocados into a large mixing bowl. Mash the avocadoes with a fork until it is somewhat smooth but not pureed. Add the remaining ingredients and stir well. Chill until serving time. Serve with tortilla chips or vegetables.

Combine first 7 ingredients in a large bowl. Stir well. Spread into a 9 inch square baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes or until heated through and set.

Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan. In a large bowl combine all ingredients except the chocolate chips and the raisins. Press the mixture into the prepared pan. Sprinkle the chocolate chips and the raisins over the top. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20-25 minutes. Cool in the pan on a wire rack. Cut into 12 squares. Store in an airtight container.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic. Saute until softened about 3 minutes. Add the curry powder and cook for about one minute. Add the zucchini and potato. Add the broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium low. Cook for about 20 minutes until the vegetables are tender. Remove from heat. Puree the soup until smooth. Season with salt.

Combine horseradish, lemon juice and garlic cloves in a food processor. Blend until smooth. Combine fennel seeds and breadcrumbs in a small bowl. Toss with panko. Combine horseradish mixture with mustard in another bowl. Spread half of horseradish mixture on each fillet. Sprinkle with breadcrumb mixture. Bake uncovered at 350 for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a large saucepan, combine the carrots and water. Bring to a boil and cover. Reduce the heat and simmer, uncovered, about 25 minutes or until the carrots are tender when pierced with the tip of a knife. Remove from the heat and drain. In a large skillet combine the carrots with the brown sugar, butter and vinegar. Cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes or until the sugar and butter are melted and the sauce is smooth. Stir in the salt. Serve immediately.
We love carrots. I had never heard of the candy coated ones and I will definitely give them a try. They sound really yummy!

Cut the mushrooms into quarters. Put in a bowl and toss them with 1 teaspoon of the oil. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let them sit in the refrigerator for 2 hours. Preheat the broiler. Drain the liquid from the mushrooms. Combine the remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil with the vinegar, water, mustard, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Arrange the mushrooms in a shallow dish. Pour the vinegar mixture over them. Broil the mushrooms for 4 to 6 minutes, basting them twice. Serve warm or at room temperature.
I like to add a few cloves of garlic to the balsamic vinegar. The vinegar is sweet and the garlic is hot.
Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the sage, rosemary, and parsleystir. Add the onions, pepper flakes, thyme, and bay leafstir. Add the mushroom piecesstir. Add the white winestir. Stir in the bro

Cream together peanut butter and margarine. Blend in banana, egg, and vanilla. Beat in flour, Splenda, baking soda, and salt. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto greased baking sheet. Bake at 325 for 10 minutes or until set. Makes 2-1/2 dozen.
Put all the ingredients into a food processor and mix until smooth. Serve with pita bread or warm tortilla chips.

In a large mixing bowl cream together the sugar, eggs and kahlua. Stir in the pecans and mix well. In another bowl combine the flour and butter. Add this mixture to the egg mixture. Pour into a deep dish pie shell. Bake for 40 minutes. Cool. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Let melt before serving.
Pecans are a rich source of protein, containing about 4.1 grams of protein per one-ounce serving. Protein helps build muscle mass and strength.
Pecans are a good source of unsaturated fatty acids, such as oleic acid. A one-ounce serving of pecans contains about 19 grams of total fat, 12 of which are unsaturated. Oleic acid has been linked to a decreased risk of cardiovascular disease.
Pecans are a good source of vitamin E. A one-ounce serving of pecans contains about 7.4 milligrams of vitamin E. Vitamin E is an antioxidant that protects cell membranes from free radical damage.
Pecans are a

Beat together butter and sugar until light and creamy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla and almond extracts. In a separate bowl, combine the dry ingredients. Add the dry mixture to the butter mixture alternating with the milk and ending with the dry mixture. Blend until well combined. Fold in the chopped apples and nuts. Pour into two greased and floured loaf pans and bake at 350 F for 60 minutes or until done.

Combine morsels, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon and nuts in a small bowl. Toss to coat well. Stir in apple slices, reserving 10 for garnish. Place mixture in a greased 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees f for 45 minutes or until apples are tender. Combine topping ingredients. Stir with a fork until crumbly. Sprinkle over apples. Bake an additional 3-5 minutes or until lightly browned. Garnish with reserved apple slices if desired. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream if desired. Makes 6-8 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add sausages and fry until browned. Add oregano and garlic. Stir to combine. Add tomatoes and stir well. Turn heat to low. Add beef stock and wine. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove cover and add olives. Continue to simmer 5 minutes longer. Arrange sausages in a single layer in a 2 1/2 quart shallow baking dish. Spoon the tomato mixture evenly over the sausages. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Garnish with fresh basil leaves. Serve with crusty bread.

Dredge chops in flour and shake off excess. In a large skillet, heat 1/4 cup of the oil. Cook chops until lightly browned. Add onions and cook until browned. Sprinkle chops with pepper and remaining oil. Pour in wine and broth. Heat to boiling. Stir in cornstarch and salt. Cook and stir until thickened.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook onion and celery until softened. Stir in vegetables and cook 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Stir in tomatoes. Cook 1 minute longer. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Let cool. Roll out dough and place in a greased 9-inch pie plate. Pour in vegetable mixture. Cover with another piece of dough. Press edges and trim. Brush with egg. Cut slits in top to vent. Bake at 375f until crust is golden brown.

Place the almonds in a food processor and chop until they are finely ground. In a non-stick skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the sliced almonds and cook until light brown. Add the parsley and cook for 1 minute more. Set aside to cool. In a large bowl, combine the ground almonds with the water and stir to make a paste. Dip each fish fillet in the paste and then roll in the almonds to coat. Heat the fish in the vermouth over medium heat until it is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with lemon wedges.

Wash and peel the beets. Slice them into wedges and place in a baking pan. Melt the margarine and mix in the syrup and the lemon juice and pour over the beets. Bake in a pre-heated oven at 325 for one hour or until tender. Serve hot or cold.

Combine the meat, breadcrumbs, parsley, egg and seasonings in a large bowlmix well. Add the onion and apples and mix thoroughly. Form into 10 mini loaves. Place the loaves in a baking pan. Combine the sauce ingredients and pour over loaves. Bake for 35 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Broil until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Combine juices and curry powder in medium bowl and stir well. Cut tofu into 8 equal slices or chunks and place in baking dish. Pour juice mixture over and turn to coat. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes or until tofu is tender and glaze is thickened. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 425f. Toss brussel sprouts with a little butter, place them on a baking sheet (I use a stoneware pan lined with parchment paper). Roast for about 15 minutes, remove from oven and toss. Roast again until tender. The key to this recipe is the browned butter. In a small saucepan, melt the butter over low heat until it starts to bubble. Continue cooking until it starts to turn golden brown. Do not walk away from your stove or the butter will burn. Remove from heat and add the nutmeg. Toss the brussel sprouts with the browned butter. Salt and pepper to taste.
Brussel Sprouts have always been my least favorite vegetable. I was always so annoyed as a child when my mom would make us eat them. So I was excited to find out that they are actually pretty tasty. I even like the smell. I found this recipe on allrecipes.com.
Preheat oven to 400°. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil

In a 3 quart saucepan, combine beans, bacon, brown sugar, butter, soy sauce, garlic powder and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer 10 minutes or until tender but still a bit firm to the bite. Stir occasionally. Garnish with sour cream if desired.

Heat olive oil in large skillet. Add shallot and garlic. Cook over medium heat until tender. Add mushrooms. Cook for 5 minutes. Combine bread crumbs and seasonings. Beat egg in a bowl. Dip each breast into egg. Then coat in bread crumb mixture. Place in skillet with mushrooms. Cook for about 4 minutes on each side. Place 2 slices mozzarella over each breast. Place back in skillet for 3 minutes. Serve with sauce.
Combine cranberries, powdered sugar, walnuts in a large bowl. Set aside.In a small bowl combine whipping cream and sugar. Beat until smooth. Fold in cranberry mixture. Chill. Serve with Fuji Apple.

In electric frying pan or large skillet saute onions and peppers until onions soften. Add garlic and saute one minute more. Add hash browns and stir until evenly coated with oil and seasonings. Add ham and continue stirring until all is heated through. Serve immediately or keep warm in a double boiler or in the oven at 300 degrees for up to 30 minutes.

Combine tuna with the remaining ingredients and serve on a bed of lettuce.
In a saucepan over low heat, saut the curry powder in olive oil for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. While the curry powder is cooking, mince the onion and chop the crystallized ginger. In a medium bowl, add the mayonnaise, rice vinegar and dijon mustard. Whisk to blend. Add the cooked curry powder, crystallized ginger, onion, pecans and cayenne pepper. Whisk again to thoroughly blend. Add the tuna and mix with a fork until tuna is well blended and coated with the dressing. Serve and enjoy.
Combine tuna with the remaining ingredients and serve on a bed of lettuce.
Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl, combine tuna, celery, onion, cheese, olives, mayo and pepper. Divide tuna mixture evenly among 4 buns. Wrap sandwiches loosely in aluminum foil. Place
Saute onion in butter until tender. Add celery and saute until tender-crisp. Add apple and cook until tender. Add flour, curry and seasonings and cook for 1 minute or until bubbly. Serve hot.

Heat oven to 350f. Grease an 8x8in pan or line with baking paper. Melt chocolate and butter together. Whisk together eggs and sugar until thick and pale. Whisk in melted chocolate mixture. Add flour and espresso. Stir until well combined. Pour batter into pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes until set. Leave to cool completely before cutting into squares. Serve at room temperature.

Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a heavy-bottomed pot. Add the carrots, celery, apple and onion, and saute until tender. Add garlic and saute until fragrant but not browned. Add the chicken broth, wine, and port. Bring to a boil over high heat and reduce to a simmer. Cook until reduced by half, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x13x3 inch pan. Mix together the white sugar, eggs and all-purpose flour until smooth. Stir in the baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon and the carrots. Stir in the walnuts. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until golden brown. Cool. Yields 16 servings.
Cream butter and sugar together. Add the beaten egg and vanilla. Add dry ingredients. Stir in white chocolate chips. Drop by spoonful onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 10 to 12 minutes.

Peel peaches and remove pits. Place peaches in a saucepan with water just covering them. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover pan and simmer until peaches are very soft, about 15 minutes. Let cool. Mash peaches into a chunky puree. Set aside. Scoop yolks from eggs into a medium bowl. Add peach puree, mustard, jam, habanero pepper, salt and pepper. Mash well. Stir in mayo. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. To serve, slice whites lengthwise. Fill whites with egg yolk mixture. Garnish with cilantro sprigs.
In a medium bowl combine the tomatoes, tarragon, mint, cilantro, parsley, scallions and salt. Serve topped with yogurt and cheese.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Beat together the granulated sugar and unsalted butter with an electric mixer on medium-high speed until light and fluffy. Add the eggs and beat just until combined. Add the vanilla and beat until combined. Add the flour, baking soda and baking powder and beat until smooth. Stir in the chopped hazelnuts. Spread the batter into an ungreased 9-inch square baking dish. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the edges begin to brown. Cool for 5 minutes then slice into bars and let cool completely.

Heat olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add scallions, garlic, dill, and cook 1 minute. Add swiss chard and cook 2 minutes. Add the chickpeas and cook 1 minute. Add the salt and black pepper. Top with the feta cheese. Serve immediately.

Saute ground pork and garlic until pork is browned. Add water and cook until the water evaporates. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce and green onions. Stir to combine. Add lobster meat. Continue to cook until lobster is done. Stir in cornstarch to thicken. Remove from heat. Add egg. Stir to combine. Serve over rice.
I love Shrimp. I had some last night for dinner. I had the best Shrimp Po Boy I have ever had. It was awesome. My husband makes them as well.
I love shrimp and lobster together.
I like to eat seafood in general. Shrimp is one of my favorites!
I'm not really big into seafood, though my kids love it.
I love seafood. I do not eat much of it.
I love seafood. I eat it at least twice a week.
I love seafood. I eat seafood at least twice a week.

Preheat oven to 350. In a 2-quart crockpot, pour in 1/4 cup flour. Mix together cream of mushroom soup and milk in a bowl. Dip chicken in mixture then in flour. Place in crockpot and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook on low 4-5 hours. Add 1/2 cup milk, 1/4 cup flour and 1 tsp. garlic powder to crockpot and stir. Cook on low 1-2 hours. Serves 4.

For the brine combine water with salt. Add sugar. Stir to dissolve. Add bay leaves. Add garlic. Add shallots. Add allspice berry. Add hot pepper sauce. Stir to combine. Add pork to a large ziploc bag. Pour brine over the top of the pork. Seal bag. Place in refrigerator. Refrigerate overnight or for 8-12 hours. Remove from bag. Pat dry. Season with salt and pepper. Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add a bit of olive oil to the pan. Place pork in the pan. Sear on each side for 3-4 minutes. Transfer to a baking sheet. Place in a 350 degree oven. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until done. Remove from oven. Let rest. Slice and serve.

Place roast in slow cooker. Add water, soy sauce, rosemary, thyme, garlic powder, bay leaf, peppercorns. Cover and cook for 5-6 hours on high or until beef is tender. Remove meat from broth, shred with forks and keep warm. Strain broth. Pour broth into cups for dipping. Serve beef on rolls.

Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat until it has browned slightly. Add the brussels sprouts and a pinch of salt and saute until they are tender and nicely browned on all sides. Remove from the heat and toss in the sage leaves. Serve at once.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Trim excess fat from the pork tenderloin. In a resealable plastic bag, combine the maple syrup, reduced-sodium soy sauce, ketchup, dijon mustard, orange zest, curry powder, ground coriander, worcestershire sauce, garlic cloves, salt, and black peppermix well. Add the pork tenderloin to the bagseal tightly and turn to coat the meat evenly with the sauce. Let marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour or more, turning once to coat evenly. Remove the pork tenderloin from the bagdiscard the marinade. Place the tenderloin on a baking sheet lined with foil. Bake for 20 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 160 degrees f (do not overcook). Serve with steamed rice.

In a large skillet melt butter, add the onion& celery, saut for 5 minutes. Add the cayenne and the baby peas, cover with cold water, bring to a boil and simmer uncovered for 5 minutes or until the peas are tender. Mix cornstarch& cold water to a thickening consistency, stir into the peas, bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute or until thickened. Remove from heat, stir in the pimiento and serve. Serves 6.

In a 9x13 inch baking dish, layer bread cubes. Top with cooked sausage. In a bowl, beat together eggs, milk, salt, and dry mustard until blended. Pour over the sausage. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover and refrigerate overnight. In the morning, bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes or until center is set. Let stand for 5-10 minutes before serving. Serve with salsa, if desired.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the asparagus and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the English peas and cook for 1 minute longer. Remove the vegetables from the pot. Add the green onions and cook until soft. Drain the vegetables. In a large bowl combine the vegetables with the pasta, tomatoes, lemon juice, olive oil, and tuna. Season with the salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl, combine the broth, gingerroot, and soy sauce. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook spaghetti according to the package directions. Add the broth mixture and the chili paste to the pot and cook 2 minutes more. Drain the pasta and return to the pot. Stir in the peanut butter and the honey. Sprinkle with the green onion and the peanuts. Serves 2.

Cut the fish into 2" by 3" pieces. In a small bowl combine garlic with garam masala, chili powder and turmeric. Rub mixture over all sides of the fish and set aside for about 30 minutes. Heat oil in a skillet over high heat. Add the fish and cook for about 3 minutes per side. Season with salt and add lemon juice. Serve hot.

Place chicken breasts in a 9 x 13 pan. Cover with ketchup and Italian dressing. Sprinkle with black pepper. Cover and refrigerate overnight. The next day remove from refrigerator, sprinkle with more black pepper, bake at 350 for 1 hour. Baste with sauce and bake 15 more minutes until done. Let sit for 15 minutes before serving. Serve with noodles and/or green beans.

In a large frying pan saute sausage, mushrooms and cabbage in olive oil until tender. Add sauce and cooked spaghetti to pan and toss well to combine. Add peppers and cook for 3-4 minutes or until heated through. Stir in cheese and season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the leek and cook until softened. Add the mushrooms, 2 cups of the broth, the tarragon, 1/4 teaspoon of the salt, and 1/8 teaspoon of the pepper. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the cornstarch mixture, lemon juice, remaining 1/2 cup broth, the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Cook until thickened. Stir in the sour cream. Cover the skillet and keep warm.

Combine sugar and white corn syrup in a large heavy sauce pan. Cook over medium heat until the mixture reaches hard crack stage. Remove from heat and add the peppermint oil and green food coloring. Beat until mixture is thoroughly combined. Drop by spoonfuls onto a buttered plate or waxed paper. Cool until hard. Store in an airtight container.
Marinade in a covered container in the refrigerator overnight. Grill or broil. Makes 6 servings.

Prepare the potato pancakes according to the instructions on the package. Set aside. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the yellow onions and saute until softened and lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add the carrot and saute until softened, about 2 minutes more. Add the ground paprika, garlic powder and fresh parsley and stir until well combined. Add the water and mix until incorporated. Pour the mixture over the potato pancakes and add the matzo meal and egg to the top of each pancake and mix well until incorporated and no dry spots remain. Bake for about 20 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the mixture is firm. Let stand for about 5 minutes before serving.

Drain and crumble tofu, sprinkle with breadcrumbs and parmesan cheese and set aside. In a large bowl combine the almonds with the garlic powder and salt and black pepper. Set aside. Pour about 1/2 cup of the water into the blender and add the egg. Blend until the egg is well incorporated into the liquid. Add the remaining 3 cups of water and blend. Set aside. In a large skillet heat the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until the garlic is golden brown. Remove and set aside. Add the egg liquid to the skillet and bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Add the almond mixture and the breadcrumb mixture to the skillet and stir until the mixture is well blended and the liquid has evaporated. Add the tofu and stir until the mixture is well blended and the liquid has evaporated. Transfer the mixture to a 9 by 13 inch baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until the stuffed tofu cubes are firm.

Mix the brown and yellow mustards with the beer and leave overnight. Strain the mixture and discard the seeds. Add the other ingrediants to the mustard and bring to the boil. Remove from the heat and leave to cool. Transfer the mixture to the blender or food processor and blend for about 30 seconds. Transfer to a jar with a tight fitting lid, store in the fridge. Use within 2 weeks.
name: creamy parmesan mustardingredients: parmesan cheese, dried parsley, yellow mustard seeds, yellow mustard powder, white wine vinegar, ground black pepperpreparation:Put the parmesan cheese in the blender and process until it forms a thick powder. Add the parsley. Next add the mustard powder and blend until the mixture resembles a thick paste. Add the vinegar, blend again. Add the pepper to taste. Put the mixture into an air tight container and refrigerate.
name: easy dijon mustardingredients: yellow mustard seeds, apple cider vinegar, water,

Rinse and drain basmati rice. Soak for 20 minutes. Boil the 4 cups of water until it reduces to 2 cups. Add the rice to the 2 cups water and 1 tsp of salt. Bring to a boil and lower the heat to a simmer. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes until the rice is tender but not mushy. Strain the rice and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking process. In a large saucepan combine the strained rice with 2 cups skim milk and 2/3 cup sugar. Add the 2 tsp of vanilla and 1/8 tsp of cinnamon. Bring to a boil while stirring constantly. Lower the heat and simmer for 10 minutes until the mixture is thickened. Cool slightly before serving. Serves 4 to 6.

Place the pearl tapioca into the inner pot of the rice cooker along with the milk. Cook the mixture until the tapioca is fully cooked and the mixture is thickened. Remove the inner pot from the rice cooker. Place the cooked tapioca mixture into a small bowl. Whisk together the egg, sugar, and salt. Temper the egg mixture into the cooked tapioca until fully incorporated. Add the vanilla extract and mix well. Return the mixture to the inner pot and cook until the pudding is heated through and the mixture has thickened. Remove from heat and serve warm.

Spray skillet with cooking spray. Cook beef in skillet over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain off fat. Add onion to skillet with meat. Cook for 5 minutes. Add cream of tomato soup and 2 cups water. Stir together. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Cover. Cook 10 minutes. Stir occasionally. Add remaining 1 cup water. Stir in instant rice. Cook 20 to 25 minutes or until rice is tender. Add green beans. Cook 10 minutes longer. Stir in parsley and pepper. Serve immediately.

Place ham in a roasting pan and cover with water. Bring to a boil and skim foam from top of water with a large spoon. Add ham and liquid to a slow cooker and cook on high for 4 hours. Drain liquid from cooker and reserve in saucepan. Remove ham from slow cooker and place in a large roasting pan or foil lined pan. In a medium bowl whisk together remaining ingredients until smooth and pour over ham. Return ham to slow cooker and cook on low for another 2 hours or until desired tenderness is reached and sauce thickens. Serve hot or at room temperature with remaining sauce.
Recipe : Baked Glazed Ham
Recipe : Rum Mustard Glazed Ham
Recipe : Baked Ham with Mustard Glaze Crock Pot
Recipe : Cider Glazed Honey Baked Ham
Recipe : Beer Ham
Recipe : Center Cut Ham on the Grill
Recipe : Holiday Ham Glaze
Recipe : Coffee Glazed Ham
Mash the cream cheese with a fork. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Chill for at least an hour. Serve with crackers or vegetable sticks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 9 inch pie plate with cooking spray or lightly grease with cooking spray or lard. Place bratwurst in large skillet over medium heatcook 5 to 7 minutes or until lightly browned, stirring to crumbledrain. Crumble into medium bowl. Stir in sauerkraut. Add Swiss cheesetoss to combine. Place on wax paper in prepared pie plateset aside. In medium bowl, beat Bisquick, milk and beer with wire whisk until blendedstir in eggs. Pour over meat mixture. Bake for 1 hour or until knife inserted in center of pie comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes before cutting to serve. Shirley j hedrick 10-1-05.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cold running water. Mix with 1 cup mayonnaise. Add ranch dressing mix and milk. Stir to combine. Add peas, green onions, olives and tomato. Toss gently. Cover. Refrigerate at least 2 hours to allow flavors to blend.

Position rack in center of oven and heat oven to 325f. Line 8x8x2-inch baking pan with foil, with ends of foil extending over sides of pan. Spray foil with nonstick cooking sprayset aside. Melt chocolate and oil in medium saucepan over low heat or in the microwave on low power until chocolate is just meltedstir until smooth. Remove from heat and cool slightlyset aside. In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat egg whites on medium speed until foamy, about 1 minute. Gradually beat in granulated sugar, about 1 minute longer. Beat in egg yolks one at a time until combined, scraping down sides of bowl after each additionbeat in vanilla. Gradually beat in chocolate mixture until smoothbeat in cinnamon and salt. Sift together all-purpose flour, baking powder, and baking sodastir into chocolate mixture just until combined. Spread batter evenly in prepared pan. Bake until top is puffed and edges are firm, about 28

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Cook zucchini and red bell pepper 5 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook 1 minute more or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add olives and sunflower seeds. Drain pasta. Add to skillet. Add pesto sauce. Toss to coat well. Serve immediately.
Boil the sweet potatoes in their skins until tender. Mash with the butter and green onion. Season with salt and pepper. Add the sour cream.

Preheat oven to 350F. Layer the lasagna as follows: one-fourth of the polenta mixtureone-fourth of the marinara sauceone-fourth of the mozzarella cheeseone-fourth of the pestoone-fourth of the pine nutsrepeat the layers once more and end with a layer of mozzarella and the pine nuts. Bake for approximately one hour or until the top is bubbly and the sauce is bubbling around the edges of the pan. Let cool for about ten minutes before cutting into slices and serving.

Combine gelatin and cold water in a small bowl and stir until dissolved (about 2 minutes). Set aside. Add hot water to the bowl with the powdered drink mix and stir until dissolved (about 2 minutes). Add the gelatin mixture to the drink mixture and stir until dissolved (about 30 seconds). Pour into popsicle molds and freeze overnight or until firm. To unmold, run mold under hot water for a few seconds to loosen the popsicles. Remove from mold and enjoy!

Combine first 4 ingredients in a small bowl and stir well to blend. Rub over both sides of the chops and allow to marinate for at least 30 minutes. Grill the lamb over medium-hot coals about 4 inches away from the heat for 10 minutes per side or until done to taste. Serve with remaining sauce.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Wash and drain mushroom caps. Set aside. In a medium skillet over medium heat saute garlic in olive oil until tender. Stir in onion powder and cayenne. Remove from heat. In a bowl, combine cream cheese and black pepper. Add sauteed mixture and stir well. Fill caps with mixture. Top each with a sprinkle of Parmesan. Bake for about 15 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown. Serve warm.
I have never been a huge fan of stuffed mushrooms because of the fussiness of the preparation. But now I am a fan! I am not sure what is in this recipe that made it so good. It is certainly not the mushrooms since I rarely eat them. It was the bacon and the cream cheese. I have no idea where the Worcestershire Sauce fits in. The bacon and cream cheese were the only thing I could taste. It was also easy to make. I can hardly wait to make this again. I have been eating them cold from the fridge
Cream the butter and cream cheese. Add the salt and flour. Mix well, then roll out to fit tart pan. Bake 25 minutes at 350 f.

In a shallow dish, combine the lemon pepper and flour. Dip both sides of each piece of chicken in the flour mixture. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat 1/2 tablespoon of the oil. Add the chicken and cook for 3 minutes per side or until done. Transfer to a plate. Heat 1/2 tablespoon of the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the scallions and cook 2 minutes or until lightly browned. Add the lemon juice and curry powder and cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add the remaining oil and cook 1 minute. Add the dressing and the avocado and stir until blended. Spoon half of the chicken and the dressing mixture into a shallow bowl. Arrange the plum tomato slices and the olives around the edges. Top with the remaining chicken and dressing mixture. Garnish with the scallions.

Cook asparagus just until tender. Remove to ice water. Drain thoroughly. Combine vinegar, water and rind in a small saucepan. Simmer, uncovered, 10 minutes. Cool completely. Combine asparagus and vinegar mixture. Add oil and lemon juicetoss well. Sprinkle with seeds. Refrigerate until serving. Serves 8.

Saut the onion with the oil. Add the thyme and flour. Cook over low heat stirring constantly for 2 minutes. Add the stock. Add the zucchini. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Add the cheese and cook until melted. Season with salt & pepper.

Place potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil and simmer until tender about 25 minutes. Drain and cool slightly. Cut into halves or quarters. Place potatoes into a large bowl. Add onion and remaining ingredients. Toss gently. Serve chilled.

Combine all ingredients in large saucepan, bring to boil. Reduce heat to simmer and cook, stirring occasionally until fruit is soft. Remove from heat and let cool. Spoon into sterile jars. Cover. Seal. Keep refrigerated for 2 months.

Place rice and cooking spray into your rice cooker. Cook the rice. When finished add Chinese sausages. Add cilantro leaf and black sesame seeds. Mix well and serve.
I love Chinese food and I love rice. And I love easy meals. So when I can combine all three of these things into one meal, it’s just perfect. And I know you’ll love this rice recipe. It’s so simple to make. All you have to do is mix all of the ingredients together and serve. And it tastes great! It’s one of my favorites. I hope you enjoy it as much as I do.
Sausage and Rice Recipe
A great side dish to serve with Chinese food.
Sausage and rice is an easy dish to make. It's simple to prepare and tastes great. I love this recipe because it uses simple ingredients. You don't need to spend a lot of time or money to prepare this dish.
Sausage and Rice Recipe - Ingredients
Sausage and Rice Recipe - How to Make
Sausage and R

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place graham crackers side by side in ungreased jelly roll pan, lined the pan with release foil, this way the graham crackers fit really good in the pan. In a 1-quart saucepan combine butter and brown sugar. Heat to boiling over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until mixture thickens slightly, about 3 minutes. Spread mixture evenly over graham crackers. Sprinkle with sliced almonds. Bake 18 to 19 minutes or until graham crackers are slightly brown and butter bubbles and turns golden. Watch carefully during the last 2 to 3 minutes of baking to make sure graham crackers do not over brown. While cookies are still in pan, with knife, immediately cut each graham cracker crosswise in half. With metal spatula, transfer cookies to a wire rack to cool. Store cookies in tightly covered container, with wax paper between layers in refrigerator up to 1 month or freeze up to 3 months.
almonds nutritional facts - what is in

Boil sugar, butter and margarine until soft crack stage. Add pecans to mixture. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto wax paper or foil lined trays. Cool slightly before removing from trays. Break into small pieces before serving.

Place chicken in ziploc bag. In a small bowl mix together lemon juice, soy sauce, garlic clove, salt, ginger, pepper. Pour over chicken in bag. Close bag tightly. Place in refrigerator for at least 2 hours.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large bowl, combine water, sugar, salt and oil. Add matzo meal and mix well. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the vanilla and almond extracts. In a small bowl, combine the cinnamon-sugar mixture. Spoon about a teaspoon of the batter into each cup of a muffin pan that has been greased with cooking spray. Spoon a teaspoon or so of the cinnamon-sugar mixture on top of each dollop of batter. Bake for about 20 minutes or until the muffin cups are golden brown. Cool for 10 minutes on a wire rack. Dip each donut into the melted chocolate and place on wax paper or a parchment-lined baking sheet. Sprinkle with nuts, if desired.
In a large pitcher combine the lemon juice, the simple syrup, the Malibu and the club soda. Add the lychee fruit and serve over ice. Garnish with the coconut flakes.

Drain oysters and discard liquid. Beat eggs with hot sauce and salt. Add oysters and mix well. In a separate bowl mix cracker crumbs and saltine crumbs together. Add water one tablespoon at a time until crumb mixture holds together. Form into patties about 3/4-inch thick. Heat the vegetable oil and fry the patties until golden brown, turning once. Serve immediately with hot sauce on the side.

In a heavy skillet, heat butter over medium heat until melted. Add the onion. Cook, stirring often, until softened, about 6 minutes. Add spinach in handfuls, stirring to wilt. Season to taste. Add rice. Add the spices. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add tomatoes and their juice. Cook until heated through, about 5 minutes. Serve.
Combine all the ingredients in the crock-pot and stir. Cook on high for 2 hours or on low for 4 hours. Serve in bowls and garnish with cheese, avocado and tortilla chips.

Place 1/4 cup of amaretto in the bottom of each of four 6-ounce glasses. Fill each glass with ice. In a cocktail shaker combine 2/3 cup fresh lime juice, 2 tablespoons tequila, 1/2 cup triple sec and 1/4 cup amaretto. Pour into prepared glasses. Garnish with lime slices.
Combine brown sugar, cream cheese, sour cream, vanilla and coffee liqueurbeat with a mixer. Refrigerate for 1 hourstir in frozen whipped topping. Serve with fresh fruit.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cut the chicken into cubes. Wrap each cube with a strip of bacon and secure with a toothpick. In a medium bowl, combine marmalade, soy sauce, sesame oil and ginger. Spray a cookie sheet with cooking spray. Place cubes in a single row on the cookie sheet. Brush with marmalade mixture. Roast for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve with orange wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Pound the chicken breasts between 2 sheets of plastic wrap with a meat pounder until 1/4 inch thick. Place in large resealable plastic bag and combine the cumin, paprika, turmeric and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt. Add the oil and shake until the meat is coated. Lay the chicken breasts flat in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes or until done (165 degrees F). Slice the spring onions and serve with the chicken.

Preheat the oven to 350f. Grease muffin pans or line with paper cups. Combine the dry ingredients in a mixing bowl. Cut in shortening with a pastry blender until it is in small pieces. Stir in the milk and egg. Spoon about 3 tbsp of batter into each muffin cup. Spread a heaping tbsp of preserves over batter. Cover with remaining batter. Bake for about 15 minutes. Cool in pans for 5 minutes then remove from pans. Cool on wire racks. Makes about 12.
The muffin tray is a very useful kitchen utensil. You can prepare various recipes in it. There are several ways of making a muffin tray. You can purchase a muffin tray or make it yourself. You can find a muffin tray in a grocery shop or a departmental store. They are also available online. You can find a variety of styles and shapes of trays. You can also make your own tray. The tray can be made of aluminum. You can also

Combine the first 3 ingredients in a large bowlcream well. Beat in the eggs. Combine the flour, baking soda, and saltstir into the peanut butter mixture. Stir in the peanuts. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375f for 8 to 10 minutes or until light golden brown.
Brown beef with onion. Add soup, vegetables. Pour into baking dish. Top with tater tots. Bake at 350 for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat. Whisk together the cocoa and cornstarch until very smooth. Beat the egg whites in a bowl until foamy. Add the powdered sugar and continue beating until the whites are glossy and stiff peaks form when the beaters are lifted out of the bowl. With the motor on low, add the cocoa mixture and mix until the batter is glossy and thickened. Add the pecans and mix until the batter is glossy and thickened. Add the pecans and mix until smooth and shiny. Drop the batter by the teaspoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheet. Bake for 12 minutes or until the edges begin to brown and the centers of the cookies are set but still soft. Cool on the cookie sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer the cookies to a wire rack and cool completely before serving.

Place biscuits in food processor or blender and process until finely ground. Combine ground biscuits, crumbs and melted butter. Press into 9 inch pie plate. Bake at 160 for 10 minutes. Spread with cheesecake filling. Bake for 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool slightly and sprinkle with strawberries and syrup. Cool completely. Place in airtight container. Make in advance. Serve cold.

Prepare the snow by combining the sweetened condensed milk and vanilla in a medium size bowl. Fold in snow until thoroughly blended. Fill the containers with the snow mixture, leaving room for a top layer of decorative candies. Decorate with colorful candies.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook rice mix according to package directions. Meanwhile, in large skillet over medium heat, brown chicken in butter for about 5 minutes. Add garlic, black pepper, and broccoli. Cook until heated through. Add cheese and stir until melted. In 13x9x2 baking dish, combine rice and broccoli mixture. Spoon chicken mixture evenly over top. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. In small bowl, blend together sour cream and parsley. Serve with rice mixture.

In a large bowl, combine beef with 1/2 can of water and the soup mix. Heat remaining 1/4 can of water in microwave until boiling. Pour over beef. Cover and let stand for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, mix yogurt with mint. Mound beef mixture onto each pita. Top with yogurt and tomato. Serve immediately.

Combine all the seasonings except the lemon zest. Rub all over the butterflied lamb. Refrigerate overnight. When ready to cook, take the roast out of the refrigerator 1 hour before cooking. Prepare a grill for high heat. Brush the lamb lightly with olive oil. Grill about 8 minutes per side for rare.

Place two or three ice cubes into each of two tall glasses. Fill with orange juice. Add a shot of amaretto and one of southern comfort to each drink. Pour a bit of grenadine over the back of a spoon held just above the top of the drinks and swirl the spoon through the drinks. Garnish with a slice of orange and serve immediately.

In a large stockpot, bring 2 quarts of water to a boil. Add 2 teaspoons of olive oil. Add leeks. Cook for 5 minutes. Add garlic. Cook for 1 minute more. Add the dry white wine. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the white pepper, oregano, clams and 1 teaspoon of olive oil. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the linguine. Cook until al dente, or until the pasta is just tender. Drain well. Serve immediately.

Sprinkle the pepper over the cocoa and sugar. Whisk together in a saucepan over low heat until the sugar is dissolved. Add the milk and the dark chocolate. Heat just until steaming, but do not boil. Serve in a mug garnished with a little extra dark chocolate and a sprig of mint. Serves one.

Heat the oil in a frying pan. Fry the cabbage until tender. Add the onion and cook until light brown. Add the green chilies, garlic, fresh ginger, turmeric and salt. Cook a little longer and serve hot. Top with coconut if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Rinse artichokes and remove tough outer leaves. Cut the artichokes in half lengthwise. Stuff each half with the sumac and dried tarragon. Drizzle with the olive oil. Bake for about 20 minutes or until the artichokes are tender and slightly browned. Drizzle the artichokes with the lemon juice and sprinkle with the red pepper. Top with cilantro.

Combine frozen cranberries and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover and simmer 15 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer 3 minutes longer. Remove from the heat and cool to room temperature. Pour into a bowl and refrigerate. Serve over turkey.

In a bowl, combine the first 3 ingredients. Rub the mixture onto both sides of the salmon. In a skillet heat the oil over medium heat. Add the tomatoes, vinegar and basil. Cook 3 minutes or until tomatoes are tender. Place the fish on a lightly greased grill rack coated with cooking spray. Grill 5 minutes on each side or until the fish just flakes when tested with a fork. Serve fish with the tomato mixture.
Name: Grilled Salmon with Balsamic GlazeIngredients: 2 Salmon Fillets 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil 1/2 teaspoon Minced Garlic 2 Tablespoons Balsamic Vinegar 1 Tablespoon Honey Salt and Pepper Preparation: Preheat the grill. Oil the fish lightly with the olive oil and sprinkle liberally with salt and pepper. Grill the fish over a hot fire until done. Mix the balsamic vinegar and honey in a bowl. Just before the fish is done, brush the glaze

In a medium saucepan, combine the sugar and water and bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook, without stirring, until the mixture reaches a deep amber color, about 7 to 10 minutes. Remove the saucepan from the heat and add the cream. Stir until smooth. Add the butter and salt and stir until melted. Pour the mixture into a large heatproof bowl. Let cool for about 1 hour and then stir in the vanilla. Add the nuts and mix well. Turn the mixture out onto a parchment paper lined sheet and form into logs. Wrap in waxed paper. Store in the refrigerator. To serve, dip the candy into the melted chocolate and let harden on a parchment paper lined sheet. Store the candy in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week.

Prepare pasta according to the directions on the package. In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt margarine. Stir in flour and cook until brown. Gradually add milk. Stir in salt and pepper to taste. Cook until thickened. Add shredded cheeses. Stir until melted. Stir in pasta. Transfer to a greased 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

Brown veal cubes and remove. Saute the onions and mushrooms. Blend together the flour and some of the whipping cream and stir into the mushrooms and onions. Return veal to the pan. Add white wine. Simmer until tender. Add lemon juice and sugar. Serve with spaetzle or noodles.

For apricot lemon glaze, combine apricot preserves, butter, lemons, corn syrup, and lemon juice in a small saucepan. Bring to boiling over medium heatboil 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Cool. For pineapple ginger glaze, combine pineapple juice, corn syrup, pineapple pieces, butter and liquid honey. Bring to boiling over medium-high heatboil 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Cool. For lime daiquiri glaze, combine daiquiri mix, lime juice, butter, liquid honey and lime peel. Bring to boiling over medium-high heatboil 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Cool. For all glazes, stir well. Brush over meatsbake at 350 F. for 45 minutes. Serve hot. Yield: 1 quart.

Heat olive oil over medium heat in a large pot. Add carrot, onion, and cauliflower. Cook until tender. Add water. Bring to a boil. Cover. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer 5 minutes. Add pasta and basil. Cook 4 minutes. Stir in cheese. Serve immediately.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the carrots and cook for about 8 minutes, or until crisp-tender. Drain well and return to the hot pan. Combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Pour the mixture over the carrots and toss to coat well. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl combine the melted butter, peanut butter, sugars and vanilla. Beat until creamy. Beat in the egg and mix thoroughly. In a separate bowl combine the flour, oats and baking soda. Slowly stir the dry ingredients into the wet mixture. Stir in the chocolate morsels. Drop by teaspoonfuls on greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 f for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper or silicone baking mat. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugars until smooth. Add in the eggs and beat for 1 minute or until combined. Add in the vanilla and salt and beat for an additional minute or until combined. Add in the baking soda and xanthan gum and mix for a few seconds until combined. Add in the pudding mix and mix until combined. Add in the gluten free flour and mix until combined. Stir in the pecans until evenly distributed. Place spoonfuls of dough on the cookie sheet and spread out with the back of a spoon until you have a round cookie about 1/2 inch thick. Bake in the preheated oven for 7 minutes or until the edges are just starting to turn golden brown. Allow the cookies to cool for a couple minutes on the cookie sheet and then remove to a wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium bowl combine margarine and sugars. Beat until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Add almond flavoring. In another bowl combine the flour, baking soda and salt. Gradually add to margarine mixture. Stir in white chocolate chips and almonds. Drop by teaspoonful on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until set. Let cool on cookie sheet for 2 minutes. Transfer to wire rack to cool completely.
name: white chocolate chunk almond cookiesingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, almond extract, flour, baking soda, salt, white baking chocolate, slivered almondspreparation:With an electric mixer cream the butter & sugar in a large bowl. Add the eggs one at a time until well blended. Add the almond extract. In a separate bowl combine the flour, baking soda, & salt. Gradually beat flour mixture into the butter mixture until well blended.

Bring water to boiling in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Remove from heatadd tea bags and spearmint sprigs. Let steep for 4 minutes. Remove tea bags and sprigsstir in sugar until dissolved. Refrigerate 2 hours or overnight. Remove mixture from refrigerator 1 hour before servingstir in vodka. Pour into a punch bowl. Serve over icegarnish with lemon and orange slices.

Prepare the chicken by boiling. Chop the vegetables. Add the chicken meat. Put the vegetables in. Add the chicken stock. Cook until it is thick. Add the soya sauce. Add the pea. Cook until the vegetables are tender. Strain. Beat the egg white with the cornstarch. Pour it into the soup. Sprinkle with the green onions. Serve hot.

Place green beans, onion and garlic in a large pot and add enough cold water to cover vegetables. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until beans are very tender. Drain. In a small bowl combine lemon juice, oil and salt and pepper. Toss vegetables with dressing and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine cream cheese, sugar and vanilla until blended. Add egg, beat well. Add sour cream, beat until smooth. Combine dry ingredients, add to creamed mixture just until moistened. Stir in pineapple with juice. Spoon into greased or paper-lined muffin cups, filling two-thirds full. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to wire rack. Dust with confectioners' sugar if desired.

Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook for 1 minute. Add the chickpeas and cook for 1 minute more. Add the tofu and cook for 3 minutes. Add the kale and cook for 5 minutes. Add the zucchini and cook for 3 minutes more. Add the lemon juice and zest. Serve over cooked rice.

Combine first 6 ingredients in a food processor. Cover and process until smooth. Spray 12 x 12 glass baking dish with cooking spray. Spread 1/4 of the ricotta mixture in baking dish. Place 4 flour tortillas on topbrush with cooking spray. Top with remaining 3/4 of ricotta mixture. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Cut into 16 squares. Garnish with cherries and cinnamon. Serve with tortilla chips.

Cook rice according to package directions. Cool. Combine sour cream and mayo. Add celery and chicken. Mix well. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Put lettuce leaves on plates. Top with salad, sprinkle with nuts.
In a large bowl, toss together the mixed greens and onion. Top with the cheese, dried cranberries, oranges and almonds. Drizzle with poppy seed dressing.

Place the tomatoes cut side up in a baking dish with the butter, garlic, orange zest and salt and pepper to taste. Bake 30-40 minutes, until the skin is softened. The tomatoes are ready to eat hot or at room temperature.

Waffle as per directions on box or machine. Top with apple pie filling and sprinkle with pecans and cinnamon. Serve with vanilla ice cream and drizzle with caramel topping.
Waffles are a delicious treat for breakfast or as a snack throughout the day. You can make them with all different types of ingredients and they will still be yummy! You can even try different flavor combinations, like cinnamon apple or sweet cream waffles.
Waffles are a type of food that can be made in a waffle maker. They are often eaten for breakfast, but can also be enjoyed as a snack or dessert. The most common type of waffle is the Belgian waffle, which is typically made with a batter that includes butter and eggs.
Waffles can be made from a variety of different recipes and can be eaten as a snack or as a meal. They can be made with different types of batter and can be eaten with different types of syrup or fruit. Waffles are a popular food in many countries and are often enjoyed as a breakfast food or as a

Combine and sift together the flour and cornflour. Add the coriander and stir to mix. Add the remaining ingredients and stir well to form a soft dough. Roll out on a floured board to 1/2cm thick. Using a 5cm round cutter, cut out rounds and set aside. Place in steamer basket over boiling water. Cook for 10-12 minutes until cooked through. Serve with dipping sauce.
The above recipe is from our family.
It is very popular here in Brazil.
It is very easy and delicious.

I'll try it and see what I think.
I'm sure I'll be back to let you know.
This is what I call real food.
It is nice to eat food that has not been tampered with by man.
We really enjoyed this recipe.
Our son does not like coriander and we tried this with out it and he really liked it.
He is not so keen on

Peel and chop 1 Hass avocado in a bowl. Add 2 tablespoons of chopped pistachio nut, 3 tablespoons of chopped fresh cilantro, 1 teaspoon of crushed red pepper flakes, and 1 tablespoon of fresh goat cheese. Stir to combine. Add salt and pepper to taste. Mash the mixture with a fork or potato masher until desired consistency. Serve on top of your favorite baked potato or salad as a side dish, or just with tortilla chips as a healthy dip.

In a medium bowl dissolve 3 packages of jello in boiling water. Let cool to 70 degrees F. Fold in cottage cheese, then refrigerate for 1 hour or until set. Fold in 1/2 the can of pineapple and half the coolwhip. Refrigerate for another hour or until firm. Garnish with remaining can of pineapple and remaining coolwhip. Makes 24 servings.

Heat a wok until smoking. Add cornflour and stir fry over high heat for 1 minute. Add sherry and pineapple and stir fry for 1 minute. Add sugar and stir fry for 1 minute. Add oil and stir fry for 2 minutes. Add green onion and bean sprouts and stir fry for 1 minute. Add tofu and stir fry until well coated. Serve with steamed rice.

Mix the egg, milk, sugar and vanilla in one container. Put the bread in another container. Dip the bread in the egg mixture. Dip the egged bread in the cinnamon. Put the bread in a pan or skillet and cook on each side until golden.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and dust a bundt pan. Combine all ingredients for filling, beat until smooth. Combine all cake ingredients. Spread half the batter in the prepared pan. Spread half the filling over the batter. Spread remaining batter over the filling. Spread remaining filling over the batter. Bake for about 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Turn out of the pan and let cool completely on a wire rack. Dust with confectioners' sugar before serving.

For the brine, combine 1 gallon of water with 2 teaspoons of kosher salt, 1 teaspoon of ground thyme, 1 tablespoon of juniper berries. Dissolve the salt in the cold water overnight or for at least 8 hours. Brine the turkey for 24 hours in the refrigerator. Remove from brine and discard brine. Pat dry with paper towels. Heat the olive oil in a large heavy-bottomed pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Once the oil is hot (you will know when you add the giblets to test it), add the giblets along with the carcass. Brown the giblets well. When the giblets are brown (approximately 5 minutes), remove them from the pot with a slotted spoon. Add the butter to the pot along with the chicken stock and sage. Bring the broth to a boil then reduce the heat to low. Cover the pot and simmer for 2 to 2 1/2 hours. When the broth is ready, preheat the oven

In a small saucepan, mix 3 cups of water with orange juice concentrate and 2 packets of the kool-aid mix. Stir to dissolve. Pour into a 9-inch pie plate. Beat cream cheese until creamy. Gradually beat in powdered sugar, until smooth. Beat in the heavy cream. Spread over the kool-aid mixture. Chill thoroughly before serving. Garnish with orange slices. Serve cold.

In a large stockpot over medium heat, bring the water to a boil. Add the yellow onion, carrot, celery, and parsley. Cook until tender. Add the corn kernels, sea salt, and black pepper. Cover the pot and simmer for 10 minutes. In a small bowl, stir together the maple syrup, corn starch, and water until smooth. Add to the pot and stir until thickened. Serve hot.

In a bowl combine flour, egg, cold water and salt and pepper until smooth. Chill. Melt 6 tbsps. butter in a pan. Cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan. Add zucchini to pan. Cook over low heat until tender. Add basil to pan. Remove from heat. Pour flour mixture into tart pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Serve warm. Makes one 9-inch tart.

Prepare beans according to directions on package. Add tomatoes and hambone. Pressure cook for 45 minutes. Remove bone. Add diced tomatoes, cooked ham, dried onions, garlic powder, and black pepper. Serve with cornbread or crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 350. In a bowl combine oil, garlic powder and seasoned pepper. Coat chicken with mixture. Place in a shallow baking dish. Bake for 40 minutes or until no pink remains in the center. Remove from oven. Top each piece of chicken with 2 slices of cheese and 1 tablespoon salsa. Return to oven for 3 minutes or until the cheese begins to melt.
Cook the potatoes in boiling water until tender. Drain and cool slightly. Put the potatoes in a large bowl and add the remaining ingredients, mixing well. Chill until serving time.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and garlicsaute 2 minutes. Stir in seasoningsaute 1 minute more. Stir in zucchini and summer squashcook 5 minutes longer or until tender. Sprinkle with cheese and serve.

Microwave egg or egg whites for 30 seconds or until heated through. Add water to mix eggs or egg whites with water until smooth. Add salt & pepper to taste. Cook for 1 minute, add more water if needed & repeat until fully cooked. Serve on toast or as desired.

Saute mushrooms, onion in bacon fat until tender, then add evaporated milk, sun-dried tomatoes and simmer for 2 minutes. Add pasta and toss with bacon bits, sour cream and parmesan cheese, black pepper and toss well. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix blueberries with 1 1/2 cups of the sugar and let stand 15 minutes. In a medium bowl, combine the blueberries with 1/4 cup of the flour. Combine the remaining 3/4 cup of flour with the 2 tablespoons of margarine or butter. Press half of the mixture on bottom of a 9 x 13 x 2-inch baking dish. Top with half of the blueberry mixture. Sprinkle half of the pecans. Repeat layers. Bake 30 minutes or until lightly browned. In a small saucepan, combine 2 cups of sugar with 1/2 cup water. Cook over medium heat until mixture boils and sugar is dissolved. Boil 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir cream cheese until melted. Add vanilla. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon cream. Remove from heat. Pour over warm dessert. Chill. Garnish with remaining pecans. Serves 8 to 10.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl, combine the crackers, onion, garlic powder, kosher salt, black pepper, basil, oregano and worcestershire sauce. In a large bowl combine the beef, 1/3 cup of the cracker mixture, the egg, and the water. Mix well. Form into 2 inch balls. Place in a 13x9 inch baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Add the remaining cracker mixture to the pan. Bake for an additional 15 minutes. Drain off excess fat. Serve with your favorite pasta.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Cut the bread in half lengthwise, then place on a baking sheet and toast in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 8 minutes. Rub the bread with the garlic cut side down. Mix the tomato halves, olive oil, italian seasoning in a bowl. Spread evenly over the toasted bread halves. Return to the oven for 1 minute. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese if desired. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Whisk together eggs, water, and salt until well-combined. Heat 2 tbsp of oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. When hot add half of the egg mixture and spread it into an even layer. Cook for about 3 minutes or until almost set but still runny. Sprinkle potato chips across the top of the egg layer and then add the second egg mixture and cook for another 3 minutes or until set. Flip out of the pan onto a plate and roll up into a tube or fold into halves and serve immediately.

In large pot or dutch oven saute the onions in the oil until soft. Add the rice and stir for a couple of minutes to get it coated with oil. Add the chicken broth, bouillon cube and water to the pot. Add the chicken breasts and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover the pot and simmer for about 30 minutes or until the rice is tender.
