Brown the kielbasa and drain grease. In a dutch oven or large pot, add chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Add potatoes, carrots, cabbage, seasonings, tomatoes and the kielbasa. Simmer for 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Serve hot.

Cut cooked potato in half and scoop out the insides leaving the shell intact. Combine the potato with remaining ingredients except extra cheese. Mash and mix well. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Fill potato skins with mixture and top with extra cheese. Bake at 425 until cheese melts and is golden brown.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the sweetened condensed milk and beat until well mixed. Stir in the flour and baking soda until well combined. Stir in the chocolate chips until evenly dispersed. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven until set. Remove from the cookie sheets and allow to cool on wire racks.
I have been making chocolate chip cookies for a few months now and have gotten a few tips from my aunt, who is a very good baker. My tips are: you don’t have to use a teaspoon measuring cup, just use a small spoon and put about 2 teaspoons of dough onto your baking sheet. I also find that the recipes that call for salt and soda taste better than the ones that don’t. My favorite recipe is the one from my aunt, which is

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, mustard and pepper. Spread the mixture on each side of the french baguette. Place the baguettes on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes or until crisp and lightly browned. Remove from oven and allow to cool. In a large bowl, combine the avocados, onion and cilantro. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Remove the crust from the baguettes and place on a platter. Top each with 1/2 of the avocado mixture and 2 slices of the prosciutto. Sprinkle with parmesan and serve. Makes 4 sandwiches.
Mix water and cornstarch, stirring until smooth. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in vinegar and seasonings. Add butter. Cool.
In a bowl, whisk together vinegar, mustard, honey, salt, and pepper. Add arugula. Drizzle with dressing. Top with cheese, pecans, and peach slices. Serve immediately.

Combine all ingredients. Refrigerate over night. Bake at 350 degrees for 2 hours.
Combine all ingredients. Refrigerate over night. Bake at 350 degrees for 2 hours.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Add more bouillon if you like a stronger beef flavor. Let it sit for about 15 minutes to soak all the flavor. Take wax paper, parchment paper or foil and cut 12 square shaped pieces. Lay the wax paper down on the counter, and make a patty from the meat and place on top, layer another sheet and patty up to 2 patties. I made 12 patties, but you can make bigger ones than i did. Place remaining patties and wax paper in a gallon sized freezer bag. Freeze nicely for up to a month. Pull them out as needed. Great grilled or even just placed in the broiler. Cooking time is about 10-15 minutes.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Mix thoroughly. Form into

In a large saucepan, combine the cauliflower florets with 1/2 cup water. Cover and cook over medium heat for about 10 minutes or until tender. Drain the cauliflower. In a large skillet or Dutch oven, melt 3 tablespoons butter. Add the onion and cook over medium heat until tender. Add the flour, stirring constantly, until well blended. Stir in the cooked cauliflower florets. Add the remaining 3 cups water. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat. In a blender or food processor, process the soup in batches until smooth. Return the soup to the saucepan. Stir in the milk and the cream cheese until smooth. Heat over medium heat until hot. Do not boil. Sprinkle with paprika. Serve with crackers. Makes 6 servings.

Heat the oil over medium heat in a wok or large skillet. Add the mushrooms and stir-fry until they release their liquid and are just about tender. Add the bok choy, and stir-fry until just wilted. Add the water and bring to a boil. Add the soy sauce, cornstarch mixture and salt. Cook, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens. Add the sugar and sesame oil to taste. Serve immediately with rice.

Spread each slice of bread with a thin layer of peanut butter. Sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar and a small amount of pumpkin pie spice. Place in a warm oven for a few minutes. Serve with a small amount of honey on top.

Pour the caramel sauce and brown sugar cinnamon syrup into a mug. Fill the mug with brewed espresso to the top. Add a splash of warm milk and top with whipped cream and a sprinkle of ground cinnamon. Serve immediately.

Brown the turkey in a skillet over medium-high heat. Drain well. Add the mushrooms, garlic, red pepper flakes, and cook until the mushrooms are done and the garlic is brown. Add the tomato sauce, water, crushed red pepper flakes, and season with salt and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, lower the heat, cover, and simmer until thickened, about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Scoop out the seeds of the bell peppers, then cut the peppers in half lengthwise and remove the stems. Stuff the bell peppers with the cooked couscous mixture. Place the stuffed bell peppers in a baking dish. Drizzle with a little of the cooking liquid from the meat sauce. Bake for about 25 minutes or until the bell peppers are tender.

Season both sides of the chops with salt& pepper. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the onions in oil for 2 minutes. Add the chops. Brown the chops for 2 minutes on each side. Remove the chops from the skillet. Add the remaining ingredients. Stir well. Pour the mixture over the chops. Simmer for 15 minutes. Serve over noodles or rice.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a bowl, mix together marmalade, mustard, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Place salmon fillets in a glass dish. Brush each fillet generously with marmalade mixture. Sprinkle each fillet with a small amount of ginger. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Heat oven to 200C/fan 180C/gas 6. Line 2 baking trays with baking parchment and place on a baking tray. Tip the marshmallows on to one of the trays and spread into an even layer. Bake for 12-15 mins or until puffed and golden, then turn onto the other baking tray and leave to cool completely. Meanwhile, put 3 tbsp of the thickened cream in a small pan and heat gently until just lukewarm. Pour over the marshmallows and stir to coat. Leave to cool for 30 mins or until set. Put the remaining thickened cream in an ice-cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions. Serve topped with the marshmallow topping and some chopped salted peanuts if you like.

In a large saucepan (preferably with a handle) melt margarine and marshmallows. Mix in cranberries and rice krispies. Press into a greased 13 x 9 x 2 inch dish. Cool and cut into squares. For a holiday treat, drizzle with melted chocolate.

Melt 3 tbsp butter over medium high heat in a large saucepan. Add scallions, garlic cloves, all-purpose flour & stir until well incorporated. Gradually stir in 1 1/2 cups chicken broth & 1 cup milk. Cook until mixture thickens, stirring constantly. Add 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley & 1/4 tsp salt. Stir in remaining broth & milk & simmer until broth is reduced by half. Add remaining 1/2 cup milk & heat through. Add mushrooms & cook until tender. Add tarragon & 1/4 tsp freshly ground black pepper. Add heavy cream & heat through. Garnish with parsley & serve.

Whisk the baking cocoa with the sugar in a medium bowl. Gradually add the water and milk and whisk until smooth. Add the vanilla and heat in the microwave 3 to 4 minutes or until hot. Top with whipped cream and sprinkle with the cinnamon.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. Serve chilled. Makes 6 servings.

Drain the tofu and pat dry using paper towel or kitchen roll. In a large bowl add the flour and mix well with a fork until well combined. In another bowl combine the water and rice wine vinegar until the sugar is dissolved. Heat the oil in a large frying pan until it is hot but not smoking. Carefully add the tofu, 2 at a time and fry until golden brown on each side. Drain the tofu on paper towel or kitchen roll and set aside while you make the dressing. In the same frying pan heat the sugar in the rice wine vinegar and water until the sugar is dissolved. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the chilli paste and cook for a further minute. Toss the fried tofu in the dressing and serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Shave each brussels sprout into thin slices using a mandoline. Put in a large bowl and toss with olive oil, salt and pepper until evenly coated. Spread the slices onto a parchment lined baking sheet and bake in the oven until browned and tender, about 25 minutes. Top with parmesan cheese and serve hot or at room temperature.

Place cocoa powder into heavy saucepan and mix with cinnamon and water until smooth. Stir in artificial sweetener or sugar substitute of your choice and vanilla extract. Heat on low until mixture begins to thicken. Pour into glass jar and store in refrigerator until ready to use.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two 8x4x2 inch loaf pans with butter or cooking spray. Sift together the flour, matcha, and baking powder into a large mixing bowlset aside. Cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffybeat in the eggs one at a time. Stir in the matcha mixture until combined. Pour batter into prepared loaf pans. Bake for 40 minutes, or until toothpick inserted into center of loaf comes out clean. Cool completely. Dust top of each loaf with powdered sugar just before serving.
What do you think of Matcha Green Tea Pound Cake?
Baked this for my husband's birthday yesterday and it was a huge hit! I baked it for 40 minutes and it was still moist, but next time I think I'll do 50 minutes to get the same texture as yours.
I made this tonight and it is soooo yummy! I used 2 tablespoons of matcha instead of 1 and

Pre-heat your oven to 375F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and place the almonds onto it. Drizzle the extra virgin olive oil and seasonings over the almonds and stir until the nuts are evenly coated and the seasonings are distributed over the nuts. Place the nuts into the pre-heated oven and roast for 25-30 minutes until the nuts are golden brown and crunchy. Remove from the oven and allow the nuts to cool completely before serving.

Preheat oven to 350f. Coat a 13x9x2-inch glass baking dish with 1 tablespoon oil. Cut each portabella into 4 wedges. Arrange in prepared pan. Bake 15 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile, combine remaining oil, garlic and thyme in a large bowl. Add artichokes, tomatoes, capsicum and olives. Toss to combine. Remove wedges from oven. Top each with a portion of artichoke mixture. Sprinkle with feta cheese. Bake 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Combine all ingredients in a non-metallic container. Place the meat in the container and cover it. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours and up to 24 hours. Remove the meat from the container, rinse the container and wipe with paper towels. Grill the steaks over direct heat to desired doneness. Slice the meat against the grain into thin strips. Serve.

In skillet over medium heat, saute marjoram and butter until butter is hot. Add venison chops and brown lightly on each side. Add mushrooms, port, salt & pepper to taste. Simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in sour cream.

Rinse greens thoroughly. Chop into bite-size pieces. In a crock pot, combine greens and chicken. In a bowl, combine apple cider vinegar and water and stir to blend. Pour mixture over greens and chickensprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high for 2-3 hours. Stir before serving. Serve over brown rice if desired.

Squeeze juice from lemons and oranges into a 16-ounce shaker or bowl. Add sugar, cover and shake hard to mix well. Add enough ice cubes to fill two-thirds full. Add water to cover ice. Cover and shake again. Pour into tall glass. Garnish with slices of lemon and orange.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Stir in green pepper and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, tomato juice and rice. Bring to boiling, cover and reduce heat to low. Cook for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally until rice is tender. Stir in frozen peas and continue to cook for another 15 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in ham.

In a blender or food processor, place butter, flour and salt and pepper. Mix until smooth. Add milk and blend until smooth. Heat potatoes and drain well. Arrange potatoes evenly in a greased 2 quart crock pot. Pour milk mixture over potatoes and sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Cover and cook for 4 to 6 hours on low or 3 hours on high.

Heat the oven to 400f. In an ovenproof skillet heat the oil over medium high heat until very hot. Add the tomatoes and cook until seared and slightly browned on both sides (about 1-2 minutes per side). Transfer the skillet to the oven and cook until the tomatoes are tender and slightly browned (about 10 minutes). Toss with the thyme. Makes 4 servings.

In a large bowl, combine the first five ingredients. Place a layer of oil on the bottom of the baking pan. Cut the biscuits in half and place on the oil. Spread the garlic mixture on top of the biscuits, then sprinkle with the cheese and the bell peppers. Bake until the cheese is melted and the biscuits are golden brown.

Cook noodles to desired tenderness. Drain in colander. Place butter or margarine in sauce pan used to cook noodles. Add noodles and toss to coat. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Serve immediately.

Combine cheese, bacon and flour in large bowl. Beat eggs in medium bowl. Combine milk and horseradish in small bowl. Stir milk mixture into eggs. Pour cheese mixture over eggs and stir just until blended. Pour mixture into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 375 for 50 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Cool for at least 1 hour before serving.
Beat together cream cheese and powdered sugar. Add the lemon zest. Gently fold in the cool whip. Spread on top of the cubed angel food cake. Top with the raspberry filling. Chill overnight.
Combine brownie mix and sweetened condensed milk. Heat in microwave for 45 seconds and stir. Stir in 1 cup of Heath Bar pieces. Shape in to balls and roll in powdered sugar. Store in refrigerator.

Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs and vanilla, then combine dry ingredients until well mixed. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 425f for 6-8 minutes or until set. Cool for 2 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.
Sometimes it is difficult to get a child to eat healthy foods. They would rather have candy and chips than anything that is good for them. While it can be difficult to get them to eat healthy foods it is not impossible. The following article contains several ideas that will help you get your child to eat healthy foods and have fun doing it.
When you are looking for something to serve at a dinner party that is healthy yet delicious, choose a dish of fruit for dessert. A fresh fruit platter can include a variety of seasonal fruit such as apples, pears, bananas, peaches and strawberries. Serve it with a simple vanilla yogurt dip or a creamy dressing.
If you have kids that are picky e

Heat oil in wok or heavy skillet over high heat. Add shanks, stirring to coat. Cook 1 minute. Add cinnamon and cook 1 minute more. Add honey and cook 30 seconds. Stir in soy sauce and cook 1 minute. Add stock and cook 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more. Pour over cooked rice and top with gai lan.

Combine oil and dill in small bowl. Preheat broiler. Place salmon on rimmed baking sheet and brush with oil mixture. Sprinkle with herbes de provence and broil on high until just done, about 8 minutes per side. Whisk mustard and vinegar in small bowl and serve with fish.
Fish is a great source of protein and also contains healthful omega-3 fatty acids, which have been linked with a reduced risk of heart disease and stroke.
In addition to providing protein and omega-3 fatty acids, fish is also low in saturated fat.
The omega-3 fatty acids found in fish may reduce the risk of heart disease and stroke.
In addition to its nutritional benefits, fish also makes a delicious and satisfying meal.
To cook fish on the stove top or grill pan, you’ll need to use a small amount of oil.
To broil fish in the oven, you’ll need to use a small amount of oil.
To bake fish in the oven, you’ll need to use a small amount of oil.
To fry

Mix together the milk, wine and flour and cook until thickened. Add butter and the cheddar cheese. Season with salt and pepper. In a large frying pan cook the eggs to your preference. Butter the english muffins and place the cooked eggs in the middle. Place the canadian bacon on top of the eggs. Spoon the cheddar mixture over the top and broil until hot.

Peel and chop apples. Combine all other ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to boil and simmer for about 10 minutes or until thickened. Cool. Lay out crescent rolls on a baking sheet. Cut each roll in half lengthwise. Spread about 1/2 tablespoon filling onto each half. Top with chopped nuts. Roll up from long end and place seam side down on baking sheet. Place on dehydrator trays and dehydrate at 140F for about 6 hours.

Boil the red bliss potatoes in the salted water until tender. In a large bowl toss the boiled potatoes with the fresh herbs. Melt the butter in the microwave then combine with the fresh herb potatoes. Melt the butter in the microwave then combine with the fresh herb potatoes. Season with black pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Cream together shortening and sugar. Add egg and lemon rind and mix well. Stir together dry ingredients and then add milk and lemon rind mixture and stir just until moistened. Stir in blueberries by hand. On a lightly floured surface roll out dough to about 1/2" thickness. Using a round biscuit cutter cut out circles and place on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 425f for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.

In a large bowl combine the noodles, soup, broth, sherry, chicken and cheese. Pour into a 2-quart casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes or until bubbly. Top with mushrooms and almonds. Bake 5 minutes more. Sprinkle on pimento before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour an 8-inch square pan. In a large bowl combine the first six dry ingredients. Set aside. In a medium bowl combine the oil and white sugar. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each. Add the carrots. Combine the dry and wet ingredients together. Fill the pan with the batter. Bake for 50 minutes or until the cake springs back when pressed in the center. Let cool. Mix the frosting ingredients together. Spread the frosting over the warm cake. Refrigerate until serving.
The best way to make these is to make sure your oven is preheated to 350. If it is not preheated correctly it could affect the cake.
Do not overcook the cake. The toothpick should come out clean.
I like to use a mixer to cream the butter and sugar. You can do this by hand also. Just mix the butter and sugar together until it is lighter in color.
Carrots are the main ingredient in

Beat egg whites with an electric mixer on low speed for 1 minute or until frothy. Increase speed to high and beat for 3 minutes or until soft peaks form. Beat in 1/3 cup sugar, 1 tsp cream of tartar and 1/4 tsp salt. Beat on high speed for 6 minutes or until stiff peaks form. Beat on low speed for 2 minutes or until glossy. Fold in 1/2 cup coconut and 1/2 cup pecans. Turn into a 13x9-in. baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire rack for 15 minutes or until completely cooled. Meanwhile, combine 1/2 cup boiling water, 1 tsp unflavored gelatin and 1 tsp unflavored gelatin in a bowl, stirring with a wire whisk 2 minutes or until completely dissolved. Stir in 1 1/4 cups cold water, 1/4 cup plus 1 tsp sugar and

1) Preheat oven to 325F degrees. Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking dish. Beat the egg whites and cream of tartar in a large bowl until they are stiff but not dry (peaks hold). Add the white sugar, brown sugar and vanilla and beat until smooth. Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt. Add the flour mixture to the egg white mixture and fold in gently until blended. Fold in the apples by hand. Pour the batter into the baking dish and bake for 40 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Serves 8-10.
name: low fat apple spice cake
ingredients: apple pie filling, spice cake mix, egg, egg whites
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray bundt pan with non stick cooking spray.
Combine all ingredients in bowl using hand mixer, until well blended. The apples should be pretty well pulverized. Pour into bundt pan. Bake for approximately 40

Heat oil in pressure cooker. Brown roast on all sides. Remove from pressure cooker. In a small bowl combine salad dressing mixes and broth. Pour over top of roast. Place in pressure cooker. Close lid. Cook for 30 minutes. Let pressure release naturally for 5 minutes. Remove lid. Skim fat off top of liquid. Serve.

Cook bacon until crisp in a skillet over medium-high heat. Drain on paper towels. Blanch the brussel sprouts in a large pot of boiling water for 3 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and plunge into ice-cold water for a minute. Drain thoroughly. Toss with the sour cream mixture in a baking dish. Sprinkle with bacon. Bake for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with the parsley before serving.

Place the rinsed red lentils in a pot with the ginger and ground turmeric. Cover with water. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat to low and simmer until the lentils are tender. Stir in the salt, cayenne pepper, vegetable oil, onion flakes and cumin seeds. Simmer for a few minutes. Serve hot with chapatis or rice.

Cut angel food cake into bite size pieces and place in 13x9 pan. Layer half of the pieces with half of the sliced strawberries and half of the chocolate. Repeat layers and top with cool whip. Chill for several hours before serving.

In a bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and salt. Cut in butter with pastry blender until crumbly. Stir in enough ice water (I used about half of the amount specified in the recipe) just until dough comes together. Pat into a ball. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough with a lightly floured rolling pin to about 1/4 inch thickness. Cut with a lightly floured biscuit cutter (I used a drinking glass), then place on an ungreased cookie sheet (or parchment lined cookie sheet) about 1 inch apart. Bake for about 15 minutes until lightly browned on bottom. Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, combine the broth, chicken and chicken broth cubes until the broth is just simmering (don't let it boil). Cover and simmer for about 15 minutes until chicken is cooked through (it will still be a little pink). Remove the chicken pieces from the broth (use two forks) and shred the meat into the bro
In a saucepan, combine milk and cocoa. Add sugar. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter and oil. Stir in dry ingredients. Drop by spoonful onto waxed paper. Allow to cool.

Brown the meat in a skillet with the vegetables. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Pour into a greased 2-quart casserole dish. Cover tightly with foil and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Uncover, sprinkle with the cheese. Bake another 15 minutes or until the top is lightly browned. Serve with salad or greens.

Pour canned pumpkin pie filling into 2 1/2 quart microwave proof bowl. Add applesauce and stir until smooth. Stir in honey and lemon rind until smooth and well mixed. Cook on high 10 minutes, stirring every 2 minutes. Add pumpkin pie spice and stir well. Cook 1 minute longer. Pour into sterilized jars or plastic containers and let cool. Refrigerate and enjoy.

Place frozen cauliflower in a crock pot. Add water to cover. Stir in celery ribs, onion, and chicken stock. Cover with lid. Cook 8 hours or until vegetables are tender. Stir in the cream, Worcestershire sauce, and cheese. Stir until melted. Makes 6 servings. Serve with bread.

Mix all-purpose flour, cornmeal, fast-rise yeast, sugar, salt and eggs together. Stir in milk and oil. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead until dough is smooth, adding more flour if necessary. Divide dough into two pieces. Shape one piece into a rectangle 12 inches long by 8 inches wide. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Brush with beaten egg yolk. Shape the other piece into a rectangle 12 inches long by 6 inches wide. Place on top of the first rectangle. Brush with egg yolk. Cut 8 slits in each rectangle about 1 1/2 inches apart. Cover with a damp cloth and let rise until doubled, about 20 minutes. Bake at 400 degrees f for 25-35 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Remove from pan. Spread with pizza sauce and top as desired.

Rub chicken breasts with lemon juice and salt and pepper and saute until browned on both sides. Add butter and metaxa brandy. Cook for 1 minute. Add cream and cook until thickened. Garnish with basil.

Wash the tomatoes. Dice the garlic. Cut the bacon into small pieces. Heat the olive oil in a pan. Add the garlic, tomatoes and herbs. Season with sugar, salt and pepper. Simmer for a few minutes. Cut the mascarpone into cubes. Add the mascarpone and the rindless bacon to the tomatoes. Cook for a few minutes. Serve with pasta.
Brown meat with onion in a Dutch oven or other 4-quart pot. Add remaining ingredients. Heat to boilingcover. Reduce heat. Simmer 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Makes 6 servings.

In saucepan combine raspberries, lime juice, and water. Bring mixture to a simmer, reduce heat to low. Cook until mixture thickens, approximately 10 minutes. Pour mixture through fine mesh strainer into mixing bowl. Press on solids to release juices. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Pour mixture into shallow metal pan (I use 9 x13). Freeze approximately 2 hours or until mixture is slushy and not frozen solid. Stir mixture every 30 minutes until it is thickened and crystallized. Serve in individual bowls with champagne drizzled over top or in chilled champagne flutes. Serve immediately.
name: chilled raspberry soupingredients: cold raspberries, unsweetened cocoa powder, sugar, whipping cream, vanilla extractpreparation: Place berries in blender containeradd cocoa powder and sugarprocess until smooth. Add creamprocess until smooth again. Stir in vanilla. Refrigerate until chilledstir before serving. Serve coldgarnish with whipped cream and

Cook pork in a pan with the peas for 10 minutes. Slice the pork into thin pieces. Set aside. Heat wok or skillet with bacon fat until hot. Then add the green pepper and onion. Fry until the onions are translucent. Add the cabbage and carrots, stir for 2 minutes. Remove from heat then add the pork and peas. Stir well. Add the rice and stir until well blended. Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with soy sauce. Serve immediately.

To make the dressing, combine the vinegar, sugar, and olive oil and refrigerate. Crumble the ramen noodles and combine them with the coleslaw mix and the almonds and sunflower seeds. Mix the dressing with the mixture and serve.

Beat together the eggs, cream cheese and garlic powder. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Heat the butter and olive oil in a frying pan and add the egg mixture. Cook, stirring constantly for 1 minute. Cook for another 2-3 minutes or until the eggs are just set. Remove from the heat and sprinkle with the dill and serve immediately.

Place 6 fresh raspberries in the bottom of each glass. In a cocktail shaker combine the vodka, orange liqueur, simple syrup and lime juice. Shake well and pour over raspberries and top with cranberry juice. Garnish with additional raspberries and sprigs of rosemary.

Cook lentils according to package directions. Drain and cool. Toss lentils with balsamic vinegar and olive oil. Add salt and pepper to taste. Divide lentils among 4 serving plates. Top each with a grape tomato and a slice of mango and avocado. Sprinkle with cilantro.
Combine first three ingredients. Mix well. Add remaining ingredients and mix thoroughly. Spread in a shallow baking dish. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for one hour.

Shred the carrots with a food processor. Add all ingredients except the oil to the food processor and process until smooth. Stir in the oil until blended. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. This recipe is best when it's chilled.

Mix apples with strawberries and rhubarb in a bowl. Add the sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg and the butter. Mix well. Pour into a baking dish. Crumble the oatmeal, brown sugar and butter in a separate bowl until it resembles coarse meal. Sprinkle the mixture over the fruit mixture and bake for 45 minutes in a preheated oven at 400 degrees F. Let cool for a few minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 180 C / Gas Mark 4. Grease and base line a 9" cake tin. Cream the butter and the sugar together until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time and the vanilla essence. Sift in the self raising flour and the milk and mix well together. Pour into the tin and bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes. Leave to cool in the tin for 10 minutes before turning out on to a wire rack to cool completely.

Boil 6 cups of water in large pot or kettle on stove. Put 4 family-size tea bags in a large bowl or pitcher. Pour boiling water over and steep for 5 minutes. Discard tea bags. Pour the remaining 3 cups of cold water into pitcher. Stir in lemonade concentrate and sugar until dissolved. Stir in remaining 3 cups of cold water, if desired. To serve, pour into tall glasses filled with ice. Top with ginger ale. Garnish with lemon slice. Makes about 5 servings.

Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add asparagus and cook until just tender. Drain. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add flour and cook 2 minutes or until lightly browned. Whisk in lemon juice and curry powder until smooth. Gradually add milk. Cook until thickened and bubbly. Add sour cream and hot pepper sauce. Cook until heated through. Add tuna and asparagus and gently toss until asparagus is coated with the sauce. Serve over rice.

Mix the mayonnaise, lime juice, red wine vinegar, sour cream, blue cheese, and louisiana hot sauce together. Add the olive oil to make the salad dressing creamy. Add the salt to taste. Add the louisiana hot sauce to taste. Refrigerate overnight to allow the flavors to blend. The longer the better.

Mix water, soy sauce, lemon juice, and tomato paste. Heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add chicken breasts and sprinkle both sides of the meat with garlic. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes per side. Add water mixture to pan. Cover pan and simmer 10 to 15 minutes or until internal temperature of the chicken is 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Add the lemon juice and parsley. Serve over pasta.

Mix together the cornbread-muffin mix, milk, and eggs according to the directions on the box. Stir in the ham, cheese, and onion. Spoon into a greased 12-cup muffin pan. Bake at 375 for 15-18 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 12.

Place chicken in the bottom of a 10-inch clay pot or Dutch oven. In a bowl, toss carrots, potatoes, garlic, parsley, caraway seed and Italian dressing. Spoon potato mixture over the chicken. Cover the top with cling wrap. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Uncover the clay pot and bake 30 minutes more. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

Cook the linguine according to the package directions. While the pasta is cooking, melt 1 tablespoon butter in a skillet. Saute the garlic until golden. Set aside. Drain the pasta and return it to the pot. Add the melted butter and the remaining tablespoon of butter. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add the braised garlic and the parmigiano-reggiano cheese. Toss to coat. Add the balsamic vinegar and the brown sugar. Toss again to combine. Serve immediately.

Cut lamb into 5cm cubes. Heat a large non-stick frying pan over high heat. Add barbecue sauce, sweet chili sauce, ginger and garlic. Cook until fragrant. Add lamb. Stir to coat with sauce. Cook until browned. Turn lamb over. Add honey. Stir. Serve.

Place the seitan in a food processor and pulse until smooth. Transfer to a shallow baking dish and bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 minutes. Heat the oil in a wok or a skillet over high heat. Add the carrots and broccoli and stir fry until crisp tender. Remove from the heat and set aside. Cook the soba noodles according to package directions. Stir the seitan and teriyaki sauce into the hot soba. Add the broccoli and carrots and toss to coat.

In a large pot over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the onion and saute until tender. Add the all-purpose flour and stir until it is evenly blended with the onions. Add the chicken stock to the pot. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Add the paprika and the broccoli. Simmer for about 10 minutes or until the broccoli is tender. Stir in the cheese. Cook until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

In a tall glass, crush the mint with a muddler. Add the lime juice and sugar. Muddle lightly. Add ice cubes and the rum. Pour in pomegranate juice. Top with soda water. Garnish with a sprig of mint and a wedge of lime.

Peel the baking potatoes and slice into 1/4-inch thick roundssteam them for about 10 minutes or until tender. While the potatoes are cooking, cut the yellow squash into 1/2-inch thick roundssteam them for about 8 minutes or until tender. Drain the steam from the potatoes and the squashrinse with cold waterdrain wellplace the potatoes into one bowl and the squash into another bowllet them cool completely, about 15 minutesstir the flour into the bowl with the potatoestoss to combinetransfer the mixture to a plate or baking sheetspread the flour mixture out into a thin layerset aside. Heat the oil for deep-fryingheat it to 375 degrees Fdip the flour-coated potato slices into the beaten eggdrain off the excess eggthen dip into the flour mixturefry the slices in the hot oil for 3 minutes or until golden brownremove the fried slices from the hot oil with tongsplace them on paper towelssprinkle

Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the potato and cook until tenderdrain and mash. Melt the bacon drippings over medium heat until hot. Add the onions and cook until tenderstir in the sugar and pepper. Stir in the mashed potato and milk and heat through. Stir in the clams and season with salt and pepper.
In a food processor combine all of the dressing ingredients. Process until smooth. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Just before serving add the granola and the garbanzo beans. Mix and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 f. Combine first 6 ingredients in a large bowl. Beat at medium speed with an electric mixer until well blended. Combine next 4 ingredients in a small bowl. Add to the egg mixture. Beat at low speed just until moistened. Pour batter into a greased 10 x 4 loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Remove from pancool completely on a wire rack. Spread with butter and serve.

Heat vegetable oil in a medium-sized pot over medium heat. Add the sliced onions and cook until they turn golden. Add the lentils, cover with water, bring to a boil then reduce the heat to low. Simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

Cook the noodles in boiling water until tenderdrain and set aside. Saute the caraway seeds in butter until browned and crispset aside. Butter a baking dish (9x12 or 11x14) and layer the cooked noodles on the bottom of the dish. Layer the slices of corned beef over the noodlessprinkle with half the caraway seeds and half the sauerkraut. Sprinkle the cheese over the corned beefpour the thousand island over the top and sprinkle with the remaining caraway seeds and the remaining sauerkraut. Pour the milk over the top and bake at 350 for one hour. The casserole will be bubbling around the edges when donedo not overbake. Serves six.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 9 x 13 pan with butter or spray with non stick cooking spray. In large bowl combine potatoes and 2 cups milk. Mash with potato masher until smooth. In small bowl combine remaining 1/2 cup milk with parmesan cheese, garlic powder and butter until creamy. Add potatoes and chicken to the small bowl. Stir until chicken is coated thoroughly. Spread in prepared pan and bake uncovered for 45 minutes.

Cut the cauliflower into florets and chop the carrots. Add the carrots to the cauliflower. Toss together. Mix the onion, capers and parsley together. Add the mustard and vinegar. Slowly add the olive oil until you reach the consistency of your liking. Pour the dressing over the cauliflower/carrot mixture. Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour before serving.

Place chicken in large resealable plastic bag. Add dried chipotle powder and shake to coat. In a small bowl, combine picante sauce and sour cream. Add half the mixture to bag and shake to coat. Add the rest and shake to coat. Grill or broil the chicken until it is done. Serve on the buns, sprinkled with cheese and topped with the green onion.

Place the sherry in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook until the sherry is reduced by half. Set aside. Whisk the vegetable oil into the reduced sherry. Whisk in the shallots. Add the olive oil in a steady stream while whisking. Season the vinaigrette with the kosher salt and the pepper. Add the spinach to a large mixing bowl. Pour the dressing over the spinach. Gently toss to coat evenly. Top with the gorgonzola. Toss again. Scatter the nuts over the top. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan, cover beans with waterbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 5 minutes or until tender-crisp. Drainreturn to the pan. Add the buttertoss to coat. Combine the flour, pepper, salt and sugarstir into the pan with the onions. Add the sour creammix well. Transfer to a greased 2-quart baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutessprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Sprinkle with the breadcrumbsbake 5 minutes longer or until lightly browned. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350. Spread one side of bread with mustard. Top with ham and 1/2 of the cheese. Beat eggs and milk togetherpour over sandwich. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake 20 minutes or until puffed and golden. Cut sandwich into wedges and serve.
If you have any recipes with ham please email me. Thanks.

Sift the flour in a medium bowl. In a medium saucepan over medium heat melt the butter with the sharp cheddar cheese, stirring constantly until it is melted. Remove from heat and pour the mixture over the sifted flour stirring to combine. Place the bowl in the refrigerator until it is cold and then roll out the dough to about 1/4 inch thick. Cut out the shapes you want with a pastry cutter or knife. Bake at 350 degrees until they are golden brown.

In a medium to large sized sauce pan saut the leeks, onion and garlic cloves in the butter for 10 minutes over medium heat. Do not brown or burn the leeks. After 10 minutes add the water and red potatoes. Season with salt and pepper to taste, cover and cook for 10 minutes. Add the low sodium chicken broth and cook until potatoes are tender about 20 to 30 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Puree the mixture in a blender or food processor until smooth. Stir in the whipping cream. Taste for seasoning and serve with plain yogurt sprinkled with fresh tarragon leaves.

Steam the sugar snap peas until tender (about 2 minutes). Combine cream cheese with mango chutney (or lemon juice) in a mixing bowl. Fold in the milk (or water), then the curry powder. Spoon the mixture onto the warm peas, then garnish with the roasted peanuts.

Combine egg and milk, set aside. Sift together remaining ingredients and then stir into egg mixture. Mix well and let sit for at least an hour. Roll fish into mixture and then deep fry until golden brown. Remove from oil and drain on paper towels. Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.

Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the asparagus and cook for 3 minutes. Add the melon to the boiling watercook for 3 minutes. Remove the vegetables from the boiling water using a slotted spoon. Set aside. In a medium bowl combine the wine and mustard. Add the vegetables to the saucetoss gently. Place the vegetables on a serving platter. Garnish with orange rind and hazelnuts. Sprinkle blue cheese over the top. Serve immediately.

Combine all the marinade ingredients and pour over meat. Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours. Heat the grill. Cook the steaks for 4 minutes per side for medium. To serve, add bacon and onion to the hot tortilla and top with meat, avocado, and cheese. Serve with salsa.

Cut red peppers in half lengthwise. Remove seeds. Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add onions and cook until tender, about 6 minutes. Add black beans and cook until heated through. Add the corn and cook until tender. Add the rice and cook until heated through. Season with the cumin and chili powder. Spoon half the mixture into each red pepper. Top with cheese. Cover with foil. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove the foil and bake until the cheese is bubbly. Serve with salsa and sour cream.

Beat egg and add to butter and milk mixture in small bowl. Stir in milk. Combine dry ingredients in another small bowl. Add to mixture with egg and milk. Fill greased or paper lined muffin cups about 2/3 full with mixture and bake at 400 for 20 minutes or until golden on top and firm to the touch.

In a heavy skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add onions and cook, stirring, until translucent, about 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add rice and cook until pale golden, about 5 minutes. Add 1 1/2 teaspoons of salt. Pour in the broth and stir until combined. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer covered, until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender, about 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and let stand, covered for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Serve immediately.

Mix together graham crackers and melted butter. Press into 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 5 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool. Beat together cream cheese and powdered sugar. Fold in peanut butter and milk. Pour into pie shell. Refrigerate. Top with chocolate syrup, caramel syrup, chocolate chips, roasted peanuts. Let stand at room temperature for 5 minutes before serving. Store leftover in freezer.

Combine onion with 1/4 cup water in a small bowl. Set aside. In a small skillet, combine brown sugar with 1/2 cup whiskey and the water mixture. Bring to a boil for 2 minutes until thickened, stirring occasionally. Stir in onion mixture, dijon and cider vinegar until smooth. Place 1/2 cup flour in a small bowl or the bottom of a dry measuring cup. Dip a meat thermometer into the flour to coat the tip, then dip into the hot whiskey mixture to coat the tip again. Place the ham steaks in a large skillet and pour the remaining whiskey mixture over the steaks. Bring to a boil for 1 minute then reduce heat to medium low. Simmer for 5 minutes per side or until heated through. Spoon the whiskey mixture over the ham steaks and serve immediately with sliced onions if desired.

Prepare the sultanas. Put a little water into a kettle and put it on to boil. Put the sultanas into a small bowl, then cover them with boiling water and set them aside. Peel and finely grate the ginger into a small mixing bowl. Finely grate half the rind from the lemon and then from the orange into the bowl. Squeeze the juice from half of the lemon and then from half of the orange and add it to the ginger in the mixing bowl. Stir in the sour cream or yogurt and set the dressing aside. Peel the carrots and grate them into a serving bowl. Drain the sultanas and add them. Stir the dressing into the carrots and sultana mixture, then season with salt and add honey or sugar to taste. Finally, stir in the chopped nuts and serve.

Preheat oven to 375. Peel, core and slice apples. In a large bowl, combine the apples and the next four ingredientstoss gently to coat apples. In another bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder and saltcut in the margarine until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in the egg and the vanillamix well. Sprinkle the mixture over the top of the fruit mixture. Bake for 45 minutes or until the fruit is tender and the topping is golden brown. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Combine cabbage, scallions, noodles and almonds. Melt butter in frying pan. Brown noodles, almonds and sesame seeds in butter. Set aside. Make dressing by combining the remaining ingredients. Combine dressing with cabbage mixture. Chill at least 30 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Combine dry ingredients in a medium bowl. Beat together eggs and oil in a smaller bowl. Stir together wet and dry ingredients. Add honey and orange juice to mixture and stir to combine. Divide batter evenly into 12 greased or paper-lined muffin cups. Bake for 18 to 22 minutes until tops are golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Cool completely on a rack.

Mix together margarine and sugars. Add vanilla and mix until creamy. Add water and stir until well blended. Add dry ingredients and mix until well blended. Fold in oats and chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 for about 10 minutes. Let cool on pan for about five minutes. Remove to a cooling rack and cool completely.

Combine dry ingredients in a bowl. Combine wet in another bowl. Mix dry and wet together. Roll out on a floured surface to about 1/4 inch thick. Cut with a floured 2 inch circle cutter. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes. Allow to cool on a rack.

Boil pasta roni according to directions. Drain. In a separate bowl combine the tuna, butter flavored cracker crumbs and italian seasoning. Stir to coat. Add the pasta and mix. Pour into a 13x9 inch casserole dish. Melt the butter in a sauce pan and pour over pasta. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
Put the pasta in the pot. Add water and salt. Cook until pasta is done. Add the milk and stir constantly. When it boils add the butter. Cook for 5 more minutes. Add sugar and salt. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Slice potatoes thin and separate slices. Lightly spray an 8x8 pan with cooking spray. Layer half of the potatoes in the pan. Sprinkle with half the onions and bacon. Dot with half the roast beef, cheese and eggs. Repeat layers with remaining potatoes, bacon and beef. Sprinkle with worcestershire sauce and season with salt and pepper to taste. Bake 15-20 minutes or until potatoes are tender and lightly browned. Serves 4-6.

Cook broth and chilies in a large stock pot over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and add corn, tomatoes and chicken. Simmer for about an hour or until the chicken is tender and the flavors meld. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with tortilla chips.

Cut up the onion in half and slice into thin rounds. Cut up the potatoes into bite size pieces. Brown the sausage. In a large saucepan over medium heat, add the onion and cook until translucent. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the broth. Add the potatoes. Bring to a boil. Cook until the potato is tender. Add the sausage and cook for 5 minutes. Add the spinach. Stir in the heavy cream. Season with salt and pepper. Heat through. Serve topped with Parmesan cheese.

Combine cooked and drained sausage with cooked and drained velveeta until well blended. Add 1/2 cup of grape jelly and mix well. Divide into squares and place in ungreased 8x8 pan. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Cook bacon until crisp. Cut into 1" pieces and set aside. Slice mushrooms and onion into thin slices. Cook until tender. Add bacon to saute pan. Add wine and cook for 1 minute. Add beans. Heat through. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.

Cut the avocados in halfremove the pitsand scoop out the flesh into a medium bowl. Add the salt and lime juicemash the avocados with a fork until they are chunky. Fold in the tomatoes, onion, and cilantrocover, and refrigerate for 30 minutes or up to 2 hours before serving. Serve with chips or use as a topping for tacos or enchiladas.

For dressing combine oil and lemon juice in a bowl and whisk until well blended. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside. In a bowl toss together the remaining ingredients. Add the dressing and toss to coat well. Cover and chill until serving time. Serve with lettuce leaves.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Place chicken in a large resealable plastic bag. Combine all remaining ingredients. Add to bag and close tightly. Shake to coat. Heat a heavy bottomed skillet over medium-high heat. Add a little oil to pan to coat. Add chicken and brown for about 3 minutes. Add remaining liquid and cook until boiling. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer for about 20 minutes or until a thermometer reads about 165 degrees. Serve with rice or pasta.

Heat a medium skillet over medium-low heat. Add the onions and a pinch of salt, and saute until translucent and browned around the edges. Increase the heat to medium-high and add the sugar and water. Stir well and simmer for about 5 minutes until the liquid evaporates and the onions are caramelized. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. In a small bowl, combine the mustard and the soy sauce and set aside. Coat the pork with the mustard mixture and sprinkle with the salt and the pepper. Bake for about 30 minutes. After the first half hour, remove the pork from the oven and brush the onions over the loin. Continue baking until the internal temperature is 160 degrees fahrenheit and the loin is very brown on the outside. Remove the loin from the pan and let it rest for at least five minutes before slicing and serving. Serve the onions on the side.

Directions for fish cooked on grill : In a small bowl combine onion, garlic and fish sauce. Mix well. Rub evenly on both sides of fish. Sprinkle with salt. Cook fish over medium high heat about 6 minutes or until fish is opaque in center. Turn fish over, sprinkle with salt. Cook 4-5 minutes more. Remove fish from grill. Turn off grill. Drizzle fish with some of the lemon juice. Remove fish from grill and serve. Directions for fish cooked in skillet : In a small bowl combine onion, garlic and fish sauce. Mix well. Rub evenly on both sides of fish. Sprinkle with salt. Cook fish in skillet over medium high heat about 6 minutes or until fish is opaque in center. Turn fish over, sprinkle with salt. Cook 4-5 minutes more. Remove fish from skillet. Turn off stove. Drizzle fish with some of the lemon juice. Remove fish from skillet. Turn off stove. Drizzle fish with some of the lemon juice. Remove fish from skillet. D
Sprinkle fish with salt and nutmeg. Coat fish with flour. Fry in hot fat. Sprinkle fish with onions. Combine orange juice and lemon juice. Pour over fish. Bake in a slow oven.

Combine all-purpose flour, butter, egg yolks, and salt with your hands until smoothgradually add milk and stir just until dough is soft enough to roll outroll out to 1/4-inch thickness on lightly floured surfacecut with floured 2-inch round cutterplace 1-2 tsp jam or plum on eachfold over to form half-moon shapepinch edges to sealplace on baking sheetbake at 375° for 15-20 minutes or until golden browndust with confectioners sugar if desired.

Mix dry ingredients. Mix eggs and cream style corn together. Add to dry mixture and mix well. Heat oil in large frying pan. Add mixture to pan in tablespoon sized mounds. Cook until bubbles break on surface. Turn and cook other side until golden. Serve with sour cream.
Mix all ingredients in a large bowl. Pour into a glass baking dish and sprinkle with the colby-monterey jack cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes. Serve with chips or crackers.

Melt margarine in double boiler or microwave. Add cocoa and mix well. Add corn syrup and vanilla and mix well. Remove from heat and add krispies and icing sugar. Pour into greased pan. Chill. Cut into squares.

Boil potatoes and mash well. Add milk and mix well. Add soup and mix well. Pour into 13x9x2 glass baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 45 minutes. Top with ham slices. Bake for another 15 minutes.
Pour brewed coffee into a large glass or mug. Add chocolate square and stir. Add cinnamon and stir. Gradually add milk while stirring. Top with whipped topping. If desired, add vanilla extract.

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease a 13x9-inch baking dish with shortening or cooking spray. Prepare chicken according to package directions. Cut into strips and set aside. In a large bowl, combine the Bisquick and milk until the Bisquick is just moistened and blended. Spread half the mixture in the bottom of the prepared dish. Sprinkle with half the chicken and half the onion and enchilada sauce. Sprinkle with half the taco seasoning and half the cheese. Repeat layers. Bake for 20 minutes or until the casserole is golden brown and the filling is heated through. Sprinkle with the remaining tortilla chips and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut the spaghetti squash in half. Remove the seeds. Place cut side down on a baking sheet. Bake for 1 hour. Remove from the oven. Remove the strands from the skins using a fork. Combine the bacon bits, evaporated milk, egg substitute, nutmeg, parmesan cheese, salt, and white pepper in a bowl. Stir until well combined. Toss the bacon mixture in the cooked spaghetti squash strands. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

Muddle mint with a splash of lemonade and a couple of blueberries in a shaker. Add lime juice and sugar. Shake with ice and strain into a collins glass. Top with seltzer and stir. Garnish with a sprig of mint and a lime slice.
Sprinkle a tablespoon of powdered chocolate in a tall glass. Add 4 tablespoons of milk and stir with a fork until well blended. Add a few drops of almond flavoring. Add a scoop of chocolate ice cream, stir well and serve.
Cream butter and sugar. Beat in eggs, one at a time, until smooth. Combine flour and baking powder. Add to creamed mixture. Fold in blueberries. Drop by spoonfuls onto greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Makes 3 dozen.
Mix 2 cups sugar and 2 cups flour. Add 1/2 cup butter. Press firmly into a 13x9 inch baking pan. Bake 1

Combine all ingredients in a jar with a tight fitting lid. Shake well to blend ingredients and store in a dry cool place. To make a dip, combine 1/2 cup ranch style dressing mix with 1/2 cup sour cream and 1/2 cup mayonnaise. Serve with vegetables or chips. To make a salad dressing combine 1/2 cup ranch style dressing with 1 cup mayonnaise and 2 teaspoons of lemon juice. Serve with salad greens.

Hard-boil 2 eggs, peel and cut into quarters. Butter a small bowl, melt butter over low heat in a saucepan. When it is hot (not boiling) crack in egg quarters one at a time and let cook for 45-50 seconds on each side. Transfer to the bowl, add salt & pepper to taste. Serve hot on a slice of white bread.

In a large saucepan combine cider, frozen raspberry concentrate and sugar. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered until raspberry concentrate is dissolved and mixture is hot, about 5 minutes. Stir in cinnamon stick and heat to serving temperature. Remove from heat and serve. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Mix pudding according to package directions. Add milk and orange juice concentrate and beat until well blended. Add fruit and refrigerate at least 30 minutes. Beat sour cream until blended and fold into mixture. Spoon into individual glasses and serve.

Heat the olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally for 3 minutes or until softened. Add chili pepper and cook for 1 more minute. Add the long grain rice and stir to combine. Add the chicken stock and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer covered for 15 minutes or until all the liquid is absorbed. Add the baby spinach to the pan and stir to combine. Season to taste with salt. Transfer to a serving bowl and garnish with freshly chopped dill and a spoonful of yogurt. Serve immediately.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Combine margarine, flour and water. Cook until thick and smooth. Add tuna and peas. Heat until warm. Add milk and heat through. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add sliced mushrooms. Heat and serve.
I make this for my grandkids when they are here for a few days.
This is the best casserole recipe I ever had.

Combine 1/3 cup key lime juice and 2 tablespoons white tequila. Marinate chicken breasts for 2 hours in refrigerator. Drain and grill on medium heat for about 10 minutes per side. Slice chicken and serve with sliced tomatoes and onion and salsa on the side.
Beat eggs. Place flour, salt and pepper in a plastic bag. Add the livers to the bag. Shake to coat. Heat oil in a skillet. Brown the coated livers. Drain. Add lemon juice to taste. Serve hot.

Heat vegetable oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat until oil shimmers. Season wings evenly with salt and pepper and fry in oil in batches until golden brown on both sides, about 4 minutes per batch, turning often. Transfer wings to a large plate lined with paper towels and let cool slightly, then cut into pieces about 3 inches long. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 2 minutes. Add hot sauce, vinegar and sugar. Bring mixture to a boil and cook until thickened, 5-7 minutes. Add wings and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Prepare a pot of hot water. Place the pot on a burner set on low heat. Add the dark chocolate to a saucepan. Add milk. Stir. Place saucepan on burner set on medium heat. Heat to melt the dark chocolate. Add butterscotch schnapps to taste. Stir. Add marshmallows to taste. Serve hot.

Combine butter and sugar in a saucepan over medium heat until melted. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the flour, lemon juice and zest until well mixed. Place in a 13x9x2 glass baking dish. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and add the cream and milk. Whisk until well blended. Return to the oven until the custard is set, about 15 minutes more. Serve warm or cold.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Cut sausages into slices and place in shallow baking pan. Add onion to pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until browned. Meanwhile mix sauce ingredients in small saucepan. Heat to boilingstirring constantly. Pour over sausages and onionscover and bake 10 minutes longer or until heated through. Serve with french bread.
I'm not much of a breakfast person but this looks absolutely delicious!
I like to try new things and this is one I will have to try for sure!
I love breakfast so I think I'd love this!
This sounds really good! I would like to make this for my family!
This looks really good. I would love to try it for breakfast sometime soon.
I love breakfast! I'd love to try this!
This looks delicious! I would love to try this for breakfast.
This looks so yummy! I think my family would love it!
I'm not much of a breakfast person but this looks absolutely delicious! I would like to make this for my family!
This

Brown the ground beef with the seasoning and drain well. Place half the meat in the bottom of a 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Top with half the potatoes, and sprinkle with half the cheese. Repeat the layers. Combine the remaining ingredients and pour evenly over the potatoes. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes or until bubbly and the potatoes are done. Yield 8-10 servings.

Saute the onions, celery and carrot in butter for a few minutes until softened. Add the chicken stock and seasonings and simmer for 15 minutes. Beat the egg yolks and milk together and stir into the soup mixture. Bring to a boil and stir continuously until thickened. Stir in the cheese and allow to melt. Stir in the Tabasco sauce and Worcestershire sauce to taste and add the beer just before serving.
In a mixing bowl, combine all ingredients. Spread onto rye crackers or toasted English muffins. Cut into strips for dipping. Makes 4 servings.

Peel off the outer layer of an onion so that all that is left is the white part of the onion. Cut that into wedges that fit into a deep skillet or casserole dish. In that same skillet, cook the bacon until crisp then remove from the skillet, leaving the bacon drippings behind. Add some more drippings if needed. Saute the onions until they are golden brown then add 1/2 of a cup of water, some salt and pepper then cover the skillet. Simmer the onion for about 20 minutes or until it is soft. Butter a deep skillet or casserole dish, add the cooked onion then add some mild cheese over the top of the onion. In a separate bowl combine the bread crumbs and melted butter until well blended then sprinkle over the top of the casserole dish. Bake in a preheated oven at 400F for about half an hour or until lightly browned. Serves 4

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Sprinkle with seasoning mix. Add water. Bring to a boil. Add chicken. Cook, uncovered, 5 to 6 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink (165 degrees f), stirring occasionally. Remove from skillet. Place about 1/4 cup chicken in each of 6 taco shells. Serve with your favorite toppings.

Place the zucchini in a single layer on a baking sheet. Drizzle with a little of the olive oil. Roast in the preheated oven until tender. Meanwhile, bring the remaining 3 cups water to a boil in a large pot. Add the broccoli florets and cook until tender. Drain the broccoli, reserving 1/4 cup of the cooking liquid. Transfer the broccoli to a large bowl. Add the chicken broth and 3 tablespoons of the hot pepper flakes. Cook the pasta in the boiling water until al dente. Drain the pasta. Add it to the broccoli mixture along with the remaining 2 tablespoons of hot pepper flakes. Add the roasted zucchini. Add the remaining 1/2 cup of the olive oil. Toss well. Add the reserved cooking liquid if necessary. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Prepare batter as directed on box of cocoa for 8-inch round layer cake. Bake in 350f oven 30 to 35 minutes. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely. Spread top of each layer with buttercream frosting, then stack layers to form one 8-inch layer cake. Frost top and sides of cake with buttercream frosting. Decorate top with candies or frosting designs. Store leftover cake in refrigerator. Makes 16 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Remove the pork loin from refrigerator. Slice a slit in the top of the loin. Slip garlic slices into slit. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Insert sage leaves and rosemary. Rub olive oil over meat. Place on a baking sheet and roast for 1-1/4 hours. Remove from oven and cover with foil. Let stand for 10 minutes. Cut into 1 inch slices and serve.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. In an aluminum roasting pan, pour the broth and add the green beans. Toss the vegetables to coat thoroughly. Drizzle the vegetables with the olive oil and season them with the salt and pepper. Bake for 30 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Toss the roasted vegetables with the almonds before serving.

Combine salt and pepper in a bowl. Sprinkle each fillet with half the salt mixture and spread with 1 teaspoon of butter. Set aside. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until soft. Add zucchini and mushrooms and saute until tender. Add tomatoes and garlic and saute until juices are released. Add wine and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in herbs. Spread 1 cup of the vegetables over each of the four fillets. Wrap each in a foil packet. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Garnish with remaining herbs and serve with lemon wedges.

Place ham in panini press or indoor grill. Cook about 1 minute or until lightly browned and heated through. Spread mustard over outside of bread. Place a slice of brie in center of each slice of bread. Layer with ham and top with pepper strips. Top with remaining slices of bread, mustard side down. Place on panini press or indoor grill and cook about 1 minute or until lightly browned and cheese is melted.

Cream butter and sugars well. Add eggs. Sift dry ingredients and add to creamed mixture. Stir through muesli and coconut. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 170c. Roll heaped tablespoons of mixture into balls. Place on trays 5cm apart. Bake 15 minutes or until golden. Cool on trays.

In large nonstick skillet over medium heat, fry sausage for about 10 minutes until no longer pink and liquid has evaporated. Remove sausage from skillet and cut into bite-sized pieces. In the skillet add the butter and stir until melted and butter is lightly browned. Whisk in the eggs until fully incorporated. Reduce heat to low, cover and cook for about 5 minutes or until eggs are set but still creamy and lightly browned. Place one slice of buttered kaiser roll on each of two platesspread with mayo. Top with sausageadd one slice of cheese, if desired. Spoon hot eggs onto rollstop with pickle. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Soak the glutinous rice for 4 hours or overnight. Drain the soaked glutinous rice and put into the pot. Pour the 1 cup of coconut milk into the rice. Cook over low heat for 15 minutes or until the rice is cooked. Stirring often to prevent the rice from sticking at the bottom of the pan. Add the 1/2 cup of brown sugar, 1 cup coconut milk, 1/2 cup coconut cream, 2 teaspoons butter and the 1 tablespoon vanilla extract and cook for another 15 minutes or until the rice has absorbed all the liquid. Pour the mixture into 8 greased muffin cups. Cool for 30 minutes or until set. To make the topping, pour the remaining 2 cups of coconut milk into the blender. Add the remaining 1 teaspoon of butter and the 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Blend until smooth. Pour into a saucepan and cook over low heat until the mixture thickens. Stirring often to prevent the mixture from sticking or burning.

Cut chicken into serving pieces. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon of the salt& pepper. Dredge the chicken in flour. Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the onion& garlic to the skillet. Saute until the onion is softened. Add the chicken to the skillet. Sauté until lightly browned, about 4 minutes per side. Add the wine. Cover the skillet. Simmer until the chicken is tender, about 5 minutes. Serve with the remaining salt& pepper.

Heat oven to 350f. Prepare unbaked pie crusts. In large bowl combine dark corn syrup, evaporated milk, eggs and egg whites. Add the pumpkin, salt, cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg. Mix well. Pour filling into pie crusts. Bake 50-55 minutes or until knife comes out clean from center. Cool and serve.

In a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, heat 2 tablespoons butter until melted. Add the bell peppers. Cook for 3 minutes. Add pesto sauce. Add 4 slices of cheese to each of 4 slices of bread. Divide the peppers between the 4 slices of bread. Close the sandwiches. Lightly butter the outside of the bread. Cook until golden. Serve immediately.

Remove shell of prawns and devein them by making a slit along center of back. Rinse well. Mix salt, black pepper and olive oil together in large bowl. Add prawns and stir well to coat with mixture. Marinate for 1 hour or longer. Heat olive oil in a wok or large skillet. Add garlic cloves and cook until fragrant. Add chopped chiles and cook 1 minute longer. Add white wine and bring to a boil. Add prawns, stirring well to coat with sauce and wine mixture. Cook until prawns turn pink 2-3 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley and serve at once.

Lightly coat a mini-muffin pan with the cooking sprayset aside. Peel the potatoes and slice them thinly with a mandoline or a vegetable slicer (a potato peeler will do in a pinch). Slice the green onions into thin rounds and set aside. In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium-low heat. Whisk in the flour until it is well combined and cook for 2 minutes or until lightly browned. Whisk in the milk and bring the mixture to a boil over medium-low heat, whisking constantly. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the mixture is thickened and smooth (about 2 minutes). Stir in the cheese until melted. Season with the salt and pepper. Spoon the cheese mixture into each of the mini muffin cups (about 2 tablespoons per cup), spreading evenly. Top each with 2 slices of green onion. Bake until golden brown (about 20 minutes). Serve warm.
Mix all but vegetables in small saucepan. Bring to boiling. Pour over vegetables. Let stand 2 to 4 hours in refrigerator. Stir before serving.

Place potatoes in a large saucepan. Cover with broth. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes. Drain. Add broth. Mash well. Add pesto. Stir until smooth. Salt to taste. Serve warm.

Cut brussels sprouts in half lengthwise and place in a heavy-bottomed saucepan with chicken stock. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 30 minutes. Melt butter in a small saucepan. Add flour and cook for 3 minutes. Whisk in milk and continue to whisk until smooth. Add to chicken stock along with nutmeg. Increase heat to high until soup begins to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add heavy cream and cook until thickened. Add more milk if necessary. Season with tabasco sauce and salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls. Garnish with sliced almonds. Serves 6.

Soften the cream cheese and then mix in the sugar. Add in the melted chocolate. Mix in the cool whip and add in the cookies. Pour into 2 small dishes and refrigerate for a few hours. Garnish with cherries if desired.

In a large mixing bowl dissolve yeast in warm water. Add milk, sugar, and salt. Stir in enough of the flour mixture to make a soft dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 6 - 8 minutes. Place dough in a greased bowl, turning once to grease the top. Cover with plastic wrap or a damp cloth. Let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, 1 - 2 hours. Punch down dough. On a lightly floured surface roll out dough 1/4 inch thick. Sprinkle with chopped bacon. Roll up jellyroll style and seal edges. Cut into 3/4 inch slices. Place slices close together in a greased 9x13 inch pan. Cover with a damp cloth or plastic wrap. Let rise in a warm place until doubled in size. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bake for 20 - 25 minutes. Serve warm.

In a small bowl combine the Fiber One and boiling water. Let cool slightly. In a large mixing bowl combine the yogurt, sugar substitute and bananas. Add the Fiber One mixture and the egg substitute. Add the flour and baking sodamix until just moistened. Spoon the batter into a greased 12-cup muffin pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Combine first 4 ingredients. Rub evenly on steaks. Heat oil in heavy large pot over medium-high heat. Add steaks and cook until brown and desired degree of doneness, 5 to 8 minutes per side for medium-rare. Transfer steaks to platter and keep warm. Add broth to pot. Bring mixture to boil. Cook until reduced to 2 tablespoons (about 5 minutes). Whisk in mustard and butter until blended. Pour sauce over steaks and serve.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Add fish. Cover. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Grill fish 4 to 5 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily. Garnish with lime wedges.

Place a whole chicken in a shallow roasting pan and rub all over with the orange juice and cider vinegar. Season the cavity with salt and pepper. Add the tarragon sprigs. Roast in a preheated 400 degree F. oven for about an hour or until a meat thermometer reads an internal temperature of 160 degrees F. Remove from oven. Pour honey over the chicken, allow it to melt slightly. Serve with a mixture of oranges and olives.
Combine all ingredients into a tall glass. Stir and garnish with whipped cream and chocolate.

Heat the oil in a frying pan and fry the onion and garlic until soft and translucent but not browned. Add the courgette and cook for 5 minutes or so until the courgette is tender but still has a bit of a bite to it. Add the tomatoes and the red pepper and simmer for 10 minutes or so. Add the pasta and cook for a further 10 minutes or so, adding the pine nuts and parmesan cheese 3 minutes before the end of the cooking time. Serve topped with parmesan cheese and extra pine nuts if desired.

Boil the potatoes until soft. Cook the corn in the microwave. Cut the potatoes and corn into small pieces. Place them in a bowl and add the sour cream and lemon juice. Season with the cumin and the hot chili. Drain the green bell peppers and chop finely. Mix them with the scallion and add them to the bowl. Mix well and chill.
name: potato salad with corn and green peppersingredients: frozen corn,boiling potatoes,green bell peppers,scallions,hot chili pepper,sour cream,olive oil,lemon juice,ground cuminpreparation:Boil the potatoes until soft. Cook the corn in the microwave. Cut the potatoes and corn into small pieces. Place them in a bowl and add the sour cream and lemon juice. Season with the cumin and the hot chili. Drain the green bell peppers and chop finely. Mix them with the scallion and add them to the bowl. Mix well and chill.
name: potato salad with

Mix as directed on package, except use 1/2 cup apple juice concentrate instead of water. Pour into greased pie plate or tart pan. Bake at 350f for 50 minutes or until firm to touch. Sprinkle with raisins and chopped nuts if desired. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Melt butter with white wine and cook until wine is almost completely evaporated. Add frozen sprouts and toss to coat. Cook over medium-high heat until tender and lightly browned. Sprinkle with remaining ingredients.

Cut squash into cubes. Heat ghee in frying pan and add cumin seeds and coriander seeds until they start to crackle. Add turmeric and stir for 30 seconds. Add cubes of squash and cook for 1 minute. Add salt and coriander leaves and stir for another minute or two. Serve hot or cold as desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Remove bones from halibut if desired. Pat dry with paper towels. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon of salt and 1/8 teaspoon of pepper. Dip each piece of fish into flour to coat. Heat 3 tablespoons of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add halibut to skillet. Cook until fish is browned on one side about 4 minutes. Turn and brown on other side 4 minutes. Remove fish from pan. Add 1/4 cup of water to skillet. Scrape up browned bits with a wooden spoon. Cook over medium heat until mixture is thickened. Remove from heat. Add 1/2 teaspoon of salt, 1/4 teaspoon of pepper, 2 tablespoons of balsamic vinegar and 1/4 teaspoon of dried rosemary. Return halibut to skillet and coat with sauce. Place halibut on a baking sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until halibut

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Toss all ingredients together in a large bowl and spread out on a large rimmed baking sheet. Roast for 30 minutes or until potatoes are tender and golden. Toss again and continue to bake until sprouts are tender and golden on the outside. If desired, garnish with more bacon and drizzle with butter and fresh lemon juice.

Combine all ingredients in a bowl except for the chicken pieces. Stir until well mixed. Place the chicken pieces in a large bowl and pour the marinade over them. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Remove the chicken from the marinade and place in a large ziplock bag. Pour marinade into a small saucepan. Bring to a boil and cook for about 1 minute. Remove the chicken from the bag and place in a large roasting pan. Pour the boiled marinade over the chicken. Bake for 1 hour at 375 or until done.
These are just a few of the recipes that I have found. I hope that you enjoy them and have a great time!
This is great for parties and holidays. I have a very large family and when we get together, we tend to go all out. We like to get together around the holidays and have a good old time. This is a great recipe for the holidays.
You will need a large pot and a large spoon.
Step 1: In a large pot over

In a small bowl mix honey, peanut butter and powdered milk until smooth. Stir in coconut and sesame seed and press into a greased 8x8 pan. Bake at 350 for 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool and cut into squares.

Combine flour, sugar, salt and baking powderset aside. Beat butter with milk and lemon juice until smoothadd dry mixture and mix well. Pour into a greased 13x9 glass dish and sprinkle with nutmeg and cinnamon. Pour peaches over battersprinkle with a little more nutmeg and cinnamon. Bake at 375 for 45 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Salt and pepper both sides of pork chops. Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add pork chops to pan. Cook until browned on both sides. Pour coconut milk into pan. Stir in hot pepper sauce and soy sauce. Add pineapple tidbits and parsley. Cover skillet tightly. Bake for 30 minutes or until chops are tender. Remove from heat. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In a small bowl, mix scallions, goat cheese, italian seasoning and roasted red peppers. Spread the spinach evenly over the top of the beef. Spoon the cheese mixture on top of the spinach. Roll the beef up tightly and tie with kitchen twine. Place on a foil-lined baking sheet and bake 30 minutes. Turn the beef over and bake another 10 minutes. Slice and serve.

Beat egg yolks well in a bowl, add 1/2 cup (125 mL) of the sugar and the salt and beat until thickened and lemon-coloured. Add the milk gradually while beating. Continue beating until mixture becomes smooth. Add the remaining 1/4 cup (62 mL) of sugar and the vanilla, mixing well. Pour into the pie crusts. Bake in a preheated 350 F (180 C) oven for about 45 minutes or until the custard is set. Cool on a wire rack. Serves 8 to 10.

Heat olive oil over medium heat. Saute onions until tender. Add remaining ingredients to crock pot. Stir well. Cover and cook on low heat for 8-10 hours or high for 4-5 hours. When ready to serve, top with tortilla strips and mexican blend cheese. Heat briefly under the broiler.

Combine flour and seasoning. Dip each breast into flour mixture, shaking off excess. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add breasts and cook until golden brown. Add apples and pears and cook until tender. Add lemon juice and cook until liquid is reduced. Add salt and pepper and serve.

Cook the penne according to the packet instructions. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a frying pan until very hot. Add the penne and stir well. Add the garlic and cook for a minute. Add the lemon zest and cook for another minute. Add the prawns and cook for about 2 minutes, then add the cherry tomatoes.
