Cook for a further minute then remove from the heat and add the lemon juice and season with pepper. Serve topped with the parsley.

Prepare 4 bread crumbs by crushing 4 whole cornflakes and combine with the seasoning and pepper in a bowl. Whisk 4 eggs and 4 tablespoons of milk in another bowl and combine the 4 fish portions in the mixture. Remove any excess batter and roll the portions in the bread crumbs and place on a baking tray. Bake for 10 minutes at 180 degrees centigrade and turn once for even cooking. Serve hot with chips and vegetables.
name: deep fried fish
ingredients: white fish fillets, plain flour, salt, egg, butter, milk, lemon wedge
preparation:Half-fill a deep pan with melted fat or oil. Heat until a faint haze rises from it. Sift the flour and salt into a bowl. Beat to a smooth batter, unbeaten egg, butter and milk. Then add the flour and salt mixture. Coat 2 pieces of fish with batter. Lift into the pan with a fork or kitchen tongs. Fry until crisp and golden,
Combine milk and pudding mix. Let stand 2 minutes. Stir well. Fold in whipped topping. Spoon into glasses. Garnish with candy bars. Serve immediately. Or refrigerate until ready to serve.

Brown pork chops in skillet with butter or margarine. Sprinkle onion over chops then pour creams over all. Bake at 350f for 30-45 minutes or until done. Serve over noodles or rice.
name: PORK CHOPS IN GRAVYingredients: pork chops, onion soup mix, cream of mushroom soup, waterpreparation: Cook pork chops in a skillet in a little oil until lightly brownedpour off drippingsadd onion soup mixpour in water and coversimmer for 30 minutes or until tenderstirring occasionallyremove pork chops from liquidplace pork chops in a serving dishstir liquid into 1 can of cream of mushroom souppour over pork chops.
name: PORK CHOPS IN MUSHROOM SAUCEingredients: pork chopscan of mushroom soupslices of breadolive oilchopped onionsalt and pepper to tastegarlic saltprepar

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil. Add potato, carrot and onion. Cook until potato is almost done, about 4 to 6 minutes. Add gingerroot and garliccook about 1 minute longer or until potato is tender. Stir in ponzu sauce and season with salt. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

In a large bowl add the garlic powder, seasoning salt & black pepper. Rub over the chicken pieces. Heat oil in a skilletbrown the chicken on all sides. Place the chicken into the slow cooker. In a bowl add the spaghetti sauce, Italian seasoning & white wine. Pour over the chicken. Cover & cook on low for 6-8 hours. Add the zucchini. Cook for an additional 1-2 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix dry milk powder, baking soda and salt. Cream together butter and molasses. Add the egg beaters and vanilla. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Stir in the raisins. Drop by teaspoons onto greased cookie sheets. Bake for about 8 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Makes about 4 dozen.
Following is an alphabetical listing of recipes for the topic "molasses". Please click on the word "more" at the end of the line to get more recipes.

In a small bowl, whisk together all the ingredients except the fish. Heat the olive oil in a medium non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. When the oil is hot, season the fish with salt and pepper. Sear the fish on both sides until cooked through. Spoon some of the maple balsamic glaze over each piece of fish. Serve hot.
name: citrus balsamic glazed salmoningredients: salmon fillets, salt and pepper, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, cornstarch, orange juice, brown sugar, chicken brothpreparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Rub salmon with salt and pepper. Place salmon in 2-quart shallow baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork. Whisk balsamic vinegar, cornstarch, orange juice and brown sugar in medium saucepan. Add chicken broth and heat to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer

Make the buttermilk marinade by mixing together the buttermilk and the coconut. In a bowl, combine the garlic, cilantro and the marinade. Add the chicken legs and turn to coat. Place in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Preheat the grill. Remove the chicken legs from the marinade and place on the grill. Cook until the meat is no longer pink. Serve immediately with rice.
These are the best recipes for chicken legs. Contribute your own chicken leg recipes using our recipe builder.

Boil the carrots whole with just enough water to cover them. Simmer until tender. Add the butter and brown sugar. Toss to melt. Add the cream and chives and toss again. Sprinkle with parsley.

Spray 13x9x2 inch baking dish with cooking sprayspread hash browns evenly over bottom of dish. Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Cook ground beef and onion together in medium skillet until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in taco seasoning mix and salsaheat through. Spoon meat mixture over hash browns. Top with cheese. Bake uncovered 25-30 minutes or until bubbly and heated through. Serve with salsa or sour cream if desired.

Cut the zucchini into rounds (approximately a quarter of an inch thick) and place in a bowl of cold water to prevent them from discoloring. Preheat a large cast iron skillet or heavy pan on high heat. Add the oil and swirl to cover the bottom of the pan. Add the zucchini and saute for 3-4 minutes until the zucchini is just lightly colored on one side. Flip the zucchini and add the lemon juice and lemon zest and cook for an additional minute or so more. Add the basil and stir together and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Sift flour with 1/2 cup of water and salt to make a thin batter. Heat 1/2 inch of oil in a pot or deep fryer to 350f. Cut each vegetable into bite size pieces. Dip each piece into the batter and quickly place in the hot oil. Fry until golden brown and crisp. Drain on paper towels. Serve with soy sauce.

In a large bowl combine the butter, sugar and corn syrup. Add the eggs one at a time and beat well after each addition. Stir in the rolled oats and the unsweetened coconut. Press into an ungreased 13 x 9-inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned. Cool in pan on a wire rack. Sprinkle with the candied cherry before cutting into bars.

Combine all the ingredients into a pan over medium-high heat and stir until the sugar has melted, about 2 minutes. Reduce the heat to low and continue to cook for 15-20 minutes or until the mixture has reduced by half (the sauce will thicken). Remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly before transferring to a blender or food processor. Process until smooth and creamy. Serve over dessert or drizzle over fruit salad.

Beat 3 eggs in large bowl with electric mixer. Stir in ricotta cheese. In small bowl combine 1/2 teaspoon water and 1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar. Add to cheese mixture. Add 1 teaspoon splenda and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Beat until smooth. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use. Heat oven to 400 degrees. Spray mini-muffin cups with pam cooking spray. Place 1 teaspoon mixture in each cup. Bake 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven. Cool in pan. Remove from pan and cool completely on wire rack. Store in airtight container. Makes 48.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium heat. Cook the onion in the hot oil until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook 1 minute. Add the beans, carrots and celery and cook 5 minutes. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil and the bay leaves. Stir in the tomato paste and cook 1 minute. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium and add the spaghetti sauce. Simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the pasta and cook 10 minutes or until the pasta is tender. Remove the bay leaves. Add the kidney and garbanzo beans and cook for 5 minutes or until heated through. Season with the Italian seasoning and salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

In a bowl combine all the ingredients and mix well using an electric mixer. Put in a greased pan or muffin tin and bake at 350f for 15-20 minutes or until done. Remove from oven and allow to cool before cutting into desired shapes.

Pound chicken breast with meat mallet or rolling pin until thin. Mix with onion, garlic salt, pepper, bread crumbs, and eggs. Shape into patties, dip in flour, then in beaten egg, then in bread crumbs. Fry in hot oil until brown all over. Serve with tartar sauce or mayonnaise.

In a large bowl, combine all vegetables. In a separate small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, vinegar and sugar. Pour dressing over vegetablestoss to combine. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving to allow flavors to blend.

Place salmon in a greased 8x4 loaf pan. Cover with mushrooms. In a bowl combine eggs with bread crumbs and cheese. Spread mixture over the fish and mushrooms. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 50 minutes. Uncover. Bake 10 minutes longer. Meanwhile prepare the sauce. In a small bowl combine the onion and 2 tablespoons lemon juice. Spoon over the fish. Serve with peas.

Cream together butter and sugar. Add eggs one at a time and beat well after each one is added. Add mashed bananas and beat well. Add sour cream and beat well. Add dry ingredients and beat until well mixed. Stir in chocolate chips. Bake for 45 minutes at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cool on wire rack.

In a large bowl, mix the grapes, blue cheese, and honey. Toss in the walnuts. In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar and oil. Pour over the salad mixture and toss to combine. Adjust the seasonings, adding salt to taste. Serve at room temperature.

In a medium heavy saucepan, combine the cocoa and sugar. Stir in the water. Bring mixture to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat& simmer uncovered, stirring frequently, until thick and smooth. Remove from heat& cool to room temperature. Stir in the vanilla. Freeze in an ice-cream maker.
Cook the pasta as directed. In a large bowl mix ricotta with the cheeses and parsley. Layer the cooked pasta with the ricotta mixture and spaghetti sauce. Cover and refrigerate overnight.

Preheat oven to 180C/350F/Gas Mark 4. Season chicken breasts with curry powder. Place in a baking dish and bake for 30-35 mins. Meanwhile, heat half of the vegetable stock in a pan, add the carrot and red pepper and cook for 10 mins. Meanwhile, heat remaining stock in a pan and bring to the boil. Add basmati rice and cook according to pack instructions. Add the green chilies and mint and mix well. Add cooked chicken to rice mixture. Add cooked carrot and red pepper to rice mixture. Serve.

In a large mixing bowl stir together warm water (120-125°F), yeast, and sugar. Stir until yeast dissolves. Let mixture stand in a warm place until it becomes foamy (about 10 minutes). Beat egg lightly with a fork, then beat into yeast mixture. Add butter, vanilla, cinnamon, salt, and nutmegstir until butter is melted. Add flour gradually until dough comes together. Knead until smooth. Cover with plastic wrap, then set aside in a warm place until doubled in volume (about 1 hour). When doubled, punch down the dough. Divide into twelve equal portions and roll each portion into a smooth ball (about one inch in diameter). Set donut balls on a greased cookie sheet and cover with plastic wraplet rise again until doubled (about 1 hour). Preheat oven to 200°F. Heat 2 inches of cooking oil in a large pot until a deep-fry thermometer reads 350°F (or until a small piece of bread browns in 1 minute).
Place a scoop of the strawberry ice cream in each of two glasses. Top with two pieces of the sponge cake. Spoon on a bit of whipped cream and top with a few fresh strawberries. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine the Italian dressing and the water. Heat oven to 425. In each hoagie roll spread half the dressing mixture on the bottom half of the roll. Top with 1/4 of the meats and 1/2 of the tomatoes and onions. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the cheese. Cover with the remaining hoagie roll and top with the remaining dressing mixture and remaining meats and vegetables. Bake uncovered for 15-20 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Cut in half and serve.

Season the turkey breasts with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Drizzle with the extra virgin olive oil. Lay the sliced onion on the bottom of the crockpot. Place the seasoned breasts on top of the onion. Pour the chicken broth over the breasts. Cook on low for 7-8 hours. Remove the breasts from the broth to cool. Reserve the broth for later. Shred the breasts and serve on a bun or toast. Add a little of the reserved broth if desired. You can also serve with rice. I like to drizzle a bit of olive oil on the meat. Enjoy.

Mix together apple juice, lime juice and cornstarch. Pour mixture into resealable plastic bag. Add the chicken to the bag. Marinate in refrigerator 2 hours or overnight. Cook chicken in skillet or baking dish over medium heat until thoroughly cooked. Stir in the bouillon cube until dissolved. Serve with rice.

Pound onion and garlic together to a paste. Add sage leaves and rosemary. Mince until fine. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion-garlic-sage-rosemary paste. Cook for about five minutes. Add merlot. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for five minutes. Add lamb chops. Let marinate for 2 to 3 hours. Remove lamb from marinade. Grill over high heat for 3 to 5 minutes per side. For medium rare. Let rest for five minutes. Serve.

Melt the butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the turbinado sugar and stir until the sugar is dissolved and the mixture is bubbly, about 1 minute. Add the fennel seed and allspice and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute more. Add the sweet potatoes and season with salt and pepper. Roast for 30 minutes, tossing once or twice until tender and slightly caramelized.

Pour water into a small pot and bring to a boil. Add the chicken quarters and cook for 30 minutes. Remove chicken from broth and let cool. Remove meat from bones. Cut into bite size pieces. Cut cucumber into bite size pieces. Heat soy sauce, sugar and scallion until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat. Add the chicken and cucumbers. Mix well. Add peanut butter and white pepper. Stir until well mixed. Serve with hot rice. Top with sesame seeds.
These are very simple to make. You can use any type of bread. We prefer a nice white bread.
You can make your own pizza dough. But if you don’t feel like making your own just buy it from your local store.
The recipe will make about 8 to 10 pizzas depending on how big you want to make them.
In a small bowl combine the flour and salt. Pour the oil over the mixture.
With your hands mix the flour with the oil until it is well blended.
Place the flour mixture on the counter. With

Separate the top and bottom halves of the croissant. Stuff the bottom halves with a teaspoon of honey nut cream cheese and set the top halves aside. In a large bowl, beat the eggs and milk together. In a second bowl, beat the half-and-half, spices and extract together. Dip the stuffed bottom halves into the egg mixture and then into the cream mixture. Fry on both sides in a skillet with a teaspoon of butter until golden brown. Top with sliced peaches and the reserved top halves. Serve hot.

Combine cabbage and pepper in medium-large sized mixing bowl. In separate bowl, combine lime juice, oil and cumin. Toss dressing with cabbage mixture. Add cilantro. Toss again. Refrigerate overnight before serving.

Place semisweet and unsweetened chocolate in a heatproof bowl. Place over pan of hot water and stir until melted. Remove from heat and stir in whipping cream, salt, sugar and scotch. Pour into fondue pot. Dip poundcake and berries. Serve with additional scotch.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Spray baking sheet with cooking spray. In a small bowl combine the preserves with the soy sauce and garlic. Toss the asparagus with the mixture and transfer to the prepared baking sheet. Roast for 10 to 15 minutes or until crisp-tender and the asparagus is just starting to brown. Serve warm.

Mix together first four ingredients and form a soft dough with a fork. Let rise until doubled. Roll out to desired thickness. Cut with a drinking glass or cookie cutter into desired shapes. Bake at 375f for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on rack. Makes 24-30 biscuits depending on thickness.

Cook the macaroni until tender and drain. Melt the butter in a saucepan. Add the flour and stir until well blended. Gradually add the milk and the seasonings. Cook over low heat until thickened. Stir in the cheese. Pour over the cooked macaroni. Sprinkle with the cracker crumbs. Bake for 30 minutes in the 350 degree fahrenheit oven.

Melt butter and olive oil together in a skillet. Add red onions and yellow onions, cook until softened and translucent, stirring occasionally, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and add salt and pepper to taste. Toss to combine. To assemble sandwiches, spread 2 tablespoons of onion mixture on each side of each bread half. Top with cheese and then 1/2 of each steak. Top with other half of bread and cut sandwiches in half. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut mozzarella sticks into 1/2 inch strips. Beat together eggs and milk. Mix together flour and breadcrumbs. Dip each strip in egg mixture then coat in flour and bread crumbs. Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Fry cheese sticks in hot oil for 3 to 4 minutes or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Arrange on baking sheet in a single layer and bake in preheated oven for 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Combine the hamburger, onion, brown sugar and barbecue sauce and shape into 8 patties. Bake on a baking sheet in a preheated 375 degree F oven for 10 minutes or until the patties are cooked through. In the meantime, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Slice the tops off of the refrigerated biscuits to make shallow bowls and place them on a baking sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the edges are golden brown. Top each biscuit with a burger patty and a slice of cheddar cheese. Bake for about 1 minute to allow the cheese to melt. Serve immediately.

In a large pot over high heat, bring the water to a boil. Add the garlic. Cook for 1 minute. Add the couscous. Stir well. Reduce the heat to medium. Add the sriracha sauce. Cook for 3 minutes. Remove from the heat. Add the parmesan cheese. Fluff the mixture with a fork. Serve warm.

Rinse and pat dry chicken. In large bowl mix flour, salt, black pepper, paprika and garlic powder. Mix well. Dip chicken in flour mixture, shake off excess. Place in greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Combine oil and margarine. Brush over top of chicken. Bake in preheated oven at 375 degrees for 1 hour. Serve hot with gravy and mashed potatoes.
Chicken cooked in the oven is almost as good as fried chicken - and much easier to prepare.

Pound out chicken breasts with meat mallet or rolling pin. Take unseasoned breadcrumbs and add salt, pepper, garlic salt, parmesan cheese, thyme, and any other herbs you desire to the crumbs. Spread a generous amount of the pesto sauce mix on the pounded out chicken breast. Roll the chicken breast up and secure with toothpicks. Dip the chicken breast in milk and then into the seasoned bread crumbs. Place chicken onto a greased pan and place into a 400f oven for approximately 20 minutes or until the chicken juices run clear. Cut into 1 inch cubes. In a skillet fry the cubes in olive oil over medium high heat for approximately 5-8 minutes or until the juices run clear. In a separate skillet saut the mushrooms with butter and garlic and diced provolone cheese. Stir and serve over the chicken.

Preheat oven to 400f. Place roast in a shallow baking pan. Add oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake for 25 minutes. Add the ginger and stir well. Add the orange juice, broth and hoisin sauce. Stir well and bake for another 45 minutes. Stir again and bake for an additional 30 minutes until meat thermometer inserted into thickest part registers 160 degrees. Remove from oven and pour off the excess liquid. Spoon remaining liquid over the meat and sprinkle with toasted sesame oil. Garnish with green onions.

Peel and pit the avocados. Mash the avocados with the back of a fork. Add the salsa and the garlic salt. Mash again until it is a thick paste. Add the pepper and stir to combine. Serve with tortilla chips.

Cut lamb into bite-sized pieces. Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium heatbrown lamb in oil until lightly browned, stirring often. Remove lamb from pan with a slotted spoon, reserving drippings in pan. Add onion, celery and carrots to pancook, stirring frequently, until onion is tender. Add tomato paste, stirring to blend well with vegetablescook over medium heat until mixture begins to darken in color. Add lamb, bay leaf and waterbring mixture to a boil. Reduce heatcover pan tightly. Simmer 1 hourstir occasionally. Stir in cabbage and parsley. Continue cooking until vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally. Remove bay leaf before serving. Serve over hot buttered noodles or rice with a dollop of sour cream if desired.

In a large bowl combine the dry roasted peanuts, sunflower seeds, toasted wheat germ and raisins. In a small saucepan over medium heat combine the brown sugar, light corn syrup and vanilla. Stir constantly until the mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat and pour over dry ingredients. Stir well. Pour into an ungreased 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan. Let cool completely. Cut into 24 bars. Store in airtight container at room temperature.

Combine lime juice, orange juice, simple syrup and basil leaves in a cocktail shaker. Muddle (crush) the basil leaves. Add ice cubes and shake well for at least 30 seconds. Strain into an ice-filled highball glass and top up with soda water. Garnish with a basil leaf.

In large pot over medium heat, combine carrots, butter and water. Bring to boil. Reduce heatcover and cook until carrots are tender-crisp. Drain. In the same pan, melt the remaining butter. Stir in the sugar, mustard and parsley. Cook and stir until smooth. Add carrots. Cook and stir until mixture thickens and coats the carrots. Sprinkle with green onions. Serve immediately.

Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium high heat. Drain fat and stir in spinachcook and stir for 2 minutes. Combine the meat and spinach with the spaghetti sauce in a large bowl. Line a large casserole dish with a single layer of the cooked raviolitop with a layer of the meat mixturesprinkle with half the mozzarella cheeserepeat layers, ending with a layer of meat mixturetop with the remaining mozzarella and a sprinkling of Parmesan cheesecover tightly and bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutesuncover and bake for about 15 minutes longer or until the cheese is melted and the pasta is tenderlet stand for about 10 minutes before serving. Serve with salad and garlic bread.

Combine quinoa and spinach in a large bowl. Whisk together remaining ingredients. Pour over quinoa mixturetoss to coat. Garnish with poppy seeds. Serve immediately.
I have to say that this is a great site. I have found that there are many different recipes for cooking spinach. I have been cooking it for some time and I am always trying to find new recipes. I love it!

Combine 1/2 cup of water with 1/4 cup of red wine in a medium sized saucepan. Cook over high heat until almost all of the liquid evaporates. Add the remaining 2 cups of water along with the butter, apples, onions, red cabbage, salt, pepper, brown sugar and vinegar. Cook for 20 minutes over medium-high heat. Stir in the flour, 1 tablespoon at a time, while mixing. Cook for 2 to 3 more minutes or until the sauce has thickened enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon.

Slice the avocados and place them in a bowl with the lime juice and olive oil. Season with salt. Arrange the bread slices on a baking sheet and toast in a 350 degrees oven. When the toasts are cool, spread each with half of the avocado mixture. Place a slice of ham on each and sprinkle with cheese. Heat in a toaster oven until the cheese melts and bubbles. Serve hot.

Mix together lean ground beef, ground ham, butter-flavored cracker crumbs, eggs and milk. Form into 1-1/2-inch meatballs and place on a cookie sheet. Combine cider vinegar, brown sugar and dry mustard and water. Stir to dissolve sugar and pour over meatballs. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until no longer pink inside.

In a small bowl mix together the soy sauce and wasabi paste. Place the scallions in another small bowl. Cook the noodles as directed on the package and rinse in cold water. Lay the tuna steaks in the marinade and let marinate for 10 minutes. Cook the tuna steaks in the oven at 450 degrees for 5 minutes on each side. When the tuna is done cooking, slice it into cubes and place over the noodles. Drizzle the wasabi mixture and the lemon over the tuna and serve the scallions and arugula on the side.

Drain sardines and chop coarsely. Combine with green onion and yogurt. Add lemon juice and seasonings and mix well. Spread over crusty bread slices or melba toast and garnish with carrot and sprinkle with paprika.

In a medium saucepan combine the dry white wine, fresh lemon juice, gouda cheese and cornstarch. Whisk until smooth. Heat over low heat, whisking constantly until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Remove from heat and stir in the nutmeg and cayenne pepper. Pour into fondue pots and serve with crusty French bread.
Pumpkin Seeds and Pumpkin Seed Oil in India
Pumpkin Seeds and Pumpkin Seed Oil in India Pumpkin is a fruit and it is one of the most popular vegetables used in the preparation of various cuisines in India. Pumpkin Seeds and Pumpkin Seed Oil are also used in the preparation of various dishes in India. Pumpkin seeds and pumpkin seed oil are the best sources of protein and vitamins in India. Pumpkin seeds and pumpkin seed oil are used in the preparation of various dishes in India. They are used in the preparation of pumpkin soup, pumpkin curry, pumpkin pasta and pumpkin soup. They are used in the prepar

Combine all but egg whites in saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens. Remove from heat. Cool. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold in cooled mixture. Pour into pie shell. Chill. Top with sliced bananas. Chill. Serve.

In a large pot, heat butter and oil over medium high heat. Add chives and saute until soft and just turning color. Add link sausages and break apart with wooden spoon as you add them to pot. Cook for about 5 minutes or until browned and cooked through. Add chicken broth, wine, and remaining spices and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until thickened. Serve warm with crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Brown the meat in a heavy skillet with a little oil. Add the remaining ingredients except for the tomatoes with juice. Add the tomatoes with juice to a crock pot. Pour the meat mixture over the tomatoes. Cover. Cook 4 hours or until meat is tender. Stir before serving. Serve over pasta.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium bowl, cream together the brown sugar and granulated sugar until smooth. Beat in the egg until combined. Beat in the peanut butter, then the vanilla. Beat in the flour, then the baking soda and salt until combined. Drop the dough by heaping teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes or until set. Cool for 2 minutes on the baking sheets then transfer the cookies to wire racks to cool completely. Place 2 miniature peanut butter cups in the centers of the cookies. Melt the chocolate chips and shortening in a microwaveable bowl at 50% power for 1-1/2 minutesstir until smooth. Drizzle the melted chocolate over the cookies and sprinkle with the coconut and the nuts. Let stand until the chocolate is set. Store the cookies in an airtight container. Makes 36.

Cut the avocados in half and remove the pits. Scoop out the avocado into a bowl and mash with a fork until coarsely chopped. Add the lemon juice and mash again. Add the plum tomato, white onion and fresh jalapeo and mash until almost smooth. Sprinkle the coarse salt over the top and stir gently. Serve with tortilla chips.

Mix first 4 ingredients until smooth. Add flour and stir until well blended. Beat eggs and add to mixturestir well. Add buttermilk and milkstir well. Add butter and mix until smooth. Combine baking powder and sodastir well into mixture. Heat waffle iron to mediumadd a scant 1/4 cup of batter to each side of iron and cook until well browned and crisp. Makes 8 large or 16 small waffles. Serve with maple syrup.

Mix together the water, the sugar and the salt. Gradually add the flour and beat until it forms a dough that is smooth and stiff enough to roll out. Add the egg yolks and continue to beat until well blended and smooth. Let the dough rest for one hour at room temperature. Dissolve the baking powder in the hot water and then add the lemon rind and fat. Stir well and then add the egg whites beating until well blended and smooth. Fold the batter gently until well blended and smooth. Heat the oil over medium heat until it reaches 375°F. Working in batches, roll the dough into a 1/4" thick rope and cut it into 1" pieces. Fry the churros until golden brown and then remove from the hot oil and drain on paper towels. Place the churros on a rack and sprinkle them with the granulated sugar while they are still hot.

Combine flour and salt in a large bowl and cut in the shortening until it resembles coarse crumbs. Add the water and mix until a ball forms. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for about 30 minutes or until firm. On a floured board, roll out the dough into a circle about 1/4 inch thick. Transfer the dough to a 9 inch pie pan and trim the edges. Refrigerate for about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, in a large bowl combine the pears, sugar, and flour. Add the dried cranberries and gently toss to coat. In a medium bowl whisk together the eggs, the cornstarch and the ginger. Whisk in the milk and the lemon zest. Pour the filling into the crust-lined pan. Bake for about 40 minutes or until the filling is set and the crust is golden brown. Let cool on the wire rack for about 1 hour before cutting and serving with whipped cream or ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly oil large cookie sheet. In large mixing bowl combine granola with 2 tablespoons melted margarine. Toss until well coated. Spread mixture evenly on baking sheet. Bake until lightly browned, about 15 minutes. Cool completely. In bowl combine 1 teaspoon melted margarine with 1/2 teaspoon sugar. Stir in nuts and raisins. Spread over cooled granola mixture. Bake 2 minutes. Cool completely. In bowl combine remaining teaspoon melted margarine with remaining sugar. Stir in remaining ingredients. Spread over cooled nuts and raisins. Cool completely. Store in airtight container. Yield 8-12 servings.

Dice the olives. Crush the pecans. Place them in a food processor or blender with the other ingredients. Process until smooth. Refrigerate until firm. Shape into balls or a rectangle. Sprinkle with more pecans. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve with crackers.

In a large pot or dutch oven combine the bones and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, uncovered for 1 hour. Remove from heat, strain the stock into a large bowl through a fine sieve or colander lined with cheese cloth or a clean kitchen toweldiscard the bones. Bring the stock back to a boil, and then reduce heat to medium-lowadd green onions, celery ribs, carrot, yellow onion, white peppercorns, szechwan pepper, and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 20 minutesdiscard the szechwan peppercorns after cooking. Strain the stock through a fine sieve or colander lined with cheese cloth or a clean kitchen towel into a large bowldiscard the vegetables. Season the stock with saltlet the stock cool slightly, then place it in a refrigerator to chill completelytransfer it to airtight containers, and refrigerate for up to 3 days, or freeze for up to 1 monthfor best flavor, let the

Cut the pear halves in half. Put the grape halves into a bowl. Mix the cream cheese and cream. Mix the mayonnaise and yogurt. Add the cream mixture and the mayonnaise mixture to the grape halves. Put a spoonful of the grape mixture into the middle of a grape leaf and wrap the grape leaf around the mixture. Put the stuffed grape leaves in an open-faced casserole. Add the pear halves in natural juice. Sprinkle with the nuts and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Serves 4.

Combine the first five ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Stir the milk mixture into the dry ingredients and beat well. Stir in enough remaining flour to make a stiff batter. Spoon the batter into 2 loaf pans that have been greased and sprinkled with cornmeal. Sprinkle with cornmeal. Cover and let stand in warm place for 45 minutes. Bake at 400 for 25 minutes.

Heat margarine and flour together over medium heat, stirring constantly for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add chicken bouillon and stir for 1 minute. Add milk and bring to a boil. Cook, stirring constantly for 2 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat. Cool 3 minutes. Beat egg yolk and slowly pour into milk mixture while stirring with a wire whisk. Add salt and white pepper to taste.

Pre heat oven to 400f. In an oven safe dish place the tomatoes, sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add the dried herbs and sprinkle with sugar. Drizzle with the olive oil and turn the tomatoes so that they are evenly covered with the olive oil. Bake for 40 minutes or until the skins start to lift from the tomato. Allow the tomatoes to cool and remove the skins. Combine the tomato flesh with the juices in the dish and puree with an immersion blender or in a food processor. Serve immediately or refrigerate and reheat before serving. Serve with grilled cheese or french bread or just by itself.

Mix together the butter, flour and powdered sugar. Press into the bottom and up the sides of a greased and floured 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Beat together the cream cheese and the pudding mix until smooth and fluffy. Spread over the crust. Beat together the milk and the Cool Whip until smooth and fluffy. Spread over the cream cheese layer. Refrigerate at least two hours before cutting into squares. Makes 18 servings.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the onion in the oil until softened about 10 minutes. Stir in the mushrooms and cook another 10 minutes or until the liquid has evaporated and the mixture is tender, stirring occasionally. Transfer to a large saucepan. Add the water, milk powder, onion flakes, parsley flakes, flour, sherry wine, salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer uncovered about 20 minutes or until thickened, stirring occasionally. Stir in the green onions. Serve hot, topped with green onion tops. Serves 4.
In a bowl add all the marinade ingredients and mix well. Add the fish pieces and marinate for 10-15 minutes. Heat a griddle and grill the fish pieces until done. Serve hot with tomato ketchup.

Combine yogurt, garlic powder and garlic in a medium bowl. Place chicken in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Pour yogurt mixture over the chicken, sprinkle with paprika, parsley and parmesan cheese. Cover dish and refrigerate at least 2 hours. Bake covered at 425 f for about 45 minutes or until juices run clear when knife is inserted at thickest part of chicken and chicken is golden brown. Makes 6 servings.

Combine the first three ingredients in a large bowl and set aside. Cut the bear steak into bite size pieces and add to the bowl. Blend well. Marinate in the refrigerator at least 3 hours. Drain off the marinade and reserve it. In a small bowl blend the remaining ingredients. Drain the marinated meat and pat dry. Place on the grill and baste with the reserved marinade. Cook over medium heat for 30 minutes until meat is done. Serve with the barbecued bear mixture. Serves 2.
11/06/06: We just got back from the Smokies and had the most amazing ribs I have ever eaten. I have to have the recipe. I have searched all over the internet and cannot find it. Do you think you could help me?
I think I will have to try this recipe. It looks like it might be a little time consuming to make. But if it tastes as good as it looks I’ll have to give it a try. I like to have something that’s a little more special than a run of

In medium bowl, combine all ingredients except 4 of the tortillas. Place in 13×9 inch baking dish sprayed with cooking spray. Arrange remaining 4 tortillas on top of casserolecover with foil. Bake at 350f for 30-40 minutes or until heated through. Remove foil and bake 5 minutes longer or until top is golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
I like to get the chicken out of the oven 20 minutes before the rest of the meal is ready so that the chicken is not overcooked.
I’m so glad you liked it. It was one of my first meals that I made when I started blogging in 2008.
This dish looks really yummy! Thanks for sharing this recipe!
Made this last night, but used leftover roasted chicken instead of raw. I didn’t have cream of mushroom soup so I just used cream of chicken instead. This was delicious!
Sounds like it was easy to change it up! Thanks for sharing

Preheat oven to 350. Beat together eggs and sugars. Stir in butter and vanilla. Add corn syrup, and beat until blended. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Sprinkle with pecans. Bake until set. Serve warm or cold.

Open ice cream sandwiches and spread with a thin layer of cool whip. Sprinkle with mini chocolate chips and nuts. Drizzle with marshmallow cream and magic shell. Sprinkle with nuts. Place one ice cream sandwich on top of each bar. Cut into slices and serve immediately.

Place spinach in a collander and squeeze out excess liquid. Beat eggs with nutmeg and pepper in a small bowl. Stir in spinach and cottage cheese. Divide into thirds and put in a greased shallow baking dish. In each section put a thin layer of the spaghetti sauce and a third of the mozzarella cheese. Fill each with a tablespoon of the cheese mixture. Fold over the sides and seal with water. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes. Cover with remaining mozzarella and bake for another 10 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with additional parmesan and serve with remaining sauce.

Chop the spinach and the basil in a food processor until finely chopped. Add the garlic and continue to process. Add the lemon juice and the water and blend until smooth. Add the cheese and blend again. Remove from processor and add the pinenuts by hand. Taste and adjust with more lemon juice or water. Serve over pasta.

In a large bowl, combine the cake mix, pudding mix and pumpkin. Beat with electric mixer for 2 minutes. Stir in the water, vegetable oil and egg until well blended. Grease and flour a 9 x 13-inch pan. Sprinkle with the pecans and toffee bits. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting. Makes about 24 slices.

Pre heat oven to 400f. Season the fish with salt and pepper. In a bowl, combine the cheese and mustard. Spread the mustard mixture on the fish and top each piece with the chives. Bake in the pre heated oven for 12-14 minutes or until the fish is cooked through and the mustard is golden brown. Serve warm with lemon wedges and tomatoes.
This is a list of words that are synonyms of cod, and have the same meaning as cod. This list is generated automatically from Wikipedia mentions of cod. This is not a list of words identical to cod.

In a heavy saucepan, combine the water, honey, vanilla bean, nutmeg, cinnamon sticks, cloves, and lemon zest. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Simmer for 30 minutes. Add the vodka. Simmer 1 minute more. Strain the liqueur through a fine strainer into a heatproof container. Cool to room temperature. Store the liqueur in the refrigerator for up to 2 months.

Instant mashed potatoes are the key to this recipe, so don't skip that step! They make for a fluffy, light bread that will amaze you! Put the ingredients in the pan in this order: 1/2 cup flour, 1 1/2 tsp sugar, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp yeast, 1/2 cup warm water, 1/4 cup butter or margarine, 1 1/2 cups instant mashed potatoes, 1 cup heavy whipping cream (I use light whipping cream) and 1/2 cup cheddar cheese. Follow the bread machine instructions for mixing the dough and baking it. When it's done baking, brush the top of the bread with the remaining 1/4 cup butter or margarine. Sprinkle with shredded cheese while it's hot. Serve it while it's still warm!

In a medium saucepan, bring broth to a boil with butter over low heat, stirring constantly until butter is melted. Add flour and stir until it is combined with the butter mixture and is bubbly. Gradually add cream, stirring constantly until the mixture is thickened and smooth. Add cheese and white pepper, stir until cheese is melted and smooth. Stir in chives and white wine and heat until the mixture just comes to a boil and thickens slightly, remove from heat and keep warm. Preheat oven broiler. Place lobster tails under broiler until they turn red and the meat is heated through. Serve the tail meat on top of the creamy mixture.

Cut the mozzarella into 12 chunks. Place each chunk on one half of a bread slice and fold the other half over the top. Press edges together to seal. In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs and water. Spread the breadcrumbs in another shallow bowl. Dip the cheese pockets into the egg mixture, allowing excess to drip back in the bowl. Dredge in the breadcrumbs, tuning to coat evenly and completely. In a large, heavy frying pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Working in batches, fry the pockets, turning once, until deep golden brown--about 4 minutes each side. Drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with garlic salt and spices. Serve hot.

In a large pot over medium heat melt butter and saute bacon until crisp. Add shallots and saute 1 minute. Add orzo and saute until golden brown. Add chicken stock, water and bring to a boil. Stir in rice and cook for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to low and cook until rice is tender about 20 minutes total. Finish with extra bacon, if desired.

I tried this recipe tonight and my family enjoyed it a lot! I did have to add some additional broth because the rice did not absorb all of the liquid and it was a bit watery after 20 minutes. I will definitely make it again. Thanks for sharing!
My wife and I had this for dinner last night and it was excellent! We are still talking about it and are going to make it again

Combine the cream cheese and the yogurt in a medium bowl. Beat the mixture until it is well blended and smooth. Fold in the sugar. Add the vanilla extract. Chill the pie filling in the refrigerator until ready to use. Place the pie filling in the bottom of an unbaked graham cracker crust. Bake the pie in a preheated oven at 375 for 50 minutes or until the center is set. Remove the pie from the oven and let it cool before serving. Top the pie with chopped strawberries.

Peel the potatoes and boil until tender. Mash the potatoes and leave to cool slightly. Add the eggs and mix well. Add the flour and season with the mustard and herbs. Form into a round patty and cook in a hot pan with olive oil. Serve hot.

In a large bowl combine eggs, butter, all-purpose flour, milk and salt. Beat with a whisk until smooth. Stir in the brown sugar and ground cinnamon. Add the apples and toss to coat well. Heat the griddle until very hot. Lightly oil the griddle. Pour about 1/4 cup of the batter into the center of the griddle and spread in a circle with a spatula. Cook until the bottom is golden brown and the top is dry. Turn the pancake over and cook on the other side for a few seconds. Serve immediately with butter and maple syrup.

Sprinkle the fresh yeast into the water and let stand 5 minutes or until the yeast rises and forms a creamy foam on the surface of the liquid. Stir in the molasses and 1 cup of the shredded wheat. In a large mixing bowl combine the 3 cups of the shredded wheat and the salt, stirring well. Combine the water and the shortening and heat until the shortening melts. Add the hot mixture to the shredded wheat mixture and stir until the shredded wheat is lightly moistened. Let stand 10 minutes. Stir in the shortening and the remaining shredded wheat. Cover the shredded wheat mixture and let stand 30 minutes or until doubled in bulk. Punch down the shredded wheat mixture and turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide the shredded wheat mixture into two equal portions and shape each portion into an 8-inch square loaf. Place the loaves on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray and brush with the egg white. Bake at 350 F for

Peel and cube potatoes. Saute in butter and oil till golden. Add onion, green pepper and minced garlic. Cover and cook till vegetables are tender. Drain any liquid and add milk. Cook till thick. Remove from heat and add bacon and eggs. Stir till well mixed. Roll in warm tortillas and serve.

In a large mixing bowl add chicken breasts and spices. Coat chicken well. Place in a 9x13 inch pan. Sprinkle with apple juice. Arrange sweet potatoes around chicken and sprinkle with apple juice. Cover and bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f. Sprinkle flank steak with 1 teaspoon sherry and 1/2 teaspoon cornstarch. Place meat in a shallow baking dish. Bake 30 minutes or until meat is no longer pink. In a small bowl, combine remaining sherry and cornstarch. Set aside. In a heavy skillet, heat 1 tablespoon peanut oil over medium-high heat. Add ginger and cook until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Stir in broccoli and cook 5 minutes. Add remaining cornstarch mixture and broth. Bring to a boil. Cook 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in meat and remaining teaspoon cornstarch. Divide rice evenly among 4 bowls. Top each serving with meat mixture. Sprinkle with scallions and serve.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan. Add the vegetables and the garlic. Cook for 3-4 minutes. Add the beans and the stock. Bring to the boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the parsley and season to taste. Serve with fresh coriander leaves. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 325f. Scoop out pulp from pumpkin halves. Chop pulp finely and combine with other ingredients. Divide mixture between halves. Arrange halves in shallow baking pan with 1/2 inch water. Bake for 45 minutes or until tender. Serve hot or at room temperature. Makes 2 servings.

Preheat oven to 375. Cut potatoes and zucchini into 1/4 in cubes. In a large pot cover potatoes and zucchini with cold water. Bring to a boil over medium high heat. Reduce heat to medium low and cook until potatoes and zucchini are tender about 20 minutes. Drain vegetables. Set aside. In a small bowl combine garlic and 1/4 cup water. Microwave until garlic is soft 1 minute. Set aside. Heat 1/2 Tbs. Oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add onions. Cook 2 minutes or until tender. Add garlic mixture. Cook 1 minute stirring constantly. Add eggs. Cook 2 minutes stirring constantly. Stir in vegetables. Add 1/3 cup flour. Stir. Cook 1 minute. Add remaining flour. Stir until flour is absorbed. Turn mixture out into a greased 13 x 9 inch pan. Bake 1 hour 10 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 8 servings.

Squeeze the excess liquid from the spinach. Combine the spinach with the mayo and soup mix. Add the waterchestnuts and green onions. Refrigerate several hours or overnight. Serve with crackers or with vegetables.

Brown chops in oil in heavy skillet. Add all remaining ingredients except cornstarch. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat to low. Simmer 45 minutes or until pineapple is tender. Stir in cornstarch mixture. Simmer 1 minute or until thickened. Serve over cooked rice. Makes 4 servings. 1 serving equals 7 points.

Grease two 9 by 5 loaf pans. Mix together flour, sugar and salt. Stir in melted margarine and butter. Add milk and combine. Beat in eggs. Stir in soda and baking soda. Add in buttermilk and stir. Add in enough additional milk to make a stiff dough. Knead briefly. Divide dough between pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Brush tops of loaves with melted margarine or butter.
Combine the first 4 ingredients. Add the mustard and the celery seed. Mix well. Serve on toasted bread.

Cook pasta shells as directed on package, drain well. In a large pot or crock pot combine condensed soup, whipping cream, velveeta cheese, butter, garlic powder, onion powder, salt & pepper to taste. Heat through. Pour over cooked pasta shells. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees until bubbly. Serve hot.

Tear up firm tofu. Put tofu into a bowl and add tamari, water, five-spice powder, star anise and molasses. Toss until all marinated. Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add tofu, then turn over after 5 minutes. Cook for another 5 minutes. Transfer onto a plate. Garnish with star anise. Serve hot.

In a medium bowl combine the Italian seasoning, seasoning salt, and garlic powder. In another bowl whisk together the oil with the lemon juice. Remove 3/4 cup of the Italian seasoning mixture to a plate. Sprinkle both sides of the chicken with the remaining 3/4 cup of the Italian seasoning mixture. Grill chicken over medium heat until golden brown and cooked through, 4 to 5 minutes per side. Sprinkle with the reserved 3/4 cup Italian seasoning mixture. Serve with a slice of lemon on top of each breast.

Preheat the broiler. Grease a baking tray or roasting pan. Season fish all over with salt and pepper. Spread the mustard over the fish and sprinkle over the paprika. Drizzle the fish with the olive oil and then the vinegar and bake for 3-4 minutes on each side until fish just starts to flake when tested with a fork or skewer. Serve straight away with some fresh lemon wedges.
name: roasted broccoli w/dijoningredients: broccoli florets, canola oil, dijon mustard, garlic powder, cumin, paprika, chili powder, red pepper flakes, sea saltpreparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Toss florets with 2 tablespoons canola oil to coat evenly. Spread florets out onto two large rimmed baking sheets. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from oven and set aside to cool slightly. In a medium bowl, stir together mustard, gar

Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Scrub and cut kumara into chunks (peel if preferred). Place in a medium-sized baking dish and cover with plastic wrap. Microwave until just soft, about 10 minutes (or bake whole until tender). Mash with a potato masher until smooth. Set aside. Heat oil in a large frying pan over high heat until very hot, add onion, reduce heat to medium-high and cook until browned. Remove from heat. Stir in zucchini and yellow squash. Cook until just softened. Remove from heat and set aside to cool slightly. Cook steaks in a large frying pan over high heat until browned all over. Place in an ovenproof dish and bake for 5 minutes. To serve, arrange vegetables over the top, sprinkle with tomatoes and serve with mash.

Boil fingerling potatoes in a large pot of water. Drain and allow them to cool. Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F. Toss the potatoes with olive oil and spices. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Place in the oven and bake for about one hour. Remove the potatoes from the oven and allow them to cool. Peel the avocados. Mix sour cream, lime juice and chili powder together. Add the avocado and gently mix until the avocado is incorporated. Serve with the potatoes.

Bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Stir in couscous. Reduce heat to low. Covercook 5 minutes or until all liquid is absorbed. Stir in scallions and plums. Let stand 5 minutes, or until plums are softened and juicy. Combine goat cheese with remaining fresh mint leaves in a small bowl. Spoon couscous into a shallow bowltop with goat cheese mixture and drizzle with honey. Serve with balsamic vinegar.

In a large frying pan over medium heat, add oil and green pepper and cook until tender. Add tomato sauce and vinegar and stir. Add crushed pineapple and celery. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Season to taste. In the same pan over high heat, cook pork chops until done. Pour the mixture over the top of the cooked pork chops. Serve over rice.

In a large bowl cream together the butter and brown sugar until smooth and well-blended. Add the egg and milk and mix well. Stir in the flour, baking soda and salt. Stir in the oats. Drop dough by rounded teaspoons about 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 9-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from the pans to wire racks. Makes about 4 dozen.

Heat the oven to 350f. Wash the potatoes, trim off any eyes (green buds), then cut them lengthwise into quarters. Put them on a baking sheet and drizzle them with the vegetable oil. Sprinkle with the ground black pepper and the herbes de provence. Bake for about one hour, turning them after half an hour. Serve hot or warm.

Heat olive oil on medium low heat. Add whole wheat flour to make a roux. Once the roux is golden brown, add the chopped shiitake mushrooms. Sauté the mushrooms for 1 minute. Add the fresh thyme. Add the vegetable stock. Add the soy sauce, apple cider vinegar and sea salt. Add the fresh ground black pepper. Turn the heat off. Pour the mushroom gravy over the wild rice. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350. In a large bowl, beat butter and sugar until creamy. Beat in egg and vanilla. In another bowl, combine flour, baking powder and soda, and salt. Add to butter mixture and beat until smooth. On a lightly floured surface, roll dough into a 18x12-in. rectangle. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Roll up jelly-roll style and pinch ends to seal. Cut into 12 slices. In a shallow bowl or pie plate, combine the sugar and cinnamon. In another shallow dish, beat the cream until soft peaks formfold in the vanilla. On a baking sheet lined with wax paper, place the slices seam side down. Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven and cool completely. In a small bowl, combine the honey and hot water until smooth. Dip bottoms of each slice in the honey mixture and place in a shallow dish. Top with a spoonful of the cream and sprinkle

In a large saucepan cook macaroni in boiling water until tender but firm to bite. Drain and set aside in a bowl. In a large skillet, cook beef with dry onion soup mix until beef is browned. Stir in tomatoes and simmer until heated through. Stir in macaroni and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Cream butter. Gradually add sugar, beating until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Combine dry ingredients. Stir dry ingredients into butter mixture until just combined. Stir in chocolate and chili powder. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto baking sheets. Bake 8-10 minutes or until edges are firm. Remove from pans and cool completely on wire racks. Makes about 40 bites.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Remove the core from the cauliflower and cut the cauliflower into small florets. In a small bowl combine the olive oil, garlic, and red pepper flakes. Transfer to a 13 by 9-inch glass baking dish. Add the cauliflower to the mixture. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the top. Bake for 25 minutes or until the cauliflower is tender. Toss the cauliflower mixture with the hot pasta. Serve hot.

Toast 4 english muffins until golden brown on both sides. Meanwhile, chop 2 hard-boiled eggs and set aside. In a small bowl, combine 2 tablespoons prepared mustard and 2 tablespoons worcestershire sauce and set aside. Spread each toasted english muffin half with 1 tablespoon prepared mustard mixture and sprinkle 1/8 cup shredded cheddar cheese on each half. Arrange 1/4 of chopped eggs on each half and sprinkle with 1/4 cup chopped cooked ham and 1/4 cup chopped cooked bacon. Top each half with another toasted english muffin half and sprinkle the top half with 1/8 cup shredded cheddar cheese. To serve, cut each sandwich into 2 wedges and serve with cream for dipping.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cook broth and barley in a saucepan over medium heat until barley is tender. Remove from heat. Stir in onion and remaining ingredients. Pour into a greased 2-quart casserole. Cut each breast crosswise into 2 slices. Place slices on top of barley mixture. Cover. Bake 30 minutes. Uncover. Bake 5 minutes longer or until browned. Sprinkle with parsley.

To make the dumplings, place the flour in a small bowl. Add 1/3 cup water and stir until combined. Add 2 more tablespoons water if the dough is dry. Knead with your hands to form a smooth dough. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough until it is 1/8 inch thick. Use a 3 1/2 inch round cutter to cut out dumplings. Place them in boiling water for 2 minutes. In a small pot bring the stock to a boil. Add the bok choy, carrot, salt, white pepper, and sesame oil. Add the dumplings and cook for 3 minutes. Serve.
