Cook potatoes as directed. Add butter. Remove from heat. Add salsa. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve.

beat cream cheese until smooth. add eggs 1 at a time and beat well after each addition. beat in frangelico and vanilla. pour into the prepared shell and bake.
Name: Chocolate Cheesecake PieIngredients: cream cheese, butter, powdered sugar, vanilla extract, Milk Chocolate Chips, Frozen Whipped Topping, Chocolate Cookie Pie CrustPreparation:In large mixing bowl, beat cream cheese, butter, sugar, and vanilla. Beat in melted chocolate. Fold in whipped topping. Spoon into crust. Cover and chill until serving.
Name: Easy Cheesecake RecipeIngredients: cream cheese, vanilla, sugar, eggs, pie crustPreparation:Put cream cheese, vanilla, and sugar in a large bowl. Mix the ingredients in the bowl. Add eggs and mix until there are no remaining lumps. Pour into the pie crust. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes.
Name: Lynne's

Combine the breadcrumbs and egg in a bowl. Add the ground chicken and mix until well blended. Add the lemon juice, sun-dried tomatoes and herbs. Season with the salt and pepper. Divide into 4 equal portions and form into patties. Top each patty with a small piece of feta cheese and press down with your thumb. Grill over medium heat until done. Serve on buns with lettuce and tomato.

In a mixing bowl, combine the eggs and light corn syrup and beat well. Blend in the brown sugar and lemon juice. Add the rind and flour and mix well. Fold in the nuts. Pour into the unbaked pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 to 50 minutes or until the center is set and the crust is golden brown. Cool before serving. Top with whipped cream and slices of lemon.

Mix the beef, sausage, tomatoes, potatoes, onion, soup and tomato paste in a 13x9-inch baking dish. Cover and bake for 45 minutes, stirring halfway through baking time. In the last 15 minutes of baking, sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top of the casserole. Sprinkle the parsley on top of the cheese. Bake uncovered for 5 minutes more to melt the cheese. Serve hot.

In a large mixing bowl combine the cream cheese, sugar, eggs, and vanilla until smooth. Add the flour and baking powder and combine well. Pour into a greased 9 x 5 x 3 pan. Bake at 325 for 1 hour. Cool for 15 minutes then invert onto a wire rack to cool. Store at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets.In a large bowl, cream together the butter and granulated sugar. Beat in the vanilla extract. Mix in the all-purpose flour, baking soda and salt. Add the cardamom, ginger, cinnamon and cloves.Shape the dough into 1 inch balls.Place on the prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned.Cool on wire racks.Dust the cookies with powdered sugar.
Combine all ingredients in a pot on the stove and bring to a simmer. Remove from heat. Stir occasionally. Serve with a cinnamon stick.

Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Rub both sides of the meat and let it sit for an hour. I usually cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let it sit in the fridge overnight. I use a gas grill and put the ribs on the highest heat setting. I place the ribs on the grill rack with the bone side facing down. I put a small bowl of water on the side of the grill. I turn the ribs every few minutes and spritz the meat with the water. After about 40 minutes or so I turn the heat down to medium and spritz with the water every few minutes. If you have a cover put the cover on and turn down the heat to low. I cook the ribs until they are tender and the meat falls off the bone. I serve the ribs with a side of barbecue sauce for dipping. I serve the rest of the sauce on the side so people can dip as much or as little as they want.

Cut the cucumbers into thin slices. Remove the seeds from the chilies and slice them thinly. Chop the onion into small pieces. Soak the dried shrimp in hot water for about 5 minutes. Cut the lime into wedges. Place the lime juice, fish sauce, sugar, peanut oil, roasted peanuts in a small bowl and whisk until the sugar has dissolved. Toss all the vegetables with the dressing until well coated.
Combine all of the ingredients together and pour into a 9x13 inch cake pan. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour. Remove from pan and let cool. Serve warm or cold.

Cut the sheets of phyllo dough in half. Brush each sheet with melted butter. Layer the filling ingredients as follows, in order. Spread ricotta cheese evenly over a sheet of phyllo dough. Top with cream cheese. Sprinkle with feta and season with a little salt and pepper. Spread with egg. Top with another sheet of phyllo. Brush with butter. Repeat layering until you have used up all of the sheets. Trim off the edges if necessary. Cut each roll into 3 pieces. Bake in a preheated oven at 375f for 25 minutes. Leave to stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Combine pineapple chunks, apples, celery, kiwi fruit, grapes and walnut pieces in large bowl. In a small bowl combine fat-free yogurt, honey, mayonnaise, lemon juice. Combine fruit mixture with dressing mixturerefrigerate at least 2 hours before serving to blend flavors. Serve on lettuce leaves.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease a 12 inch pizza pan. In a large bowl, combine the first 5 ingredients until well mixed. Roll into a 12 inch circle. Press onto pan. Bake for 10 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Top with desired toppings and bake an additional 10 minutes.

Combine wheat flour, cracked wheat, cornmeal, soya flour, bacon, herbs and salt to make a dough. Let stand for 10 minutes. Knead, adding buttermilk until soft dough forms. Roll out to 1/2 -inch thickness and cut into squares or triangles with a pastry cutter. Let rise for 20 minutes. Bake for 12 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve hot with butter or margarine, marmalade or honey.

Combine soy sauce, garlic and orange marmalade in slow cookeradd spareribscover and cook on low heat for 8 hours or until meat is tender. Combine ketchup and remaining 1/4 cup water in a small bowlpour over ribs. Cover and cook another 1 1/2 hours or until meat is tender and sauce is thickened. Serves 4-5.

Soak almonds overnight in water. Strain and blend in blender. Add sugar, food coloring and orange flower water. Divide mixture into 24 equal portions and roll into small balls. Place a walnut half in the center of each ball. Shape the ball around the nut to form a date. Refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight. Roll in powdered sugar just before serving.
Place all but the cayenne pepper in a crock pot. Cook on low for 6 hours. Add the cayenne pepper. Toss the cooked bow tie pasta into the soup. Simmer for 2 minutes to heat the pasta and serve.

In a large soup pot or dutch oven, saute the onions in a little olive oil over medium heat for 5-10 minutes. Add the garlic and saute an additional 2-3 minutes. Stir in the carrots, beans, broth and tomatoes. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium low and simmer for 30-40 minutes. Stir occasionally. Serve hot. Enjoy.

Peel and dice the tomatoes and onion. Wash and dice the cilantro. Cut the jalapeno in half and remove the seeds and inner ribs. Cut into 1-inch pieces. Combine the vegetables in a medium bowl and toss with the lime juice. Add the salt to taste. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heatadd spring onions and cook 3 to 4 minutes. Add tomatoes, garlic, salt and pepper and cook another 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat, allow to cool slightly, then stuff into the pepper halves. Place the pepper halves into a shallow casserole dish. Sprinkle with the remaining basil leaves. Bake 20 to 25 minutes, until the peppers are tender and the topping is golden brown. Serve hot.
Combine first five ingredients in a large bowl. Mix well. Toss with dressing and mix well. Cover and refrigerate overnight.

To make the base put the ground hazelnuts into a bowl and mix with the ground almonds, rice flour and hazelnut liqueur. Press into the base of four 20cm/8inch spring form cake tins and place in the freezer for an hour. To make the filling beat the Nutella with the Frangelico in a bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Spoon the mixture onto the base and freeze for an hour. To make the top spread the remaining Nutella onto the frozen base and top with the chopped hazelnuts and the dark chocolate curls. Freeze for another hour and serve straight from the freezer.

In a large saucepan, combine the uncooked rice, water, margarine and dry onion soup mix. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to lowcover and simmer for 40 minutes or until the rice is tender. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place the center-cut pork chops on top of the rice. Cover the pan with foil. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove the cover and bake for an additional 30 minutes, or until the chops are done.

In a skillet over medium high heat brown the chicken breasts in the vegetable oil. Once browned add the bell peppers and water. Cook until water boils away. Add the picante sauce and cook until it thickens. Turn off heat and add the cheese. Heat the flour tortillas in the microwave for about 1 minute. Put a scoop of rice in the center of each tortilla and top with some of the picante mixture. Fold the ends of the tortilla over the filling and fold the sides over the top. Roll it up and place seam side down on a baking sheet. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Cook the chimichangas until golden brown. Serve with salsa.

Combine gelatin with boiling water in medium saucepan. Stir in milk and vanilla pudding mix until smooth and thickened. Stir in sour cherries. Spread into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish and chill until set. Cut into cubes and roll in powdered sugar before serving.
Combine ingredients in a large glass jar. Cover and shake well. Refrigerate. Makes about 1/4 cup. Yields about 1 cup of dressing. Use 1/3 cup of dressing for each 2 cups of lettuce.

In a skillet, melt butter. Add bacon. Cook over medium heat until crisp. Transfer to paper towels. Add pork chops to skillet. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Brown on all sides. Add onion to skillet. Add garlic clove. Cook over low heat until onions are golden brown. Add sauerkraut. Stir until heated through. Add beer. Cover skillet. Simmer over low heat for 20-25 minutes, or until meat is tender. Serve with mashed potatoes.
I am looking for a recipe for baking sauerkraut. I know that it is made by adding a little brown sugar. I have no idea how to cook it. I would appreciate any help that you can give me. Thanks.
What is your favorite way to prepare sauerkraut?

Season fish on both sides with seasoning salt. Dust fish lightly with flour. Heat oil in a nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Add fish and saute until golden brown. Remove fish from pan and set aside. Combine remaining ingredients. Pour mixture over fish and bake at 400f for 15 minutes. Serve hot.

In a frying pan over medium heat add butter. When melted add the cheese. Cook on each side until golden brown. Squeeze lemon juice over. Serve with french bread.
Name: saganakiIngredients: Kasseri Cheese, Flour, Olive Oil, Ouzo, Lemon, Fresh Oregano, Cherry Tomatoes, Pita Bread, Kalamata OlivePreparation: Soak the Cheese in Ouzo and Dredge in Flour. Heat Olive Oil until Almost Smoking. Saut Cheese and Brown about 1 Minute on Each Side. Flame with More Ouzo. Transfer to Serving Platter and Squeeze Lemon Juice and Sprinkle Oregano and Salt and Pepper. Serve with Pita Bread, Olives and Tomatoes.

Slice the garlic cloves and sprinkle over the lamb. Mix the honey and vinegar. Pour this over the meat and marinate for 4-5 hours. Cook the lamb on the barbecue or under the broiler for 10-12 minutes. Sprinkle with the salt and black pepper and serve. Serve with sautéed zucchini.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine the hash browns with the rice krispies and set aside. In a large bowl, combine the sour cream, cheese and onions. Add the soup and butter and blend thoroughly. Add the hashbrowns and rice krispies and stir to combine. Pour into a greased 13 x 9 inch baking pan. Bake for 45 minutes or until the top is golden brown.

Put everything except the onion slices into the crockpot, mix well. Cook on low 6-8 hours or high 3-4 hours. Cook on high 1 hour, then add onion slices. Cook another 1-2 hours or until onions are soft.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Place the dough on an ungreased baking sheet. Separate dough into rectangles. Mix melted butter with garlic cloves. Spoon mixture over the dough rectangles, spreading mixture to cover entire dough rectangle. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake for about 12 minutes or until the tops are golden brown and cheese is melted. Serve warm. Serves about 6.

In a food processor combine the yogurt, cinnamon, and sugar. Process until smooth. Transfer to a small bowl. Add the olive oil and honey. Stir to combine. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve. Preheat the grill to high. Grill the fig halves until the skins are charred on both sides. Top each slice with a spoonful of the yogurt mixture and a sprinkling of toasted hazelnuts. Serve immediately.

Prepare fruit fillingheat brown sugar with butter in 2-quart saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolves, stirring constantlycook about 2 minutes or until mixture is smooth and begins to bubblestir in flour and cinnamonpour into large bowlstir in fruitpour mixture into prepared dishtop with praline toppingbake 40 minutes or until golden brownserve warm with ice cream or whipped cream if desired.

Cook pasta al dente. Add peas to the water about 2 minutes before the pasta is done. Drain both. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onion. Saute until translucent. Add the heavy cream. Heat to boiling. Add the pasta and the ham. Stir gently. Taste for seasoning. Garnish with Parmesan.

Prepare the crust: In a medium bowl combine the graham cracker crumbs and brown sugar, add melted margarine and stir well. Press into a 9 inch springform pan and refrigerate for a least one hour. Prepare the filling: In a mixing bowl combine the cream cheese with the gelatin and whisk together until smooth. In a medium saucepan combine the sugar and milk and stir well. Add the gelatin mixture and stir until the gelatin is dissolved and the mixture is smooth. Add the lemon juice and the blueberries and stir well. Pour the filling into the prepared springform pan. Refrigerate for at least four hours or until set. Top the dessert with the whipped cream and sprinkle the brown sugar over the top. Serve chilled.
Place espresso in cup. Add steamed milk to cover espresso. Add cocoa powder to taste. Drizzle over a little maple syrup to taste.

Preheat broiler. Wash peppers well, remove stem and seeds. Cut peppers into strips. Coat peppers with olive oil. Broil for about 45 minutes. Remove from broiler. Mix together remaining ingredients. Add to peppers. Refrigerate. Serve cold.

In a small bowl, stir together garlic and parsley. Spread 1 side of each slice of sourdough bread with garlic mixture. Layer 1 slice of sourdough with 1 slice of each of the remaining cheeses, except for parmesan cheese. Place remaining slice of sourdough on top of cheese and press down lightly to secure sandwiches. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon of butter per sandwich until the sandwiches are golden brown. Serve immediately.

Preheat your easy bake oven for 20 minutes. Spray your easy bake oven pan with cooking spray. Mix together the dry ingredients in a bowl and set aside. In another bowl mix together the milk, shortening and vanilla. Add the dry mixture and mix until the batter is smooth. Pour into your easy bake pan and bake for 35 minutes or until done. Remove and let cool before serving.

Prepare an ice bath. In a blender combine lemon juice, 1 1/4 cups of the granulated sugar, and the half-and-halfpuree until smooth. Strain through a fine sieve into a large bowl, pressing on solidsdiscard solids. Stir in the remaining 1/4 cup granulated sugar. Stir in the crushed pineapple with juice. Chill until very cold, about 4 hours. Stir in the whipping cream just before serving. Serve immediately, garnished with mint.

Preheat oven to 350. Butter a 13x9 pan. Combine first three ingredients in a large bowl. Spread evenly over the bottom of the pan. Place peaches over the batter. Cut cake mix into pieces. Add pudding mix. Combine. Spread evenly over the fruit. Beat together milk, oil and vanilla. Pour over the top. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean. Let cool completely. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before cutting into squares. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Place the squash cut side up on a cookie sheet lined with foil and bake for about 45 minutes or until tender when pierced with a fork. Meanwhile, combine the sugar, flour, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, orange rind and nuts with melted butter in a small bowl. Fill the cavities with this mixture and return the squash to the oven for 5 minutes or until filling is bubbly hot and squash is hot through. Serve hot as an appetizer or side dish. Makes 4 servings.

In a large soup pot saute turkey kielbasa, onion, green pepper, celery rib with cajun seasoning until tender, about 5 minutes. Remove from pan with slotted spoon add to pot. Increase heat to high add bay leaf to pan. Saute until pan is dry about 3 minutes. Add stewed tomatoes and broth. Bring to boil reduce heat to low cover pot return turkey kielbasa to pot. Simmer 20 minutes or until rice is tender. Serve hot garnished with chopped parsley or green onions if desired.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened and translucent, 3-4 minutes. Add chiles and cook until tender. Add zucchini and cook until tender-crisp. Add tomatoes and cook until softened. Season to taste. Add pasta and cook until al dente. Sprinkle with monterey jack and serve.

Boil the potatoes whole for about 20-30 minutes or until easily pierced with a fork. Drain and cool completely. Large dice the potatoes. Place in a bowl with enough room for stirring. Add the remaining ingrdients, using salt and pepper to taste. Stir and chill until ready to serve. Feel free to add more sour cream if salad seems dry.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Pound the chicken breasts to a thin layer. Mix together the Neufchatel cheese, onions, sherry and nutmeg. Spread mixture onto the chicken breasts and roll up. Place the stuffed breasts on a broiler pan. Sprinkle with paprika and bake for 20-25 minutes or until done. For the sauce combine the mayonnaise and lemon juice with the hot sauce. Spread the sauce over the toasted roll. Top with the chicken roll and garnish with a sprig of parsley.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add gemelli. Cook according to package directions. Drain. In a saute pan, heat the pine nuts in the olive oil until brown. Set aside. In the same pan over medium heat, add the asparagus and cook for 3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 more minute. Add the pasta and toss. Add the seasoning. Toss until well blended. Drizzle with the lemon juice. Sprinkle the pine nut on top.

In a large mixing bowl combine all of the crust ingredients. Press mixture onto the bottom of a 9 inch pie pan. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Cool completely. In a large mixing bowl combine all of the filling ingredients. Pour filling over cooled crust. Chill for at least 3 hours before serving with whipped topping.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl, combine pork, eggs, skim milk, dijon-style mustard and worcestershire. Season with kosher salt and black pepper. Mix until combined. Place in loaf pan. In medium bowl, combine breadcrumbs and parsley. Sprinkle over top of pork mixture. Wrap bacon around loaf. Bake 1-1/2 hours.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add onions and cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in the beans and heat until hot. Spray both sides of each tortilla with cooking spray and place on a baking sheet. Spoon about half a cup of the bean mixture down the center of each tortilla. Sprinkle each with a tablespoon of the cheese. Fold up the sides of the tortilla over the filling, then fold the top over the filling to make a triangle. Bake for 5 minutes or until golden brown and bubbly. Serve with salsa if desired.

Cut the squash into cubes. In a large mixing bowl, add the vegetables and egg. Mix in the bread crumbs and cheese. Add seasoning to taste. Form into cakes. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. When the butter is bubbling, add the cakes. Cook 3-4 minutes per side. Serve hot.
Today I was so tired I couldn’t even get myself to write an entry. So I’m cheating by using my friend’s blog to write this entry. I think I’m getting sick. I haven’t been this tired in years.
I’m so tired I can’t even get myself to write an entry. I feel like I’m getting sick. My head hurts, my eyes hurt and my muscles feel heavy. I’ve been lying in bed for the past 2 hours just thinking. I think I’m getting sick.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a mini loaf pan with cooking spray or line with a strip of non-stick baking paper cut to fit the pan. In a large mixing bowl combine the pepper, celery, oats, catsup, thyme and salt. Mix well with a fork or potato masher. Add the turkey and mix until evenly distributed. Spoon mixture into the loaf pan and spread it out to form a loaf with an indentation in the center. Place pan in the oven and bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until a thermometer inserted into the thickest portion reads 165 degrees F. Remove pan from the oven and let stand for 5 minutes before removing loaves from pan to a serving platter. Cut into individual loaves and serve warm.

Cook the hamburger and drain. Add the brown sugar and cook until it carmelizes. Add the onion and garlic and cook until tender. Stir in the soup. Add the milk and egg noodles and cook until heated through. Pour into a greased 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Mix the soup and sauce and pour over the hamburger. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until hot and bubbly.

Rub tenderloin with kosher salt and pepper to taste. In a large bowl, whisk together onion powder, garlic powder, thyme, ginger powder, soy sauce and olive oil. Pour mixture into slow cooker. Add tenderloin to slow cooker and top with pineapple chunks and dried cranberries. Cook on high for 4 hours or on low for 8 hours. Remove tenderloin from slow cooker. Remove and discard the dried cranberries. Pour the remaining contents into a blender or food processor and puree. Pour the puree back into the slow cooker. Slice the tenderloin into thin slices. Serve with the puree.

Bring a large pot of water to a boiladd ramen noodles and cook according to package directions. Break up the noodles and drain the pot of boiling water and stir. Add ketchup and the contents of the flavor packets and stir again until the ketchup is distributed through the noodlesremove from heat and let cool until able to handle with your hands. Break up the bread into small pieces and add to the pot. Mix all together and add the cheese until it is thoroughly distributed through the stew and the cheese is melted. Serve while hot.

Heat olive oil over medium heat in a large heavy-bottom pot. Add the garlic and chicken stock. Add smoked turkey leg. Cook for 5 minutes or until the smoked turkey leg is fully cooked. Add the collards. Cook 25 minutes or until tender. Add the salt and pepper. Garnish with crushed red pepper flakes.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed cream together the butter and sugars until combined. Add the egg and vanilla. Add the all-purpose flour, kosher salt and baking powder and mix until combined. Add the baking soda and mix. Add the chocolate chips and mix until just combined. Use a cookie scoop and place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 9 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes. Transfer to a wire rack and let cool.
i have never been good at baking. i’m a “throw it together” kind of girl. i just never seem to measure anything. i’m working on it. but i do have a recipe i’ve made over and over that is so good. i’ve tried others but they never seem as good.
i use a hand mixer for these. i do not have a stand mixer.
2. cream together the butter and sugars.
3. add the eggs and the vanilla.
4. add the flour mixture and mix

Mix all the ingredients together. Shape into 4 balls. Flatten the balls to about 1/2 inch thickness. Fry them in lots of butter. They should be medium rare inside. Serve with fried potatoes, or on a toast. You can also put a fried egg on top.

Mix milk and mushrooms together, put aside. Brown pork chops on each side. Remove from skillet and put aside. Add garlic powder to the skillet that the chops were cooked in and saute for one minute. Add the mushrooms mixture to the pan and stir constantly. Add chops back to the pan and cover with the lid. Cook 15-20 minutes or until done. Serve.
This is the best recipe for mushroom pork tenderloin that I've ever tasted! I love it!
Pork tenderloin is the best cut of meat to use when you want to make something that is moist and tender. I love to make this dish for my family because they always rave about it.
I love to cook this recipe for my family because it's so easy to make and they love it! I serve it with mashed potatoes and green beans.
This is my favorite way to prepare pork tenderloin! It's so delicious and easy to make.

Cook sausages over medium heat until crumbled and browned. Add onions to pan. Add half-and-half, eggs, oregano and salt and pepper to taste. Cover pan and cook over low heat for about 15 minutes or until eggs are set.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-low heat until it is hot but not smoking. Add the onions and cook until softened. Add the butter and cook until melted. Add the chicken and cook until lightly browned. Add the lemon rind and cook for 2 minutes. Add capers and juice and cook 2 minutes more. Add basil and cook 2 minutes more. Serve over hot rice.

In a large bowl combine the margarine and 1/2 cup of the granulated sugar. Beat with a mixer at medium speed until well blended (about 1 minute). Add the egg and beat until smooth. Beat in the vanilla and orange zest. Combine the flour and baking powderadd to margarine mixture alternately with the lemon juice. Beat at low speed until combined. Cover and chill for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 375f. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Divide dough into 10 equal portions. Roll each portion into a 1-inch ball. Place balls 1-inch apart on baking sheets. Bake until lightly browned (20-25 minutes). Cool on wire racks. Stir powdered sugar into remaining 3/4 cup granulated sugar. Dip warm cookies in powdered mixtureplace on wire racks. Cool completely. Makes 40 cookies.
Sugar and Butter are my favorites, i love them!
I really like the Vanilla Pudding!
I like

Cut beef into bite-sized chunks and place in shallow dish. Whisk together red wine and black pepper. Pour over beef. Cover with plastic wrap and chill overnight. To serve, cook asparagus in boiling water until just tender, about 4 minutes. Drain and refresh under cold water. Toss together asparagus and herbs. Divide butter lettuce among plates and top with beef. Drizzle avocado dip over beef. Top with asparagus and sprinkle with nasturtium petals.

Cream together margarine and brown sugar. Beat in egg and buttermilk. In a separate bowl mix together oats, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Add dry mixture to wet mixture and mix just until combined. Fold in blueberries. Spoon into greased muffin cups and bake for 20 minutes.

Combine cabbage, onions and almonds in a large bowl. In another bowl whisk together the seasoning sauce. Pour over coleslaw and toss well to coat. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish with sesame seeds and more almonds if desired. Serve on lettuce leaves or in a salad bowl.

Brown ground beef and garlic. Stir in onions and cook until the onions are clear. Add water and bouillon granules and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer 10 minutes. Stir in sour cream and flour. Cook over low heat 5 minutes. Cook egg noodles according to package directions. Drain and serve topped with Beef Stroganoff mixture.

Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Cut the tomatoes in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds. Brush both sides of each tomato with the olive oil, sprinkle with the garlic and olives and season with the salt and pepper. Grill the tomatoes until they are just beginning to soften and the olives are lightly browned, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine cookies and butter in a food processor and process until fine crumbs form. Press into bottom and sides of 9-inch metal pie pan. Bake until firm (about 10 minutes). Cool. Spread ice cream into pie shell and freeze for about 1 hour or until firm. Combine remaining cookie crumbs and peanuts in a small bowl. Sprinkle over ice cream. Drizzle with fudge sauce and top with peanut butter cups. Return pie to freezer and freeze until firm (at least 1 hour). Remove from freezer about 10 minutes before serving. Serve with hot coffee and coffee liqueur.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine whole wheat pastry flour, raw sugar and salt in a medium bowl. Mix with a fork or pastry blender until crumbly. Add melted butter and mix until crumbly dough forms. Shape into 1-inch balls. Place balls about 1-inch apart on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on cookie sheet for 1 minute. Transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine all the dry ingredients. Add milk and mix until just moistened. Fold in the applesauce. Pour into a 9x5 loaf pan. Bake for 50 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Cook the pasta in boiling water until al dente. Drain and return to the pot. Combine the other ingredients and toss until well coated. Sprinkle with more parmesan and serve.

Cut the meat into chunks. Season with the salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a heavy based pan. Fry the meat until brown. Add the water. Add the sugar, sultanas and vegetables. Simmer for 1 hour until tender. Serve with rice or bread.

Cut pears in half lengthwisearrange, cut side down on lightly greased baking dish. Sprinkle with sugar and dot with butter. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes or until tender. Pour heavy cream over pearsbake 10 minutes basting frequently.

Place bread in liquid. In small bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients with the bread soakings. Melt the butter in another bowl. Stir the wet bread soakings into the melted butter until the mixture is smooth. Allow to rest for several minutes while you bring the broth to a boil. Drop the batter by the heaping teaspoon into the boiling broth. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the bread dumplings are cooked through.
Name: Baking Powder Dumpling
1 tablespoon shortening (melted)
Dissolve the baking soda into the boiling water and then add the flour, salt, and shortening. Stir until well mixed. Drop by spoonfuls into the boiling stew. Cook for 15 minutes over medium heat.
Name: Marge's Dumplings
2 tablespoons shortening (melted)
Name: Fluffy Dumpling
1/2 cup shortening (melted)
Name: Never Fail Dumpling
Name: Dumplings (Gluten

In a medium bowl, combine the milk, cocoa powder, and vanillaset aside. In another bowl, whisk the flour, eggs, oil, and salt together until smooth. Add the cocoa mixture to the bowl of egg mixturestir to combine. Heat an electric skillet or large nonstick skillet over medium-low heatbrush with cooking oil to coat the surface. Use about 2 tbsp of the batter to make each crepepour the batter into the skillet in the shape of a pancakecook for about 30 seconds or until the edges are dryflip the crepe over using a spatulacook for another 30 seconds or until the underside is dryremove the crepe from the skilletrepeat with remaining batter to make about 6 crepesdust the crepes with powdered sugar before serving.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium bowl beat together the eggs and milk. In a medium baking dish add the scallops and sprinkle the cracker crumbs over top. Pour the egg mixture over the crumbs and stir to combine. Bake uncovered for 35 minutes or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool for at least 5 minutes. Top with the cheddar cheese and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sift together the flour, granulated sugar, brown sugar, baking soda, and salt. Beat the margarine and granulated sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer until creamy. Beat in the vanilla. Add the egg, beating well after each addition. Mix in the dry ingredients. Stir in the white chocolate chips. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake in the preheated oven until the edges are golden brown. Remove the cookies from the cookie sheets to cool on wire racks.

Melt the butter and chocolate in a double boiler over simmering water. Whisk in the vanilla. Remove from heat and stir in the egg yolks. Combine the flour and salt and stir into the chocolate mixture. Beat the egg whites with a pinch of salt until they form stiff peaks. Fold into the chocolate mixture. Divide among greased or paper lined muffin cups. Bake for 10 minutes at 350. In the last 2 minutes of cooking time, add a few drops of water to the top of each muffin. Let the water bubble for a minute, then remove the muffins from the oven and serve.

Beat light cream cheese and fat-free condensed milk with electric mixer on medium speed for 4 minutes. Stir in orange concentrate. Add 2 cups of frozen orange juice concentrate and continue to beat. Fold in Cool Whip. Spoon into prepared crust. Cover and chill for at least 2 hours. Top with remaining Cool Whip. Sprinkle with toasted coconut. Refrigerate for up to 24 hours.

Mix together the first 3 ingredients and set aside. In small bowl mix together remaining ingredients. Add to first mixture and blend well. Use for potato salad, chicken salad, egg salad, or as is on any kind of salad.

In a large bowl combine the tomatoes, mozzarella and 1 tablespoon of the extra virgin olive oil. Toss to coat evenly and set aside for about 1 hour. Meanwhile, cook the pasta in a large pot of lightly-salted water until it is al dente and drain. Combine the tomato mixture with the pasta and add the basil, red wine vinegar and remaining 1 tablespoon of extra virgin olive oil. Add the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of pepper and toss to combine. Taste and adjust the seasonings with salt as needed. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onions and saute until softened. Add ground beef and cook until no longer pink. Drain and return to skillet. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Add macaroni and cook until tender. Stir in tomato sauce and chili powder. Bring to a boil. Add in kidney beans. Sprinkle in cheese and stir until melted. Serve hot.

Spread half of cream cheese in bottom of tortilla. Spread half of ranch dressing mix in middle of tortilla. Spread half of miracle whip in middle of tortilla. Sprinkle with half of shredded cheese. Sprinkle with half of jalapenos. Fold tortilla over. Cut in half. Serves 1.
I really like your website. I have added it to my bookmarks and will be back!

In a large heavy saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add shallot and scallions. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in celery. Cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in chicken broth. Increase heat to high and bring to boil. Stir in potato. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until potato is tender. Remove from heat. In small bowl, whisk together rosemary, nutmeg, and half-and-half. Ladle about 1 cup of hot soup into blender or food processor. Cover. Process until smooth. Repeat with remaining hot soup. Return puree to saucepan. Stir in additional half-and-half to thin to desired consistency. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Prepare a 9x13 inch baking pan with cooking spray. In a medium bowl, combine the cornmeal and buttermilk. In a small bowl, combine the cream cheese and butter. In a large bowl, combine the cornmeal mixture and the cream cheese mixture. Add the eggs, one at a time, and mix well after each addition. Add the raisins. Stir in the brown sugar and the pumpkin pie spice. Spray a large bowl with cooking oil. Add the cornmeal mixture and mix until well combined. Press half of the batter into the prepared baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the remaining batter with the cranberry chutney and spread over the baked batter. Bake 15 minutes more. Sprinkle with the nuts and serve.

Wash apples. Core with apple corer. Cut the apple into 1/8 inch slices. Toss the apple slices with the sugar. Make simple syrup by combining corn syrup and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. Add the cinnamon oil and red food coloring. Simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Cool. Prepare the skewers by inserting the tip into the apple slice. Insert the skewer into the apple slice. Place in refrigerator until ready to serve.

Marinate the steak in the rosemary, soy sauce, barbecue sauce, wine and garlic. Rub it all over the steak. Leave it in the fridge overnight. The next day take it out of the fridge and leave it at room temperature for 1 hour. Now place the steak on the barbecue and cook for 20 minutes turning it regularly until it is cooked through.

In a large heavy pot heat the ghee over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until golden brown. Add the garlic and the ginger and saute until the garlic is softened and the ginger is fragrant. Add the spices and cook until the spices are fragrant and the oil is no longer clear. Add the butter and stir until the butter is incorporated with the spices and the mixture is very hot and bubbly. Let simmer until the butter is fragrant and the mixture is thickened. Serve warm.

Cook the chicken breasts according to your package instructions. Let cool and shred with two forks. Mix together the mayonnaise, seasoning and 1/2 cup of the shredded chicken. Spoon the mixture into a greased 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with the remaining 1 cup of the shredded chicken and top with the crushed doritos. Melt the butter in a small saucepan and pour over the top. Bake at 350° for 20-25 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and the sauce is bubbly. Serve with tortilla chips.
I want you to know that I think it is very irresponsible of you to share recipes that use canned soup as a main ingredient. If you are not eating a healthy diet or do not care about your health, that is one thing. But if you care about your health and your family's health and the health of others, you should not be posting recipes that use canned soups. Canned soups are loaded with chemicals. The chemicals in
Stir together ricotta, yogurt, walnuts, garlic powder and pepper. Add butter. Stir over low heat until warm. Spoon onto hot cooked pasta. Top with parmesan cheese and parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan. In a large bowl mix together the turkey, stuffing mix, eggs, and milk. Add the vegetables and cranberries. Pour into prepared loaf pan. Bake 1 hour or until internal temperature reaches 170 degrees and no longer pink in center. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.
Mary, I hope your family enjoys your yummy dishes!

Measure tea into a tea pot or heat proof pitcher. Add ginger. Pour boiling water over tea. Cover and steep 5 minutes. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Add lemon juice and strain tea. Add more ice if desired. Garnish with mint sprigs.
This entry was posted on April 14, 2009 at 3:40 pm	and is filed under All, Beverages. Tagged: iced green tea with ginger, iced lemon ginger mint tea, iced tea with fresh mint leaves, Iced tea with ginger, Mint iced tea, Mint Julep Sweet Tea, Touch of Mint Iced Tea. You can follow any responses to this entry through the RSS 2.0 feed. You can leave a response, or trackback from your own site.

Place Oreos in food processor and pulse until finely ground. Add butter and pulse to mix. Press mixture onto bottom and sides of 9-inch metal pie pan. Freeze until firm, about 10 minutes. Spread coffee ice cream over crust and smooth with spatula. Spread chocolate ice cream over coffee ice cream. Freeze until firm, about 10 minutes. Spread chocolate fudge topping over ice cream. Chill at least 3 hours before serving. Garnish with whipped cream and walnuts just before serving.
Combine yogurt, dill, vinegar and garlic. Brush on fish. Let stand for 15 minutes. Mash the mayonnaise. Spread on fish. Grill. Serve hot.

Cut up the apple and red onion into small pieces and place in a bowl. Cut up the green onions into small pieces. Place all the cut up vegetables and fruits together in the bowl with the cashews. Put the dressing in the bowl and mix it with the vegetables and fruits. Place the bowl of vegetables and fruits in the refrigerator for about 2 hours to let the dressing meld with the vegetables and fruits. Take the bowl out of the refrigerator and mix it thoroughly. Place the salad in a bowl and serve.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain, rinse with cold water, and set aside. Meanwhile, in a large nonstick skillet cook the chicken over medium heat for about 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in dressing. Reduce the heat to low. Add the pepper. Simmer for 2 to 3 minutes or until the mixture is heated through. Drain the pasta. Add the chicken mixture. Stir in the broth. Cook over low heat for 3 minutes or until the mixture is heated through. Sprinkle each portion with the cheeses. Top with the croutons.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and cut potatoes into wedges. Heat olive oil in a pan. Add the potatoes and toss until well coated. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Lay the potatoes on the baking sheet. Sprinkle with seasoning and season with salt and pepper. Bake for about 25-30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot.
I'm trying your recipe tonight. It's going to be a side with steaks. I can't wait.

Preheat oven to 375f. Combine steak sauce, pineapple juice, brown sugar, and cornstarch in a bowl until smooth. Pour half of the mixture into a 9 by 13 glass baking dish. Arrange steaks on top of mixture. Top steaks with remaining mixture and sprinkle with cayenne pepper. Cover with foil. Bake for 1 hour or until steaks are tender.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cut fennel bulb in half lengthwise then cut into thin slices. Cut red onion into thin slices. Cut butternut squash in half lengthwise then cut into 1-inch cubes. In large bowl combine squash, fennel slices, onion slices, olive oil, spices, and 1/2 teaspoon each of salt and pepper. Toss to mix. Spread vegetable mixture in 13x9-inch baking dish. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until vegetables are tender.

Preheat grill to medium high. Brush zucchini and yellow squash with half of dressingplace on grill rack. Grill 5 minutes on each side or until lightly browned. Brush remaining dressing over red pepperplace on grill rack. Grill 5 minutes on each side or until lightly browned. Cut red pepper lengthwise in halfremove seeds and ribs. Cut into strips. Combine barbecue sauce and next 3 ingredients in a small bowlset aside. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add chickencook 2 minutes on each side or until done. Combine orange zest and juice in a small bowlstir well. Serve chicken with vegetables and orange juice mixture.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Remove any tough outer leaves from cabbage. Trim stem from remaining leaves. Boil leaves 3-5 minutes, or until tender. Drain. Rinse with cold water. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic and onion. Sauté until lightly browned. Add beef. Cook until no longer pink. Drain. Stir in tomato paste. Add water. Heat to boiling. Add remaining ingredients. Stir well. Place 2 cups of mixture into each cabbage leaf. Place filled leaves seam side down into a 2-quart casserole dish. Cover. Bake 2-3 hours, or until meat is no longer pink. Makes 8 to 10 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 13x9 inch baking dish. Combine flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and cheese in a large bowl. Cut in 1/2 cup of butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in cracker crumbs. In a separate bowl, combine pineapple chunks, sugar, and pineapple juice. Spread cracker mixture in prepared dish. Top with pineapple mixture. Dot with remaining 1 tablespoon butter. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Boil water and dissolve orange jello in it. Pour over chopped walnuts. Fold in crushed pineapple. Let cool until partially set. Then fold in whipped cream and vanilla. Put in a mold. Refrigerate until set. To serve, invert mold and decorate the top of the mold with graham cracker.

Place a dozen eggs in a large pot and add just enough water to cover them completely. Place on medium heat and bring to a rolling boil for 7 minutes. Turn off heat and let cool to room temperature. Cut off the top of each egg and use a spoon to remove yolk and place in a bowl. Drain and rinse the whites and place them back in the pot with the yolks. Add the garlic cloves, bay leaves and onion slices and fill the pot with enough water to cover the eggs completely. Bring the water back up to a rolling boil and let cook for 20 minutes. Remove the pot from the heat and let cool completely. Strain the water from the eggs and place the eggs back in the pot with the onion slices and bay leaves. Add the remaining ingredients and bring the pot up to a rolling boil. Simmer for 5 minutes, then turn off the heat and let cool completely. Pour the mixture through a fine strainer and pack the eggs into clean pint jars. Seal the jars tightly and place them in a cool place for at least 24 hours before serving.

Mix together the cornstarch and half the sugar in 1 cup of cold water and set aside. Melt the butter in the bottom of a 1 1/2 quart casserole dish. Stir in the crushed pineapple, vanilla and the remaining sugar. Sprinkle the pecans on top. Add the eggs one at a time to the mixture of cornstarch and water. Stir well. Pour the egg mixture into the casserole. Sprinkle the top with the remaining 1/4 cup sugar. Bake for about 40 minutes. Check to see if the mixture is bubbling. The mixture will be bubbling around the edges and will be firm in the center. Do not stir the mixture while baking. Serve immediately.
