Mix together the soy sauce and the honey in a shallow pan. Add the ribs, cover and let stand at room temperature for 1 hour. Place the ribs on a grill over a low to medium heat. Cover and cook for 45 minutes. Remove from the heat and brush with the plum jam. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve hot or cold with the plum glaze.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper liners. In a large bowl combine whole wheat flour, baking soda, salt and sugar. Stir in cranberries. In a small bowl combine egg, vanilla, and orange zest. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Stir in starter. Fill prepared cups two-thirds full. Bake in preheated oven for 18 to 20 minutes or until tops are lightly browned. Cool in pan 5 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely on a wire rack. Makes 12 muffins.

Combine the 2 vinegars in a large bowl. Add the oil in a slow, steady stream, whisking constantly. Season the dressing with the mustard, honey, salt, and pepper. In a large serving bowl, toss the tomatoes with the dressing. Arrange the toasted bread in the bottom of the bowl. Spoon the tomatoes over the bread, then sprinkle the basil leaves over the top. Serve immediately.

Place the squash, onion and egg in a large bowl and mix well. Add the seasoning and mix well. Add the flour 1 cup at a time to the mixture. Continue mixing well until all of the flour is absorbed. Add the oil and mix well. Heat a large skillet with a little oil in it. Using a large spoon, drop the mixture into the skillet. Flatten to desired thickness. Cook for about 3 to 5 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Serve with honey mustard. Serve as an appetizer or a side dish. You can also use your favorite barbecue sauce if you wish. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix all ingredients together in a greased baking dish except bread. Cover with bread slices. Bake for 45 minutes until set. Serve with additional mustard for dipping bread slices.

Cut steak into 1/2 inch strips. Place strips in a non-reactive dish with 1/4 cup lime juice. Let marinate for 1 hour. Add fish sauce, chili, garlic, onion and remaining lime juice. Toss to coat. Add cucumber, cilantro, and scallion. Toss to blend. Add lettuce and toss again to blend. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Line a cookie sheet with aluminum foil and spray the foil lightly with non-stick cooking spray. Place the semisweet baking chocolate in a bowl and set aside. In a medium size bowl, mix together the honey graham crackers and the dry roasted peanuts. Add the semisweet baking chocolate to the graham crackers and peanuts and stir until the mixture is well combined. Spread the mixture on the cookie sheet and flatten to create an even layer. Bake in the oven for about 8 minutes or until the chocolate is melted and the graham crackers are crispy. Let the chocolate cool completely before breaking into pieces.

Spread 1 side of 4 slices of bread with mayonnaise. Top with sliced turkey, roasted red peppers and watercress. Spread remaining 4 slices of bread with mayonnaise and arrange on top of sandwiches. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Spread 1/4 cup of watercress between each sandwich. Top sandwiches with remaining 1/4 cup watercress. Cook sandwiches until crispy and golden brown, about 4 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board and slice in half. Enjoy.

Combine the first five ingredients in the work bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment and beat until smooth and creamy. In another bowl combine the dry ingredients and beat into the creamed mixture until just combined. Fold in the rice crispies. Drop by heaping tablespoonful onto a greased cookie sheet and bake at 350f for about 10 minutes or until just starting to brown at the edges. Remove from oven and cool on a wire rack. Makes about 4 1/2 dozen cookies.

Preheat the oven to 325F. Lightly butter (or oil) two baking sheets and set them aside.In a large bowl whisk together the egg whites and the sugar until stiff and glossy. Gently fold in the slivered almonds and spices until well mixed.Scoop the batter into 1 inch balls, and place on the prepared baking sheets. Bake for about 18 minutes until lightly browned on the bottom. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheets for about 10 minutes before transferring them to wire racks to cool completely.The cookies will keep for up to one week in an air tight container.
Brown meat. Add water, taco seasoning mix and green chili. Simmer 5 minutes. Stir in red pepper. Spoon into warmed tortilla shells. Top with shredded cheddar cheese. Serve with desired toppings.

In a small pan, combine blueberries and water. Simmer for 10 minutes or until blueberries have broken down completely and have formed a puree. Stir in granulated sugar and cinnamon stick and cook for an additional minute. Remove from heat and stir in maple syrup until well combined. Serve warm as is or with ice cream or pancakes.

Boil pasta in plenty of water until tender but still firm to bite. Drain in a colander over a bowl, reserving 1 cup of the cooking liquid. Combine shrimp, garlic salt and 2 tablespoons of water in a small bowl. Let stand for 10 minutes to allow the shrimp to marinate while the pasta boils. Meanwhile, melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heatadd shrimp and saute until just opaque in the center, 1 to 2 minutes per sideremove to a plate. Add the reserved pasta cooking liquid to the skillet and scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan. Add the cream cheese, stirring constantly until melted. Stir in the milk and the basil leavescook, stirring constantly until the sauce is smooth and thickened. Return the shrimp to the skillettoss to coat with the sauce. Add the pasta and toss to combinesprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Serve with extra shrimp if desired.
Combine first 4 ingredients in a blender container. Process until smooth. Add ice creamprocess until smooth. Pour into glasses. Serve immediately.

Place the spinach in a food processor with the bread crumbs and pulse to a coarse paste. In a large bowl, stir together the spinach mixture and the egg white. Season with the cheese and a pinch of pepper and mix well. Form into small balls and press into the bread crumbs. In a deep fryer, heat the oil to 325. Fry the balls in small batches until they are golden brown. Serve with the chile and rock salt.

Combine corned beef with onion soup. Add eggs and breadcrumbs. Mix well. Form into small patties about an inch thick. Brown patties in hot oil. Add water or stock to the frying pan to make gravy. Serve patties on the gravy with vegetables.

Cut the fat off the chops. Dust both sides of the chops with flour and brown them in a little fat in a frying pan. Add the sugar and stir to brown. Add tomato sauce, vinegar, water and ginger. Bring to the boil, add curry powder to taste and simmer gently until the chops are tender. Check the seasoning before serving with plain boiled rice.

Combine 2 cups of flour and all of the other dry ingredients in the bowl of an electric mixer. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and add the remaining 1 cup of flour, the yeast, the egg yolk and the water. Beat on low speed just until the dough comes together. Increase speed to medium and beat 4 minutes or until the dough is smooth and elastic. Place dough in an oiled bowl. Cover the dough with plastic wrap or a clean towel and let rise in a warm place for 1 to 1 1/2 hours or until doubled in size. Punch down the dough and turn it out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide the dough into 3 equal pieces and roll each piece into an 8-inch rope. Form each rope into a loose ring. Place the rings on baking sheets lined with parchment paper or lightly greased wax paper. Cover loosely and let rise for about 1 hour or until the dough is doubled. Brush the loaves of bread with the beaten egg white and sprinkle

Combine sugar and butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring mixture to a boil. Boil for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add milk and butterscotch chips. Stir until mixture is smooth and melted. Remove from heat and add oats and coconut. Spread onto a greased baking sheet and bake in a 350 oven for 30 minutes. Cool.
These are the recipes submitted by members of the Pioneer Woman Cooks Facebook Group. If you’re a member of the Facebook group, and you have a recipe you’d like to submit for consideration in future weeks, send it to me!
You can find me on Facebook , Instagram and Pinterest . I’d love it if you’d follow along!

Soak the vegetables in brine (1/2 cup canning salt dissolved in 1 quart of water) overnight. Drain and place in a glass or plastic container. Add the remaining ingredients and seal. Place in refrigerator until ready to serve.
Cucumbers are a member of the pumpkin family and are classified as a vegetable, although they can be used like a fruit because they are mostly composed of water. They are 95% water and are low in calories but high in fiber, calcium and potassium. They are a good source of vitamins A, C, K and B1, thiamin, riboflavin and niacin. The seeds are also edible and are good source of minerals, protein, fatty acids and amino acids.
There are three general categories of cucumbers, pickling (slicing), burpless (slicing) and English (slicing), which are eaten raw. The pickling category includes Kirby, National Pickling and White Spine (also known as Saladette) varieties. The pickling varieties

Line jelly roll pan with wax paper. Combine marshmallows with honey, butter and vanilla in microwave safe dish. Heat for 2 minutes or until marshmallows are completely melted. Stir in peanut butter. Combine oats, rice cereal and coconut in a large bowl. Drizzle with marshmallow mixture and stir until well coated. Spread onto prepared pan. Top with nuts. Let cool until firm and cut into bars.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Beat eggs in a shallow dish. In a separate bowl mix together breadcrumbs and cheeses. Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add butter. When melted add garlic and cook until golden. Remove from heat and set aside. Dip chicken in egg mixture then roll in the cheese mixture. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes. Serve with the garlic butter.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. In a small bowl, combine the streusel ingredients and set aside. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg. In a small bowl, combine the flour, baking powder and salt. Add to the creamed mixture alternately with the milk. Stir in the vanilla. Fold in the strawberries. Spoon the batter into the prepared pans. Sprinkle with streusel. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Brown the chicken in a small amount of butter until cooked through. Cut into bite-sized pieces. In a 13x9 inch baking dish, layer the bottom with 1/2 cup of the rice. Top with a layer of the mushrooms. Repeat layers until all the rice and mushrooms are used up. Next add the chopped bell pepper, celery, and 1 cup of the chicken. Add the soup and cooked rice-a-roni mix. Toss together lightly. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and molasses. Combine the dry ingredients and stir into the creamed mixture until well blended. Cover and chill for at least 1 hour or until firm enough to roll. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Roll the dough into balls and roll each ball in the granulated sugar. Place the balls on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake for 10 minutes. Let cool on the cookie sheets for 3 minutes before removing. Makes about 36 cookies.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, stir together the butter and sugars until smooth. Add the vanilla extract and mix. Add the eggs one at a time and mix well after each addition. In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, baking soda and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet and mix until just combined. Stir in the chocolate chunks. Scoop dough by teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Edges of the cookie should be golden brown. Allow to cool for 1 minute on the cookie sheet before transferring to a wire rack to finish cooling.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Drain the frozen concentrate and add the lemon juice, hoisin sauce and the water. In a shallow bowl combine the frozen concentrate mixture with the vegetable oil, sugar, ginger and garlic. Toss the chicken wings and place on an oiled baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the juice is bubbling. Serve hot with the green onions and hot sauce for garnish.

In a large kettle combine cider, apricot nectar, sugar, orange juice and lemon juice. Stir well until sugar has dissolved and mixture comes to a boil. Add the cinnamon stick and the allspice, cloves and nutmeg. Boil uncovered for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and serve hot or cold.
Marinate cauli floret with rice vinegar, olive oil, salt and pepper. Let it stand for 30 minutes. Drain. Mix it with 1/2 tsp. curry powder. Serve at room temperature.

Peel the leek and wash thoroughly. Cut into small slices and saute in butter until soft. Add the frozen spinach and season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and stir through the sour cream. Allow to cool. Preheat the oven to 200 degrees celsius. Roll out the pastry and use a round cutter of your choice to cut out circles for the base of the tarts. Line the tins with the pastry. Spoon the spinach mixture into the tins and sprinkle with grated tasty cheese. Bake for 30 minutes.

Bring 2 liters of water to the boil in a large pot or saucepan over high heat. Remove from heat and add sugar (or honey) and ginger. Stir well and let the mixture cool to room temperature for 20 minutes. Add the tea bags (or tea leaves) to the mixture and let steep for 3-5 minutes. Remove the tea bags (or strain the mixture if using loose leaves). Add evaporated milk (or regular milk) to the tea and stir well until combined. Serve in individual cups with sugar on the side or pour into 2 liter jug for the entire family to enjoy.

Rinse the quinoa and add to a pot with 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil and simmer for 15 minutes. Let cool and add olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Toss in herbs and onion and mix well. Serve in a bowl with pistachios sprinkled over top.

Bring water to boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to low and add parsley. Steep 10 minutes. Strain parsley mixture into a pitcher and add lime zest. Add 2 cups cold water and stir in lime juice and sugar until well blended. Add club soda. Serve over ice cubes in tall glasses. Garnish with additional parsley leaves, if desired.

Mix together sweet yeast and cottage cheese, let sit overnight. Cream butter with 2 cups of sugar. Add eggs one at a time. Add lemon rind, lemon juice, milk, cornstarch and rum. Add cottage cheese mixture and mix well. Put batter in unbaked pastry shell and bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour or until cake tests done with toothpick. Let cool completely. Frost with lemon frosting. Combine powdered sugar and lemon juice. Stir until smooth. Add rum until you reach desired consistency. Spread over cake. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and saute until the onion is translucent and the garlic is fragrant about 3 minutes. Add the beef and cook until browned and no longer pink about 6 minutes. Add the salt and pepper and stir in the pasta sauce until well combined. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the cooked pasta and the parmesan cheese until well coated. Transfer the mixture to a 9 by 13 inch baking dish and sprinkle with the mozzarella cheese. Bake until the cheese is melted and the top is slightly browned about 15 minutes. Serve immediately.

Combine the first three ingredients. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Add the remaining ingredients except the carrots. Bring to a boil then reduce heat to low. Cook for five to ten minutes, stirring occasionally until thickened. Add the carrots and cook until heated through. Serve immediately. Makes six servings.

Mix 1 tablespoon olive oil with dill. Rub over the salmon fillets. Sprinkle with more dill and squeeze over freshly squeezed lemon juice. Bake in a 350 degrees oven for 15-20 minutes or until cooked through and flakes easily.

Soak the beans overnight. Rinse them in cold water. Pour the beans and water into a saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce to a simmer and cook for about 50 minutes. Drain the beans and discard the water. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. In a large bowl combine the onions and balsamic vinegar. Pour the onions into an 8x8 inch baking pan. Place the onions and beans on a baking sheet and bake until browned and crunchy (about 40 minutes). Top with fresh rosemary and drizzle with extra virgin olive oil.

Beat together butter, sugar and extract until creamy. Stir in flour. Stir in almonds. Shape into 1 inch balls and place 2 inches apart on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 12 minutes or until golden brown around the edges. Cool on a wire rack. Makes about 4 dozen.

In a blender puree all of the ingredients except for heavy cream. Once smooth, add heavy cream and blend until you get a smooth consistency. Serve with a lemon wedge on the side for garnish and souring of soup to taste.

Heat oil over medium high heat until very hot. Add chicken and stir to coat with oil. Add soy sauce and wine and stir to combine well. Turn heat to low and cover and cook until chicken is done (about 10-15 minutes).

Wash the spinach well and boil in water with a little bit of sugar until tender. Let cool. In a bowl mix eggs with the spinach. Add the flour and a little bit of water. Mix well with your hands until you have a smooth dough. Make a little ball of the dough with your hands and drop it into boiling water. Cook for about 15 minutes. Serve with butter and parsley.

Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees. Beat peanut butter with a mixer until creamy. Add the sugars, eggs and vanilla. Beat until the mixture is smooth. Add the chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 minutes. Let cool for 1 minute before removing to cool on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl stir together stuffing, butter and cheese. Press into a greased pie plate. Top with meat, roasted garlic and onion. In a small bowl beat together eggs and milk. Pour over the top. Bake for 30 minutes or until set. Cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Place potatoes in an 8 inch square baking dish which has been wiped down with shortening or sprayed with pam. Potatoes will thaw over night in the fridge. Sprinkle dish with cheese, ham and onions. In a separate bowl, beate eggs, evaporated milk, pepper and salt together. Pour into baking dish over the potato mixture. Cover and refridgerate for several hours or overnight. Remove from refridgerator 30 minutes before baking. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 55-60 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.

In small bowl mix cream cheese, garlic and black pepper. Spread cream cheese mixture on bologna slices. Top each slice with 2 slices cheddar cheese. Wrap each slice around a pickle. Serve with crackers.

Heat olive oil over medium heat in a large stockpot. Add onions and garlicsaute 3 to 5 minutes or until onions are translucent. Stir in wine and cook 1 to 2 minutes or until wine is reduced by half. Add brothbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 30 minutes or until greens are tender. Stir in beansheat through. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately. Yield: 4 servings.

In a small bowl combine the vinegar, sugar, garlic, oregano, dill and pepper. Stir until well blended. Slowly add the olive oil while whisking until smooth. Stir in buttermilk. Taste and adjust seasoning to taste. Dressing will keep up to 1 week in an airtight container.

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine turkey and 1/4 cup water. Cover and cook for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and chill. In a small bowl combine all other ingredients. To serve, place lettuce on four plates. Divide turkey over lettuce. Spoon dressing over turkey. Garnish with kiwi fruit and nuts. Serves 4.
cranberry salad - Cranberry Salad is a traditional side dish that is perfect for Thanksgiving and Christmas.
Southern Cranberry Salad - Southern Cranberry Salad is a traditional side dish that is perfect for Thanksgiving and Christmas.
Cranberry Pineapple Salad - Cranberry Pineapple Salad is a traditional side dish that is perfect for Thanksgiving and Christmas.
Creamy Fresh Cranberry and Fruit Salad - Creamy Fresh Cranberry and Fruit Salad is a traditional side dish that is perfect for Thanksgiving and Christmas.
Cranberry Feta and Walnut Salad - Cranberry Feta and Walnut Salad is a traditional side d
Combine all the ingredients in a bowl. Chill until serving time. Serve with crackers or biscuits.

Heat the butter in a pan. Fry the bacon cubes until crisp. Add the bacon cubes to the speculaas. Add the ground beef. Season with the speculaas spices. Fry the meat with the bacon until crisp. Add the ketjap manis and the sambal bajak. Season with the speculaas spices. Stir well. Make the speculaas-coating. Boil the water and the speculaas together. Put the mixture through a sieve. Mix the coating with the meat. Form into 20 meatballs. Bake the meatballs in the oven at 180 degrees Celsius for 20 minutes. Serve with a salad.

Preheat oven to 350. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. In a shallow bowl, mix the honey, lime juice and soy sauce. Put the flour in a small bowl. In a small bowl, combine the hoisin sauce, gingerroot and cumin. In a large resealable plastic bag, add the chicken, 1 tablespoon of the flour and 1 tablespoon of the hoisin mixture. Seal the bag and shake to coat. In a shallow dish, mix the paprika and remaining flour. Dip the coated chicken in the flour, coating all sides. Place the coated chicken on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes or until the chicken is tender and the juices run clear when pierced with a knife. Serve with lime wedges.

Cut the peppercorns open with a knife. Heat peanut oil in a wok or large frying pan over a high heat until smoking hot. Add the ginger and garlic and stir-fry for 10 seconds. Add the chicken pieces and stir-fry until just cooked through. Add the rice wine, honey, soy sauce, water, peppercorns and star anise. Bring to the boil, cover with a lid and cook over a low heat for 15 minutes. Serve over rice.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the peas and boil until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Drain the water from the pot and set aside. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the green onions and saut for about one minute. Add the peas, salt, and pepper to taste. Sauté for an additional 3 minutes or until heated through. Remove from the heat and add the chives. Serve immediately.

In a non-stick pan over medium heat, heat oil. Season scallops with salt and pepper and place in hot oil. Cook scallops on each side until opaque, about 1 minute per side. Sprinkle with chopped chives. Serve.

Mix flour with granulated sugar & salt. Mix in melted butter, eggs & milk. Stir in vanilla & pecans. Pour in unbaked pie crust & bake at 350f for 40 minutes. Serves 10.
100+ easy, quick, delicious recipes for pecans - from sweet treats like pecan pie, chocolate pecan bark and pecan brittle to savory dishes such as pecan chicken salad, pecan stuffing and even pecan ice cream!
Pecan Recipes and Information about Pecans
Pecans are one of the most widely distributed nuts in the United States. They are a part of the hickory nut family and are native to the southern United States. The pecan is the state nut of Texas.
Pecans are known for their delicious flavor and are one of the most popular nuts in the United States. They can be eaten raw or cooked and are commonly used in baking, as a topping for ice cream and in many other recipes.
Pecans can be purchased in the shell or

Cut each bacon slice into four pieces. Combine hot sauce, soy sauce, ketchup, worcestershire sauce and sugar in large bowlstir well. Place a water chestnut on each piece of bacon. Wrap one end around water chestnutsecure with wooden pick or small piece of string. Repeat with remaining pieces of bacon and water chestnuts. Place pieces on broiler pan or cookie sheetplace in oven. Broil 2-3 inches from heat until done.

Heat 2 tbsps oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add 1/2 the onion and 1/2 the garlic and saute until softened and lightly browned. Add the eggs and mix well. Cook for about 2 minutes until the eggs are slightly set. Add 1/2 the chicken and stir fry for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the frozen vegetables and cook for about 1 minute. Stir in the remaining onion and garlic and the soy sauce and mix well. Add the rice and stir fry for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the remaining chicken and stir fry until the meat is heated through. Add sesame oil and mix well. Serve immediately.
name: chinese brown sauce chickeningredients: boneless chicken breasts, garlic cloves, soy sauce, brown sugar, chicken broth, cornstarch, broccoli, carrot, peas, cooked ricepreparation:Lightly brown chicken breasts in a small amount of oil. Remove from pan and add garlic, soy sauce, brown sugar and 1

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Cut sweet potatoes into wedges and place in a bowl with the chili powder, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and brown sugar. Toss until well coated with seasonings. Place in a single layer onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Drizzle with olive oil and bake until crispy and browned, about 20 minutes. Toss once during cooking. Serve hot.

Remove stems from mushrooms and chop. Bake portabella caps for about 10 minutes in 400 degree oven. Remove and cool. In a small bowl combine goat cheese and red pepper strips and set aside. Spread a small amount of olive oil over the caps. Top each with a small amount of goat cheese mixture. Sprinkle with pepper. Bake at 350 degrees for about 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Brown hamburger and onion in skillet until hamburger is cooked and no longer pink. Drain and set aside. Brown hot sausage in skillet until it is no longer pink. Add hamburger and onions back to skillet and heat through. Add cream of mushroom soup and salsa. Cook until cheese is melted. Serve in bowl and top with shredded cheese and green onions.

Preheat oven to 400. Spray a baking dish or broiler pan with nonstick spray. Place chicken in dish. In a small bowl combine the honey and orange juice. Mix well. In another bowl combine the ginger, pepper and red pepper. Sprinkle the mixture over the honey and juice mixture. Combine well. Spread evenly over the chicken. In a small bowl combine the corn flakes and parsley flakes. Sprinkle over the chicken. Bake uncovered 25 to 30 minutes, until no pink remains and juices run clear. Makes 4 servings.
Combine mayo and mustard in a small bowl. Stir in chilies, olives and onion. In a large bowl, combine mayo mixture, ham and cheese. Fill each bun with ham mixture. Top with tomato. Roll up and serve.

Spread a little of the miracle whip in a pie plate or other shallow dish. Top with a layer of crabmeat, then top that with a layer of the cocktail sauce, then a layer of the peppers and onions, then another layer of crabmeat, then another layer of cocktail sauce, then a layer of tomatoes and another layer of crabmeat. Top with a layer of cheddar cheese and top with the remaining miracle whip. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the refrigerator overnight or at least 8 hours to allow the flavors to blend together. Serve with crackers or vegetable chips.

Heat oil in a large pot. Add broccoli and cook for a few minutes, until slightly soft. Add the rest of the vegetables and continue to cook, stirring occasionally until soft. Add the stock and simmer for a few minutes. Add the fat-free evaporated milk and the salt and pepper. Stir well. Simmer for a few minutes, until heated through and ready to serve. Serve hot. Makes about 8 servings. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare a 9-inch springform pan by lining bottom with wax paper, butter the paper and sides of pan. In a small bowl combine 1/2 cup of the sugar and 1/2 cup of the brandy. Toss the cranberries in the mixture. Set aside. Cream the butter and remaining 2 cups of sugar. Beat until smooth and light, then beat in the eggs one at a time. Sift the dry ingredients and mix into the butter mixture. Fold in the cranberries. Pour batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top. Bake for 1 hour. Cool on a wire rack for 15 minutes. Meanwhile combine the cream, brandy and mint. Mix well. Remove sides of the springform pan. Serve the cake with the brandy cream topping. Garnish with the almonds.

Wash and soak navy beans overnight in water. The next day, drain the beans and place in a large pot with the ham bone, garlic clove, bay leaf and enough water to cover by 2-3 inches. Bring the pot to a boil and skim any foam that comes to the surface. Reduce the heat to a low boil and cook for 2-3 hours or until the beans are tender but still hold their shape. Remove ham bone from the pot and save the meat for garnishing the soup later on. Take 2 cups of the cooked bean mixture and place in a blender or food processor. Process the cooked beans until they are smooth. Return the puree to the pot of cooked beans and add the potato, carrots, onion and celery. Cook for 10 more minutes. Season the soup with salt and pepper and garnish each serving with a piece of the ham bone meat.
Combine the yogurt and milk in a blenderadd the ice cream and continue to mix until smooth. Pour into glasses and add a marshmallow and drizzle on caramel sauce.

Preheat grill to medium high. Slice onion in half lengthwise. Place onion cut side down on grill. Cook until onions start to char slightly. Remove from grill and place in a small bowl. Add 1/4 cup of the plain nonfat yogurt and mash well with a fork. Add a pinch of salt and pepper and 1 tsp of old bay seasoning. Set aside. Pound chicken breasts to 1/2 inch thickness. Place in a ziplock bag and add remaining 1 cup nonfat yogurt. Add fresh ground pepper, sea salt and garlic. Massage to coat. Marinate at least 1 hour, up to 24 hours. When ready to cook, remove chicken from bag and place on grill. Discard the remaining marinade. Cook 4 minutes per side and serve with onion sauce on the side. Serve with a salad and some veggies or rice for a complete meal.

Dip fillets in milk. Shake off excess. Dip fillets in flour. Shake off excess. Heat butter and oil together. Saute onion and green bell pepper until soft. Add tomato sauce and worcestershire sauce. Add red snapper fillets. Cover. Cook 5 minutes per side. Sprinkle with Parmesan. Garnish with lemon.

Brown meat in a large skillet. Add onion and garlic. Add in can of rotel tomatoes and drained can of corn. Add in can of ranch style beans and add in a small amount of water. Simmer for about 5 minutes. Stir in instant rice. Simmer for about 3 minutes until it is tender. Add in taco seasoning and stir well. Pour in the rest of the water. Simmer until the water is absorbed. Top with cheese and bake for 10 minutes.
I made the Mexican skillet casserole tonight with some small modifications. I didn't have whole kernel corn so I used about 1/4 of a can of cream style corn. I also didn't have ranch style beans so I used refried beans. I added more water than the recipe called for so my skillet was very moist. I think the recipe would have been better with the water at the end like you normally cook rice.
This recipe was quick and easy and really good! I added about half of a can of cream style corn and some frozen peppers and onions. I also added about a
Boil sweet potato pieces until tender. Drain and mash with the butter. Stir in the brown sugar and cream to the desired consistency. Add the ground cayenne pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Melt 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook for 3 to 5 minutes on each side or until golden. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to the pan, along with the tomatoes, apricot, raisins, salt & pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and cook for 4 to 6 minutes or until the sauce is thickened. Serve over rice.
Heat wine and honey in saucepan until boiling. Add remaining ingredients and boil until slightly thickened. Cool slightly and spoon over ham. Bake at 400 until heated through, about one hour.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Trim 1 inch of fat from pork tenderloins. Cut into 1 inch medallions. Place in a shallow baking dish. Melt butter in a small sauce pan over medium heat. Stir in cream and bring to a boil. Stir in the mango chutney. Pour over medallions and cover tightly with foil. Bake 30 minutes. Meanwhile, combine 1 1/2 cups water and rice in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boilcover, reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes or until water is absorbed. Uncover and let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Stir in green onion. Serve medallions over rice.

In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg yolk and vanilla. Beat in the sifted dry ingredients. Fold in the miniature chocolate chips and crushed red candy cane. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 400 f for 8-10 minutes or until set. Cool slightly on the cookie sheets and then transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Store in an airtight container.
To prepare the sauce combine the cream cheese, milk, green chilies, and chicken. Spread over the crescent roll dough. Top with the chips. Bake at 400 degrees for 10-12 minutes.

Cook the carrot slices in a large pot of boiling water until crisp tender, about 3 minutes. Drain in a colander and let cool. Melt the butter in a small saucepan and stir in the salt and chili powder. Add the ginger ale and stir. Cook and stir until the liquid has almost evaporated. Add the carrot slices and toss to coat. Garnish with the parsley.

Spread cream cheese onto 8 oz bagel thins. Top with seafood mixture, then sprinkle with shrimp. Top with tomatoes, peppers and onions. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Place on cookie sheet and bake in 350 degree oven for 15 - 18 minutes until cheese is golden brown and bubbly. Serve with assorted crackers.

Combine first 8 ingredients in a bowl. Shape mixture into 4 patties. Grill over medium-high heat for 10-12 minutes or until done, turning once. Just before taking off the grill, place cheese slices on each patty. Serve on buns with lettuce, tomato, etc.

Place potatoes in a medium saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil then reduce to medium heat and cook until tender (about 15 minutes). Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Meanwhile, combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Drain the potatoes and place in a medium bowl. Add the sauce and toss until coated. Add the water chestnuts, bell peppers, scallions and toss again. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in brown sugar & cereal. Mix well. Add vanilla & honey. Stir until well coated. Drop by tablespoonfuls onto waxed paper. Cool until hardened. Makes about 12 dozen.

I love to cook! I especially love cooking for my husband and two daughters. I’ve been told I have an interesting way of cooking things but my family seems to love it so I’m happy.
Spread cooked turkey with ranch dressing. Add green onions and sun-dried tomatoes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Wrap in a flour tortilla and serve.

Heat 2 tablespoons soy sauce and the cumin in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Add tomatoes and cook until softened. In a small bowl combine walnuts and 2 tablespoons soy sauce. Stir well to coat. Stir in collard greens. Spoon the mixture evenly into 6 taco shells. Sprinkle with the green onion and cilantro. Serve with a lime wedge and lemon juice.
Cook cabbage and onions in boiling water for 10 minutes. Drain. Place in a bowl. In a small bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Mix with the vegetables and toss gently. Cover and refrigerate.

Mix the ground chicken with the egg whites, bread crumbs, chopped yellow onion, chopped celery, the chili sauce and the hot pepper sauce together in a large bowl. Form the mixture into patties, then refrigerate for 1 hour. Remove the patties from the refrigerator. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the patties and cook for 2 minutes per side or until the patties are brown and crisp. Serve with any desired toppings or as desired.
name: baked chicken tendersingredients: chicken breast tenders, butter, garlic powder, paprika, flour, egg substitute, flourpreparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Lightly grease a baking sheet or line with foil and spray with nonstick baking spray. In a large bowl, combine the chicken tenders with the butter, garlic powder and paprikatoss to coat. In a shallow bowl or pie plate combine the flour and egg substitutemix

Preheat the oven to 375. Place the ham on a piece of bread. Layer with the cheddar cheese. In a medium mixing bowl, beat together the eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Pour over the bread. Bake for about 45 minutes.

In a saucepan bring 3 cups water to a boil. Gradually add the cornmeal, stirring constantly. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in 3 cups of parmesan cheese. Continue stirring until the mixture is thickened, about 30 minutes. Stir in the remaining 1 cup of parmesan cheese. Stir in the remaining 1 cup of parmesan cheese. Remove from the heat. Stir in the jalapeno jack cheese and mix well. Season with the salt and white pepper to taste. Serve warm.

Mix together oatmeal, coconut and dates in a large bowl. In another bowl combine flour with ginger and stir in butter and golden syrup. Add water and mix until dough is smooth. Press dough into a 9 x 13 inch tin and bake for 20 minutes at 375 f. Let cool and break into pieces.
name: oatmeal date cookies
ingredients: shortening, sugar, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, salt, baking soda, oatmeal, dates
preparation:Cream shortening. Gradually add the sugar, beating well. Add eggs and vanilla. Beat well. Combine flour, salt and soda. Add to creamed mixture, mixing well. Stir in the uncooked oats and chopped dates. Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls onto lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from cookie sheets while still warm. Complete cooling on wire racks.
name: delicious oatme

Preheat the oven to 350f. On a baking sheet, line up the shortcrust pastry dough in a rectangle shape. Sprinkle the butter in the center and spread over the dough. Cut the dough lengthwise and lay the two pieces on top of the butter. Press the two pieces together and then fold over the sides and ends in the middle so that you have a rectangle shape that looks like a book with the two pieces on top. Roll the dough out into a rectangle with the butter inside. Sprinkle with brown sugar and pour the maple syrup over the butter. Put the apples and cut the peel and core out. Mix the apple slices with the cinnamon and the nutmeg and place them over the butter. Place the dough in the oven and bake for about 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine honey and sugar in a heavy saucepanstir over low heat until the mixture boils and turns dark amber. Remove from heat and cool. In a large mixing bowl combine the eggs, melted butter and vanilla. Stir in the honey mixture and the flour. Pour into a greased 9 inch pie plate and bake for 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack before slicing.

In a bowl mix together the rice krispies, sugar, cinnamon, unsalted butter, eggs, cream cheese, milk and vanilla until thoroughly blended. Add the noodles and raisins and mix well. Spread in a 13x9 inch greased baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 to 45 minutes or until well browned on top and bubbling around edges. Let cool for 10 minutes before cutting into squares. Serves 10 to 12
Cut pork chops into 1 1/2 inch pieces. Place in 2 quart greased casserole. Combine remaining ingredients. Pour over chops. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Stir every 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a 9x13-inch baking dish with crescent rolls. Brown the chicken. Mix together the cream cheese, milk and seasonings and pour over the chicken. Bake for 30 minutes.
name: pork loafingredients: ground pork, onion, bread crumbs, ketchup, milk, eggs, seasoning, baconpreparation:Combine all ingredients. Spread into loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees.
name: stuffed pork tenderloiningredients: pork tenderloin, cream cheese, sour cream, stuffing mix, vegetable oilpreparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brown the pork tenderloin on all sides. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. In a bowl combine the cream cheese with the sour cream and stuffing mix. Spread the mixture evenly on the pork tenderloin and wrap in foil. Cook for 1 hour or until cooked through.

Cut each sausage into 6 slices and place in bottom of cup. Top each with 2 teaspoons of the ranch dressing mix and 2 shavings of cheese. Fold the wrapper over the top and pinch the edge closed. Place each wrapper seam side down onto prepared baking sheet and bake at 450 for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with additional ranch dressing or ketchup.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Season the pork chops with salt and pepper. Brown the chops on all sides in a small amount of oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Place the browned pork chops in a shallow baking dish. Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the garlic and saute until fragrant. Add the apple juice and bring to a boil. Stir in the jellied cranberry sauce and simmer until the sauce has thickened. Pour the sauce over the pork chops. Bake in the preheated oven until the pork is no longer pink in the center and the sauce is thickened, about 30 minutes. Place the sliced apples on top of the pork and return the dish to the oven. Bake until the apples are tender, about 10 minutes. Remove the dish from the oven and stir in the applesauce and cloves. Garnish each serving with a sprig of parsley and a slice of apple

Cut the prosciutto into thin strips. In a skillet, heat the oil. Cook the onions and the garlic over medium heat for about 5 minutes. Add the prosciutto and cook for 3 minutes. Add the tomatoes. Cook for about 15 minutes. Add the basil and the capers. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with spaghetti.

Beat the milk and the egg together in a bowl until smooth. Add the Bisquick and the vanilla and mix until just combined. Dip the bread into the mixture and then into the cinnamon and sugar mixture to coat both sides. Let stand until ready to cook. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook the bread until golden brown on both sides and serve immediately with the warm syrup.

Bring water and butter to a boil in a small saucepan. Add flour and whisk until smooth. Continue whisking while slowly adding milk and nutmeg. Cook until thickened and smooth. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Place one sheet of phyllo dough onto a flat surface. Brush the top of the sheet with melted butter. Lay another sheet of phyllo dough overtop and brush again with butter. Continue layering phyllo dough and brushing with butter. When you have used up approximately half of your phyllo dough, remove one sheet and sprinkle with parmesan cheese and spinach. Cover with another sheet of phyllo dough and brush with butter. Repeat until all of your sheets of phyllo dough are used.Spoon filling mixture into each hole created by layering sheets of phyllo dough. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes. Garnish with hard boiled egg slices and serve.

In food processor or blender process red peppers. Add feta cheese, vinegar, sugar, and cayenne. Pulse until smooth. Transfer to small serving bowl. Serve with vegetables, pita bread, or crackers. Note: Refrigerate leftovers in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

Combine cold water with gelatin mixes and let sit for 3 minutes. Stir together until dissolved. Refrigerate for 2 hours until set. Slice fruit into small cubes. Add fruit to fruit cups. Chill overnight to set. Top fruit cups with cool whip.

Pour the vegetable oil in a saute pan over high heat. When the oil is hot, add the shrimp. Cook for 1 minute per side. Remove from heat and set aside. In a small bowl, combine the scallion and gingerroot. Add the sea salt and mixed peppercorns. Mix well and set aside. Heat the chile in a dry small skillet over high heat for 10 seconds. Remove from heat and set aside. Toss the cooked shrimp with the scallion and ginger mixture. Sprinkle with chile and cilantro. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan bring the sugar, evaporated milk, butter and salt to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly until the mixture comes to a full boil (236f) and reaches the soft ball stage. Remove from heat and stir in the chocolate chips until melted and incorporated. Add the marshmallows and mix until blended. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the vanilla and nuts (if using). Let cool slightly and spread into the prepared pan and refrigerate until firm before cutting into squares.

Place the navy beans in a large bowl. Cover with water 3-inches above the beans. Soak for 8 hours. Drain the beans. Place in a large saucepan with 8 cups of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Simmer for 2 hours or until the beans are tender. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Cook until the ham is heated through. Serve.

Melt the butter and mix in the cocoa powder, then add the boiling water (do not boil the butter & cocoa) let cool slightly. Mix the dry ingredients together in a separate bowl, then add to the wet mixture. Let the dough set in the fridge for about 45 minutes to an hour. Roll into small balls and press with your thumb to make an indention. Melt the chocolate in a double broiler (or microwave) then pour over the tops of the cookies, or drizzle with chocolate syrup. Place in fridge to set up.

Melt butter in a medium bowl. Combine it with the worcestershire and the seasoning salt. Add the cereal to the bowl. Pour the mixture out onto wax paper and spread out. Let cool for about 15 minutes. Next, add the mixed nuts. Spread out the mixture again and let cool for another 15 minutes. Mix and store in an airtight container.

In a large pot, bring the water to boil and add the dry beans. Lower the heat and cook for about 30 minutes. Then add the remaining ingredients. Simmer for another hour or until the carrots and celery are tender and the beans are soft. Serve hot.

Melt butter in a skillet. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Add spinach and cook until wilted. In a bowl, beat together the eggs and milk. Add the mushrooms and spinach mixture. Season with the pepper and salt. Pour into unbaked pie shells and sprinkle with the cheese. Bake at 425 degrees F for 20 minutes or until the custard is set.

To prepare the paste combine the red peppers, salt, and garlic cloves in a large saucepan. Cook on low heat for one hour. Mash the mixture with a potato masher until smooth. Add the water one teaspoon at a time until it forms a paste. Add the oil. Stir to combine. Add the remaining water as needed until the desired consistency is achieved. Store in the refrigerator. Serve with bread, crackers, or as a sauce for meat.
Brown hamburger. Stir in flour and cook until browned. Stir in onion soup mix and tomato paste. Add water, bouillon and sour cream. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve over hot pasta.

Preheat oven to 350f. Unroll 1 package crescent rolls. Separate into 8 triangles. Cut each triangle in half to make 16 triangles. Cut each apple in half and remove the seeds and core. Cut each half of the apple into 4 wedges. Arrange 2 wedges of apple in each triangle of the roll. In a bowl combine 1/4 cup each of brown and white sugar and 1 tablespoon of cinnamon. Sprinkle the apples with the sugar and cinnamon. Cut butter into small pieces. Arrange 8 pieces of butter on top of each apple. Bake the apples for 15 to 20 minutes or until the dough is golden brown and the apples are tender. Cut each roll in half and serve hot with whipped topping.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease or spray 12 cup muffin pan. Combine flour, sugar, cinnamon and salt in medium bowlmake well in center of mixture. Combine egg, oil, vanilla extract and pears in small bowlbeat until smooth. Stir egg mixture into dry ingredients just until moistened. Stir in nuts. Spoon batter into prepared pan. Bake 20 minutes or until golden and toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool in pan 5 minutes. Remove from panserve warm or cool completely on wire rack. Makes 12 muffins.

Beat cream cheese and brown sugar until blended. Stir in vanilla and egg. Dissolve gelatin in boiling water, stir in flour. Add to cream cheese mixture. Mix well. Stir in cranberries and pecans. Fill pie crusts and bake in 425 oven for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 1 hour. Cut into wedges. Refrigerate leftovers.

Spread each slice of bread with 2 tablespoons apple butter. Arrange 2 slices of swiss cheese over apple butter on 4 slices of bread. Top with remaining 4 slices of bread. Brush outside of each sandwich with melted butter. Broil in toaster oven or regular oven until toasted and cheese is melted. Cut into 4 wedges and serve warm with apple slices on the side.

In a heavy medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the flour and whisk constantly for 3-4 minutes, until it forms a roux. Add the milk and whisk until thickened and bubbly. Remove from the heat and stir in the oregano, garlic, and pepper. Pour over pasta.

Boil the water and cook the cavolfiore with the garlic cloves for about 15 minutes. When done, add the anchovies. Drain the cavolfiore and the anchovies on a paper towel. In a bowl add the cavolfiore and the anchovies, the garlic cloves and the rest of the ingredients. Add the extra virgin olive oil and the red wine vinegar. Season with the herbs. Serve chilled.

Place the lime zest in a small saucepan with the lavender flowers and the water. Bring the water to a boil over medium-high heat, then turn off the heat and allow the mixture to steep for 15 minutes. Remove the lavender flowers and place the lime zest in a cheesecloth bagset aside. In a large saucepan combine the peaches, lavender-infused water and lime zestbring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook until the peaches are tender, about 5 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a food mill or strainer set over a large bowlpress the mixture through the strainer, discarding the lime zest. Return the peaches to the saucepan and cook over medium-low heat until the mixture thickens slightly, 5 to 10 minutes. Add the lemon juice and granulated sugarcook until the mixture thickens slightly, 5 to 10 minutes. Stir in the liquid pectincook until the mixture thickens slightly again, about 1 minute more. Remove the saucepan from

Combine ketchup, soy sauce, molasses, ginger, and garlic in a slow cooker. Stir to combine. Add the pork and toss to coat. Cover and cook on low for 5 to 6 hours. Remove the ribs and pour the juices into a small bowl. Stir to remove any lumps. Return the ribs to the pan and simmer, uncovered, for 30 to 40 minutes. Serve the ribs with the sauce.
In a small bowl, combine the olive oil and vinegar. Whisk in the mustard and 1/2 teaspoon each of the basil and coarse salt. Slice the tomatoes and toss with the dressing. Season with the pepper.

Add all of the ingredients except the lemon juice to a food processor or blender. Pulse until smooth. Add the lemon juice and pulse again. Serve over your favorite pasta dish or use as a dip for bread.

Place all ingredients into your bread machine in the order that is listed, according to your manufacturers directions for the dough cycle. Do not use the quick bread cycle. When done, remove from the machine and shape into small balls. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Brush with melted margarine or butter. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm draft-free area until doubled in size (about 30 minutes to 1 hour). Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes or until golden brown.

To prepare the Marinade: In a bowl combine the wine, olive oil and lemon and lime juices. Add the salt, oregano and crushed red pepper flakes. Add the garlic and stir to blend. Add the meat to the bowl and toss to coat. Cover and chill the mixture 4 to 12 hours. Prepare the Grilling Sauce: In a blender combine the tomatoes, tomato paste and oregano and puree until smooth. Strain the pureed mixture through a fine mesh sieve. Discard the solids. Return the tomato puree to the blender and add the vinegar. Blend until smooth. Heat the oil in a saucepan over low heat. Add the tomato puree and cook until heated through. Season to taste with salt. Preheat a grill to medium heat. Drain the meat and discard the marinade. Grill the meat over direct heat until done to preference. Serve the meat topped with the grilling sauce and garnished with the parsley.

In a large skillet on med-high heat add margarine and let melt. Add cabbage, yellow onion and cook until tender. Add smoked sausage, cook until heated through and bacon bits. Salt to taste, add sugar and black pepper to taste. Stir until well combined, cook for 1 minute and serve over cooked rice. Serves 3-4.
Cabbage is good for you. It’s full of vitamins, minerals, antioxidants and fiber. And if you’re eating it as part of the Mediterranean diet, you’re eating it as part of the healthiest diet in the world.
Cabbage, like most cruciferous vegetables, is full of nutrients that can help protect your body against chronic disease.
And even though it might not be as tasty as the newest superfood, it’s still worth eating.
I’m going to share some of the best ways to eat cabbage with you so that you can get the most nutritional value out of it while still enjoying the flavor as much as possible.

Place 2 cups of the water into a small pot and add the salt. Bring to a boil and then add the quinoa and reduce heat to low. Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or until the water is absorbed and the quinoa is tender. Remove from heat and fluff with a fork. Place the carrot and parsley into the bowl of a food processor and process until finely chopped. Combine the carrot, parsley and the remaining 2 cups water into the pot with the quinoa. Cook for 3 minutes or until the carrots are tender. Remove from heat and allow to cool. In a medium bowl, combine the carrots and quinoa with the lemon juice and olive oil. Add the garlic and soy sauce and toss to coat. Place the carrots and quinoa onto a serving plate and top with the sunflower seeds. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Cut potato and onion into 1/4 inch slices. Place in a large bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together mustard and oil until combined. Drizzle over potato and onion slices and toss until well coated. Place a piece of foil on the grill and add potato and onion slices in a single layer. Place a piece of foil on top and fold edges together to seal. Grill for about 10 minutes or until tender.

Beat together the cream cheese, butter, powdered sugar, and brown sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer until well blended. Add the vanilla and beat until smooth. Stir in the mini semisweet chocolate chips. Spread into a 13x9 inch baking pan that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Sprinkle with the pecans and drizzle with the honey. Bake at 425 for 15 to 20 minutes. Serve warm with graham crackers. Store in the fridge.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).In a bowl, soak the tortilla chips in milk for about 5 minutes or until softened. Squeeze out excess milk and transfer to a food processorpulse until the chips are ground into small pieces. Add the ground beef and mix well with your hands.In a large bowl, combine the ground beef mixture with the eggs, salt and pepper. Form into a loaf and place on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until the internal temperature reaches 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).While the meatloaf is baking, combine the ketchup with the salsa and water in a saucepan over medium-low heatstir until smooth. Let cool completely. Remove the loaf from the oven and brush the top with the glaze. Continue brushing until the glaze is completely absorbed by the meat loaf. Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

Heat oil in a large dutch oven over medium heat. Add garliccook 1 minute. Stir in tomatoes and green chilies. Simmer uncovered until slightly thickened. Stir in navy beans, milk, salt, and pepper. Heat through. Garnish with parsley. Serve with tortilla chips.
In medium saucepan, cook ground beef over medium-high heat, 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until cooked well, drain. Reduce heat to medium. Stir in remaining ingredients, except shredded cheese and tortilla chips. Cook 8-12 minutes or until thoroughly heated, stirring frequently. Top individual servings with shredded cheese and tortilla chips.
Heat a small non-stick skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add whole tomato to skillet and heat until skin is blistered and slightly charred, turning frequently. Cool tomato slightly and coarsely chop.
In a large saucepan, combine tomato, onion, and garlic. Cook over medium heat until onion and gar

Mix together the first four ingredients. Add the eggs and milk. Stir just until smooth. Heat 1 teaspoon of oil in a frying pan. Add 1/4 cup of batter. Cook until the top is bubbly. Turn and cook on the other side until done. Repeat with the remaining batter. Serve warm. Top with butter, jam or syrup.

In a small bowl, beat together the eggs, sugar, almond extract, salt and dried cherries until well combined.In slow cooker, combine whole milk and cooked rice and stir well. Add the cherry mixture and stir well.Cover and cook on low setting for 4 hours or until mixture is set.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.Cut the squash in half lengthwise through the stem. Remove the seeds with a spoon. Scrub the sweet potato with a brush, then cut into 1/2-inch cubes. Wash the leeks and cut them in half lengthwise. Cut out the tough green ribs in the center. Cut the leeks crosswise into 1/4-inch slices.Season the chicken with salt and fresh ground pepper. Heat the oven to 375 degrees.Place the squash cut side up on a baking sheet. Roast for 35 minutes. Scatter the sweet potato cubes around the squash. Roast for 30 minutes longer. In a medium nonstick skillet, heat the leeks in 2 tablespoons of the oil over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add the marmalade and the broth. Bring to a boil. Cover partially. Simmer over low heat until reduced by half. Stir in the hoisin sauce.

Mix chocolate chips with milk in a small saucepan over low heat until melted. Add heavy whipping cream and vanilla and beat until smooth. Refrigerate for at least one hour. Spread between layers and on sides of a layer cake. Decorate with miniature marshmallows.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter, sugars, eggs and vanilla. In another bowl, mix together the flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda. Combine the wet and dry ingredients. Stir in chocolate chips. With your fingers, place golf ball-sized dough portions 2-inches apart on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 9-10 minutes or just until edges are light brown.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add carrots, broth and salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer until carrots are tender about 10 minutes. Add chicken and return to boiling. Stir in honey, mustard, brown sugar and cornstarch. Bring to boilingcook and stir 1 minute or until thickened. Remove from heatstir in parsley. Serve with rice, pasta or potatoes.

Cook orzo according to package directions. Drain and rinse in cold water. Set aside. In a large bowl, whisk together lemon juice, marjoram, mustard, lemon zest, oil and feta cheese. Stir in scallions, olives and tomatoes. Add orzo and toss to combine. Serve.

Brown beef in a skillet. Add onion and pepper. Cook until vegetables are tender. Drain. Stir in refried beans. Spoon into each of 6 tostada shells. Bake in a 400 oven for 5 minutes or until hot. Top with cheese. Serve immediately. Makes 6 tostados.

Combine first five ingredients in a bowl. Mix well and set aside. Cream together butter, sugars, egg and vanilla until very smooth. Stir in peanut butter. Add dry mixture and mix well. Stir in chocolate chips if desired. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake in preheated oven for 12-14 minutes or until edges begin to turn golden brown. Remove from oven and immediately press down with a fork dipped in water to create a crosshatch pattern on each cookie. Remove from pan with a spatula and place on wire racks to cool. Makes about 4 dozen 2-inch cookies.

Heat oil in heavy skillet. Add onion and cook until softened. Add mango, peppercorns, and orange juicecook until mango is tender. Add gingerroot and banana. Cook until banana is tender. Remove from heat. Stir in raisins. Cool. Transfer to a food processor and process until smooth. Add vinegar. Chill in airtight container for 48 hours.

In a medium bowl combine rolled oats, splenda sugar substitute, salt and rum extract. Combine 1 1/2 cups water and 1 1/2 cups water. Bring to a boil. Add oats mixture slowly while whisking. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes, or until thickened. Add bananas and cook for 5 minutes or until tender but not mushy. Stir in butter and vanilla extract. Serve with milk or half n half
In large skillet, melt butter. Add onion and saute until tender. Add cooked ham and saute until warmed through. Add salt, pepper and caraway seed. Toss with cooked egg noodles. Serve immediately.

Cut up white cabbage into thin slices. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat butter. Cook bacon strips for 3-5 minutes. Remove strips from pan and set aside. Add cabbage to pan with allspice and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat. Mix with butter. Add 1 teaspoon pepper. Add bacon back to mixture. Cook for an additional 1 minute. Serves 4.

In a small mixing bowl combine cream cheese with dressing. Spread over each tortilla. Top with tomatoes, basil and pine nuts. Roll up and cut into pinwheels. Place in a shallow dish. In a separate dish combine pasta with 1/4 cup of the dressing. Arrange tomato pinwheels over top of the pasta. Sprinkle with pine nuts and additional sun-dried tomato vinaigrette. Bake at 425 for approximately 10 minutes. Serve with additional sun-dried tomato vinaigrette. Serves 6.

Soak the beans overnight. Drain the water. Place the meat into a heavy pot along with the onion. Brown the meat in the oil. Add the garlic. Add the bay leaf. Add the beans. Add the potatoes. Add the paprika. Add the barley. Add enough boiling water to cover the mixture by one inch. Cover the pot and place it into the oven. Bake at 250f for 24 hours.

Heat the olive oil in a saute pan and cook the garlic and shallots for approximately one minute or until softened and fragrant. Add the red bell peppers and cook for two minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook for an additional two minutes or until mushrooms have softened slightly and browned. Season with the herbs and remove from the heat. Top each crostini toast with swiss cheese, mushroom mixture and garnish with fresh parsley. Serve immediately.

Cook the white shoepeg corn according to package directions. Drain well. In a bowl, combine the corn, vegetables and the remaining ingredients. Spoon into a 3 quart baking dish. Crumble the crackers and butter over the top. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees grease a 9x13 inch pan. In a large bowl, beat together butter and sugar until light and creamy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Beat in the lemon juice and the essence. Stir in the flour and baking powder. Spread evenly into the pan and bake for 25 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. Dust with confectioners sugar.

Combine sugar, vanilla, egg and milk together in a large shallow dish. Dip bread until soaked on both sides. Cook in skillet over medium heat. Use a small amount of oil to keep the toast from sticking. Allow the first side to brown, then flip to brown the second side of the bread. Dust with powdered sugar or top with your favorite syrup. Sprinkle coconut on top.

Combine first 3 ingredients. Dip chicken into mixtureplace in 13x9 pan. Combine next 3 ingredientspour over chicken. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes.

Remove collard green stems and chop stems into 2 inch pieces. Chop leaves into smaller pieces. In a large pot, combine all vegetables and butter. Cook covered over medium heat until greens are tender. Add barbecue sauce and real maple syrup. Simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and add salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.

Brown bratwursts on both sides and slice them. In a pot over medium heat combine cold water and butter. Stir until butter melts. Add flour and continue stirring until mixture is smooth. Cook for 2 minutes. Add sour cream and salt and pepper to taste. Cook for another 2 minutes. Pour sauce over bratwursts and serve.

In a bowl combine the first 5 ingredientspour half of the mixture over the meat. Cover loosely with foil. Bake at 350 for 1 1/2 hours. Remove foilbaste loin with remaining glaze mixture. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes longer or until meat thermometer reads 155-160 degrees.
name: roast pork and apple dinneringredients: pork chops, onion, sliced mushrooms, balsamic vinaigrette, minute white rice, condensed chicken broth, water, red apples, dried thyme leavespreparation:Spray large nonstick skillet with cooking spray. Add chops. Cook on medium-high heat 4 minutes on each side or until browned. Add onion, mushrooms and dressing. Cook an additional 3 minutes. Stir in rice, broth, water, apples and thyme. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer 10 minutes or until heated through.
name: crock pot apple glazed pork roastingred

Heat the oven to 375f. Spray a large baking dish with cooking sprayset aside. Wash and dice the potato into bite-size pieces. In a small bowl, combine the seafood seasoning and breadcrumbs until well blended. Add the diced potato and mix well. Lay the salmon fillet in the prepared dish and spread the potato mixture evenly over the top of the fish. Bake for about 15 minutes or until fish is opaque and cooked through. Serve over rice or noodles and sprinkle with a little more seafood seasoning if desired.

Mix all ingredients together. Place beef tenderloin steaks in a resealable plastic bag or bowl. Add seasoning mixture and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight. Remove from refrigerator 1 hour before grilling. Preheat the grill for high heat. Grill steaks for 8-10 minutes per side or until desired doneness. Let stand 10 minutes before slicing.
Place all in a large bowl and mix well. Store in the refrigerator at least 2 hours before serving.

In a large skillet over medium-low heat, saute the onion and garlic in the oil until the onion is soft but not browned--about 10 minutes. Add the cayenne pepper and cook for a few minutes more. Add the greens and turn up the heat to medium-highstir constantly so the greens will not stick to the pan. As soon as the greens begin to wilt, add the water and bring to a boilthen cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the salt, stirring wellthen cover again and cook for 15 more minutes. The greens will have wilted to a very soft consistency when they are donetaste for salt.

Beat eggs until well mixed. Heat a skillet over low heat, add butter. Add eggs. Stir occasionally until set. Add mushrooms and bacon bits and continue stirring until well blended. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately on hot buttered toast.

Steam the green beans. While the green beans are steaming add the blue cheese, chopped red onion and pecans to a food processor. Process until smooth. When the green beans are done steaming add to the food processor along with the olive oil and vinegar. Process until everything is incorporated. Season with the salt and pepper. Toss in the pecan pieces. Serve chilled.
name: Green Bean Salad with Feta and Lemoningredients: Green Beans, Feta Cheese, Fresh Dill, Sweet Onion, Fresh Lemon Zest, Olive Oil, Fresh Ground Black Pepperpreparation: Prepare an ice water bath for the green beans. Bring about 4 quarts of salted water to a boil. Cook green beans until tender, about 6 minutes. Transfer beans to the ice water bath and let cool about 5 minutes. Drain and dry beans and transfer to a large bowl. Add remaining ingredients to bowl and toss well to combine. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 3 days.
name: Green Be

Prepare crust by combining cookie crumbs and melted butter. Press into the bottom of a 9 inch pie plate and bake in a preheated oven at 400 degrees for about 10 minutes. Cool completely before filling. Beat together cream cheese and sweetened condensed milk. Stir in the cherries. Spread onto crust and bake for about 45 minutes or until center is set. Cool completely. Combine chocolates in a sauce pan over low heat. Stir until melted. Spread over filling. Chill before slicing. Garnish each slice with a maraschino cherry.

In a large pot of boiling, salted water, cook the penne until al dente. Drain. In a large saute pan over medium heat, heat 2 t olive oil. Add broccoli and cook until crisp-tender. Add the sugar snap peas and zucchini. Cook until all the vegetables are tender. Add the cream cheese and cook until the cheese is melted. Stir in the lemon juice and season with salt. Toss the pasta with the vegetables. Sprinkle with the parmesan and basil. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease an 8-inch cast-iron skillet or 8-inch square panset aside. In a medium bowl combine the milk, buttermilk, egg, vegetable oil and the cornmealstir well with a wooden spoon just until combined. Set aside for 2 minutes while you combine the remaining ingredients in a medium bowl. Add the remaining ingredients and stir just until combinedpour over the cornmeal mixture and stir just until combined. Pour into skilletbake for about 35 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before cutting into wedgesserve warm.

Wash and peel apples. Cut into pieces. Add to a large pot with juice and boiling water. Simmer for one hour. Pour through a sieve to remove seeds. Return to pot and add sugar crystals. Stir until dissolved. Add vanilla. Heat just to boiling and remove from heat. Add honey to taste. Serve with ice cream.
name: hot apple cideringredients: apples, cinnamon stick, lemon juice, oranges, brown sugar, ginger ale, icepreparation:Heat water to boiling in large saucepan. Add apples. Simmer until soft, about 30 minutes. Remove apples and add ginger ale. Return apples to ginger ale. Stir in lemon juice and sugar. Refrigerate overnight. Serve over ice.
name: spiced apple cideringredients: apple cider, light brown sugar, cinnamon sticks, fresh ginger rootpreparation:Place apple cider in large saucepan. Bring to boiling. Add brown sugar and ginger root. Reduce heat

Preheat a skillet over medium heat and add the olive oil. Add the sliced onion and red and green bell peppers to the hot skillet and cook until tender, about 4 to 5 minutes. While the vegetables are cooking, remove the casing from the hot dogs. Heat the remaining oil in a small skillet over medium heat and cook the hot dogs for 1 1/2 minutes per side. Cut each hot dog lengthwise into 3 slices. Divide the cooked vegetables evenly among 4 multi-grain hoagie buns. Top each bun with 1/4 pound of the cooked lean roast beef. Top with a tablespoon of salsa, 3 slices of hot dog and 1 ounce of cheese. Close the bun and serve.

In a large saute pan heat butter over medium heat. Add onions and saute until translucent. Add garlic and saute until fragrant. Add mushrooms and saute until tender. Add bouillon cube and saute for two minutes. Add nutmeg and stir. Add beef broth and bring to a boil. Add pepper and salt to taste. Reduce heat to low and simmer for five minutes. Remove from heat and stir in sour cream. Serve hot over cooked egg noodles.

Put chocolate and butterscotch chips in saucepan. Put on burner and turn on low heat. Stir and stir until melted and smooth. Remove from heat and add peanut butter. Mix and stir until peanut butter is evenly coated. Turn off burner and quickly add the rice krispy cereal. Mix and stir until they are evenly coated. Put in plastic bag and keep in the refrigerator.

Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan. Add the onion and garlic and saute until golden. Add the rice and cook over a low heat until the grains begin to soften. Stir in the curry powder. Season with salt and pepper. Add the frozen spinach. Heat through. Meanwhile, in a large pot, heat the coconut milk and the water. Add the lentils and the bay leaf. Bring to a boil and simmer over a medium heat until the lentils are tender. Remove from the heat and discard the bay leaf. Add the lentils to the rice mixture. Spoon into a buttered baking dish. Cover and bake in a moderate oven (350f/180c) for about 30 minutes. Serve hot.

Remove the seed from the center of each avocado half. Scoop out the meat with a spoon and place it into a bowl. Mash the avocado with a fork until it is the desired consistency. Add the green chilies, tomatoes and seasoning. Mix well. Add the mayonnaise and lemon juice. Mix well. Serve with tortilla chips.

Heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion to the pan, saute until the onions begin to brown. Add the chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Add the basil. Simmer 5 minutes. Add the rice. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add the green beans. Simmer 10 minutes. Add the tuna and cherry tomatoes. Stir. Serve over the rice.

Preheat the broiler. Place the slices of baguette on a baking sheet. Broil until golden brown. Rub the toasted bread slices with the garlic cloves. Spread the pesto over the toasts. Sprinkle with the bacon. Add the tomato slices, basil leaves, and season to taste with the salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
