Rub the tenderloin with the olive oil. Sprinkle the steaks with the garlic powder and salt. Place the tenderloin in the oven. Roast the meat until it is 3 to 4 inches thick. In the meantime, combine the sour cream and the blue cheese. When the meat is done cooking remove it from the oven. Place the meat in a baking dish. Spoon the cream and blue cheese mixture over the meat. Bake the meat again until it is hot and bubbly. Serve the meat with the remaining cream and blue cheese mixture. Serve with potato wedges, salad or vegetables.

In a large bowl combine cream cheese, ham, cheddar cheese and spring onions. Season with black pepper. Press into a greased 20cm x 10cm loaf tin. Sprinkle top with macadamia nuts. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours to firm up before slicing. Serve with crackers or biscuits.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 4 minutes. Stir in jalapeno pepper and cook until softened and fragrant, about 1 minute longer. Add rice and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute more. Add beans and broth and bring mixture to a boil over high heat. Add thyme and simmer until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Stir in coconut milk and remove from heat. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve over a bed of rice.

Mince the garlic and green onions. Finely chop the jalapeno pepper and slice it in half. Scoop the seeds out of the pepper with the tip of your knife blade. Coarsely chop the seeded pepper and set aside. Cut the avocados in half and remove the pits. Scoop the meat from the shell and place it in a mixing bowl. Add the minced green onions and garlic, the chopped seeded pepper and the lemon juice. Mash the mixture with the back of the spoon. Add the chili powder and the salt. Mash the mixture again. Add the chopped tomato and mash the mixture one last time. Serve immediately with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 220c/fan190c/gas7. Cut potatoes in half lengthways, then cut each half into quarters lengthways. Place in a large baking dish. Cut capsicum into strips. Scatter over potatoes with tomatoes. Crumble bacon into a small bowl with garlic clove and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle over potatoes and vegetables. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake for 30 minutes, or until potatoes are tender when pierced with the tip of a knife. Remove from oven and stir through chicken. Bake for a further 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a baking dish with butter or margarine. Combine eggs, sour cream, milk, salt and pepper in a large bowlstir well. Pour egg mixture into baking dish and bake for 45 minutes or until set and firm to the touch. Sprinkle with green onion and cheddar cheese. Bake for an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Cut into wedges and serve warm.

Heat olive oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Brown the pork on both sides. Remove from pan and set aside. Add garlic to the skillet and saute until fragrant but not browned. Add tomatoes and spices. Cook, stirring frequently until slightly thickened. Add the pork and cook until heated through. Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender yet firm. Drain and add to skillet. Cook just until pasta is heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with a green salad.

Place the dry ingredients into the food processor bowl and process until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Scatter the shortening pieces over the flour mixture. Pulse the machine on and off just until the mixture resembles coarse meal with pea-sized lumps of shortening throughout. Sprinkle the ice water over the mixture and process just until the dough begins to stick together. Scrape the dough onto a lightly floured surface. With the heel of your hand, press the dough into a disk about 1/2 inch thick. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least one hour.

In a 2- or 3-quart saucepan, saute onion and garlic over medium-high heat. Add beans, mashed sweet potatoes, and cumin. Mix well. Warm the tortillas and make quesadillas with the cheese. Good with salsa and sour cream.

In a 3-quart saucepan, combine the butter, yogurt, brown sugar, molasses, dry mustard, and salt. Cook over medium heat until boiling. Add the broad beans and simmer for 5 minutes or until the mixture thickens a little and the beans are heated through. Serve warm. Serves 4.

Slice the vegetables into uniform 1/2 inch pieces. Arrange the vegetables on the skewers in a pleasing arrangement. Marinate the vegetables in the refrigerator for 30 minutes or more. Grill over high heat for approximately 10 minutes or until the vegetables are nicely charred and soft. Serve over lettuce on a sandwich roll.

Boil or steam the potatoes until done to your liking. Peel them while they are still hot and put them in a mixing bowl. Mash them lightly. Beat in an egg, then add a little milk to make a soft batter. Stir in the sugar, salt and white pepper to taste. Heat a greased skillet over medium heat or heat a skillet grill on high heat. Drop batter by spoonfuls onto the hot surface. Cook for 2-3 minutes until golden brown on both sides. Serve hot buttered or spread with jam.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Spray a large baking sheet with cooking spray. In a medium bowl mix together potatoes, italian seasoning, onion powder, garlic powder, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper. Drizzle with olive oil flavored cooking spray. Place potato mixture in a single layer on prepared baking sheet. Roast potatoes for about 25 minutes or until just tender, tossing occasionally. Sprinkle with fresh parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. Layer half of the tortillas in the bottom of a greased 9x13 pan, cutting if desired to fit. Top with half the chicken mixture. Top with half the cheese. Repeat layers. Bake uncovered 30 minutes.
Mustard is great with anything, especially beef. I use it to make the best beef sandwiches around. I have been making this for over 20 years.

Combine cornstarch and water and stir until smooth. Season with salt to taste and set aside. Prepare chicken by rubbing with Dijon mustard and then coating with cornstarch mixture on both sides. Place in oven-proof dish and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. After 45 minutes remove from oven and add pineapple slices and garlic clove to the dish. Spoon the remaining cornstarch mixture over the chicken and place back in oven for 15 minutes. Serve with sliced rosemary sprinkled over the top and maraschino cherries on the side.

Brown sausage and remove from pan. Saute onion with a bit of butter. Add parsley flakes and ground pepper. Add a bit of water if the onion needs to be cooked down. When the sausage is cool enough to handle, crumble it into the mixture. Add the drained sauerkraut. Add a bit more water to the sauce to make it spreadable. Add the cream of mushroom soup. Salt and pepper to taste. Pour mixture into a 9x13 casserole dish. Cook pasta according to the directions. Drain it. Toss it with the parmesan cheese. Cover the pasta with the mixture. Bake at 375 for 20-30 minutes. Serve hot.

Peel bananas and slice in half lengthwise. Combine lemon juice and sugar in small bowl. Dip each slice of banana into mixture and lay on wax paper. Melt butter in large nonstick skillet over medium heat and place phyllo dough in skillet. Fold in half and cook until golden brown. Remove from heat and place on wax paper. Repeat until all dough is used up. Lay 1 or 2 slices of banana in bottom of each pastry shell and top with hot fudge and caramel candy pieces. Roll pastry around filling and place seam side down on wax paper. Repeat until all shells are filled. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Roll in powdered sugar before serving.

Heat olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until onion is soft, about 3 minutes. Add in squash and cook until tender. Add in brown sugar and cook 2 more minutes. Add in vanilla, brown sugar and parsley. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Transfer to an 8×8 baking pan or casserole dish. Sprinkle top with pecans. Bake in a preheated 375 degrees for 10 minutes. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 400 degree f. Beat together eggs, milk, flour, salt and butter in a bowl until well blended. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 5 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot with butter or syrup.

Wash vegetables and chop into medium-sized pieces. Put everything into a large pan. Add 1 quart of boiling water and let stand 1 hour or overnight to make vegetables soft. Drain vegetables well and press with a potato masher or potato ricer to make it mushy. Add 1/2 cup of water or enough to make it moist but not watery. Add sugar, flour, ginger, turmeric and celery seeds to taste. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and boil for 15 minutes or until it is the consistency of a relish or chow-chow. Let it cool and put into hot sterilized canning jars. Process in hot water bath for 10 minutes to seal.

Preheat the oven to 375F. Lightly grease a baking sheet or line with baking paper. Slice the pastry sheets in half down the middle, to make four rectangles. Divide the spinach between the pastry sheets, then sprinkle the feta cheese over the top. Make an egg wash by beating the eggs together with a little milk. Brush the egg wash over the pastry sheets. Sprinkle the sun-dried tomatoes over the top. Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes until golden brown. Serve immediately.

In a saucepan combine water and white sugar. Bring to a boil and boil for 3-5 minutes until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat and add vanilla. Pour into a jar and let cool. Add the pumpkin pie spice and the ground cloves. Store in the refrigerator.
These recipes are easy and tasty.
My family loves these recipes!
These recipes are great! I made the Pumpkin Spice Muffins and the Chocolate Syrup.
The Chocolate Syrup is amazing. I even made it in the blender!
I love the Pumpkin Spice Muffins. I made them for breakfast and everyone loved them. I think I will make them again next week.
This recipe for coffee chiller is the best! I like it better than the one I have been using.

Grease pie pan and line with crust or press crumbs into pan and bake until lightly browned. Melt butter with cocoa and add sugar and eggs beating well after each addition. Stir in walnuts and pour into pie shell. Bake for 18 minutes in preheated 375 degree F (190 degree C) oven. Cool before serving.
These are sooooooooooo good!!!!! I love the chocolate chips and the nuts. I will definitely be making these again!
These are really good and moist!

Place decaffeinated tea bags in the bottom of a large pitcher or bowl. Bring the apple juice to a boil in a large saucepan or double boiler. Pour the apple juice over the tea bags and add the allspice. Let the tea steep for at least 1 hour before serving. Stir occasionally. Add honey to taste. Chill until ready to serve. Serve the tea over ice with a slice of lemon and an optional sprinkle of allspice on top of each glass.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Place hens on a shallow baking dish breast side up. Add butter and apple to the baking dish. Sprinkle the tops of the hens with salt and pepper. Bake for 40 minutes or until no longer pink at the bone and juices run clear. Cool for 5-10 minutes. To prepare the sauce, heat the oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the onion and cook until softened. Stir in the remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened. Pour sauce over the hens and serve.

Cream together butter and brown sugar until light and creamy. Add vanilla and mix well. Sift together the flour and salt. Stir in the dry ingredients. Divide dough in half and color half the dough with the food coloring. Roll the dough out on a piece of wax paper and place the other half of the dough on top of the colored dough. Roll the dough together and refrigerate until firm. Roll the dough out on a lightly floured board and cut out shapes with a cookie cutter. Bake at 375 degrees for about 8 minutes or until edges are lightly brown. Cool completely and then ice as desired.
1. In large bowl, beat butter and brown sugar until light and creamy. Add vanilla and mix well.
2. Sift together the flour and salt. Stir in the dry ingredients.
3. Divide dough in half and color half the dough with the food coloring.
4. Roll the dough out on a piece of wax paper and place the other half of the dough on top of the colored dough. Roll the dough

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Place hotdogs in 8x8 inch foil-lined pan. Top with onions. Bake 30 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with pepper. Spread with mustard. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 minutes. Remove from oven and serve immediately.

In a large bowl add the tomatoes. Onion. Jalapenos. Cilantro. Dried ghost chilies. Lime juice. Olive oil. Sugar. Salt. And hot sauce. Mix all the ingredients well. Let the mixture sit in the refrigerator for 2 hours before serving. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat a grill to high heat. Peel and devein the shrimp, leaving the tails on. In a bowl combine the ketchup, molasses, water and soy sauce. Whisk together. In a small bowl combine the chili paste and crushed garlic. In a medium bowl combine the shrimp with the ketchup mixture. Add the sesame oil and chili paste mixture. Toss well. Cook the shrimp on the preheated grill 1-2 minutes per side. Serve hot.

In a heavy saucepan over low heat, melt together the sugar, light brown sugar, cocoa and the light cream. Mix in the butter and the vanilla extract. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, then cook for about 3 minutes or until the candy thermometer reads 260 f degrees. Add the pecans and cook for an additional 3 minutes or until the mixture reaches 265 f degrees. Pour the praline mixture onto a wax paper-lined cookie sheet. Cool for 30 minutes or until it is firm enough to handle. Using a spatula or wooden spoon, drop the candy by spoonfuls onto the wax paper and spread out with the back of the spoon to form balls about 1 inch in diameter. Roll each praline in the chopped chocolate until coated. Return the balls to the wax paper and store in an airtight container until ready to serve. Makes approximately 60 small balls.
This entry was posted in Cookies & Biscuits and tagged Bananas and Pralines, Creme Brulee with Praline Topping, Cream
Combine apple juice, strawberries and cantaloupe in a blender. Blend until smooth and slushy. Add ice cubes and honey if desired. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375f. Cream together butter and sugars. Add egg and mix well. Add milk and mix well. Add oats and mix well. Add flour. Mix well. Stir in raisins. Drop by teaspoons onto a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake for 12 minutes. Cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly spray a 12 cup muffin pan. Combine coconut, oats and 1/3 cup brown sugar. Set aside. Beat together the other 1/3 cup brown sugar and the butter until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg. Stir together the flours and remaining dry ingredients. Add the wet ingredients and mix just until combined. Fold in the coconut mixture. Spoon into prepared muffin cups and bake for 18 minutes. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pan.

Cook the vegetables in boiling salted water for 5 to 6 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain well. In a large mixing bowl combine the butter, sugar, nutmeg and salt. Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed for 2 to 3 minutes or until creamy. Add vegetables and beat until just combined. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate for up to 6 hours. Bring to room temperature before serving. Makes 4 servings.
Place ice in a glass. Pour in raspberry vodka and lime wedges. Add in diet sprite until glass is full. Mix in peach schnapps last. Garnish with lime wedges.
Toss broccoli florets in a hot pan with butter and garlic until lightly browned. Add lemon juice and zest and cook for a couple minutes. Toss in chopped nuts and serve.

Cook spaghetti in boiling salted water until al dente. Meanwhile heat olive oil in a pan with garlic and chili and cook for 1 minute until fragrant. Add crabmeat and stir gently for 2 minutes. Add parsley and season with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Drain pasta and toss with the crabmeat sauce. Serve with parmesan cheese and parsley to garnish.

Cream margarine and yellow cake mix, add egg and beat well. Mix in cream cheese and powdered sugar then add coconut and walnuts. Spread onto the bottom of a greased jelly roll pan and bake at 400 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until the edges turn golden brown. Let cool and cut into squares or rectangles.

Slice the turkey breasts into 4 equal pieces. In a shallow bowl or plate combine the bread crumbs and the parmesan cheese and mix together. In another shallow bowl or plate beat the eggs. Dip the turkey into the egg and then into the breadcrumb mixture. Place on a plate while you prepare the rest of the turkey. Heat the oil and shallow fry the turkey over medium heat until golden on both sides. Remove from the pan and place on paper towels to drain. Squeeze some lemon over the turkey before serving. You can also add some melted butter if you wish.

Cook chicken breasts in chicken broth (or water) until cooked through (165 degrees) and shred with two forks. Cook potatoes in boiling water 15 minutes or so, drain, peel, and cube. Cook green beans in boiling water 3 minutes or so or steam them if you prefer. Whisk together yogurt, mayonnaise, milk, dill weed, salt and pepper to make the dressing. Combine everything in a large bowl, stirring gently to combine. Refrigerate to chill, or serve immediately if serving warm.

In a medium bowl, combine the pasta and oil. Stir in the pork and next four ingredients. Stir in the tomatoes and cheese. Cook in a medium skillet over medium heat until heated through. Makes about 2 1/2 cups.

Marinate cube steaks with soy sauce, minced ginger and garlic for 1 hour. Drain. Combine flour with salt and pepper. Dredge steaks in flour mixture. Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add steaks. Cook until brown (about 5 minutes per side). Remove steaks from skilletadd broccoli to pan. Cook until tender-crunchy. Toss with soy sauce mixture. Serve over hot cooked rice.
Mix all ingredients together. Refrigerate overnight. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Grease and flour 10 cup tube pan. In a large bowl, combine butter and sugar. Beat until well blended. Beat in the vanilla and the 2 egg yolks. Add the 1/2 cup flour and the baking powder. Beat until well blended. In another bowl, beat the egg whites until they form stiff peaks. Fold the egg whites into the batter. Turn into the prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes or until the top springs back when touched. Cool in the pan on a wire rack. In the meantime, prepare the glaze. In a small saucepan combine 1/3 cup sugar and the 2 tablespoons water. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until the mixture comes to a boil. Continue to cook and stir for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in the butter and the 1 teaspoon vanilla. Pour the glaze over the cooled cake. Top with pecans. Store in the refrigerator. Makes 12 servings

In a blender, combine the yogurt, chai tea, banana, and 1 cup milk and blend until smooth. Pour into 2 tall glasses and serve immediately. Garnish each serving with caramel sauce, a sprinkle of mint leaves, and a dollop of whipped topping.

Sift the dry ingredients together. Add the butter and work it in with a pastry blender or fork. Add the cream cheese and mix it in. Add the milk, mix it in. Let it stand for about 10 minutes. Roll out the dough to about an inch thick. Cut out with a biscuit cutter or a glass. Place them on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 400 for about 10 minutes. Makes about 2 dozen.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Cream together the margarine, butter, sugar and vanilla in a large bowl until smooth. Add the beaten egg and mix well. Stir in the dry ingredients. Refrigerate for at least one hour or until well-chilled. Roll dough into one-inch balls. Place them on greased cookie sheet about two inches apart from each other. Bake for about 8 to 10 minutes, or until the edges are slightly golden brown but the middle is still slightly soft to the touch. Let them cool on the pan for a couple of minutes before moving them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 375f. Mix together the bisquick, egg and vegetable oil until crumbly. Add the remaining ingredients until well combined. Spoon into a 9-inch pie pan. Bake for 45 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.
1. In a large skillet, heat 2 teaspoons of vegetable oil. Add mushroomscook 3 minutes. Add onioncook 3 minutes. Add garliccook 1 minute.
2. Combine mushroom mixture, spinach, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper in a small bowl.
3. Divide mixture into 4 equal portions. Using about 1/4 of mixture for each portion, make 4 patties.
4. Heat remaining vegetable oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add pattiescook 5 minutes on each side. Serve with rice.
In a large skillet saute cabbage, celery, and green peppers in oil until tenderstir in onion and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Brown sausages in a skillet and drain off fat. Add pineapples, bananas and brown sugar. Stir well, then add cinnamon. Simmer for 3-5 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 200 degrees c. Place the milk and breadcrumbs in a shallow bowl and mix well. Dip the chicken wings into the milk and then into the breadcrumbs to coat evenly. Spread the sesame seeds on a plate. Roll the chicken wings in the sesame seeds to coat well. Place the coated wings onto a lined oven tray and cook for 30 minutes turning once until golden and cooked through. Serve at once with lemon wedges and yoghurt if desired.

Combine the chili sauce and cheese in a small bowl. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fill each tortilla with 1/4 cup red-chile mixture and 1 tablespoon onions and roll up. Place the rolled tortillas seam-side down in a greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish. Beat the eggs in a bowladd the remaining oil and milk and mix well. Pour egg mixture over the tortillas. Sprinkle with the remaining 2 cups cheese. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting into squares to serve.

Heat oven to 350°. In small bowl, microwave chocolate and butter in microwave on high power for 2 min. stirring frequently until smooth. Cool. In small bowl, beat condensed milk and liqueur until smooth. Stir into chocolate mixture. Stir in almonds. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Roll into 1 inch balls. Roll in cocoa. Store in refrigerator.
Mix all ingredients together and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Use 1/2 tsp in a recipe or as a dipping sauce for bread or vegetables.

In a large skillet heat 1 tablespoon of the oil. Add the garlic and cook over moderately low heat until golden but not browned. Add the pine nuts and stir until lightly toasted. Add the blanched almonds and stir for 2 minutes longer. Add the spinach and stir-fry until wilted. Remove from heat and stir in 1/4 cup of the parsley. Season with salt. Transfer to plates. Cut the Serrano ham into 1/2-inch dice. In a medium skillet heat 1 tablespoon of the oil until almost smoking. Add the ham and cook over moderate heat, stirring frequently until golden. Add 1/4 cup of the parsley and season with salt. Spoon the ham over the spinach. Garnish each serving with 1 teaspoon of capers.

In a large saucepan, cook the leek in the butter over low heat until soft. Sprinkle with the curry powder and powdered ginger. Stir over medium heat until fragrant. Stir the peas into the leek mixture and cook 3 to 4 minutes more or until tender-crisp. Add the carrot, celery, and enough water to cover by about 1 inch. Bring to a boil over high heatreduce the heat to medium-low and cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in the milk. Season with the salt and pepper to taste. Serve with a dollop of yogurt if desired.

Heat the olive oil over low heat and add the garlic cloves and green onions. Cook for 1 minute until the onions are translucent. Add the tomatoes and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the wine vinegar and cook for one more minute. Sprinkle on the oregano and basil. Remove from heat and stir in the feta cheese and olives and serve immediately.

Boil potatoes whole until tender. Cut into wedges. Heat oil and butter in heavy skillet over moderately high heat until foam subsides. Add potatoes and cook, turning occasionally, until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

In a small skillet over medium heat saut the green pepper strips and onion in butter until tender. In a saucepan combine tomato sauce, beans and chili powder. Heat to boiling. In a skillet over medium heat saut the hot dogs in butter until browned and heated through. Arrange corn chips in an inverted layer in each of 2 individual serving dishes. Top each with the beans and tomato sauce mixture. Top with the sauted hot dogs and sprinkle with cheese. Makes 2 servings.

Combine graham cracker crumbs with 2 tbsp melted butterpress into bottom of 13x9-inch baking pan. Beat creamy peanut butter and pudding mixes with milk until well blendedspread over graham cracker crumbstop with remaining crumbspress down firmly. Freeze until set (about 3 hours). Cut into 4 rows by 3 rows to form 12 bars.

In a large bowl combine butter, honey, and corn syrupstir until smooth. Add raisinsstir until blended. In another bowl combine quick oats, baking powder, salt and peanutsmix well. Stir dry mixture into wet mixture until blended. Spread mixture into a greased 9x13x2 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes or until top is golden. Cool. Cut into squares and store in an airtight container. Yields: about 3 dozen.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f (230 degrees c). Toss cauliflower in oil and salt & pepper, then spread out on baking sheet. Roast until tender and lightly browned, about 25-30 minutes. Heat butter in skillet over medium heat and add flour. Cook flour until light brown, stirring constantly. Whisk milk into flour mixture until smooth. Add salt & pepper and bring to a boilcook & stir for 1 minute more. Remove from heat and stir in cheese until melted. Stir in cauliflower, then serve.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Place the refrigerated buttermilk biscuits on a cookie sheet and pop into the oven for 10 minutes. Cool the biscuits on wire racks for 10 minutes. Spread the cooled buttermilk biscuits with butter. Sprinkle with the sugar. Drizzle with half of the cooled strawberry syrup. Top with the cool whip. Garnish with strawberry slices and blueberries.

Place butter in medium saucepan over medium heat. Saute carrots until tender-crisp, about 10 minutes, stirring frequently. Stir in sugar, salt and winecook over medium heat until liquid is reduced to glaze by half, 10-12 minutes.

Crumble cheeses into large bowl. Mix in chutney. Add onionmix well. Coverrefrigerate 2 hours or overnight. Serve with crackers. Yields 4 cups.

Fry ground beef with onion and green pepper until browned. Drain off fat. Add rice and season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese, if desired. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour, covered with foil until the cheese is melted.

Mix together next 3 ingredients in a small bowl. Place fish in a small shallow baking dish. Pour marinade over fish and refrigerate for 2 hours. In small skillet saute onion in sesame oil over medium heat until onion is translucent. Remove fish from marinade and grill skin side down on medium-hot grill until fish flakes with a fork. Top with onion mixture. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve with rice.

Prepare wontons and set aside. Bring water to boil. Add wontons and cook for 3 minutes or until they float. Drain the wontons and set aside. In the meantime, bring the chicken broth to boil in another saucepan. Add broccoli stem, gingerroot, straw mushrooms, and green onions to the boiling broth. Simmer for 3-4 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add the wontons to the broth. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine the flour, salt and pepper. Dip pork chops into flour mixture. In a large skillet, melt 2 tablespoons of butter and brown pork chops on both sides. In a small bowl, combine remaining 1 tablespoon butter with honey. Pour over chops and sprinkle with pecans. Bake, uncovered at 425 for 10-15 minutes or until a meat thermometer reads 165f. Serve with mashed potatoes or rice and vegetables of your choice.

In a shallow bowl, combine flour, thyme, pepper and brown sugardredge pork chops on both sides in the
Prepare cake mix according to package directions. Add water, oil, sugar and vanillamix well. Add beaten eggsmix well. Add sour creammix well. Bake according to package directions.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a shallow baking pan with cooking spray. Lay the asparagus spears in a single layer. Drizzle with the cooking spray. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. In a small saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Stir in the shallots. Slowly whisk in the vinegar. Whisk until well blended. Remove the asparagus from the oven and sprinkle with the salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle the dressing over the asparagus spears, tossing to coat. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt butter or margarine in a skillet. Add onions and hash browns. Cook and stir until potatoes are lightly browned and onions are tender. Grease a 9x13 inch pan and place hash browns in the bottom of the pan. Beat eggs, milk and salt and pepper 1- 2 minutes. Stir in grated cheese. Pour over potatoes. Bake at 350 degrees 45-50 minutes, until a knife inserted comes out clean.
Mix sugar-free gelatin with boiling water. Mix with cold water. Add ice cubes. Chill for a few hours. Add fat-free cool whip to the top.

Cut the avocados in half around the seed. Twist the halves apart and remove the seed. Scoop out the flesh into a large bowl and mash with a fork until the flesh is smoothly pureed but with some texture (the perfect consistency for dipping tortilla chips in). Add the onion, cilantro, garlic, lime juice, mayonnaise, hot sauce, and salt to taste. Fold in the tomatoes.

Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chili pepper and ginger. Cook, stirring constantly until the ginger is browned. Stir in the lentils and the water. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer, uncovered, until the lentils are tender. Add the coriander and the spinach. Cook for 1 minute or until the spinach is wilted. Season to taste with the salt and pepper. Add the lemon juice and serve.
Drain the beans. Toss the beans with the rest of the salad ingredients. Dress with the vinegar. Add the eggs. Toss again. Serve.

Mix together ground beef and rice krispies. Add egg and mix until well blended. Add salt, onion, brown sugar, and catsup. Divide mixture in half and form into 2 patties. Brown in pan or grill until done. Mix together tomato soup and vinegar. Pour over patties. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until done. Serve on a hamburger bun.

Heat a wok or pan until it is very hot. Add the sunflower oil. Add the ginger and stir-fry for a minute. Add the red chili pepper and the garlic and stir-fry for another minute. Add the soy sauce and the Thai fish sauce. Add the bok choy. Cover the pan and cook for 2 minutes. Serve the bok choy immediately.

Preheat oven to 450f. Cut the tomatoes in half lengthwise. Place cut side down in a small casserole dish or on a small baking sheet. Sprinkle with the salt substitute and pepper. Drizzle with the balsamic vinegar and olive oil. Roast for about 15 minutes. Sprinkle with the fresh basil and garlic and serve immediately.

Combine yogurt, garlic and mint. Divide into two portions. Marinate each side of the chicken for 4-6 hours. Cook over medium heat for 10-12 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 170 deg f. Drizzle yogurt sauce over each piece. Serve with the remaining yogurt sauce. Garnish with fresh mint.

Mix dry ingredients. In a stand mixer cream together butter and sugars. Add vanilla. Beat in dry mix. Add eggs one at a time. Add cocoa. Add chocolate chips. Form into balls and place on cookie sheets. Bake at 325 degrees for about 20 minutes. Cool on wire rack.

In a small food processor, combine all ingredients and puree until smooth. Pour into a large resealable plastic bag and add the flank steaks. Seal the bag and refrigerate overnight for best flavor. Grill the steaks over hot coals or broil for 5 minutes per side. Cook to your desired doneness. Serves 4 to 6.

In a mixing bowl, combine dried mixed fruit with tea, brandy and dark brown sugar. Mix together egg yolks and brandy. Add to mixed fruit, stir to combine and let stand for 5 minutes. In another bowl, combine 2 cups self-raising flour with mixed spice. Stir into fruit mixture. In a separate bowl combine 1 cup self-raising flour with 1 cup castor sugar and the remaining 3 tbsp mixed spice. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form and gently fold into fruit mixture with the rest of the self-raising flour mixture. Spoon mixture into a greased 20 cm square tin and level the surface with a knife. Bake for 1 hour or until golden. Remove from oven to cool for 15 minutes before turning out of tin to cool on a wire rack. To make the icing, beat butter until smooth, add sugar and beat until creamy. Add enough of the 1 cup icing sugar to make a spreadable but not too thick mixture. Spread over tea bread, sprinkle with extra mixed spice and serve.

Melt 1 stick butter in a large skillet. Add shallots and saute until soft and translucent. Add in the bell peppers and saute for about 5 minutes. Add in the green beans and the remaining stick of butter. Season with salt and pepper. Saute until the butter has melted and the green beans are tender. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion. Cook for 5 minutes or until softened. Add broth, mushrooms, carrot, lentils, celery and rosemary. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium. Cook for 20 minutes or until lentils are tender. Remove bay leaf. Season with freshly ground black pepper.

Melt butter. Add water to melted butter. Add apples. Cook over medium high heat until tender. Add sugar and cinnamon. Stir to combine. Makes about 16 servings.

Cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling water. Drain. Heat the oil in a non-stick frying pan. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the plum tomatoes, bring the juices to a boil then add the spinach. Cook for 2 minutes. Mix the pasta through the sauce. Garnish with the parsley. Serve.

Drain apples and place in a large bowl. Add remaining 1/2 cup lemon juice and 1/2 cup maple syrup. Toss to coat. Add dates and toss again. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and chopped lemon balm. Cook the wax and green beans in salted water for 3 to 4 minutes. Drain and cool. In a large bowl combine the other vegetables. Add the vinegar, oil and sugar and mix well. Combine first four ingredients. Add tapioca and mix well. Add cherries and stir to mix well. Cut cereal in half and press into 9 inch glass pie plate. Spread filling over cereal. Bake at 400 degrees for one hour.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse in cold water. Place in large bowl. In saucepan over low heat, combine corn, sour cream and butter. Stir until butter is melted. Pour over pasta and toss well. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Serves 6.

Separate the eggs. In a large saucepan over medium heat whisk together the eggs, cheese and breadcrumbs. Add the chicken stock a little at a time whisking constantly. When the mixture begins to thicken remove from heat. Serve immediately.

I love that you have included the time it takes to make each one. I really appreciate that.
Thanks for linking up to my blog party.
I am so glad you found this helpful! I have found that many of my friends love to cook but just don't have a lot of time. I try to make things simple for them!
I like the idea of this. I love soups too. I think it's a good idea to have some of these recipes up your sleeve when you're in a rush.
Thanks for stopping by! Soups are my favorite thing to make on cold days!
Great list of recipes! I'm going to share this on my FB page for my readers! Thanks for stopping by and sharing at Funtastic Friday!
Thanks for sharing these yummy recipes!

Preheat oven to 350. In small bowl combine butter and garlic. Spread between slices of bread. Sprinkle with paprika. Spread remaining butter mixture over tops. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with cheese. Return to oven for an additional 5 minutes or until heated through. Cut into wedges. Makes 8 servings.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt the butter. Add the scallions and saute until wilted. Add the chile, garlic and thyme and cook for about 1 minute. Stir in the broth and the shrimp. Cover the skillet and cook over low heat for about 5 minutes or until the shrimp is cooked through. Transfer the skillet to a serving platter and sprinkle with the parsley. Serve immediately.

Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until a fork can be inserted into the center of the potato with ease. Drain the potatoes and then mash them with a fork or a hand masher. Add the butter and mix well with a spoon. Add the ricotta cheese and mix well again. Add the kale and mix well one last time. Salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately.

Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in the flour until incorporated. Cook for a minute or so. Gradually whisk in the milk. Bring to a simmer and cook until thickened and smooth. Add the cheese, paprika, nutmeg and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with chicken, fish or pork.

Mix all the above together. Pour into a greased and floured 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes. Let cool. Cream together 1/2 cup powdered sugar and 3 tablespoons orange extract until smooth. Spread on top of cooled cake. Sprinkle on top 1/2 cup powdered sugar. Let stand for an hour or so before cutting.

For the bread machine, add the warm water, white flour, wheat flour, honey, shortening, salt and yeast to the bread pan of the bread machine according to the manufacturers directions and run on the basic setting (or whatever the manufacturers recommends for the best results). If using a loaf pan, you will need to transfer the dough to the pan after the first rise and let rise again before baking.

Heat butter in a large frypan over medium heat. Add flour and stir with a wooden spoon for a minute then add the chicken and stir fry until no longer pink. Add lemon juice and stir until thickened then add the liqueur and honey and stir well. Add orange zest and stir. Transfer chicken and sauce to a shallow ovenproof dish and bake for about 20 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Serve with steamed rice.

Thaw the broccoli if it is frozen. Saute the onions in butter until transparent. Add the broccoli and saute until it is almost done. Add the bacon. Remove from heat. In a bowl combine the sour cream, eggs, and cheeses. Season with thyme and worcestershire sauce. Pour into the pie crust. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes at 350 degrees. Allow to cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add chicken to pan and cook for 3 minutes per side or until no longer pink in center and juices run clear. Dissolve thyme in vinegar. Add vinegar mixture to pan. Cook 1 minute or until thickened. Remove chicken from pan. Spoon sauce over chicken. Yields 1 serving with 1/2 cup sauce.

Preheat the oven to 400 F. Grease a 12-cup muffin pan or line with paper liners. Whisk together the eggs and sugar in a large mixing bowl. Add the vegetable oil and beat until smooth. Stir in the apple and carrot and set aside. Sift together the flours, baking powder and salt. Stir into the egg mixture along with the cinnamon and nuts. Fill the prepared muffin cups two-thirds full. Bake for 20 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Combine 1 can of apple pie filling with 2 cups of applesauce in a large bowl. Add 2 tsp. cinnamon and 1/4 cup brown sugar. Mix well. Roll out pastry shell. Place in 9 inch pie plate. Pour in the apple mixture and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Let cool before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In mixing bowl, combine ground beef, mushroom soup, onion, egg, worcestershire sauce and bread crumbs. Mix well with your hands until combined. Divide meat mixture into 8 equal portions. Press each portion into the center of each slice of bread, making a meat filled pocket. Sprinkle each with some cheese. Place in a greased baking dish or on cookie sheet. Bake 20-25 minutes or until done.

Boil the potatoes until tender. Drain and let cool. Dice the potatoes. In a small bowl whisk the olive oil, lemon juice, lemon zest and kosher salt together. Add the potatoes and cilantro to the bowl. Toss to coat. Add the scallions and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Combine first five ingredients and beat until blended and smooth. Fold in sour cream and almond extract. Pour into pie shell and bake at 400 for 40 minutes or until top is light golden brown. Cool on wire rack. Chill at least 4 hours before serving. Top with fresh berries and whipped cream.

In a large skillet cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and drain. Cut kielbasa into 1/2-inch slices. In the same skillet brown kielbasa. In a large saucepan or Dutch oven cook potatoes in boiling water for about 20 minutes or until tender. Cut broccoli florets into 1/2-inch pieces. Remove potatoes from water, add broccoli and cook for 2 minutes. Add celery, carrots, kielbasa and bacon. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese and bake at 350f until cheese is melted.

Place egg yolks and water in top of double boiler set over medium heat. Beat until thickened. Turn off heat. Add 2 tbs butter. Beat over low heat until thickened. Add remaining butter, beating until mixture is thickened. Remove from heat. Beat in lemon juice, salt, white pepper, and cayenne. Serve immediately. Makes 1 cup.

Heat 1/4 cup of the oil in a large sauté pan over medium heat until it shimmers. Add the onions and sauté them, stirring occasionally, until they begin to brown and caramelize, about 20 minutes. Stir the vinegar into the onions and continue to sauté until they caramelize further and the mixture is very dark brown and almost dry, about 5 minutes more. Add the thyme and salt and pepper to taste and stir to combine well. Meanwhile, place the potatoes in a large saucepan and cover them with cold water by about 1". Bring them to a boil over high heat and cook until the potatoes can be easily pierced with a sharp knife, about 15 minutes. Drain the potatoes and add them to the sauté pan with the caramelized onions and remaining 2 tablespoons oil. Add the mustard and horseradish and stir to combine well. Mash the mixture with a fork or a potato masher and add the half-and-half as needed to make a thick but smooth consistency. Season to taste with salt and pe

Boil water. Add salt and jalapenos. Add vegetables and cook for five minutes. Drain and pour cold water over vegetables. Let stand for one hour. Drain and add vinegar. Let stand for one hour. Store for up to one week.
Combine all the ingredients and marinade the onion for 3 hours. Grill or roast 10 to 15 minutes.

In large mixing bowl, combine 1 1/2 cups of the cornmeal, whole wheat pastry flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and saltadd egg whitesbeat with hand or stand mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy (about 2 minutes). Beat in fat free buttermilk, then stir in corn kernels, cheddar cheese, and jalapenosstir just until moistened (batter will be lumpy). Divide evenly into greased 8-inch round pansbake at 350 for 25 minutes or until light golden brown and toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Let stand in pan 5 minutes before removing to cool on wire rackcut into wedges to serve.

Spread mustard on top side of both slices of bread. On top slice of bread layer swiss cheese, half of ham slices and half of mayonnaise. Top with other slice of ham slices and remaining mayonnaise. On bottom slice place swiss cheese and remaining ham slices. Spread other slice of bread with mustard and place it mayo-side down on top slice. Grill sandwiches for 2-3 minutes per side or until golden brown. Cut into four wedges for serving.

2. Grilled Ham and Cheese Sourdough Sandwiches - http://allrecipes.com/Recipe/grilled-ham-and-cheese-sourdough-sandwiches/
3. Grilled Ham N Jack Cheese Sandwiches - http://allrecipes.com/Recipe/grilled-ham-n-jack-cheese-sandwiches/

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place the meat in a glass or plastic baking dish and cover with foil. Bake for 3 hours and let cool in the cooking liquid. Remove meat from baking dish and slice into thin slices on the diagonal. Reheat meat in baking dish in a low oven for 30 minutes and serve with pan juices as sauce.
Pork tenderloin is a cut of meat that comes from the center of the loin of a hog or pig. This cut of meat is a relatively lean cut of meat and is often used in many recipes for a variety of dishes. It is a popular cut of meat for those who are looking for a lean and healthy option for their meals.
Pork tenderloin is a cut of meat that is taken from the back of the pig and is typically a long and narrow piece of meat. It is a relatively lean cut of meat and has a mild flavor that is often described as being slightly sweet and savory. It is a popular cut of meat for those who are looking for a lean and healthy option for their meals.

Preheat oven to 450f. Combine onion, butter, lemon juice, parsley, thyme, salt and paprika in a small bowl. Cut the ends off each chicken. Cut each piece in half lengthwise. Spread the chicken pieces on a roasting pan. Brush them lightly on both sides with the onion mixture. Roast for 1 hour. Reduce heat to 325f. Continue baking for an additional 1 hour or until juices run clear when center of thickest portion is pierced. Remove to serving platter. Garnish with parsley.

Cook beef and onion in skillet until beef is browned. Stir in the soup and mushrooms. Remove from heat and add tortillas. Stir until well combined. Pour into a greased 2-quart baking dish. Add milk and bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and top with the cheeses. Bake 2-3 minutes longer until cheese is melted. Serve with sour cream, guacamole or plain.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Sift together 1/2 cup of flour and 1/4 teaspoon salt into a bowl. Set aside. Cream together 1/2 cup granulated sugar and 1/2 cup vegetable oil. Mix well. Add 1/4 cup milk and mix well. Add 1 teaspoon vanilla and mix well. Add 2 eggs and mix well. Add the 1/2 cup flour mixture and mix well. Add 1/2 cup creamy peanut butter and mix well. Stir in 1/2 cup coarsely chopped nuts (optional). Shape into 1 1/2 inch balls. Roll balls in additional 1/2 cup granulated sugar and place on lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 minutes or until done. Remove from cookie sheets and cool on wire racks. Makes 5 dozen 1 1/2 inch balls.
I know I’ve made this cookie before, and I’ve posted about it before. But I couldn’t find a post for it. It’s not my recipe

Cut fish into 4 portions. Season with salt and pepper. Dust with five spice powder to coat. Heat a little oil in fry pan. Add fish skin side up. Cook 3 - 4 minutes to brown. Turn over and cook 2 minutes more. Cut bok choy into half lengthways, cook in boiling, salted water 2 minutes then drain. Serve with rice and spring onions.

First of all you need to cut the fruitcake into cubes and set them aside. Then place the cubes in a small pot and cover with brandy. Let them soak for about 15 minutes. Once the cake cubes are soft, place them in the bottom of the cups you are using. Sprinkle the tops with the white chocolate shavings and decorate with the red sprinkles or other decorative candies.
Sauté the mushrooms in the oil until golden. Combine the vinegar, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Add to the mushrooms. Toss. Sprinkle with green onion tops.

Cream the icing sugar and butter until light and fluffy, then blend in the flours and rice flour. Press into a shallow baking dish and chill for at least one hour before cutting into bars or squares and serving with a dollop of raspberry jam.

Place tuna steaks on a plate. Season with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil and vinegar in a small saucepan over medium high heat. Bring to a boil and boil for 2 minutes. Pour over tuna and let marinade for 10 minutes. Grill tuna for 4 minutes on each side. Slice and serve.

Prepare 2 cups of strong brewed coffee. Place coffee in a blender and add half-and-half and milk. Add vanilla syrup and ice and blend until smooth and foamy. Pour into two tall glasses and garnish with whipped cream. Serve immediately.
I love all of these drinks and I am a big coffee drinker. I think the cafe mocha mint would be my favorite. I love the idea of putting a little cocoa on top.
These sound really good. I think my favorite is the Mocha Mint.
I love this time of year, because I get to make all kinds of drinks like this! My kids are always up for it too!
I love coffee. These look so tasty. I love a good iced mocha.
I love all of these drinks but I'm going to try out the Brazilian Mocha first!
I love drinking my coffee! I would love to try out a few of these recipes and see if I can make my coffee tasting better.
I have got to try these recipes. They sound so good.
These are some

In a medium bowl, combine miso and rice vinegar. Let stand at least 5 minutes or until mixture has slightly thickened. Stir in sake and both sugarsset aside. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Rinse salmon fillets, and pat dry with paper towels. Place in a baking dish. In a medium bowl, combine sake and rice vinegar and let stand at least 5 minutes or until mixture has slightly thickened. Stir in sake and both sugarsset aside. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Rinse salmon fillets, and pat dry with paper towels. Place in a baking dish. Whisk together gingerroot and soy saucebrush over both sides of each fillet. Sprinkle with panko crumbs. Bake for 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Turn the oven off and allow the salmon to remain in the oven for an additional 30 minutes or until done. Spread each fillet with a small amount of

In 2-quart microwave-safe casserole dish or bowl combine macaroni and chicken broth. Cover and microwave on high for 3 minutes or until pasta is tender and liquid is absorbed. Stir in broccoli. In small bowl combine cheese and milkstir until smooth. Add to macaroni mixture and toss to coat. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes or until heated through and topping is melted.

In small bowl, combine the oyster crackers, parsley, and Lemon & Herb Seasoning. Sprinkle with salt and cayenne. Press onto both sides of scallops. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the scallops to the skillet and cook until golden brown and crispy on the bottom (about 2 minutes). Flip and continue to cook until done (about 2 minutes). Transfer to a serving dish and top with Dijon mustard. Serve warm.

In a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish, arrange the cranberries in a single layer. Stir together the water and the sugar. Pour over the berries and toss to coat. Sprinkle the lemon juice and the cinnamon evenly over the berries. Bake uncovered in preheated oven for 1 hour. Stir marmalade into the berry mixture. Sprinkle with the walnuts and bake an additional 30 minutes or until the berry mixture is thick and bubbly. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a heavy 12-inch to 14-inch skillet, combine butter, onion, jalapeno pepper, and red pepper flakes. Cook over medium heat until onion is golden brown. Add water, garlic, tomato puree, and lemon juice. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add the clams. Cover and cook until the clams open. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl mix the milk with the beaten egg. Season with salt and pepper, then add the onion and garlic, stirring to combine. Melt the butter in a 9 inch skillet over medium heat. Stir in the mushrooms, sprinkle in the cheeses and continue to cook for 2 - 3 minutes until the cheeses are almost melted. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for 2 - 3 minutes or until the egg mixture is set on the bottom. Slide the skillet onto the plate then fold the omelet over to serve. Serve hot

Combine all the ingredients except the fish and salt and pepper in a bowl. Place the fish in an oven proof dish and pour the marinade over it. Cover with foil and bake at 400 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes. Serve hot with more of the marinade. Garnish with sliced scallions.

Heat oven to 425 degrees. Season chicken all over with paprika, garlic powder, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Put chicken in a large shallow roasting pan. Roast for 40 minutes. Lower heat to 350 degrees. Add remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt. Put half the thyme leaves in the cavity of the chicken. Cut the other half in half and scatter them over the chicken. Cut lemon in half, and squeeze the juice over the chicken. Pour butter over the top. Roast for an additional 20 minutes.

Melt the butter in a large pan over a low heat. Add the onions and cook for 5 minutes until soft but not coloured. Add the bacon and cook until lightly coloured. Add the lentils and cook for 1 minute. Add the vegetable stock. Bring to the boil and simmer for 25-30 minutes or until the lentils are tender. Add the chopped tomatoes. Bring back to the boil. Season with salt and pepper. Whisk in the double cream. Serve immediately.
These look great. I've been looking for a good lentil recipe. I'm going to try these.
thanks for sharing those. i'm always looking for new lentil recipes.
Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl until mixed thoroughly. Transfer the mixture to a baking tray and pat down the mixture until smooth. Bake for 1 hour or until cooked through.

Cook frozen hash browns as directed. Drain. Pour eggs into 2 quart saucepan. Add milk and dried onion flakes. Stir until smooth. Stir in dill. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently. Season with seasoning salt and pepper. Pour half the egg mixture over potatoes. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup cheddar cheese. Top with fish sticks. Top with remaining egg mixture. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until bubbly and golden. Serve with lettuce and tomato.
Grease a 9x13-inch pan. Beat together butter, sugars and eggs. Stir in flour, baking powder, salt, chocolate chips and nuts. Press into pan. Bake 25 minutes at 350f.

Crush angel food cake into 1 1/2 cups fine crumbs (using a blender or food processor works best). Add 1 cup heath bits and mix well. Press into a 13 x 9 pan. Set aside. Mix 2 packages of instant pudding with 3 cups of milk and 1 1/2 cups of cold water. Pour over crumb mixture and spread evenly. Chill until set. Fold 2 cups of cooled whip into remaining 1 cup of whipped cream. Spread on top of cake. Refrigerate until serving time.

Preheat oven to 175 degrees celsius. Blend together the flour, baking powder and salt. Cut in the butter with a pastry blender or fork until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir together the honey and milk and add to the flour mixture all at once. Mix until the dough holds together. Turn out onto a floured surface and knead a few times. Roll out to 1/2-inch thickness on a lightly floured surface. Cut with a 2-inch round cutter. Place on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned. Cool on a wire rack. Makes 24 2-inch biscuits.

Brown the meat in the skillet and drain the fat. In a large pot combine the beef broth and macaroni. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 10 minutes. Add the meat, the red kidney beans and the spaghetti sauce. Simmer for another 10 minutes. Stir in the Parmesan cheese and simmer for 2 minutes. Serve with Parmesan cheese on top.

Cook rice according to package directions. In large skillet or Dutch oven brown meat. Stir in Kielbasa. Season with salt, cayenne pepper, and chili powder. Add onions. Cook over medium heat 2 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add beans and tomatoesstir. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 10 minutes or until rice is tender.

To make the chile sauce, in a small saucepan, combine the chiles, garlic, lemon juice, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 cup water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heatboil for 1 minute. Cool to room temperature. Thread the shrimp onto skewers. Grill the shrimp over high heat for 4 minutes on each side. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt with the peanut oil. Brush the shrimp with the mixture during the last 30 seconds of cooking. Serve the shrimp with the sauce.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a small bowl, mix ketchup, vinegar, water and brown sugar. With a brush or your fingers, coat the chicken with the ketchup mixture. Bake uncovered for about 20 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear. In a medium bowl mix the soy sauce and sesame oil. In a small bowl combine cornstarch and water. Drain the juices from the baking pan and pour them into the mixture of cornstarch and water and whisk until it is smooth. Pour the sauce over the chicken and mix well with the red pepper flakes. Bake uncovered for another 10 minutes or until the glaze is thick and bubbly.

Cut the ends off the shallot and place in a small bowl. Add the balsamic vinegar and stir to combine. Drizzle 1/2 the vinegar mixture over the top. Add the remaining vinegar mixture and the extra virgin olive oil. Drizzle the remaining mixture over the top. Cover the bowl and place in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. After 2 hours, remove the bowl from the refrigerator and sprinkle the salt and freshly ground pepper over the top. Garnish with the thyme sprig and serve.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f (165 degrees c). Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan or two 8-inch round pansset aside. Cream together the shortening and sugar. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Mix in the bananasset aside to cool slightly. Sift together the flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon. Stir this mixture into the creamed mixture. Stir in the nuts if desiredmix just to moisten the dry ingredients. Spread the batter into the prepared panssmooth the top. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes for a loaf or 30 to 35 minutes for the rounds, or until a wooden toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from ovencool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to wire racks to cool completely. Wrap cooled loaves in plastic wrap or wax paper or store in airtight containers.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Place the sliced sweet potatoes in a large mixing bowl. Melt the butter in the microwave and then stir into the sweet potatoes. Add the orange juice and zest and season with the cayenne, cumin and smoked paprika. Mix together well and transfer the potatoes into an even layer on a large parchment-lined baking sheet. Bake for about 40 minutes or until the potatoes are fork-tender and golden brown on the edges. Serve hot with a drizzle of extra honey or orange juice.

In a small saucepan, combine 2 cups eggnog and 3/4 cup milk. Cook over low heat until heated through. Stir in 2 tablespoons chocolate syrup and 1/2 teaspoon bourbon. Top with marshmallows and sprinkle with nutmeg.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a bowl, mix together the shredded coconut and sesame seeds. Dip turkey slices into the beaten egg whites, then dredge in the coconut mixture to coat evenly. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray, and place the turkey slices on the sheet. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven.
Combine first 5 ingredients in a bowl. Add oiltoss gently to coat. Add vinegartoss gently. Sprinkle with nuts. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Serves 6.

Combine the cornmeal and flour, then add the salt and pepper. Dip the fish pieces into the mixture and then into the corn oil. Fry until golden brown and crisp on both sides, about 10 minutes total. Serve hot with tartar sauce and lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Mix together flour and baking powder in a bowl. Beat together butter and egg in a separate bowlstir in flour and soy sauce mixture until well blended. Stir in sweet potatoes and honeymix well. Place a nonstick cooking spray in a skillet over medium heat. Drop batter by heaping tablespoonfuls onto skilletflatten slightly. Cook until brown, about 3 minutes per side.
In blender container, combine evaporated skim milk, white chocolate and vanilla. Blend until smooth. Gradually add coffee and blend again. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl, combine the maple syrup and the mustard. Whisk in the vinegar and the rosemary. Season the mixture with the garlic, orange zest, and the pepper. Add the lamb and toss to coat well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours and up to overnight. Preheat the broiler. Arrange the lamb in a single layer in a roasting pan. Broil 4 inches from the heat for 10 minutes, turning the chops over and basting with the glaze after 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Combine the dry ingredients in a large bowl. Add the wet ingredients and mix together thoroughly. Fold in the coconut, if using. Spoon the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour. Remove the loaf from the pan and cool on a wire rack before slicing.

Brown the ground beef with the seasoning and drain off the fat. Mix the can of cream of celery soup with the can of water. Put half the meat mixture in the bottom of a greased 9x13 casserole dish. Top with a layer of mashed potatoes. Then add the rest of the meat mixture. Top with a layer of crescent rolls. Add the cream of celery soup mixture to the top. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees until the rolls are golden brown. Serve warm.

In a medium bowl, stir together the peanut butter and brown sugar until combined. Add the egg and stir until smooth. Stir in the vanilla and baking soda. Fold in the miniature chocolate chips. Drop the dough by the teaspoon onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing the cookies 2 inches apart. Bake until puffed and golden, about 12 minutes. Transfer the cookies to a wire rack to cool.
