This is the recipe that I use for my cookies!

Cook the pasta according to the package directions. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Saute the chicken with the onions and green peppers. When the chicken is no longer pink inside, add the tomatoes. Continue cooking until the tomatoes begin to soften. Stir in the salsa con queso. Add the milk. Continue cooking until the mixture begins to thicken. Remove the mixture from heat and stir in the cooked pasta. Pour the mixture into a 9 x 13 baking dish and sprinkle with the grated cheese. Bake for about 20 to 25 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. In a bowl combine butter, salt and pepper. Add the potatoes and toss until coated with butter. Place potatoes in a single layer on a shallow baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until browned. Sprinkle with cheese and bacon just before serving. Garnish with scallions.

Preheat oven to 350. In a shallow bowl, blend together bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, parsley, salt, and pepper. In a small saucepan, heat butter and garlic over very low heat until butter melts. Remove from heat. Brush chicken pieces with garlic butter, then roll in bread crumb mixture to coat. Place chicken skin side up on a large foil-lined baking sheet. Mix together any remaining crumb mixture and butter and sprinkle over chicken. Place in oven and bake 1 hour.

Put the butter, golden syrup and condensed milk in a heavy bottom pan, cook over a low heat until it reaches 118f on a thermometer. Remove the pan from the heat and add the vanilla extract. Stir in the sugar, beat until glossy. Pour into a baking tray lined with greaseproof paper, smooth with the back of a spoon. Leave in the fridge until set, then cut into squares with a sharp knife. Store in an air tight container at room temperature for up to one week or in the fridge for up to two weeks.

Peel and slice the potatoes very thin, about 1/4 inch thick. Place the sliced potatoes in a bowl with the sour cream and ranch dressing. Mix thoroughly and let sit for a few minutes for the flavors to blend together. Add butter, salt and pepper to taste. Mash the mixture thoroughly. Serve immediately.

Boil 4 cups of corn in salted water until tender but still has some crunch. Drain well and let cool slightly. Combine the corn with 2 cups of chopped tomatoes and 1/4 cup chopped onion in a bowl. Add 3 tablespoons of olive oil, 1 teaspoon of vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper to taste. Stir well, cover and refrigerate for at least an hour before serving. Serve cold. You can add 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil right before serving to make it even more summery.

Cut the chicken breasts into cubes. Mix soup and sour cream in a medium bowl. Add the cubed chicken and mix well. Spray a medium baking dish with pam cooking spray. Place half the chicken mixture in the dish, then half the chilies, peppers and corn chips. Top with the rest of the chicken mixture, then the rest of the corn chips, then the rest of the peppers and the rest of the chilies. Sprinkle with cheese, bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until bubbly.

Boil radish in water. Drain radish and cut into cubes. Cook penne in water until almost al dente. Drain and mix with radish. Heat olive oil over medium-high heat in a large pan. Add onion and garlic. Cook for a minute. Add radish/pasta mixture. Cook for one more minute. Sprinkle with parmesan.

Preheat the oven to 400. In a deep dish combine the flour, baking powder, water and egg. Stir until smooth. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Dip the fillets in the batter. Sear the fish until brown, about 3 minutes per side. Place the fish on baking sheets. Bake until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork, about 10 minutes. Serve the puffs with the lemon wedge, chili sauce and salt.

Cook the chorizo sausage with the onion in a large non stick skillet over medium heat until it is browned and the liquid has evaporated. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F. In a medium bowl combine the eggs, milk and pepper and salt and beat well with an electric mixer for 1 minute or until light and fluffy. Melt the cheese in the microwave for about 1 minute or until melted and smooth, stirring frequently. Spoon the cheese mixture evenly over the bottom half of each tortilla and sprinkle with the hot pepper sauce. Top with the eggs and some of the salsa. Fold the top half of the tortilla over the filling and place in the ungreased muffin cups. Bake for 20 minutes or until the shells are golden brown and the eggs are firm. Serve warm.

Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and green peppersaute until tender. Add the garlicstir for 1 minute. Stir in the pearl barley, broth, and season with salt and pepper. Coverbring to a boil. Reduce the heat to lowsimmer for 30 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Cook the hamburger. Drain off fat. Add onion and seasoning. Mix well. Cook until well done. Break up the noodles. Add the veggies. Mix well. Add the hamburger mixture. Mix well. Heat to boiling. Serve.

Remove outer leaves from cauliflower and cut into flowerets and place in large bowl. Beat egg yolks with cream until thick and add remaining ingredients, except cauliflower and butter. Pour over cauliflower and mix well. Spoon into a shallow pan and sprinkle top with bread crumbs and dot with bits of butter. Bake at 350f for about 25-30 minutes or til top is brown and crisp. Serves about 6.

Cook the pasta in a large pot of salted boiling water according to package directions. Drain the pasta. In a large bowl, toss the pasta with the oil and the ham. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a serving platter. Garnish with the asparagus and the parsley. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Add hot water and vanilla extract. Stir in the flour mixture. Stir in the chocolate chips. Cover and refrigerate for about an hour or so, or until it's easier to handle. Heat the oven to 400f and grease your cookie sheets. Drop the dough with a 1/4 cup measuring cup onto the sheets. Bake for about 12 minutes or until golden brown on the edges and the middle is still soft. These freeze well. You can store them in an airtight container for about a month in the fridge or freezer.

Sift together the flour, baking powder and baking soda. In a large bowl combine the granulated sugar, milk and the canola oil. Add the dry mixture and stir gently. Add the egg and mix well. Stir in the marshmallows. Fold in chocolate chips. Spoon batter into greased muffin cups. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes and remove to wire rack. Makes 12.

Pound each chicken breast half to a 1/2-inch thickness. In a shallow bowl or plate combine the hot sauce and vinegar. Heat the margarine in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Dip each chicken breast in the hot sauce mixture and place in the skillet. Cook until lightly browned on both sides. Place in a 9-inch x 13-inch baking dish. Combine the remaining ingredients and spoon over the chicken. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.

Crumble vanilla wafers into a bowl and set aside. In a large bowl beat together butter and sugar until blended. Add the egg white and beat until light and fluffy. Add the cream cheese and beat until blended. Add the coffee liqueur and beat until blended. Stir in the crumbled vanilla wafers and beat just until combined. Drop tablespoon-size dollops onto a baking sheet coated with cooking spray and bake for 18 minutes or until puffed and golden brown. Let cool on the pan for 1 hour before removing to a rack to cool completely. Serve with coffee.
Combine all in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Taste and adjust with more salt and pepper if necessary. Use as a dip or a sauce.

In a large saucepan saute butter with onions, carrots, celery ribs, potato and turnips until softened. Add chicken stock, bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Blend well or process in blender or food processor. Add the garlic and cook for another minute or two. Add honey and bring to a simmer again for a few minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Wash and rinse rice. Bring to a boil with 3 cups of water. Simmer for 25 minutes or until tender. Drain. Set aside. Brown 3 slices of cubed ham. Drain and add to cooked rice. Add 1 can of chopped tomatoes. Add 3 stalks of celery and 1 chopped green pepper. Add 1/4 teaspoon of garlic powder. Add 1/2 teaspoon of ground black pepper and 1 teaspoon of salt. Pour into a greased casserole dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly.
I always add a little cinnamon to my Spanish rice. Makes it that much better.
I usually add the spices and seasonings at the beginning with the sauteed onions and peppers.
I always use leftover rotisserie or deli turkey in my spanish rice.
I always add a little cinnamon and cumin to my Spanish rice. I also brown the meat and vegetables to get that great brown flavor

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 13"x9" pan with cooking spray. Lay turkey bacon in pan and cook until crispy. Cut the bacon into 1" strips and set aside. Cut the bread into 1" cubes and place in pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Toss the cubes with the turkey bacon strips and sprinkle with the tomato. Drizzle the bread cubes with the mayonnaise. Bake for 5 minutes longer. Serve warm.

Combine meat, sausage, cheese and spices and mix well. Put into a baking dish and bake at 375 until brown and bubbly. Melt Velveeta cheese and pour over top of meat loaf and return to oven until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve with mashed potatoes and gravy.

Bring a medium saucepan of water to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the zucchini and carrots. Cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Drain the vegetables and cool.In a large bowl, whisk together the oil, garlic, lemon juice, salt, pepper and basil. Toss with the vegetables. Sprinkle with the chives.
name: carrots zucchini and basil
ingredients: zucchini, carrots, scallions, extra virgin olive oil, water, garlic, salt & freshly ground black pepper, lemon juice, fresh basil leaves, chives
preparation: Bring a medium saucepan of water to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the zucchini and carrots. Cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Drain the vegetables and cool. In a large bowl, whisk together the oil, garlic, lemon juice, salt, pepper and basil. Toss with the vegetables. Sprinkle with the chives.
name: sauteed z

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees f. Coat a large baking sheet with cooking spray. Place tomatoes and onion on the prepared sheet. Drizzle with 2 tbsp of the oil, 1 tbsp of the garlic and the chilies. Season with salt and pepper. Toss well to coat and spread in a single layer. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool slightly. Reserve 1/2 cup of the tomatoes for the garnish. Cut the remaining tomatoes in half and squeeze out the seeds into a colander set over a bowl. Chop the tomatoes. Combine the tomatoes with the rind, the remaining oil, and the remaining garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to blend. Lay the fish in 1 layer in the prepared baking dish. Drizzle with the tomato mixture. Sprinkle with the basil and the reserved tomato pieces. Bake for 12 minutes. Serve immediately.
Slice apples thin and place in bottom of a 4-5 quart crock pot. Lay polish sausages over apples. Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Pour over all in pot. Cover and cook on low 6 hours.

In a large mixing bowl, stir together the first 4 ingredients. Microwave for 3 minutes. Remove from microwave. Add oats and peanut butter. Stir until well blended. Drop by teaspoonfuls on wax paper. Cool.

Prepare honey marinade in a saucepan. Add the garlic cloves to the marinade. Cook over medium heat until the garlic is tender, 15-20 minutes. Remove the garlic from the honey. Serve with the sauce drizzled over the garlic.

Melt the butter in a large heavy skillet over low heatstir in the sugar, and cook until the mixture is amber brown. Remove from the heat, add the lemon juice and vanilla, stirring well. Let cool to room temperature while you prepare the filling. In a large bowl, beat the eggs until they are well blended. Add the cooled syrup mixture to the eggs and beat until well blended. Pour the filling into the pie shell. Sprinkle the pecans on top, making sure that they are distributed evenly all around the edge of the shell. Bake in a preheated 325f oven for about 1 hour, or until the filling is set. Cool on a rack.
This was a very easy to make recipe with very good results! I didn't use the whole recipe for the topping. I only made about half of it for a 9 inch pie shell. I also used more sugar in the topping because I like it sweet! The filling was very tasty! I will make this again!
This was a very easy to make recipe with very good results! I didn't use the

Wash and clean the shrimp. Sprinkle with flour and salt and pepper on both sides. Heat the vegetable oil in a large pan and cook the shrimp 2-3 minutes on each side or until opaque. Pour the wine into the pan and continue cooking until the liquid evaporates. Remove the shrimp from the pan and keep them warm while you prepare the sauce. In the same pan, heat the butter until melted and add the lemon juice and parsley. Taste for seasoning and serve with the shrimp and pasta or rice of choice.

Measure all ingredients into bread machine pan, in order that they are listed. Set machine for dough cycle and start. At end of dough cycle, remove dough to lightly floured surface and shape into loaf. Place in greased loaf pan, cover and let rise until bread is 1 to 2 inches above edges of pan. Be patient, sourdough without the addition of commercial yeast can take up to several hours to rise. Bake at 375 degrees f for 40 to 50 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on wire rack. Top can be brushed with butter for a soft crust, if desired. This is what develops the characteristic sour flavor and the longer the proof, the sourer it will be. If you start with 1 cup of starter and feed it 1 cup each of water and flour, you should have enough to make your bread and save the rest to start your next batch.

In a large bowl, beat together ricotta cheese, sugar, and eggs until well blended. Stir in vanilla. Combine pudding mix and milk in small bowl until smooth. Stir into ricotta mixture until well blended. Pour batter into 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 25 minutes, or until set in the center. Cool cake in pan on wire rack for 10 minutes, then remove from pan. Spread top of cake with non-dairy topping. Cut into squares and serve.

Thaw 2 egg roll wraps according to package directions. Meanwhile, cook the mashed potatoes according to package directionsstir in the ricotta cheese. Let cool for 5 minutes. Spread a little mashed potato mixture on 1 egg roll wraptop with 1/4 cup chives, a few chives, a few tablespoons of ricotta mixture, and a few chives. Roll up tightly. Repeat the layers for the remaining wraps. In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil over medium-high heat until hot. Add 3 egg rollscook 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Remove from pankeep warm. Repeat the cooking procedure with the remaining egg rolls. Serve warm. Serving suggestion:Spoon on sour cream and sprinkle with parsley. Makes 8 servings.

Mix cornflour and dark soya in bowl. Heat stock and add cornflour mixture. Cook until thickened. Add bok choy. Stir in sweet chili sauce. Cut steaks into bite-size pieces and add to pan. Add onion. Cook until hot. Serve with plain or fried rice.

Combine first 8 ingredients in a small bowl. Set aside. Pull husks back from corn, and scrub silks. Brush butter over corn. Sprinkle with spice mixture. Place corn on grill rack. Grill 12 minutes or until done, turning occasionally.

In a glass or ceramic bowl or pan mix all of the above ingredients except the chicken. Add the chicken to the bowl or pan. Cover the bowl or pan with plastic wrap or foil. Marinate in refrigerator overnight.

To cook the peas, bring the water to a boil. Add the peas. Cook for 2 minutes then drain in a colander. Set aside. Pre-heat the oven to 450°F. To make the fritters, combine the first six ingredients in a large bowl. Add the drained peas. Season with salt and pepper. Lightly dust the surface of your work area with flour. Take one handful of the mixture in your hand. Squeeze together to form a ball. Dip into flour then tap off the excess. Place onto a baking sheet. Repeat with remaining mixture. Place in the oven for about 15 minutes or until golden. Serve hot.
name: halloumi and corn casserole
ingredients: butter, light cream, cream cheese, halloumi cheese, sweetcorn, green onions, flat leaf parsley, garlic clove, nutmeg
preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Spread the butter over the bottom and sides of a casserole dish. Warm

Preheat oven to 375°F. In a small bowl, combine cream cheese, sour cream and garlic. Set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, sauté chicken in oil for about five minutes or until no longer pink in the center. Add sour cream mixture and heat for 1 minute. Stir in mushroom, tomato and onionscook for 2 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley and salt and pepper, if desired. Roll out the pizza dough into a 13-inch circle and place onto a baking sheet sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Top with mozzarella and chicken mixture. Bake for about 18 minutes or until the cheese is bubbly and the edges of the pizza are browned. Serve warm with a side salad.
pizza crusts, butter, ground chicken, garlic powder, salsa, monterey jack cheese
Heat oven to 450f. Place pizza crust onto ungreased baking sheet.
Melt butter

Grate and squeeze the lemon and orange into a big mixing bowl. Stir in the honey and ginger, and pour into a big jug. Add cinnamon and cloves and mix well. Pour into glasses and serve with ice and slices of lemon and orange. Add water if you like it diluted.

Heat a frying pan over medium heat and add oil. When the oil is hot add the curry powder and stir fry for about a minute or until fragrant. Add the sliced onion and saute for another minute or until softened and transparent. Add the sliced brussels sprouts and saute for about a minute or until they soften and turn translucent. Season with salt and serve.

Combine mandarin oranges, pineapple, lemon juice, jalapeno and salt in a large bowl. Cover and refrigerate. To make the marinade, combine oil and peppers in a small bowl. Set aside. Pound the chicken to a 1/2 inch thickness. Place the chicken in a large resealable plastic bag. Add the marinade to the bag, seal and turn to coat. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Thread the chicken on skewers. Grill over medium heat for 3 minutes per side or until no longer pink in the center. Serve the chicken with the mandarin orange mixture.

Place the chicken legs and ranch dressing into a ziploc bag and seal. Gently shake to coat. Let the chicken marinate for 3 hours or overnight. Remove the chicken from the ranch dressing mixture and place on a cooking sprayed broiler pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and gently pour the salsa over the top of the chicken legs and sprinkle on the cheese. Return to the oven for 2 to 3 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve over rice and top with sour cream.

Put a slice of bread in a bowl. Crush it with a rolling pin or a potato masher. Pour in juice and a little hot water. Add a bit more hot water and stir until it is a smooth puree. Stir in yoghurt and refrigerate until cold. Melt dark chocolate and pour over bread mixture. Spoon into 4 glasses and chill. When ready to serve, spoon some cold whipped cream into each glass and top with a dollop of yoghurt. Garnish with a raspberry and a bit of chocolate.

In a saucepan, combine orange rind and dried cranberries and enough water to cover. Simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in green beans and cook until crisp-tender. Drain and set aside. Heat butter in saucepan over medium-high heat. Add honey and cranberry mixture and heat through. Add bacon bits and stir well. Serve with green beans.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions. Cook and stir 3 minutes or until onions are tender. Add chicken and next 6 ingredients (through sour cream). Cook 5 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 24 standard muffin cups or line with paper baking cups.In a large bowl, combine the yellow cake mix and the pumpkin puree. Add the Egg Beaters, agave nectar, cinnamon, and saltbeat until smooth.Stir in the water and oil and beat until smooth.Spoon batter into muffin cups and bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool cupcakes for 5 minutes in the pans on a wire rack, then remove and cool completely on the wire rack.Makes 24 cupcakes.

Peel 1 large jalapeno pepper and 1 large green bell pepper and remove all seeds and membranes. Cut peppers into fine dice and place in blender. Cover and blend on low speed until finely chopped. Add 2 cups of fresh cider vinegar and 2 cups of granulated sugar and blend until smooth. Add 1/8 teaspoon of ground cayenne pepper and 1 package of liquid fruit pectin and blend until thoroughly mixed. Pour into hot 8-cup jars and process in water bath for 5 minutes. Makes 8 1/2-pint jars.

Cook shrimp until pink. Let cool and cut into bite sized pieces. In a bowl mix together mayonaise, ketchup, garlic salt, worcestershire sauce and old bay seasoning. Add shrimp and bell peppers. Serve on lettuce.

In a large bowl combine the cornstarch with the sugar and salt. Add the pineapple, oranges, eggs, butter, and vanilla. Mix well. Pour into a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Bake in a preheated 350F oven for about 20 minutes, until set. Cool slightly. Stir in the Cool Whip. Sprinkle with coconut. Serve immediately. Serves 10.

Preheat the oven to 350f. Mix the chicken, chilies, and salsa in a small bowl. Mix the salt and cream in a large shallow dish. Heat the oil in a frying pan over med-high. Fry the tortillas one at a time for a few seconds until they start to blister and turn soft. Immediately dip each one in the cream mixture. Put a large dollop of the chicken mixture on each tortilla and roll it up. Place it in a ungreased baking pan, flap side down. When all of the tortillas are done, pour the remaining cream over them and sprinkle the cheese over the top. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes or so, until they are thoroughly heated.
Cream margarine and peanut butter together. Add marshmallows and mix well. Add chocolate chips. Add vanilla and mix well. Add cereal and mix well. Put into bowls. Freeze.

Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Add the shrimp and stir to coat. Heat a wok or skillet over medium high heat. Add the shrimp mixture and cook for 5 to 6 minutes until the shrimp are cooked through. Stir in the green onions and cilantro and serve.

Heat a large saute pan over medium high heat. Add diced onion and cook until translucent. Add smoked sausage and cook until cooked through. Remove to a bowl and set aside. In the same pan, add a little more olive oil. Beat the eggs and milk together and pour into the pan. Add sour cream, salt and pepper. Pour the smoked sausage and onions back into the pan. Cook for a few minutes until just set. Sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese on top of the egg mixture. Cook for a few minutes more until the top is lightly golden brown. Remove from the heat and let cool for a few minutes. Cut into wedges. Serve with warm tortillas.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, heat milk until hot. Add cocoa. Cool to room temperature. In a medium-size bowl, cream butter. Gradually beat in cooled milk mixture until smooth. Gradually add confectioners' sugarbeat until smooth. Fold in melted chocolate. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or until slightly thickened. Frost your favorite cake. Makes about 2 cups.

Prepare the angel food cake according to package directions. Remove from oven. Cut the cake into cubes. Combine the prepared pudding with milk according to package directions. Let the mixture set for 15 minutes or until thickened. Chop the strawberries into small pieces. Drizzle the strawberries with red food coloring. Fold the strawberries into the pudding mixture. Stir in the cubed angel food cake. Chill the mixture for 1 hour. When ready to serve, layer the parfaits in a clear glass. First put a layer of pudding mixture followed by a layer of angel food cake, followed by a layer of strawberries and so on. Top with whipped cream. Sprinkle with strawberry halves.

Cook noodles as directed on package. Cook hamburger, season to taste. Add gravy mix to hamburger, cover & simmer until cooked through (about 15 minutes). Drain noodles & add to mixture, heat through & serve.

Rinse and pick over the cranberries to discard any bad ones. Combine the rest with the honey and sherry and simmer over low heat until the fruit has popped and the sauce has thickened slightly, about 10 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and let cool for a couple of minutes. Add the apricots and stir to combine. Remove and discard the apricot pits and transfer the fruit to a bowl or platter and let cool to room temperature. Serve with turkey, chicken or ham or with a variety of cheeses. You can also serve it with ice cream or pound cake for a great dessert. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week or freeze for up to six months.

In a medium bowl combine all wet ingredients. Stir in vanilla. In a separate bowl combine dry ingredients. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour wet mixture into the well. Mix just until dry and wet are combined. Do not over mix. Grease a 12 cup muffin pan or use paper liners. Fill the muffin cups with batter. Sprinkle with walnuts. Bake in a preheated 400 degree oven for 15 to 20 minutes. Makes 12 muffins.

Mix butter, salt and pepper together in bowl. Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add fish, and butter mixture. Cook tilapia until fish flakes easily with fork. Sprinkle with cheese. Top with green onions and basil.

To prepare the vegetables: Rinse the carrots and trim off the ends. Peel the onion and cut in half. Slice both halves into 1/4-inch slices and set aside. Grate the ginger into a small bowl. Add the lemon juice and let stand. To prepare the peanut sauce: Heat the oil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion slices and saute for 2 minutes. Stir in the curry powder and saute for 1 minute. Add the coconut milk and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the ginger mixture and peanuts and simmer for 1 minute. Season with the salt and pepper. Pour the sauce over the vegetables and serve. Serves 2.

Combine the water and milk in a small saucepan and place over a low heat. In a small bowl, combine the yeast and a little of the lukewarm milk and set aside for 10 minutes. In a large bowl, combine the flour and salt. Make a well in the center and pour in the yeast mixture and the egg yolk. Mix well and add the oil. Knead the dough for about 10 minutes and add the yeast mixture and the egg yolk. Mix well and add the oil. Knead the dough for about 10 minutes. Add the water and milk mixture and mix well. Knead again for about 5 minutes. Add the apple and raisins. Knead for a further 5 minutes. Leave to rise for about 1 hour. Roll out the dough on a floured surface. Cut out rounds with a floured cutter and place on a baking sheet. Brush with the egg and sprinkle with the sugar. Bake in a preheated oven at 180 degrees C for 15-20 minutes or until cooked.

Place all but the chicken in a blender and puree. Add the water and puree again. Heat the chicken and add the tomatoes and green onions. Add the pureed mixture to the pan and stir. Lower the heat. Bake in a casserole dish. Bake for 40 minutes. Serve.

Brown ground beef in a large skillet. Add the onions. Cook until the beef is no longer pinkdrain the fat. Add the soup, water, creamed-style corn and the cooked noodles. Bring the mixture to a boilcover and simmer for about ten minutes. Add the mushrooms and black olivesstir well. Remove from heat. Pour the mixture into a 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle the cheddar cheese evenly over the top. Bake at 375 for about twenty minutes. Uncover and sprinkle the cheddar cheese evenly over the top. Bake for about ten minutes longer until the cheese is melted.

Saute onion and butter in large skillet until tender. Add soup and milkcook over low heat until hot. Add rice and cook until tender. Add broccolitoss to combine. Remove from heatadd cheese. Mix well. Pour into 2 quart casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until heated through. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serves 6.

In a saucepan, saute cabbage and onion in butter until tender. Stir in flour. Add milk and cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in beaten egg until smooth. Add salt and pepper. Stuff into shells. Bake at 400f for 10 minutes. Garnish with parsley.

Heat corn oil in a skillet over high heat until it sizzles when you put a small piece of meat in it. Put 1-1/2 pounds of boneless pork chops or steak into the skillet and saute for 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until they are cooked through. Remove meat from pan and place on paper towels to drain fat. Place cooked meat in a 2-quart casserole. To make the sauce, add lemon juice, water, and tabasco sauce to the skillet in which you cooked the meat and cook on low heat until the liquid is reduced and a thick syrup is formed. Pour syrup over the meat and serve.
I have been wanting to make this for a while and I finally got around to it and it was very good. I used 3 cans of diced tomatoes and 1 can of tomato paste and it was very thick and it did not seem like it would cook down much more. I will probably try it again with only 1 can of diced tomatoes and 1 can of paste next time to see if it makes it thinner and cooks

In a fry pan melt the butter. Add the brown sugar, and stir until it begins to boil. Remove from heat. Stir in the eggs. Return to heat and cook for one minute. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla and nuts. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto wax paper to cool. Melt the chocolate and drizzle over the top. Roll the balls in the coconut and roll again in the cherries.

Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the shallots and cook for 3 minutes or until soft. Add the ground turmeric, cumin and coriander and cook for 1 minute. Add the coconut milk and the water and bring to the boil. Stir in the rice and cook for 5 minutes or until the rice is tender. Add the cinnamon stick and the lime leaves. Stir for 1 minute or until aromatic. Serve with the lime leaves.
name: spiced lemon riceingredients: vegetable oil, mustard seeds, ground turmeric, onion, garlic cloves, chilies, long-grain white rice, fresh lemon juice, kosher salt, roasted cashewspreparation:Heat oil in a large heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and turmeric and cook, shaking pan, until mustard seeds pop, 1-2 minutes. Add onion, garlic, and chile and cook, stirring occasionally, until onion is translucent, about 7

Season the chicken breast halves with coarse salt and freshly ground pepper. In a shallow bowl or plate, combine the flour with the 1/4 cup water. Working 1 piece at a time, dredge the chicken breasts in the flour mixture until well coated. Place the wok over medium-high heat and add the wok oil. Cook the dredged chicken breasts until golden and cooked through. Remove the chicken from the wok and set aside. In the same wok over medium heat, whisk together the vinegar and chicken stock until the mixture is smooth. Add the lemon curd and whisk until the curd is melted and well incorporated into the sauce. Return the chicken breasts to the wok and toss to coat with the sauce. Garnish with scallions. Serve hot with steamed jasmine rice and steamed broccoli. Makes 4 servings.

Bring barley and 2 cups water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Reduce heat to low and simmer until barley is tender, about 40-45 minutes. Drain excess liquid. In a small bowl, combine olive oil and lime juice. Toss with barley to combine. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Chill for up to 2 days. Makes 6 servings.

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a bowl, stirring well. Add butter. Stir just until the dry ingredients are moistened. Shape dough into ball. Make a lengthwise slit into each date and stuff with a pecan half. Press a generous tablespoon of cheese mixture around each date, covering it completely. Cover and chill for 45 minutes. Place dates on a greased baking sheet and bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Remove to wire rack and cool. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Cheesecake with a gorgeous, golden, crunchy top? This recipe has a trick up its sleeve! The secret is a mixture of butter, sugar, and flour that is baked on top of the cheesecake batter. The top mixture is baked until it forms a crust on the top of the batter while the batter bakes in the oven.
Place 1/4 cup sugar in a small bowl. Dissolve cornstarch in waterstir into the sugar mixture. Set aside.
Combine the remaining sugar with the corn

Mix all except last three ingredients in bowl. Form into four patties and shape to fit in a 9 by 13 pan. Bake at 325 degrees for 30 minutes. Mix remaining three ingredients and pour over hamburgers and bake another 10 minutes or until done to desired degree of doneness.
Beat cream cheese until smooth. Add all remaining ingredients and mix well. Form into a ball and refrigerate for 24 hours or longer. Roll in nuts. Serve with crackers.

In an 8×8 pan spread the cream cheese in the bottom of the pan. Sprinkle with the jalapeno pepper, followed by the can of diced chili. Top with the green onions, then the can of diced green chilies. Sprinkle with the shredded cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until melted and bubbly. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with tortilla chips.
Boil the potatoes in water for 15 minutes. Drain them and cool. In a large bowl, combine the other ingredients. Add the potatoes. Mix well. Chill for one hour before serving.

Combine all ingredients except the peanuts and the cherries. Toss the nuts and cherries together and spread on a baking sheet. Bake for about an hour and a half until the nuts are a light brown color and slightly crisp. Cool and store in an airtight container.

Melt the butter in a pan. Add the cornstarch mixed with the water, stirring constantly for 1 minute or until thickened. Add the brown sugar and raisins. Cook 1 minute or until the sugar is melted. Add the bananas and cook 1 minute or until the bananas are just tender. Sprinkle with the lemon juice and serve immediately.
Slice oranges and strawberries. Peel and slice bananas. Place in bowl. Top with sour cream. Drizzle with honey and juice. Refrigerate. Serve chilled.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a large bowl, beating at medium speed until well blended (dough will be crumbly). Roll into 1-inch ballsplace 2 inches apart on waxed paper-lined baking sheets. Refrigerate 15 minutes or freeze 30 minutes (to prevent spreading). Roll in pecansplace on baking sheets. Refrigerate or freeze 15 minutes or until firm. Dip into melted chocolateplace on waxed paper. Refrigerate 5 minutes or until chocolate is set. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

Make crust as directed on box. Bake at 350 for 5 min. Cool. Whisk together milk and pudding in medium bowl. Fold in whipped topping until well blended. Spread over the bottom layer of the crust. Refrigerate at least 1 hour. Meanwhile, beat cream cheese and sugar in large bowl with mixer until blended. Stir in milk mixture and pour over top of pie. Refrigerate 1 hour or until set.

Heat the olive oil in a saucepan. Add the onion and saute over medium heat until tender. Add the chicken and brown on all sides. Add the cumin and saute for 30 seconds. Add the broth, orange juice, lemon juice, orange zest, capers and black pepper. Cover the pan and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Cook for 30 minutes or until the chicken is tender. Garnish with the parsley.
Chicken is one of the most popular meats in the world. It is a good source of protein and has many health benefits. There are many different ways to cook chicken. You can bake it, grill it, roast it, or fry it. You can also add herbs and spices to it to make it taste better. Chicken is a good meat to eat if you are trying to lose weight. It is a low-fat meat that has a lot of protein. This makes it a good choice for people who are trying to lose weight. You can also make a lot of different dishes with chicken. You can make a chicken sal

Heat grill. In a small bowl, combine the horseradish, soy sauce, garlic and sour cream. Mix to blend well. Salt and pepper to taste. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Oil the grill. Place the salmon on the oven rack. Spread the horseradish mixture on both sides. Bake 8-10 minutes. Remove from the oven. To serve, place a dollop of mayonnaise on each piece of fish. Sprinkle on basil. Garnish each piece with a small slice of lemon.

Cook bacon in skillet until crisp. Remove bacon and drain. Add onion and green pepper to drippings and saute for 2 minutes. Add can of tomatoes and 1 teaspoon of salt. Add 4 cups of the cooked rice and mix well. Add remaining 1 teaspoon of salt and sprinkle with the reserved crisp bacon. Makes 6 servings.
Cut out shapes from american cheese slices using cookie cutters. Arrange on white bread slices and top with swiss slices and ham. Grill or toast until browned. Makes 24 servings.

Wash and shred carrots in food processor. Add spinach and tomatoes. Toss together. In small bowl combine sour cream and cottage cheese. Add parsley and Tabasco sauce. Whisk until smooth. Toss dressing into vegetable mixture. Sprinkle with almonds and serve.

In a large salad bowl, combine the broccolini and the dressing. Toss gently until the broccolini is evenly coated with the dressing and serve immediately.
The following recipes were contributed by my favorite foodie friends and I would love to hear from you too!
Please share your favorite recipes by leaving a comment on this page or by joining my foodie community at www.facebook.com/myfoodiefriend .
If you enjoyed this page on my favorite recipes for broccoli, you may also enjoy one of these other foodie favorites!

Melt butter over low heat in a small saucepan. Add shallot and cook for 1 minute. Add beer, vinegar, lemon juice, hot sauce, parsley, cayenne and pepper. Continue to cook for 5 minutes. Serve over fish of any kind.

Cut eggplants crosswise into 1/2-inch slices. Place on baking sheet. Drizzle with marinara sauce. Top with basil leaves. Sprinkle with mozzarella. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes or until heated through. Makes 2 servings.
I love baking. I have been baking for more than 20 years and I've been blogging since March 2009. I love all kinds of desserts. I make cakes, cookies, cupcakes and tarts.
Award winning baker of all things sweet.
I have been cooking for a while but started blogging in January this year. I try different recipes from different blogs and websites and I love baking.
I am a wife of a wonderful husband, a mom of two cute boys. I love cooking for my family and friends. I love trying new recipes.
I love cooking and baking. I like to try new recipes. I love learning new things. I like taking pictures.

Sauté the onion in butter until softened. Add the mushrooms and stir to coat in the butter. Cook for 3 minutes then turn off the heat. Make the mashed potato mixture with the lemon juice. Season the filling mixture with the salt and pepper. Spread the filling mixture over the base of a greased pie dish. Cover the filling mixture with the sour cream. Sprinkle the grated cheese over the filling mixture. Bake in a preheated oven for 25 minutes at 350 degrees.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In large bowl, mix all ingredients. Divide into 4 equal portions. Shape each portion into a round loaf about 8 inches long. Press a crescent roll onto each end of each loaf. Bake on ungreased cookie sheet for about 35 minutes or until heated through. Serve with spaghetti sauce.

Bring a large pan of water to a boil. Add bay leaves, cumin seeds. Return to a boil. Add cabbage, and boil for 3 minutes. Add sugar, coconut milk, chili, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.

Cut each steak into thin strips. Place the meat, lemon juice and the garlic in a bowl and mix together. Cover and marinate overnight. Thread the meat strips onto skewers. Threading onto skewers is best done using 4 toothpicks stuck into each end of each strip of meat. Heat a grill or barbecue to medium heat and cook the meat strips until cooked to your liking. Turn often for even cooking.

Cream together the peanut butter and sugars. Beat in the egg and vanilla. Combine the dry ingredients and stir into the wet ingredients to form a dough. Stir in the chocolate chips. Scoop up about 1 tablespoon of dough and shape into a ball with your hands. Place the ball on a greased or parchment lined baking sheet. Press a small indentation in the middle of each ball with your thumb. Fill the indentation with peanut butter and then press the dough back together. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.
The Ultimate Cookie Recipes eBook is available now!
This eBook has all 13 of the Ultimate Cookie Recipes that you have been loving here on the blog. Plus I included 8 bonus cookies! That is a total of 21 cookie recipes!
I wanted to make it as easy as possible for you to find and make these cookies! So I included the ingredients and directions for every single one of these cookies in this eBook

Cut chicken into bite sized pieces. In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, brown the chicken in the oil, stirring often. Add garlic, salsa, seasonings and water. Heat to boiling. Add corn. Cook over medium heat until the liquid is absorbed. Stir in beans. Cook just until heated through. Serve with shredded cheese.

Heat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking pan with nonstick spray or line with parchment paper and spray paper with nonstick spray. Combine butter, lemon zest and juice in a large bowl. Add granulated sugar and continue to whisk until mixture is light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time and whisk until thoroughly combined. Add flour and lemon juice and mix until just combined. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for about 35 minutes or until set and browned at the edges. Remove from oven and allow to cool completely. Dust with icing sugar before cutting into squares. Serves about 15-20.

Prepare grill. Combine olives, lime juice and garlic in a small bowl. Grill chicken 5 minutes per side or until done. Brush chicken with half of the olives mixture during the last 2 minutes of grilling. Remove from grill and cut into strips. Combine remaining olives mixture, oregano and cumin in a small bowl. Add chicken and toss to coat. Spoon about 1/2 cup chicken mixture onto each flour tortilla. Serve with salsa, if desired.
In a small saucepan heat the butter. Add the honey and simmer for 2 minutes. Add the frozen peas and simmer for another minute. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425. Layer pepperoni, onion and swiss in bottom of pie shell. Sprinkle mozzarella over top. Beat eggs with milk, salt, oregano and garlic powder. Pour over mozzarella. Bake for 1 hour until knife inserted in center comes out clean.

Heat oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add squash and onion and saute about 8 minutes or until crisp-tender. Stir in jalapeno and saute an additional minute. Add tomatoes and saute 2-3 minutes or until tomatoes are hot. Stir in corn and heat through. Season with salt and pepper to taste and top with cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve over rice or hot cooked pasta or potatoes or over a bed of lettuce or by itself.

In a medium bowl mix together dry ingredients (flour through baking soda). In a separate medium bowl mix together butter, milk and vanilla. Add wet ingredients to dry and mix until just blended. Fold in the applesauce and mix gently. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until hot. Add a small amount of oil (I use olive oil) and wipe around the edges of the skillet. Pour about a quarter cup of batter into the skillet and spread into a pancake shape. Flip when the bottom side is slightly golden brown and the top side is slightly bubbly. Serve with maple syrup, if desired. Makes 8 pancakes.

Bring chicken broth to a boil. Add green beans and simmer until crisp tender. Drain well and set aside. Combine oil and sesame seeds in a small bowl. Toss beans with oil mixture. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Add the leeks and saute for 2 minutes or until tender. Add the oranges to the pan and saute for 1 minute or until lightly browned. Add the ketchup, brown sugar, soy sauce, and peanuts. Heat until hot. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350. Place oil into a large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the chops on both sides. Remove from pan. Add the onion and celery to the skillet. Cook until tender. In a medium bowl, combine the soup and milk. In another bowl, combine the eggs and pepper. Add the poultry seasoning to the egg mixture. Add the chops to the skillet and cover. Cook on low heat for 30 minutes. Remove from heat. Place one biscuit over each chop and cover the pan. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown and chops are cooked through. Remove from pan. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Spray a 2.5 quart baking dish with cooking spray. Melt 2 tablespoons oil in a large saute pan. Add the onion, celery, carrot, and garlic. Saute until the vegetables are tender. Add the pecans, and cook until toasted. Add the rice. Add the beef broth and the chicken broth. Add the mushrooms. Stir gently until combined. Pour into the baking dish. Sprinkle with the parsley. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes.

Mix dry ingredients together in a bowl. Add the egg and mix thoroughly with a fork. Add the milk to thin the batter to the desired consistency. Add cinnamon to taste. Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat. Drop the batter into the skillet by the tablespoonful. Brown on both sides to make a very thin pancake. Serve with jam, honey or maple syrup.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).In a large baking dish combine the potatoes and onion. Sprinkle with the rosemary and oregano. Add the garlic and chicken stock. Season with the salt and pepper. Place the chicken on top of the potato mixture. Drizzle the lemon juice over the chicken. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven. Sprinkle the cherry tomatoes around the edges of the baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes longer or until the chicken is no longer pink in the center and the potato mixture is tender. Serve hot.

Cook quinoa according to pack instructions. When done, allow to cool for 10 mins. Mix quinoa, tomato, lemon zest and mint and allow to infuse for 30 mins. Mix through remaining ingredients. Serve as a side dish.
1. In a bowl mix together flour and pepper. Dip fish pieces into mixture then fry fish pieces until golden brown.
2. In another bowl mix together creamy peanut butter and cranberry jelly.
3. Place fish pieces on a plate. Drizzle some of the peanut butter/cranberry jelly mixture over fish pieces.
4. Serve fish pieces topped with more of the peanut butter/cranberry jelly mixture.
1. Mix together garlic salt and pepper. Dip fish pieces into mixture then fry fish pieces until golden brown.
2. Place fish pieces on a plate. Drizzle some of the peanut butter/cranberry jelly mixture over fish pieces.
3. Serve fish pieces topped with more of the peanut butter/cran

Preheat your pressure cooker. Rinse the ribs under cold water. Pat them dry with a paper towel. Place the ribs in the pot. Add the prepared mustard, paprika, salt, pepper and the beer. Lock the lid in place. Cook on high for 45 minutes. Unlock the lid. Transfer the ribs to a serving platter. Pour the liquid from the pot into a small saucepan. Cook over low heat until reduced by half. Stir in the onions. Serve the sauce over the ribs.
In a large skillet heat oil. Add onion and saute 2-3 minutes or until tender crisp. Add remaining ingredients and saute over medium-high heat until hot. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

Sauté onions and bell peppers in olive oil until softened. Add garlic and saute until fragrant. Add the tomatoes and saute until tender. Season with basil and black pepper. Add the basted eggs and simmer until the egg whites are set but yolks are still runny. Garnish with basil and serve with bread.

In a medium bowl, combine the feta cheese with the kalamata olivesmix well. Place the ground beef into a large bowl or food processor, add the dried oregano, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper. Mix or pulse until combined. Form the mixture into 4 patties. Heat 1 teaspoon of the olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the burgers and cook for 3 to 4 minutes per side or until done to your liking. Transfer the burgers to buns and top with the feta mixture and tzatziki sauce. Serve immediately.

Mix crumbs & sugar together. Melt margarine & add to crumbs & sugar. Press mixture into a 9x13 pan. Bake for 10 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool. Beat pineapple & juice together. Add mini-marshmallows to mixture & fold in cool whip. Spread over crust. Refrigerate for 2 hours to set before cutting.

Melt butter in a pot over medium-high heat. Add white wine. Add 1/4 cup of water. Add the parsley. Add the pepper sauce. Add the clams. Steam for 10 to 15 minutes or until they have opened up. Serve with a lemon wedge.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line baking sheet with waxed paper. Cut baked potatoes into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Toss with oil, onion, green bell pepper, garlic powder, paprika, salt, black pepper. Spread onto baking sheet. Bake 30 minutes or until crisp and brown.

In a food processor combine all the pudding ingredients except the avocado. Puree the mixture until smooth. Add the avocado and puree again. Transfer the mixture into 4 small ramekins. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve. Can be refrigerated up to 3 days.

In a medium saucepan over medium-low heat combine milk, peanut butter and milk chocolate chips until smooth, about 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Remove from heat. Stir in marshmallow creme until smooth. Pour into fondue pot or small serving bowl. Serve with graham cracker crumbs, granny smith apples, strawberries, and/or bananas for dipping. For extra crunch top with crushed peanuts or chopped nuts. Serves 4-6.
If you have more time than money you can make this recipe with regular milk chocolate chips and it will taste just as delicious!
Combine all ingredients in large bowl, mixing well. Using no-stick cooking spray, lightly grease 13x9 pan and then spread mixture evenly into pan. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool completely before cutting into squares. Important to cool completely so it sets up firmly before cutting.
Place pound cake slices on a baking sheet. I line the sheet with fo

Preheat oven to 375. Lightly grease or line 12 muffin cups. In a large bowl combine the flour, cinnamon and baking powder. In a small bowl combine the oatmeal and brown sugar. Add the milk and stir until smooth. Add the egg whites and mix well. Add the dry ingredients and mix just until blended. Stir in the fruit and the yogurt. Spoon into prepared cups. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan for 5 minutes before removing. Makes 12 muffins.

Spray a casserole dish with cooking oil, saute fresh mushrooms in the oil for about 5 minutes until tender. Remove from heat and add the eggs, and stir in the mayonnaise, set aside while you prepare the rest of the ingredients. In a large bowl combine the chicken flavor stuffing mix with the milk, stir until it is the consistency you like for your stuffing. Spread the mixture into your casserole dish. Then spread the sauteed mushrooms on top. Sprinkle the onions on top of the mushrooms. Top with tomatoes and finally the cheese. Cover with foil and bake at 350f for about an hour. Uncover the last 10 minutes or so to get the cheese nice and brown.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large saucepan or dutch oven, combine sweet potatoes, water, butter, brown sugar and spices. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Bake for about 1 hour. Cool 5 minutes. Mash sweet potatoes with cream, salt and vanilla. Serve warm. Serves 8.

Slice the peppers lengthwise and remove the seeds. In a large bowl add the tomatoes and the bay leaves. Add the peppers and toss. Add the garlic and cook over low heat for about 3 minutes. Add the onions and cook for 5 minutes. Add the olives and season with the salt and pepper. Cook for another 20 minutes. Cool and serve at room temperature.

Boil potatoes until tender. Mash potatoes with a potato masher. Add butter to mashed potatoes. Cut eggs in half and remove yolks. Mash yolks with fork. Add sour cream, lemon juice, dill and mustard to yolks. Add smoked salmon. Fill egg whites. Garnish with dill. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
Combine all the ingredients in a bowl. Blend until smooth. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease bottom only of 8-inch square panline sides with foil. In large bowl, beat cake crumbs with potato starch and eggs until smooth and thick. Stir in sugar, orange zest, lemon zest, orange juice, and vanilla extract until well blended. Fold in walnuts. Spoon into prepared panspread evenly. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan on wire rack 2 minutesremove from pancool completely on rack. Sift powdered sugar over topspread evenly. Makes 8 servings

Place two slices of bread butter side down in a skillet. Top each with one slice of turkey breast and one slice of cheese. Melt a pat of butter over each sandwich. When the bottoms are golden brown, flip the sandwiches over to toast the other side. Cut each half into 2 triangles to make 8 pieces.

Place 1 cup wild rice in a 1 quart saucepan. Cover with 2 1/2 cups cold water. Bring to a boil. Cover tightly with a lid. Simmer for 35 to 45 minutes. Drain off excess water. Add 2 cups water. Stir. Add 1/4 teaspoon salt. Cover tightly. Cook 20 minutes or until all water is absorbed. Fluff with a fork. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet. Cook onions in butter until tender. Add mushrooms. Cook 2 to 3 minutes. Add remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Cook 10 to 15 minutes or until all water is absorbed. Stir in wild rice. Pour into a greased 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

In a medium bowl combine the quinoa and rice flour. Mix in the honey, brown sugar and peanut butter. Beat well. Stir in vanilla. In a separate bowl combine the margarine and the baking soda. Add to quinoa mixture. Stir in the nuts. Chill for at least 2 hours. Drop by teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake in a preheated oven at 350f for 8 minutes or until light golden brown. Let cool on the cookie sheets for a minute or two and then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.

Clean the shrimp. Saute the garlic in the butter. Add the shrimp and cook until they turn pink. Add the lemon juice, season to taste and remove from the heat. Sprinkle the shrimp with the crumbled feta cheese. Stir in the cream and serve immediately. Sprinkle with green onions.

In a small sauce pan over medium heat, melt butter. Add garlic, stirring constantly. Add water, cover and bring to a boil. Cook until onion is tender. Add heavy cream, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Add fresh cilantro and stir until combined.

Cook bacon in skillet. Drain the bacon. Cube the bacon and put in a small bowl. Chop the green onions. Mix the catalina dressing with the cubed bacon and chopped green onions. Spread the mixture over the chicken. Top the chicken with the monterey jack cheese. Bake for 10 minutes in a 350 degree oven. Let it sit for a few minutes. Serve the chicken in a small bun.

Combine spinach and strawberries. Stir in poppy seed dressing. Divide among 4 plates. Arrange goat cheese and french bread on plates. Top each with a spoonful of salad mixture and a handful of almonds. Drizzle remaining dressing over all and sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.

Mix shortening, brown sugar and white sugar. Add in eggs and vanilla. Sift in all dry ingredients except the graham flour. Add in graham flour and mix well. Add the milk and mix well. Pour into a greased 13x9-inch pan. Bake at 350f for 25 to 30 minutes. Cool for a few minutes before cutting. Makes 2 dozen.

Line 2 pie pans with pastry, or use ready made pastry shells. Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water. Add lemon juice, stir until dissolved. Add crushed pineapple to mixture. Refrigerate until firm. Remove from refrigerator, fold in Cool Whip and maraschino cherries. Spread filling into pastry shells. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving. Makes 2 pies.

Preheat oven to 375°F. Place chicken in 9x13-inch baking dishset aside. In a small bowl, combine dressing, worcestershire sauce, and spicy mustardmix well. Pour dressing mixture over chickentoss to coat. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes or until tender and glaze is bubbly. Serve with celery sticks or blue cheese dressing if desired.

Combine crushed pineapple, brown sugar and lime juice. Toss together. In a small bowl combine mustard and soy sauce. Brush this mixture over both sides of the chicken breast. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Serve over rice.

Heat oil in large skillet or wok on medium high heat. Add onion and saute 2 minutes. Add bell pepper and sausage and saute for 4 minutes. Add chicken and tomatoes and saute 2 minutes. Add Cajun seasoning and celery salt. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Cut the chicken into bite sized cubes. In a small bowl, combine the garlic, cumin, paprika, thyme and lemon juice. In another bowl combine the olive oil and cayenne. In a third bowl combine the seasoning mix and olive oil mix. Place the cubed chicken in a plastic bag and pour half of the seasoning mix over it. Toss to coat and set aside. In a small bowl combine the remaining seasoning mix. Place the cubed chicken onto wooden or metal skewers. Drizzle with the remaining seasoning mix. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes or until the juices run clear.
