In a small bowl combine first 6 ingredients. In a large bowl combine the remaining ingredientsadd marinade. Add the chicken, turning to coat. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Thread the chicken onto 8 metal or soaked wood skewers. Grill over medium heat for 8 minutes per side or until the chicken is done.

Preheat oven to 170 degrees C (340 degrees F). Grease a loaf pan with a bit of olive oil or cooking spray or line with a bit of greased baking paper and set aside. In a large bowl, beat together the banana, egg, brown sugar and buttermilk until smooth. In a separate bowl, combine the self-raising flour, plain flour, cinnamon and baking powder and stir together. Add the dry ingredients to the wet and stir until well combined. Spoon into the prepared pan and spread with a bit more cinnamon and a generous teaspoon of jam on top. Bake in the pre-heated oven for 45 minutes or until cooked through and a skewer comes out clean when inserted into the center. Cool in the pan for a few minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Add skim milk to a 1 1/2-quart microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high for 2 to 4 minutes, stirring every minute. Stir in brown sugar and margarine. Mix in ground cinnamon. Add the old-fashioned oats and toss to coat. Pour into a 2-quart casserole. Arrange the apples and dried cranberries on top. Sprinkle with walnuts. Bake for 25 minutes or until the apples are tender.

Place the potatoes in a large saucepan of cold watercover and bring to a boil over high heat. Cook until tender when pierced with a knife, about 20 minutes. Drain the potatoes wellreturn to the saucepan, and mash until smooth using a potato masher or a hand-held mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Stir in the creamseason with salt and pepper. Add the buttermix just until smooth. Remove the herb sprigs from the roasting panreserve the butter for another use. Place the pan over medium heatadd the roasted garlic cloves, the lavender flowers and the reserved herb sprigscook for 1 minute. Remove from the heatadd the herb sprigs to the mashed potatoesstir until incorporatedseason with salt and pepper. Transfer to a serving dishtop with the reserved herb sprigs.

Melt butter over medium heat in a Dutch oven, whisking in flour until smooth and well blendedstirring constantly, cook and stir for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Gradually stir in milk until mixture comes to a boilcook and stir for 2 minutes until thickened and smooth. Remove from heatstir in chicken broth, chicken, and green chiliesreturn to heat and cook for 10 minutes or until heated through. Stir in garlic powder and salt and pepper.

Mix together the ground sirloin and onion soup mix. Add egg and cracker crumbs and form into 1 inch balls. Brown in a little olive oil in skillet on medium heat. Add ketchup, apple jelly and blackberry wine. Cook on low for about an hour. Serves 10-12.

Preheat your oven to 180C. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Beat together flour, muesli and sultanas. Add brown sugar and beat until combined. Add butter and beat until combined. Add beaten egg and beat until just combined. Add honey and beat until just combined. Roll heaped teaspoonfuls of mixture into balls and place on lined tray. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 1 minute on tray then place on wire rack to cool completely.
Mix all ingredients together and spread on top of 12 pieces of bread (3/4 inch thick). Top with remaining pieces of bread and press down. Chill before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x13 inch pan. Combine yellow cake mix and milk in a large bowl. Beat for 2 minutes. Add eggs, one at a time. Beat until smooth. Pour half the batter into the prepared pan. Spread the rhubarb on top of the batter. Add the remaining batter over the rhubarb. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 to 45 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. Spread the whipped cream over the top of the warm cake. Serves 12.

In a large mixing bowl cream together the margarine and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Combine the flour, pudding mix, and sodamix well. Stir into the creamed mixture until well mixed. Fold in the chocolate chips. Drop by spoonfuls 2 inches apart onto a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Do not overbake! Cool for 1 minuteremove from cookie sheet to cooling rack.
I would like to make cookies with my daughter that are easy to make.
I would like to make a chewy chocolate cookie that is easy to make with the kids and is something different than your basic cookie recipe.
I love a simple recipe that's easy to make.
I love to make recipes that are simple to make.
I would like to make the best cookies ever!
I would like to make a chewy chocolate chip cookie that is easy to make with the kids and is something different than your basic cookie recipe

Heat oil in medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onions& saute until tender. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add mushrooms& cook until tender. Stir in broth& water. Add tomatoes& basil. Bring to boil. Reduce heat& simmer, uncovered for 5 minutes. Add noodles. Simmer until noodles are tender. Ladle into individual bowls. Sprinkle each serving with crouton. Melt parmesan over each serving. Serves 4.

In medium saucepan over medium heat melt margarine and brown sugar, stirring constantly. Stir in milk and bring to boil, stirring constantly. Boil for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in natural-style peanut butter and vanilla extract. Stir until well incorporated and glossy. Pour into an 8-inch square baking dish and spread into an even layer. Let cool completely. Once cool, dust with icing sugar and cut into squares.

Cook and drain asparagus. Cut ham in 1/2 inch wide strips. Chop onion. Mix all ingredients. Pour into unbaked pie crust. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until knife inserted comes out clean. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting.
I think I'm gonna have to try the Asparagus Ham Pie recipe. I have a ton of asparagus left in the fridge.
That Asparagus Ham Pie looks good.
Wow that spinach ham quiche sounds like a breakfast to die for.

Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Crumble the bacon and set aside. Sprinkle the chicken with the poultry seasoning. In the same skillet over medium-high heat, cook the chicken in the bacon grease for 5-6 minutes per side or until juices run clear. Place the cheese slices on the bottom half of the buns and top with the cooked chicken. Top with lettuce, tomatoes, onion and dill pickle slices. Add the reserved crumbled bacon on top. Serve on a platter with the other bun half.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foilgrease with cooking spray. Place 1 acorn squash halve cut side up on the prepared baking sheetrepeat with the second halve. Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the flesh is tender. Remove from the ovenlet cool for 5 minutes. Carefully scoop the flesh from the skinsreserve the skins. Mash the flesh with the water, butter, salt, and pepperstir in the maple syrup. Spoon the puree back into the skinstop with the reserved skins. Return to the oven, uncovered, and bake for 10 minutes more, or until the puree is hot. Serve immediately.
In a large bowl, combine all ingredients. Chill 2 hours. Serve with tortilla chips.

Place 400g of lentils into a large saucepan of cold water. Add 2 crushed bay leaves. Bring to the boil then simmer for 20 minutes. Drain the lentils into a colander. Put them back into the saucepan with 200g of chopped onion. Bring to the boil then reduce to a simmer. Cook for a further 10 minutes. Add the carrots and mushrooms. Season to taste. Add the potato. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the stock cube. Add the corned beef. Cook for 10 minutes. Remove the bay leaves. Blend the soup to a smooth consistency. Serve immediately.
Place all ingredients into a blender or food processor. Mix well. Serve as a spread for crackers or pitas or as a dip with chips or vegetables.
In a large saucepan, cook carrots and apples in the broth over low heat until tender. Stir in evaporated milk and cook for 2 minutes longer. Sprinkle with nutmeg.

Melt canola oil in microwave. Add english toffee bars and rice krispies and mix well. Add peanut butter and stir until mixed well and begins to form a ball. Add miniature semisweet chocolate chips and mix well. Roll into small balls and place on wax paper. Cool and refrigerate until set. Melt chocolate in top of double boiler over boiling water, stirring constantly until smooth. Dip balls into melted chocolate. Place balls on wax paper to set.

Season turkey with Cavenders Greek Seasoning to taste. Brown in hot oil in skillet. Turn and brown other side. Drain off drippings leaving 1 tablespoon of oil in skillet. Stir in gravy to desired consistency. Stir in mushrooms. Serve on hot buns.

Peel the radishes using a vegetable peeler so that you have nice thin slices. Slice the baguette into 4 pieces. Scoop the middle of the radishes out with a spoon and place on top of the baguette slices. Sprinkle with coarse salt. Crumble the goat cheese on top of the radish slices. Place in the fridge for 30 minutes before serving to allow the flavours to mingle.

Prepare and chill a 1-quart pudding mold. Combine frozen berries and next 3 ingredients in a food processorprocess until smooth. Transfer to a large bowlstir in granulated sugar. Pour into mold. Let stand in refrigerator 3 hours or until set. Garnish with almonds if desired. Store in refrigerator.
You'll have to look at my blog for this one. I'm sorry I can't make it here.

Heat oven to 425f. Spray 8-inch square baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. In small bowl, combine all ingredients except hash brown potatoes and bacon bits. Mix well. Spoon into prepared dish. Bake for 22-25 minutes or until casserole is heated through. Top with hash brown potatoes and bacon bits. Bake 4 minutes longer or until cheese is melted and crust is golden brown.
Cut cauliflower into florets, wash well and drain. Add to pickling mixture. Bring to boil. Simmer for 10 minutes. Cool. Store in refrigerator.

Pour 2 cups milk into a medium bowl. Add pudding mix. Beat with an electric mixer 1 minute. Spread mixture evenly into crust. Beat cream cheese, sugar substitute and 1 tablespoon milk with an electric mixer until smooth. Fold in whipped topping on low speed. Spread over chocolate mixture. Chill at least 3 hours before serving.

Spread 1 slice of bread with jam to coat well. Layer with 1 slice turkey breast and 1 slice provolone cheese. Top with 1 slice ham. Spread remaining slice of bread with butter to coat well. Place sandwich in hot skillet over medium heat. Cook until browned on both sides and cheese melts. Cut into wedges to serve.
Name: grilled hamburger mushroom sandwich Name: Grilled Pizza Sandwich Name: Grilled Ham Egg and Cheese Sandwich Name: Grilled Chocolate and Peanut Butter Sandwich Name: Grilled Fresh Mozzarella Prosciutto and Fig Jam Sandwich Name: Grilled Formaggio Sandwiches Name: Toasted Grilled Cheese Sandwich Name: Grilled Monte Cristo Sandwich

Saute sausage in a large frying pan over medium heat until no longer pink. Add salsa and mix well. Cook until heated through. Add beer and mix well. Add cheese and cook until melted. Serve with tortilla chips or corn chips.

Butter 9 x 13 pan with margarine and set aside. In a double boiler over medium heat, combine margarine, sugar, evaporated milk and salt. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Boil for 6 minutes stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add chocolate chips. Stir until melted and blended. Add marshmallow cream and vanilla. Beat for 2 minutes or until cool. Spread evenly into pan. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares.

In a blender combine lime juice, raspberry jam, mint jelly, oil, garlic, salt, dry mustard and pepper. Blend until smooth. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
 creamy red pepper soup with shrimpingredients: red pepper, celery, onion, chicken broth, dry mustard powder, sea salt, garlic salt, pepperpreparation:Bring broth to boil in large pot. Add red pepper, celery, onion, dry mustard powder, salt, and pepper. Reduce heatsimmer 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Meanwhile, in large skillet, saute shrimp in butter until shrimp are pinkdrain excess fat. In blender, process soup in batches until smooth. Add shrimpblend until smooth.

In a large stock pot, bring broth to boil. Place chicken in broth and lower heat. Cook until tender (about 30-35 minutes). Remove chicken from broth and let cool. Chop or shred chicken. In a large bowl, combine chicken, sour cream and mayonnaiseset aside. Chop apples and grapesadd to chicken mixture. Cut cantaloupe in half and scoop seeds from insidediscard seeds. Scoop cantaloupe into a bowladd to chicken mixture. Sprinkle mixture with almonds. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve on a bed of lettuce. Makes 6 servings.

In a medium bowl, combine 1/4 cup flour, 1/4 cup sugar, 1/8 tsp. baking powder and 1/8 tsp. baking soda. Add enough milk to make a stiff paste. Store in a tightly covered container. Use 1 to 2 teaspoons per recipe for desired size.

In a mixing bowl add the tapioca flour and the eggs. Whisk until well combined. Add the butter and mix until well incorporated. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Divide the dough into 4 equal balls. Flatten each ball between your hands and place them into a greased baking pan. Take one ball and place it flat in your hands. Add a small amount of the shredded cheeses. Fold the ball into a small round shape. Place it in the prepared baking pan. Repeat with the remaining 3 balls of dough. Bake for 20 minutes or until the tops are golden brown. Remove from oven and place the pans on wire racks to cool. Serve warm.

Soak fish in orange/lime mixture for at least one hour. Remove fish and discard liquid. Place fish in a glass baking dish and cover tightly with plastic wrap. Place dish in a heavy skillet of boiling water. Cook for about 2 minutes per side, or until fish is just done. Remove from water and place on a serving dish. Garnish fish with cilantro and serve immediately.

Sift flour with baking powder, salt and sugar together in the large bowl of an electric mixer. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add milk and vanillastir just until moistened. Stir in maple syrup until well blended. Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls into boiling broth and simmer covered until tender about 10 minutes. Makes about 10-12 servings.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Combine the first six ingredients in a large bowl. Add the raisins and toss. Spread the mixture on a large baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes. Stir and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and stir in the nuts. Cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

Cut avocados in half and remove pits. Scoop out the flesh into a bowl. Add the lime juice. Mash the avocado with a fork until it is coarsely chopped. Season to taste with the cumin, cayenne pepper, and salt. Add the tomatoes and cilantro and gently fold to combine. Garnish with the onion and chopped cilantro. Serve with tortilla chips.
Guacamole is a Mexican dip made from the avocado fruit mixed with onion, tomatoes, chiles and other spices. The term is also used for an avocado-based dip or salad that does not meet the traditional definition of guacamole in Mexico. In Mexico, the name refers to an avocado-based relish that is traditionally made with chiles (serranos or jalapeos), onions, tomatoes, and lime juice. It is most often served with tortilla chips or as a filling for tacos, but is also used in many other dishes. The exact origins of the recipe are unclearhowever, some

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the green beans and cook for about 5 minutes, or until crisp-tender. Drain well. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add the oil. Saute the garlic for about 30 seconds or until fragrant, then add the wine and cook for 1 minute to deglaze the pan. Add the green beans and saute for 1 to 2 minutes until heated through. Toss in the lime juice and season with the salt & pepper to taste. Divide among 4 plates and serve with the manchego cheese.

Prepare a crock pot by putting water in the bottom to keep the food from burning. Cut up the mushrooms into bite sized pieces. Place the mushrooms and the portabella mushrooms in the bottom of the crock pot. Season the pork with ranch dressing mix, brown gravy mix, salt and pepper. Layer the pork in the crockpot over the mushrooms and then the celery soup over the top of the pork. Cover the top of the pork with the cream of celery soup. Cover the top of the soup with the chicken gravy. Cook the pork for 6-7 hours or until it is tender. Serve over rice or noodles.

Place frozen green beans in a colander to drain excess water. In a large nonstick skillet heat 1 tablespoon of the oil until hot but not smoking. Add the salt and garlic. Sauté for 1 minute. Stir in the cilantro. Add the green beans and the remaining 2 tablespoons of the oil. Cook for 2 minutes. Transfer to a serving dish. Serve hot.

Place the ham slices evenly on the bottom half of the bagel. Sprinkle with the tomatoes. Then add the basil leaves. Sprinkle with the mozzarella cheese. Top with the other half of the bagel. Cut into slices and serve.

Preheat oven to 400. In a skillet over medium heat, cook sausage until no longer pink. Drain off fat. In a large bowl combine sausage, eggs, chilies and milk. Add biscuit mix, stirring just to mix. Set aside. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Spread half the sausage mixture in bottom of dish. Sprinkle half the cheese. Layer with remaining sausage mixture and cheddar cheese. Bake at 400 for about 20 minutes or until golden. Serve warm with hot salsa.

Prepare tea according to package directions. Add lemon juice and chopped mint during last 5 minutes of steeping time. Allow to cool, then pour into glasses over ice cubes. Top with apple juice and garnish with slices of lemon and mint sprigs.

In a large bowl, combine green beans, hazelnuts, grainy mustard, balsamic vinegar, fine sea salt and extra virgin olive oil. Toss. Add flax seed oil and hazelnut oil. Toss. Add the chopped red onion. Toss again.

Slice red bell peppers into strips about 1 inch wide. Place sliced red bell peppers into bottom of slow cooker. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Top with roast. Mix remaining ingredients and pour over beef. Cover and cook on high 5-6 hours or low 8-9 hours. Serve on kaiser rolls with desired amount of meat.

Blend fat-free cream cheese and prepared horseradish in small bowl until smooth. Spread each flour tortilla with about 1 teaspoon of the cream cheese mixture. Sprinkle evenly with mustard and top with about 1/4 cup spinach leaves and 1/4 cup roast beef. Sprinkle with about 1 tablespoon grated cheddar cheese. Roll up each tortilla tightly and secure with wooden picks. Refrigerate until serving time.
Add the gingerroot and lemongrass to the water. Bring to boil. Turn off heat. Let sit for 5 minutes. Strain. Add herbal tea and sugar. Squeeze lemon for taste. Add honey for taste. Stir. Enjoy.

In a large pot, saute the onions in the butter until translucent. Add the squash, cover and cook over low heat until tender. Add the potatoes and cook until tender. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add the spinach and cook for 2-3 minutes. Pour into bowls and sprinkle each serving with green onions and cider vinegar. Season to taste. Serve immediately.

Place olives in a bowl. Add the meyer lemon juice and the thyme. Let them sit for at least a few hours or overnight. In the meantime, make the pickling liquid by adding the salt to water in a small pot. Bring to a boil and stir until the salt has dissolved. Add the peppercorns and let the brine cool. Add the olives to the pickling liquid. Keep refrigerated. They will keep for a week or more.

In a skillet or dutch oven bring water to a boil. Add spaghetti, reduce to simmer and cook for 5 minutes. Add tuna and continue to simmer. Add capers and olives. Add pasta sauce. Cook another 2 minutes. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt butter in skillet and brown pork chops on both sides. Put chops in casserole dish. Layer potatoes evenly over chops. Put cream of mushroom soup evenly over the potatoes. Sprinkle onion evenly over the cream of mushroom soup. Sprinkle cheese over the top. Pour milk over the cheese. Bake uncovered for 30-45 minutes.

Peel, core and slice the apples and arrange them evenly in a 9x13 inch baking pan. In a large bowl stir together the oats, flour, brown sugar, salt, and butter until well combined. Stir in the apples until the fruit is coated with the oat mixture. Pour into the pan and bake for about 1 hour or until the apples are tender and the topping is golden. Serve warm with whipped cream or frozen yogurt.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. In a small bowl stir together the cream cheese and mustard. Spread onto one side of a tortilla. Top with the ham and pickle. Fold over the tortilla to make a sandwich. Place the sandwich on a cookie sheet. Bake in the preheated oven 12 to 15 minutes or until the tortilla is browned.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine egg whites, salt, and sugar in a large bowlbeat until stiff peaks form. Fold chocolate wafers and nuts into egg whitesspoon into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Spread frozen non-dairy topping over top of crumb mixturesprinkle with chocolate pieces. Bake for 15 minutes more, or until the top is golden brown. Cut into squares and serve.
I like the Chocolate Chip Pecan Pie Muffins and the Chocolate Wafer Pie. They look so yummy!
I like the Chocolate Wafer Pie and Chocolate Chip Pecan Pie Muffins recipes!
I like the Chocolate Wafer Pie recipe!
I like the Chocolate Wafer Pie recipe the best.
Chocolate Wafer Pie looks very good!
I like the Chocolate Wafer Pie recipe!
I like the chocolate chip pec

Sift together dry ingredients and spices. Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and mashed banana. Mix in dry ingredients and buttermilk alternately with the sour cream. Pour into a greased and floured tube pan or a greased and lightly floured loaf pan. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 1 hour for a tube pan and 1 hour and 10 minutes for a loaf pan. Cool and frost with a simple butter frosting.

Sauté sausage and salsa in nonstick skillet over medium heat until thoroughly cooked. Add rice and cook for 1 minute. Beat eggs, sour cream and seasonings together. Add to rice and sausage mixture. Spoon into 9 x 13 baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until heated through. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting into squares and serving.

Bring water to a boil in a saucepan on medium-high heat. Remove from heat. Add nutella and stir until smooth. Add sugar and stir until melted. Add butter and stir until melted. Add salt. Add vanilla essence. Chill until ready to serve.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a 9 inch pie plate with non stick spray. Beat eggs in a large bowl. Stir in ricotta cheese. In a small bowl combine tomatoes, oregano, basil, onion, and garlic. Stir into egg mixture. In a separate bowl combine mushrooms, salt and pepper. Fold into egg mixture. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until firm. Makes 12 servings.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add noodles and cook for 5 minutes. Drain. In a large skillet over medium-high heat melt butter. Add garlic. Cook until lightly browned, stirring constantly. Add olive oil and continue to cook until fragrant. Add cooked noodles. Stir in oyster sauce, bouillon powder, and chicken powder. Cook over low heat for 1-2 minutes. Add parmesan cheese. Stir to combine. Serve immediately.

To prepare the fruit, peel and cut the gala apples into quarters. Set aside. To prepare the crumble, first make sure you have your biscuits already rolled out and ready to go. Then you want to put a little butter into your frying pan and melt it. Next you want to add your brown sugar and mix it up so that it gets really nice and sticky and melty. Once that has been done you can add your biscuits and make sure that you spread them out so that they are nice and evenly distributed in your frying pan. Then you can put your biscuits into your frying pan and cook them for around 12 minutes or until they are golden brown and nice and crunchy. Once they have been cooked you can pour your melted brown sugar over them and then add your sliced apples on top of that. After you have added your apples you can add your passion fruit and give it a little stir so that everything is mixed together really well. Then you can put it into your oven and cook for around 25 minutes or until it is a nice golden brown color and your fruit has been cooked through and it
Cook potatoes and onions together for 10-15 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat the oven to 250 degrees. Spray the inside of a crockpot with Pam. Layer the frozen hash browns in the bottom of the crockpot. Sprinkle with the ham, onion and green pepper. In a medium bowl, beat together the eggs, skim milk and seasonings. Pour the egg mixture over the other ingredients. Cover the crockpot with the lid and place it in the preheated oven. Bake for about 1 hour. Serve hot with a side of salsa.

Mix white meat with egg beaters& milk. Add salt& pepper to taste. Heat oil in fry pan. Sauté mushrooms& onions until tender. Add meat mixture& cook until no longer pink. Remove from pan. In same pan, beat 4 eggs& pour over meat. Sprinkle with cheese& parsley& bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until set. Cut into wedges to serve.

Beat eggs with a fork. Add milk, honey, lemon rind and ground cinnamon and beat again until blended. Dip bread slices into mixture, one at a time, and fry in hot oil until brown. Remove from oil and place on paper towels. Serve warm with sour cream. Sprinkle with lemon wedge and clear honey.

In a large skillet, cook the margarine and the flour together for 30 seconds or until the mixture turns light brown. Slowly add the chicken broth and the milk. Bring to boil. Reduce to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Add the lump crab meat and the Old Bay Seasoning and continue to simmer for another 5 minutes. Ladle the soup into serving bowls. Garnish with some Old Bay Seasoning and freshly chopped parsley.

Bring chicken broth to boil in saucepan over high heat. Add couscous, reduce heat to medium-low, cover pot with tight-fitting lid. Simmer for 5 minutes or until all liquid is absorbed. Stir in olive oil, onion, garlic and soy sauce. Add ground ginger. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve hot.

In large saucepan combine sugar, butter & evaporated milk. Bring just to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in pumpkin, spices & marshmallow creme. Pour into buttered dish & refrigerate until firm. Top with melted chocolate chips. Cool until set. Cut into squares.

Place roast in a baking dish. Cover with salad dressing. Add soy sauce. Let stand at room temperature for at least two hours. Sprinkle with garlic and onion. Bake in a preheated oven at 250 f for two to two and a half hours. Serve on toast.
The information on this page is from the Food section's "In the Kitchen" collection. It has been provided by third parties. Any questions or concerns about the content should be directed to its source.

Place onions in the bowl of a food processor and pulse until fine. Add the cream cheese and process until smooth. Add the tuna and pulse again until the mixture is well blended. Add the lemon juice and pulse once more until thoroughly blended. Chill for at least an hour. Remove from the refrigerator and scoop the mixture into a pastry bag fitted with a small round or star-shaped tip. Pipe a little of the mixture into each cherry tomato. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve immediately or refrigerate for up to two hours.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Spread beans evenly on oven-safe platter. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese, and bake for 3 minutes or until cheese melts. Stir in jalapeno peppers and sour cream, and continue baking 5-7 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine all of the ingredients except the bread for the dressing. Set aside while you fry your eggs. In a small saucepan over medium-high heat combine all of the ingredients for the dressing, whisk to combine well. Cook until slightly thickened. Remove from heat. Fill a large skillet or saute pan with about 1/2 inch of oil and place on the stove over medium-high heat. Once the oil has heated place 3 or 4 eggs into the pan. Sprinkle some of the spices into the pan so that they float to the top of the egg. Cook until you like your eggs cooked. Remove from pan and place on paper towels to drain excess oil. Serve on top of bread drizzled with dressing.

Preheat oven to 350f. Butter a 2-quart baking dish, or 8-inch square baking dish. In a medium bowl, mix blueberries, peaches, brown sugar, lemon juice, lemon zest and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Pour mixture into prepared baking dish. In another medium bowl, mix together all-purpose flour, baking powder and remaining 1/2 teaspoon of saltstir well with fork or pastry blender until combined. Add butter and use pastry blender or your fingers to quickly cut through butter until mixture resembles coarse meal. Pour mixture evenly over blueberry mixture. Bake 35-40 minutes, until topping is golden brown. Serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream.

In large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium heat, cook bacon 5 minutes or until crispremove from pan with slotted spoon. Increase heat to medium-highadd onioncook 3 minutes or until tender. Add watercook 5 minutes or until potatoes are almost tender. Add half-and-halfheat through over medium heat. Add creamed corncook 3 minutes or until heated through. Stir in frozen corncook 1 minute or until hot. Stir in baconcook 1 minute longer or until thoroughly heated. Sprinkle with black pepper. Serve with crusty bread.

Place the roast in a crockpot and pour 1/2 can of cream of mushroom soup over it. Place the potatoes and carrots around the meat, then pour the rest of the can of soup over all of it. Sprinkle with the basil, worcestershire sauce and the minced onion (this is optional). Cover the crockpot and let cook on low for 8-10 hours. Serve with the extra liquid as gravy. You can serve this over potatoes or rice or mashed potatoes. If you are making mashed potatoes, make the potatoes first and let cool, then add the liquid from the crockpot to them and mash them together before serving.
Mix first three ingredients in a large bowl. Blend in remaining ingredients. Pour into pie crust. Refrigerate 2 hours or until set. Garnish with fresh lemon rind if desired.

Place all ingredients in your bread machine in the order the manufacturer recommends. Set to dough cycle and press start. After baking, remove from pan and cool on a wire rack. To serve, cut into slices and spread with a mixture of equal parts softened margarine and mayonnaise. Makes 2 loaves.

In a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat, brown the meat. Add the pepper and crushed red pepper flakes. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the apricot jam and cook for 1 to 2 minutes longer. Stir in the dressing and soy sauce. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in the ginger and garlic powders. Stir and serve over hot cooked rice.

Cook the haricots verts in a large pot of boiling water for about 2 minutes. Remove from the water and plunge into ice water. Drain and chill. In a saute pan over medium-high heat, cook the bacon until crisp. Remove the bacon and place on a paper-towel-lined plate. Set aside. Add the shallots to the bacon fat and cook until tender. Add the vinegar and walnut oil and cook over medium heat for about 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper. Add the chilled haricots verts and toss. Arrange the haricots verts and bacon on a platter and sprinkle with parsley. Garnish with toasted walnuts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Separate dough into 4 rectangles. Sprinkle each rectangle evenly with about 1 tablespoon of the bacon mixture (reserve remaining for garnish). Top each rectangle with about 1 tablespoon of the onion mixture (reserve remaining for garnish), then sprinkle lightly with about 2 tablespoons of the parmesan cheese (reserve remaining for garnish). Starting at the wide end, roll each rectangle up. Place the rolled up rectangles cut sides down onto a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Combine remaining 2 tablespoons parmesan cheese, the fresh parsley and the milk in a small bowl. Drizzle over the baked crescents. Garnish each serving with 1 tablespoon of the bacon mixture and 1 tablespoon of the onion mixture, if desired. Makes 12 servings.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken liver. Cook 10 minutes or until browned. Remove from skillet. Add remaining 1 tablespoon oil to skillet. Add garlic. Saute 2 minutes. Add tomatoes. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 1 hour. Stir in green peas. Add basil and black pepper. Simmer 5 minutes longer. Remove bay leaf. Pour sauce over cooked chicken liver. Serve over hot pasta. Serve with crusty Italian bread.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, heat the oil. Add onion and cook until soft. Add the bell pepper and cook until soft. Add the garlic and cook until golden. Add the diced tomatoes and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the oregano and cook for 1 minute more. Add the scallops and cook until just done. Remove from heat and add the parsley. Toss the pasta in the sauce and serve.
Combine gin and dry vermouth in a shaker and shake well with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a green olive and a cube of blue cheese.

Combine the graham cracker crumbs and melted butter. Press into the bottom of a mini-cheesecake pan or muffin tin. Bake at 350 degrees for 5 minutes. Cool slightly. Beat the cream cheese and cocoa until smooth. Add the sweetened condensed milk and continue beating until well blended. Beat in the vanilla and the egg. Fold in the chocolate chips. Pour into the pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool completely. Store in the refrigerator. To serve, top each cheesecake with a dollop of chocolate ganache or whipped cream.

Place cinnamon sticks in water to flavor it. In a blender, blend milk, corn, sugar and water until smooth. Heat up coconut milk and add to blender mix. Blend well until smooth. Mix in vanilla and salt to taste. Chill for 3 hours. Serve in bowls topped with more cinnamon and cinnamon sticks if desired. Serves 4.

Heat milk in a saucepan over medium heat until boiling. Turn down heat to medium-low and add in half-and-half cream. Add in sugar and cook for 10 minutes or until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat, add in white chocolate, vanilla and brandy. Stir until melted and combined. Ladle into mugs and enjoy with marshmallow or whipped topping on top.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Season the fillets with salt and pepper. Cook the fillets 1 1/2 minutes on each side. Transfer the fillets to a baking dish. Reduce the heat to low. In the same pan, combine the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil with the apples, garlic, maple syrup, vinegar, mustard, and water. Cook until the apples are just tender, about 5 minutes. Pour the apple mixture over the fillets. Cover tightly with foil. Bake 20 minutes. Uncover. Bake for another 10 to 15 minutes or until the pork is no longer pink in the center. Serve immediately.

Cut butternut squash in half lengthwise. With a large sharp knife or a spoon scrape out seeds. Chop up squash. Peel salad potatoes. Cut into large pieces. Cut off ends of bell peppers. Slice into large pieces. Cut red onion into large pieces. Put all vegetables in a large bowl. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil. Add garlic. Add bay leaves. Add rosemary. Add sea salt. Toss. Place vegetables in a large rectangular pyrex or ceramic dish. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for one hour. Stir. Bake for another hour. Stir. Bake for another hour. Stir. Remove from oven. Serve.

In a large bowl combine almonds, quinoa, dried apple, raisins and cinnamon. In a medium bowl combine water, brown sugar, vanilla yogurt and vanilla extract. Pour over the dry ingredients. Mix well. Spread evenly on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool completely. Break into pieces.
Brown meat with the onions, then add in the remaining ingredients. Simmer for about an hour. Serve with cheese and sour cream.

Mix together the golden syrup, banana, peanut butter and melted chocolate until smooth and blended. Add the beaten eggs a little at a time while stirring all the while. Add the rice flour and stir until combined. Stir in the baking soda (this will fizz) Add the soy flour and stir again until combined. The dough will be sticky, this is ok. Put in the fridge for 10 minutes to chill the mixture slightly. When the dough is cool enough to handle form small balls using about a tablespoon of dough each. Place on a lined baking tray. Bake for 10 -12 minutes until the edges are golden brown and the centres are still pale. Remove from the oven and place on a wire rack to cool.

Cover bottom of crock pot with frozen hash brown potatoes and bacon pieces. Arrange onions and bell peppers in a single layer over the potato and bacon mixture. Sprinkle cheddar cheese evenly over the vegetables. In a large bowl whisk eggs and milk together until thoroughly blended. Season with salt and pepper. Pour the egg mixture over the vegetable and potato mixture in the crock pot. Cover the crock pot and place it in the oven. Bake at 325 degrees for 45 minutes or until the omelet is thoroughly set and the center is no longer runny. Cut into wedges and serve immediately.

Mix lettuce with cooked brown rice and chili peppers. Place on a plate and add diced tomatoes and cucumber slices. Chop the chicken into small pieces and place over the top of the salad. Add 1 tsp of balsamic vinegar and fresh ground black pepper to taste.

Heat oil and garlic in large skillet. Add beef and stir until evenly coated. Remove with slotted spoon to plate. Heat broccoli and mushrooms 3 minutes. Return meat to skillet and add Oyster Sauce. Stir until well blended. Cook uncovered 5 minutes. Stir in water and cook until liquid is almost evaporated. Stir in fish sauce and pepper and serve.

Place a grapefruit on a broiler rack in a shallow dish. Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon, drizzle with a little butter. Broil just until the fruit is warm in the center - 1 to 2 minutes on each side. Serve topped with maraschino cherry. Serves 1.

In a large saute pan over medium heat melt the butter. Add the shallots and saute for 2 minutes. Add the cream to the pan and heat to a simmer. Add the basil, lemon juice, red wine vinegar and tabasco to taste. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add the zucchini and tomatoes. Simmer for 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Season fillets with salt and pepper. Combine ham, orange rind and white pepper. Spread flour on platter. Dip fillets in beaten egg, then in the crumbs. Place in frying pan with margarine. Cook over medium heat 3-4 minutes on each side or until fillets are tender. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Place vinegars in saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until syrup is reduced by half. Add salt and pepper and remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Mix sugar with oil and lemon juice in a large bowl. Add vinegar mixture and toss well. Place beets in a colander and sprinkle with flour. Toss gently until coated well. Add the flour coated beets to the vinaigrette mixture and toss well until coated. Chill well in the refrigerator or serve at room temperature. Garnish with sour cream and dill sprigs if desired.

In a large skillet brown the meat with the onion until the meat is no longer pink. Drain off the fat and add the remaining ingredients. Transfer to a 2 quart casserole dish. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve with a salad or vegetable.

Heat oven to 425f. Lightly coat baking sheet with cooking spray. Spread each pizza crust with about 1 tsp of oil. Bake for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Meanwhile, cut chicken into 1/2-inch-thick slices. In a medium bowl combine the wing sauce and dressingset aside. Cut each chicken slice in half, then cut each half into thin strips. Cut celery on an angle into thin strips. Spread about 2 tablespoons of wing sauce mixture on each pizza crust. Arrange half the chicken and half the celery on each pizza and sprinkle each with half the cheese. Bake 3 minutes longer or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve immediately with remaining dressing for dipping.

Add broth to a pot and bring to boil. Add artichoke hearts and dried basil and oregano to broth. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and let simmer for 30 minutes. Add dried basil and oregano. Stir in artichoke hearts and let simmer for 2 minutes. Add garbanzo beans and let simmer for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with pasta.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the skim milk, granulated sugar and heavy cream. Stir until the sugar has completely dissolved. Add the pure vanilla extract and turn off the heat. Place one scoop of your favorite vanilla ice cream into a bowl. Pour the creamy birthday cake mixture over the ice cream. Sprinkle with the rainbow sprinkles. Serve immediately.

Combine Bisquick and milk. Beat on high speed 30 seconds. Add egg and beat 1 minute. Spoon into greased 24 cup muffin pan filling three-fourths full. Bake at 400 degrees 20 to 25 minutes or until done. Remove to wire rack. Serve warm.
In a large bowl, cream the sugar and shortening until fluffy.
Add egg and milk and mix well.
Combine dry ingredients and gradually add to creamed mixture.
Mix well. Fold in chips.
Spoon about 1 tablespoon batter into each greased mini muffin cup.
Bake at 375 for 10 to 13 minutes or until muffins test done by inserting a toothpick in center of muffin.
Cool in pan about 10 minutes before removing.
Sift together the flour, cocoa, baking powder, cinnamon and salt into a large bowl.
Stir in the sugar and chocolate chips.
Lightly beat the eggs in a large bowl, then beat in

Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add garlic and saute until tender. Add the orzo. Bring to a boilreduce heat to medium low. Stir in 3 cups of water. Simmer until tender. In a small bowl, combine the half-and-half and the remaining 2 tablespoons waterstir well. Add the half-and-half mixture to the saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Add the parmesan cheese. Cook until the cheese melts. Add the shrimp. Stir in the basil. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour a 12 cup bundt pan. Combine cake ingredients and beat on low for 2 minutes. Add poppyseed and beat on medium for 1 minute. Spread batter evenly in prepared pan. Bake for 25-40 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean and the center springs back when touched. Cool for 15 minutes in the pan then remove to wire rack to cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar and serve with chocolate sauce or icing if desired.

In a medium saucepan over low heat, combine milk and margarine. Bring to a simmer and stir constantly until margarine is melted. In a large bowl, beat eggs and milk until smooth. In a separate bowl combine mexican blend cheese, salsa, and egg mixture. Heat a 10 to 12 inch nonstick skillet over medium heat. Spread one quarter of egg mixture in bottom of skillet and sprinkle with half of the mexican blend cheese. Cook until almost set. Repeat with remaining egg mixture and cheese. Stack onto a large plate. Sprinkle with salsa. Warm tortillas and serve.

Trim stalks from fennel bulb and cut off tops. Cut bulb into thin wedges. Peel and core applescut into wedges. Slice onion into very thin rings. Heat 1/2 inch of water in a large skillet over medium-high heat. When water boils, add corn and cook, stirring occasionally until tender and golden brown, about 5 minutes. Drain. Cut each wedge into 2 pieces. Add to bowl with fennel wedges and apple wedges. Whisk together lemon juice, 1/4 cup olive oil, sugar, salt and pepper in a small bowlpour over vegetables and toss. Sprinkle with fennel leaves. Serve warm or at room temperature. Serves 6 to 8.
Spread bread with butter and top with slices of salmon. Top the fish with slices of cucumber. Top with another slice of bread. Cut into small triangles.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil over high heat. Cook the noodles according to package directions until tender but firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain thoroughlytoss with butter to coat. Place in a serving dish or shallow casserole dish. In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt 2 tablespoons of the butter. Add sour creamwhisk until blended. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Pour over noodlestoss gently to coat. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 F for 20 minutes or until bubbly.

In a small bowl combine raisins, oil and vinegarset aside. Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heatadd onions and saute until softened, about 15 minutes. Add capers and raisin mixturesaute 5 minutes longerstir in dill and cook 2 minutes longer. Season with hot sauce, salt and pepper. Divide onion mixture among the baguette slices. Top each slice with 2 cooked shrimp and serve immediately.

Place french bread on baking sheet with cut side down. Butter one side of each slice of french bread. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup parmesan cheese. Broil 2 to 3 minutes until toasted. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup of parmesan and broil 2 to 3 minutes more until melted. Cut into triangles and serve.

Heat oil in frying pan. Add onions and cook until lightly brown. Remove from pan and set aside. Brown the hot dogs in the oil. Remove from pan and place in buns. Add toppings as desired.

In a large skillet cook margarine and onion until tender. Sprinkle flour over the top and stir until smooth. Gradually add skim milk and cook over low heat until mixture thickens and is smooth. Remove from heat and stir in ham and cheese. In a casserole dish place half the potatoes. Pour half the sauce over the potatoes and sprinkle with 1/2 of the remaining cheddar cheese. Repeat layers. Bake in a 350 degree oven until the cheese melts and the potatoes are tender.

Combine oil and vinegar in a small bowl. Stir in sugar and set aside. Cook and drain tri-color spiral pasta. Cool and put into large bowl. Add cucumber and onion. Combine dressing and pour over pasta. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Just before serving add cauliflower, broccoli and olives. Toss.

Place Pillsbury Sugar Cookie Dough into large mixing bowlpress dough into bottom of ungreased 13x9-inch pansprinkle with 1/2 cup of the sugarpour over the 1/4 cup of melted butterspread evenlysprinkle with the remaining 1/2 cup of the sugarsprinkle with the lemon juicespread evenlybake 28-34 minutes or until lightly brownedcool completelycut into 24 barsstore in airtight container at room temperature.

In a large bowl combine 1/4 cup olive oil with 2 cloves minced garlic and 1 tsp. Dried rosemary. Season with sea salt and black pepper. In a separate bowl, toss together 1/2 cup olive oil with 1 tsp. Dried rosemary and 1 tsp. Salt. Slice naan bread into 1/2 inch slices. Brush both sides with olive oil seasoned with rosemary. In a nonstick saute pan over medium heat, cook peppers and onions in 1/4 cup olive oil for 4-5 minutes, until tender. Stir in cherry tomatoes. Cook another 2 minutes or until tomatoes are heated through. Add 1/2 cup of olive oil seasoned with rosemary. Cook another 2 minutes until tomatoes are heated through. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Transfer to serving plate. Serve with sliced naan bread. Makes 4 servings.

In a food processor, process parsley until finely chopped. Add garlic and shallotprocess until finely minced. Transfer to a small bowl. Add italian seasonings and rosemarymix well. In a small bowl combine lemon juice and mustard. In a large nonstick skillet heat 1 tablespoon of the oil over medium-high heat. Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepperadd to skillet. Cook for 1 minute. Add lemon mixtureturn to coat. Add parsley mixturetoss to coat. Remove from heat. Serve with remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Makes 2 servings.

Cream butter and sugar. Dissolve soda in buttermilk. Sift dry ingredients. Add soda mixture to the creamed mixture. Stir in buttermilk and the last two tablespoons of butter. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Heat oven to 400 degrees. Dust work surface with flour. On a well-floured surface, roll the dough out to a thickness of about 1/4 inch. Cut with a round biscuit cutter, a small can or a glass with a rim of about one inch. Place on a greased baking sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes, or until lightly browned. Cool on a wire rack. Makes about 24 breads.

preheat the oven to 425 degrees f. Spray a 9 inch cast iron skillet with cooking spray. Combine the yellow cornmeal, unsifted flour, sugar, baking powder and soda and salt in a large mixing bowl and stir well. Add the sour cream and stir until well combined and smooth. Add the egg and beat well with a fork until the batter is smooth and well blended. Add the milk and beat with a fork until it is well blended and smooth. Pour the batter into the prepared cast iron skillet and place in the preheated oven for 18 to 20 minutes or until the top is golden and the bread is firm when it is gently pushed in the center. Cool slightly and serve warm. Cut into wedges and serve with butter, honey or syrup.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c).In a bowl, combine the stuffing mix, water and egg. Divide mixture evenly among 24 paper-lined muffin cupspress down firmly into each cup to form a base. Combine the remaining 2 cups stuffing mix with the barbecue sauce and 1/2 cup waterspoon over the tops of the cups. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until browned and crusty. Cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Put 1 1/2 cups of coconut in a large bowl. In another bowl combine the butter and condense milk. Melt over medium heat and bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in salt and chocolate until smooth. Add 1/2 cup coconut. Stir to combine. Add nuts and pour into greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes. Cool completely. Spread remaining coconut on a plate. Cut fudge into pieces and roll in coconut. Store airtight.

Place the chicken breast halves in a bowl. Mince the garlic with a knife or in a food processor. Add the garlic to the bowl with the chicken. Add oregano and crushed red pepper. Combine well. Add olive oil and toss to coat evenly. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Pour 2 tablespoons of water into each of 2 shallow baking dishes. Arrange the chicken in the pans. Cover with foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Uncover and baste. Bake until no longer pink in center and juices run clear (10-15 minutes). Remove from oven. Add more water if necessary. Mix in lemon juice. Drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat the grill for high heat. In a medium bowl, whisk together the peach preserves, ginger and lime zest until smooth. Add the Dijon and lime juice and whisk until combined. Set aside. Prepare the ham by trimming the fat and scoring the meat in a diamond pattern on both sides. Lightly oil the grill and brush the scored side of the ham with the peach-ginger glaze. Grill for 2 minutes before turning over and brushing the other side. Continue turning and brushing every minute or so until the meat is heated through. The time will depend on the thickness of the meat and the heat of the grill. Transfer the ham to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Cut the ham into ½-inch thick slices and serve immediately.

Combine orange juice, ginger and green onion in small bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Pour about half the mixture over the salmon and let marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the remaining orange juice mixture, lime juice and garlic in medium bowl. Stir in the teriyaki sauce. Remove the salmon from the refrigerator and cook on broiler pan in the oven 4 inches from the heat for 3 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Brush with the citrus mixture and cook 1 minute more. Serve warm.

Bring water to a boil in a large pot. Add dark brown sugar. Stir until dissolved. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add heavy cream. Stir until dissolved. Add ground cinnamon. Stir until dissolved. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla extract. Let cool. Store in the refrigerator.

Mix all together with hands till you have a ball. Flatten on a cookie sheet to desired thickness with a glass or a cookie cutter. Bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees till golden brown. Makes about 30 cookies.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Toss potatoes in oil and salt and place on a foiled baking sheet in a single layer. Bake in oven about 45 minutues or until tender and browned. Meanwhile in small bowl combine sour cream with blue cheese and chives. Spoon mixture into center of potatoes and serve.
